situation: i felt guilty when i was driving home one night and a person tried to fly into my lane, and did not see me. i honked and they swerved back into their lane, slammed on their brakes, and hit the water cones.
dialogue: yeah about 10 years ago i had a horrifying experience. it was 100% their fault but they hit the water barrels and survived. they had no injuries but they almost ran me off the road.
did you suffer any injuries?
no i was not hit. it turned out they were drunk. i felt guilty but realized it was his fault.
label: guilty
response: why did you feel guilty? people really should not drive drunk.

situation: my mother stopped by my house one day and said she saw 3 dogs on the road, down from our house. they were starving, with ribs showing, and it was a mother dog and her two small puppies. of course, my daughter wanted to bring them to our house, so we could feed and help them. we did, and my heart went out to them, as they were so sweet, but really were in a bad shape.
dialogue: well, can you tell me about your experience? i think we swapped places
yeah i wanted to tell you about the time i was hit by a drunk driver i am so happy to still be alive after that experience
oh my goodness, that is very scary! i hope you are okay now and the drunk driver was punished for his actions?
label: caring
response: yeah he was punished hes in jail still

situation: i just broke up with my girlfriend, we were together for 8 years, i feel so empty.
dialogue: i there, do not know what to do, jst broke up with my girlfirned, we were 8 years together
sorry to hear! do you have any idea about the break up? did you think about it ?
yes we decided together with our minds, and know i come home and feel so distant from the world
label: lonely
response: sorry again! hope you will get relief from this sadness. please concentrate on your interests to divert your mind from this.

situation: i received concert tickets for christmas.
dialogue: i could not wait to go to the concert.
which concert?
the u2 concert. tickets were really expensive and i never thought we would be able to go, but somehow we did!
label: excited
response: wow, that is awesome! i have never been to an actual concert.

situation: i have read an article about a little newborn babygirl. she died because she was premature and she had problems breathing on her own when she was born but parents did not take her to the hospital because they do not believe in medication
dialogue: i am so sad because i have read an article about a newborn girl who died because her parents did not believe in medication and doctors
ugh, those articles always get me too. what was wrong with her?
she was born premature at home, she had hard time breathing on her own but instead of taking her to the doctor parents were just praying
label: sad
response: jeez! its so unfortunate. very sad really.

situation: my friend's baby hurt himself yesterday i was trying to cheer him up
dialogue: so my friend's baby fell down and scraped his knee yesterday and i was trying so hard to cheer him up
that is nice of you. what did you do?
i was singing nursery songs
label: caring
response: which one?

situation: i really hope my husband finds a full time job soon
dialogue: my husband lost a job but i am hoping he can find a full time job soon
he will, i have faith.
thank you so much!
label: hopeful
response: no problem. what kind of work does he do?

situation: some guys shot my neighbour and ran into the woods
dialogue: i just moved to this neighborhood and some dumb criminals shot one of my neighbors and ran into the woods!
that is not good. do you own a gun?
i do! i want to be able to protect my son
label: angry
response: that is always number one goal.

situation: i am going to see my parents soon!
dialogue: i am so excited because i am finally going to visit my parents next month! i did not see them for 3 years
3 years is a long time. how come?
i moved to the us and they stayed in my homecountry
label: joyful
response: oh i see. they must miss you, too.

situation: i felt very angry when a co-worker of mine pretended he was in a car accident to get out of working july 4th. i worked to midnight for him to only find out he was faking it. i was furious
dialogue: i was very angry when a co worker lied about a car accident to get out of working july 4th. i covered his shift till midnight and he was lying about the accident
that is not very nice.
yeah he got caught in someones pics on facebook. never lie and then go out with people who like to take pictures.
label: angry
response: yes. i do not have a facebook.

situation: i went to buy a 42 inch tv at walmart, the billboard says 299 usd, it was at 399 usd after taxes.
dialogue: so yeah i drove 2 hours to get to wallmart. with 299 in my wallet as advertised, and the real price of the tv was 399 usd. what a bummer
that is horrible.
yeah i had my hopes reall high and then i left empty handed, such a terrible feeling!
label: disappointed
response: yes i do not like walmart.

situation: a time i felt i should be loyal and honest is when my good friend's boyfriend showed interest in me in a romantic manner. i am married, and i also really care for my friend, so two reasons i would not encourage his behavior. i let him know that he was wrong to do that, and felt good that i did, but felt really bad for my friend.
dialogue: my friend's boyfriend recently made a pass at me. i am married, and i also am really good friend's with his girlfriend so i felt really bad. i made sure he knew i was loyal and honest to both!
that is horrible. did you tell on him?

i struggled with it, but my friend was in a really bad spot, with no income and raising her grandchild, he was the financial supporter. so, i did not tell her, as i knew it would really hurt her in several ways, plus she really loves him!
label: faithful
response: that is a tough situation.

situation: my baby is sleeping
dialogue: my baby is sleeping. it is so peaceful and quiet in this house
i guess it makes you appreciate things you used to take for granted,. but it does not last forever and is worth it.
i totally agree with you!
label: content
response: that is a full time job raising a human

situation: all my friends live in a different country
dialogue: hi, i feel so lonely sometimes because all my friends live in a different country
oh, i am sure you are lonely. maybe you can join some kind of club that lets you meet new friends?
i was thinking about it! i wanted to join a group for local moms
label: lonely
response: that is a good idea! this way you can also meet friends for yourself, but also maybe meet new friend's for your children to hang out with while you do with their moms!

situation: my friend's son is wild and not disciplined, where he is always acting bad. one day he grabbed one of our expensive games and sat on it, breaking it. this really irked me!
dialogue: i have a friend that has a child that is unruly and does bad things. one day at our home, he grabbed a game and sat on it, instantly breaking it! it was expensive and this really irked me, especially because she does not discipline him when he does bad things.
oh man. i am all about discipline! i do not like spoiled bratty kids
me either! i have two of my own children, and i would have never let them get away with that kind of behavior when they were his age. i just do not understand those kind of parents!
label: annoyed
response: yes, i have heard some parents do not ever say no to their kids. makes no sense

situation: i recently spoke with an ex-girlfriend of mine. i think that she is doing very well. our recent talks were invigorating and nostalgic, reminding me of my past experiences with her.
dialogue: i recently spoke with my ex-girlfriend on the phone. the conversation went pretty well, and it reminded me of my past experiences with her.
did things end amicably? i hope everything is good now!
yes, they ended somewhat well, but there were tense moments. i am glad she is doing well, but i miss her.
label: nostalgic
response: i understand that, i hope things work out well for you both in the end!

situation: one of the most blissed out moment of time i remember in life was right after the birth of my first child.
dialogue: one of the times i remember feeling the most blissed out in life was right after the birth of my first child.
that is a very blessed day. it is something you will never forget.
obviously there are the demands of a new child, but that feeling of finally meeting someone you waited so long for, and the love surrounding the whole situation. truly something to remember.
label: content
response: yes, i could not agree more. it is remarkable how your feeling suddenly change.

situation: i was incredibly grateful when job payment came through *just* in the nick of time. i went from feeling scared and desperate to grateful and optimistic.
dialogue: have you ever been in a situation when payment of some kind has come through *just* in the nick of time?! talk about gratitude!
i bet that must have been nerve wracking until it happened.
absolutely. you go from scared and desperate to grateful and optimistic in one quick moment! it is not a situation i wish to be in again.
label: grateful
response: oh i am sure. i would not like to be in a situation like that. good thing everything worked out for you.

situation: my really close friend lost her parents and siblings in a fire and consoling her about the incident just made me realize how thankful i should be each day for the family i am blessed with.
dialogue: i am so grateful for my family due to an incident with my friend
oh really? what happened with your family and friend then?
my friend lost her parents and siblings in a fire and their family was very close to mine. so seeing her go through the grief made me realize how thankful i should be
label: grateful
response: oh wow, that is awful. stuff like that really teaches you to appreciate what you've got and to not take it for granted.

situation: my intuition has led me into some situations that had i only used my head, i might have missed out on. i am a big believer in listening to your "gut".
dialogue: i am a big believer in listening to your gut. sometimes i might wonder where my intuition is leading me, but it always seems to be spot on.
i agree, someimes we just know
it is a "knowing", and a flowing! when something is right, it just feels easier to go with it, like you are being led, even if you might not fully know to where.
label: trusting
response: exactly, i get that entirely!

situation: it was around the time of my 18th birthday and i had mock exams so i could not really celebrate it. but my friends threw me a surprise party
dialogue: i could not celebrate my 18th birthday as i had exams during the time and i felt terrible for it. but my friends threw a surprise party for me and it was the best!
that is great! how did they surprise you?

i was studying in my bedroom for a couple of hours straight with headphones on and then my mom called me to the living room for dinner and when i went out the whole place was decorated and everyone was there
label: surprised
response: that is so sweet of them, i hope you enjoyed it!

situation: i was sharing a house with 5 girls and all of them have boyfriends and hang out with them over the weekend and i feel lonely and down.
dialogue: i feel lonely sometimes cause i live in a house with 5 girls and all of them have boyfriends and sometimes they are all hanging out with their significant others and i feel lonely
awww, that sucks man. hopefully they do not say mean things to you about being lonely.
sometimes they joke about it and obviously i make it look like its totally fine cause i do not want to give them the impression that i am lonely but it does hurt sometimes
label: lonely
response: well i used to be lonely a lot but i eventually found someone. i think you will too.

situation: i was surprised to learn how different my two kids' personalities could be. silly, i know. but true!
dialogue: as silly as it sounds, i was so surprised at how different my two kids were as babies. you are reminded that they are wired with their own personalities from the git-go.
yeah that is always odd to me, before they can talk they are already unique!
one was pacifier, one was fingers. one wanted to co-sleep, one liked her space. one liked facing *out* in the baby bjorn carrier, one liked cocooning in a sling!
label: surprised
response: that is how it goes, sometimes you can just figure them out immediately

situation: i was really craving chik-fil-a sunday so i drove there. when i got there i realized they were closed. i was pretty upset.
dialogue: the other day i had a deep craving for chik-fil-a.
i understand that one,they are my favorite place to eat
mine too. so i drive there and pull in the parking lot and it is completely empty. i then realized it was sunday.
label: disappointed
response: that has happened to me too many times to count

situation: i visited an orphan once and just being there made me so thankful for parents and family
dialogue: i visited an orphan once and it was such a surreal moment. it made me realise how thankful i should be for a family
that must have been and intense and emotional moment for you.
yes it definitely was. i went with intentions to teach the kid a few things but i ended up learning lots more from him
label: grateful
response: uau, what a surreal moment.i always believe kids have a lot to teach us.

situation: while their relationship is rough now, i have to believe that my oldest child and husband will end up with a wonderful relationship.
dialogue: my oldest and my husband have always had a rough relationship. i have got to believe that as she gets older, it will get better!
i am sure it will! i did not get along with my dad until i became an adult.
that is always good to hear. but in the moment, argh, my *heart*. how did your mom maneuver the differences between y'all? did that wear on her?
label: hopeful
response: yes it did. i believe she just waited it out and tried to neutralize the conversation when we were together.

situation: kids will be kids, but i am still ashamed when i think of how i treated one girl in sixth grade. i learned then that peer pressure does not often support your being your best self.
dialogue: i can still look back with shame at the way i treated a girl in sixth grade. i was not as bad as others, but that does not make me feel any better.
where you not secure in your self?
well, like a lot of 6th graders i was aware of *not* wanting to be an outcast for any reason. and unfortunately, she was. as an adult of course, my heart squeezes for *all* the kids we were!
label: ashamed
response: you can track her down to say sorry, or would that be creepy?

situation: i am so impressed by my current boss. he is a terrific example of leadership in every way.
dialogue: i am currently working for someone that is *such* a great example of a leader! it makes going into work inspiring every day / every way.
lucky you! that is rare. maybe one day people will think of you like that?

that is a very kind statement, and certainly what i would strive for. and it is the rarity that *inspires* me. that should be the norm, not the exception! that is what i would like to inspire in people. how about you?
label: impressed
response: i have something totally different. my boss is clueless to the world and have no business being a leader.

situation: i could not believe how big my friend's baby had gotten since the last time i had seen her!
dialogue: my friend's baby has grown so much since the last time i had seen her!
it is crazy how quickly kiddos grow! even in a few weeks time! do you see your friend and her baby often?
it had been about 8 weeks i do not get out her way often, even though we live 30 minutes away.
label: surprised
response: that is how life goes! different schedules and demands, i am sure she is so thrilled when she *does* get to see you!

situation: i am always proud when i set my sights on something and achieve it. running my very first marathon was a big one!
dialogue: running my first (and maybe only!) marathon felt like *such* a huge accomplishment!
wow, that is an amazing accomplishment!  congratulations!  you gotta be feeling like you are on top of the world after that!
ah, it was the best! plus it helped that i purposely chose an amazing destination in which to run it, it was the venice marathon!
label: proud
response: my first thought was "california" but then there is venice [italy] and then either way, that is an amazing destination!

situation: i recently started talking to and lightly dating a woman. i really enjoy her company. i thought we would end up being together, but she recently moved and now treats me differently.
dialogue: i recently found out that a person i very much intimately admired did not feel the same way for me. i was pretty surprised.
i am sorry to hear that! how did you find out?
she just started treating me differently all of a sudden. and now she is going to be moving away soon.
label: surprised
response: that is a real bummer, but as they say, there are plenty of fish in the sea!

situation: nothing makes me angrier than seeing bullying in any way, shape, or form. especially when it comes to bigotry or racism.
dialogue: i am always appalled when i see bullying in action, whether it is on a playground or political stage, not much makes me angrier.
i feel the same way.
how do you channel the anger? obviously, it too easily turns into the same kind of negative emotion i am upset about, so that can feel hypocritical!
label: angry
response: i practice boxing. i love to punch the sandbags.it is very therapeutic.

situation: one morning my mother came by to get my daughter for school, and told me she saw that my daughter's cat had been hit on the road. he was dead, and i had to tell my daughter. she loved her cat so much, it was very difficult.
dialogue: one morning my mother came to my house to pick my daughter up for school and told me she saw my daughter's cat on the road and he had been hit. i had to tell my daughter about the loss of her beloved pet.
oh no that is terrible!  how did your daughter take it?
she was around 11, so she took it very hard. i went ahead and let her stay home from school, as i knew she would not do well that day.
label: sad
response: oh poor thing.  i hope she is doing better now.  losing a pet is extremely hard!

situation: i remember being so excited to take our kids to disneyland for the first time! i grew up going there, and could not wait to share the experience!
dialogue: i was so excited to take our kids to disneyland for the first time!
ooo they are gonna love it, just its expensive, i remember when it was only $20 to get in.
same! i was excited because i grew up going there. my grandparents lived in tucson, and we would spend the summers with them, the most exciting part being our drive to disneyland each year!
label: excited
response: which one are you going to california or florida ?

situation: i recently talked on the phone with my father. i had not spoken to him for a while. the whole experience was surreal because he does not appear often in my life. it reminds me of childhood.
dialogue: i recently spoke to my father for the first time in years. it reminded me of my childhood and the distant past.
cool.  somethings never change.  what did you reflect upon?
we spoke about our recent lives. apparently he is in the market for a new car.
label: nostalgic
response: yeah, i miss my dad.  he died several years ago.  what kind of car is he looking for?

situation: recently i was at my mother-in-laws and she surprised me by buying me some organizational stuff for my house.  she knows how much i love to organize and she decided to surprise me by getting me some stuff i needed.
dialogue: do you like to organize your house.  my mother-in-law recently surprised me recently with some organizing stuff b/c she knows how much i love it!
i am trying to get into it. we have our first baby on the way and need to reorganize everything. do you have tips?
labels and bins can be your best friend!  especially with a new baby.
label: surprised
response: my big thing is i am like o' i may need that leave it out of the tote box. before i know it i have more stuff laying around then when i started.

situation: i get very annoyed when people do not return or acknowledge emails.
dialogue: i find it odd, and annoying, when people do not respond to or even acknowledge emails.
well, sometimes people are busy and do not have the time to check emails
it would be great if there was a way we could all tell the best way to reach someone, i know some people prefer texts to emails, but if you are in a work situation, how do you ensure communication?
label: annoyed
response: text and emails are still the best option., until a nw way is created.

situation: i recently got very upset with my sister when said some very mean things to me. i let her know that she was out of line by yelling at her. i feel bad for both of us.
dialogue: i recently had a big argument with my sister. we both got very upset and angry at each other.
is not that what sisters are for?  what were you guys upset about?
i am not so sure. we just had a discussion that heated and became an argument with tempers flying.
label: angry
response: maybe once you feel like you can bring it up again, you can try to approach the topic from another angle.

situation: i think the most lonely i have felt was when we moved overseas, my husband had to travel out of *that* country for business, and i had a new baby and dog to keep me company!
dialogue: i felt most lonely when we first moved overseas, my husband then had to travel out of *that* country for business, and i had a new baby!
congratulations! where did you travel from and where did you end up?
from santa fe to hong kong, ultimately a fantastic adventure. and i ended up with a wonderful group of friends. expats bond quickly!
label: lonely
response: that must have been quite the culture shock, glad it all worked out though!

situation: i feel sad when i see people squandering their potential or underestimating themselves.
dialogue: one of the saddest things to me is when people underestimate what they can do and/or are capable of.
i know, that actually happens to me sometimes! last year i did not get accepted into this fellowship and for a couple of weeks i was underestimating myself a lot.
that is perfectly natural. you sound like the kind of person, though, that quickly regained their bearings. disappointments like that usually come with some *good* lessons.
label: sad
response: yea for sure, i definitely learned that sometimes life just works in a funny way. when's the last time you have been really disappointed?

situation: once i was ashamed b/c my husband asked me not to tell my mom that he was actually busy when she needed his help with something.  i ended up telling her and he found out and was pretty upset with me.
dialogue: once my husband asked me not to tell my mom that he was busy that day when she needed his help but i told her anyway.  i really felt bad b/c he got pretty upset with me.
i totally understand why he was mad. why did you tell her?
yeah that is a good question.  i totally deserved him being mad.  i just felt bad for him b/c he was so busy that day and i did not want him to have one more thing on his plate i guess
label: ashamed
response: i guess he wanted to be available if she needed him.

situation: there was a neighbor i never had met that called my son a derogatory name one time when he was riding his bike. she did not like that he got in her yard a little bit when he went around the corner and was very ugly to him, and he was only 10 years old at the time.
dialogue: there was a back neighbor that called my 10 year old son a ugly name one time, simply because he entered her yard slightly when he rode around the corner.!
what is a back neighbor? and that is crazy!
yes, she lived several house back and she did not know me, until after she did that! she knew me then, but after i talked to her, she apologized to both of us.
label: furious
response: oh my! i am glad she apologized!

situation: i am continually value *health*. too often, i see people either squandering it or not appreciating it until it is gone.
dialogue: too often, it is a health scare that makes us value health. it inspires me to try and do something to keep healthy every day.
i understand. i am think the same thing. what is your health issue?

happily, i do not have one! it is more seeing family and friends and the situations they are in. not everything can be helped, but there are some things we can all do to take care of ourselves, you know?
label: grateful
response: yes, we should try to yourself heathy

situation: every time i look through older photos of my children, i am taken right back to the time they were that size!
dialogue: every time i look through older photos of my children, i am taken right back to the time they were that size, and what we were doing! it is a bittersweet feeling, for sure.
oh, it sure is, i feel the same way. they grow up so fast!
are your kids adults now?
label: sentimental
response: one of them is! i have an 18 year old and a 12 year old.

situation: i have to say that at my wedding i felt the most confident i have ever felt.  i felt beautiful and ready to conquer the world!
dialogue: i have a hard time having confidence in myself but when i got married and i had my hair and makeup done i felt like i was beautiful!  i had so much confidence in myself that day and it was great!
i bet you were beautiful on that day. i hope that confidence has carried on since then!
i really try but it is hard to replicate that day for sure.
label: confident
response: it would be hard to replicate that day for sure, but i bet you have a lot to be confident about. you got this!

situation: my husband and i both work for ourselves, so as the end of the month approaches, we can sometimes feel a little worried about bringing in the funds we need.
dialogue: my husband and i both work for ourselves, a blessing and a curse at times, since it can be tough to determine a "regular" income.
i bet it is tough. a regular income is nice but the freedom you get from working for yourselfs is better.
we found a pretty good balance in that i have a part-time job that i *love*, and that comes with benefits like insurance. that is a big worry addressed, right there.
label: anxious
response: your so lucky. insurance is my number one worry every month.

situation: once, i had plans to meet up with an old flame. i got to the spot and spotted her from across the room. she gave me a big hug, and then introduced me to her new boyfriend.
dialogue: i met up with an old flame recently, did not go how i expected
oh ya? what happened?? i am intrigued
well, right after she gave me a big hug, she introduced me to her new boyfriend.
label: jealous
response: woah plot twist. she brought him along to meet you?

situation: i recently booked our vacation accommodations in florida, which we are going to in a few weeks. we have a large beachfront condo and i cannot wait!
dialogue: my family and i are going on vacation in a few weeks. we rented a largo beachfront condo and i cannot wait!
oh i love the beach!  which beach are you going to go to?
we are going to be staying at miramar beach in florida, about an  hour panama city beach. the view is amazing from our balcony and we are so ready!
label: excited
response: pcb is where we always go! if you want to drive a little bit, go to hunts in pcb it is off the beaten path but the best seafood and prices just go early (like 4oclock) for dinner or you will not get in!

situation: my friend maria and i had plans for brunch. we were supposed to meet at 11, but she did not even call me till 3. i had work at 5, so the day was a waste.
dialogue: i was supposed to go for brunch with my friend maria the other day. at least that was the plan.
why did not you go?
well, we had initially agreed to meet at 11. would not you know it, she did not end up returning my text until 3pm!
label: annoyed
response: is she always a flake? maybe time for a new friend?

situation: once i was super afraid b/c there was this guys following me and my mom at this grocery store.  i was not sure what to do about the situation so i told the manager at the store and he had someone walk me and my mom out to my car so we would be safe.
dialogue: me and my mom were at this grocery store recently and this guy started following us outside the store and then again inside the store it was so scary!
did he do anything to you and your mom?
well i knew he was following us and so i asked the manager to walk us out to the car and when he did we saw the guy come out again from between the two buildings b/c he was waiting on us.  so scary!
label: afraid
response: i am glad that nothing happened.

situation: i waited at a restaurant for 30 minutes before i called and left my girlfriend an angry voicemail. turns out she had been in a car crash, and was talking to the police officer.
dialogue: did i tell you what happened with li the other night? boy do i feel dumb.
no, you did not tell me! what happened?

she is 45 minutes late to our anniversary dinner. i do not know what happened to me but i called and left an angry message. turns out, she had gotten t-boned at an intersection and was talking to the police officer when i called!
label: guilty
response: oh no! is she okay?! do not beat yourself up too much, you could not have ever imagined that she had been in an accident.

situation: i went to my girlfriend's work party. i ended up drinking too much with her co-workers. she made me feel better when we got home, and blamed it on one guy in particular.
dialogue: ugh! i looked like such a fool at my girlfriend's work party!
what happened?

well, i ended up having way too much to drink. one of her co-workers had a bottle of fireball (gross i know) and was making everybody do shots. i did not want to look foolish, so i had. well too many.
label: grateful
response: i love fireball.

situation: i had tickets to see jay-z and beyonce at an outdoor venue. the big day came, and tropical storm hit. not only did the concert get rained out, but no one got a refund.
dialogue: did i tell you what happened with the concert i was supposed to go to saturday?
no, what happened?
well first of all, it was not just any concert it was jay-z and beyonce! and it got rained out!
label: disappointed
response: that is horrible. will they reschedule?

situation: i came home from vacation and my long lost friend was sleeping on my couch. we all thought he had died in a monsoon in thailand.
dialogue: you are never going to guess who was sleeping on the couch when i got home from new york.
who, tell me!
my friend benny! the one we all thought died in a monsoon in thailand!
label: surprised
response: wow, what happened?

situation: my husband came home from shopping a couple days before mother's day and he gave me some unexpected gifts. he had got me a beautiful diamond ring, along with some other wonderful gifts!
dialogue: recently, my husband came home from grocery shopping and had gifts for me for mother's day. he had a beautiful diamond ring and other lovely gifts, it was very unexpected!
that is very nice gift. did you bought anything for him for father's day?
i did! i also gave him unexpected gifts and he was super happy. i was very touched by him being so thoughtful!
label: surprised
response: that is great.

situation: i went in for a third interview at a company considering me. the owner was in attendance, and i could see he was impressed with my portfolio. they told me they still were looking at two other candidates, but i bet i will get an offer tonight or tomorrow.
dialogue: i know i should not count my chicks before they hatch, but i am feeling pretty good after that interview today!
oh what job was the interview for?
this advertising company! the owner was there you should have seen his face. my last freelance project was a real winner. think i got it?
label: confident
response: i think you got it man! congratz!

situation: i was at the world's largest pistachio when an armed man burst in to the gift shop. he was in a shootout with the police, but he never acted like he was going to hurt us. i am just happy to be alive
dialogue: did i ever tell you about the time i "got taken hostage"?
oh my  are you really serious?

as a heart attack. it was me and big c at the world's largest pistachio. all of the sudden we hear gunshots, and didi's still in the car. we ran in the building, and he comes flying in after us. he never pointed the gun at us, and we ended up running away when he was distracted. it is too crazy i cannot make this up. just glad to be alive!
label: terrified
response: i am very glad it has a happy ending. sounds a bit scary

situation: i had a friend's boyfriend make a pass at me when i went to visit my friend. he actually kissed me, and this made me very upset. i could not believe the nerve!
dialogue: i went to visit a friend one day and her boyfriend made a pass at me. he actually suddenly kissed me, as i was waiting for my friend to return. i could not believe his nerve!
oh no, what did you do?
i quietly pushed him away, as i did not want my friend to hear. i was so shocked and upset, since he knew i would not want to make a scene and took advantage.
label: angry
response: did you ever tell your friend?

situation: this past friday night our refrigerator stopped working! we had to go all weekend without it, which lead to having to throw out a lot of food and some strong odors! it was monday before we were able to get it repaired.
dialogue: this past friday night our refrigerator stopped cooling! we had to go the weekend without it, and of course had to deal with some unpleasant smells and throw away a large amount of food! it was not a fun weekend for us!
oh no, i hate when that happens. i can sympathize with you because that is happen to me twice! its okay in the winter time and you can sort of keep your food fresh but not during the summer
yes, and of course we tried to call and have someone come out, but to no avail! you do not realize how much you rely on things like that until they are not working!
label: disgusted
response: i wish refrigerators would have a warranty that replaced food when they went bad.

situation: i felt bad recently because i was dishonest with my friend about her boyfriend. he had made a pass at me, but i never told her about it.
dialogue: i felt pretty bad when i was having girl talk with my friend and we were talking about our partners. her boyfriend had made a pass at me, but i never told her about it.
wao, you must fell weird about it! what you thinki to do about it?

i felt bad, but she was not working and taking care of her grandchild, and her boyfriend was the financial support. i knew it would really be hard on her if she found out, not to mention she really loves him.
label: guilty
response: super tough situation, i think you should let her know, and let her decides next

situation: i hug my mom from behind, and it was not my mom
dialogue: i was at the mall and hug my mom and said to her: time to go mommy! and i was not her, can you imagine my reaction to it?
oh, i am sure you were embarrassed! but, maybe you can laugh about it now?
yes, totally but at the moment i felt like the stupidiest person on earth, did not know were to hide! and my mom was watching
label: embarrassed
response: well, i am sure mom had a laugh! i can imagine how you felt at the time though!

situation: i have a vacation condo in florida at the beach reserved in a few weeks. it is right on the beach, with gorgeous ocean views and i cannot wait to go.
dialogue: i am looking forward to going on vacation in a few weeks! we have a condo reserved on the beach, with fantastic ocean views. i am ready!
ah, that sounds fantastic! which ocean will you be enjoying?
well, we are staying at panama city beach, so we are right there at the gulf of mexico.
label: anticipating
response: sounds awesome! do you have a beachside beverage or traditions that you enjoy? (mine would be tequila + lime..very jimmy buffett)

situation: i was so proud of my 15 year old daughter. she was determined to work this summer, even with us telling her no one would hire her unless she was 16. she persevered and we were wrong, she was hired at the first job she interviewed for!
dialogue: i am definitely a proud parent of our 15 year old, she was determined to work this summer, and even with us saying no one would hire her until 16, she found a job!
well, that is impressive! i can see why you are proud. sounds like a hard working young lady!
that, and she is enjoying the independence of having her own money. remember that? making money that you truly could use for your *pleasure* (and not just necessities ?!)
label: proud
response: yes, i was the same way too! i started working two days after i turned 16 so i could have my own money too!

situation: i am annoyed by people who will not return their grocery carts, and just leave them in the parking lot!
dialogue: okay, a silly pet peeve but one nonetheless, when people just leave their grocery carts willy-nilly in the parking lot. no consideration for others or the people who work at the store!
absolutely i agree i always try to not even bring cart unless i have too many too carry.
me too. and i will always make sure to at *least* put it in one of those cart corrals, if not walk it back up to the store. hey, extra exercise
label: annoyed
response: yes me too now if everyone would just take our lead

situation: i wnet home, and my wife surpises me with a picture of our future baby.
dialogue: i came home, and my wife showed me a picture in 4d of our future baby, my heart speeded so fast!
oh wow. do you know whether it will be a boy or girl yet?
we choose to wait! but the amount of happiness in my body is tremendous! never felt this way before.
label: joyful
response: first time parent?

situation: i love when i am in the "flow" doing what i am doing, whether it is speaking or doing large-scale visual capture of meetings.
dialogue: i love being in the "flow", whether it is in speaking to a group of people or working to help facilitate meetings.
what kind of work do you do?

i work with different organizations on strengthening their culture, and i do large-scale visual notetaking (also known as graphic recording). are you familiar with that at all? (not unusual not to be!)
label: confident
response: actually i am not, but it sounds very interesting and by working with different organizations, i would imagine it is also exciting and new every day.

situation: i am impressed by leaders who know it is best to surround themselves with people who are smarter/better/more experienced than themselves in some areas.
dialogue: i love when leaders know that it actually *helps* them to be surrounded by strong people, people they can learn from, that challenge them, and that in some ways could be considered "better".
i agree, its always nice to have people around you who are smarter in some areas
it is just too many leaders want "yes men" and/or people who feel non-threatening. it is a trap and a quick path to mediocrity, if not failure!
label: impressed
response: yes men are definitely a bad idea when it comes to life and business

situation: i was so happy the day i learned i was pregnant with our first child!
dialogue: i will always remember the day i learned i was pregnant with our first child, halloween in chicago, and we were with friends at the shedd aquarium! i have loved baby belugas since
baby belugas are cute, but not as cute as your baby!
ha! true that that is also the year that a bug's life came out, and we always thought of our young one as "dot", the spunky little girl ant in the movie.
label: joyful
response: that is so funny! i do not think she will want to be compared to an ant when she gets older. you will have to remind her.

situation: i came in the room on mother's day. i expected a couple of gifts not balloons, tons of gifts and flowers. the gifts were so heartfelt too.
dialogue: this mother's day was amazing! i got so much more than expected and it was all so heartfelt
that is great!  sometimes we mom's get a bit forgotten, so to have an entire day where we are just loved is such a great feeling.
yes, definitely! i actually cried a few times because of how much thought went into each gift and what was written in the cards
label: surprised
response: those words are the things we cherish more than any other thing, i love it when my girls do that!

situation: i had an interview for my dream job. i felt sure i would get it, but i did not in the end.
dialogue: that is too bad. what do you think went wrong?
i am not sure, it was pretty random
did they give you any feedback?
label: confident
response: no, nothing at all

situation: i just found out that my sister and her husband are pregnant. they are great people and i hope they will be amazing parents!
dialogue: so my sister told us a couple weeks ago she was pregnant. her and her husband are so excited. i hope they have an amazing 9 months and then an amazing time raising the baby.
that is exciting news!  i bet you were so surprised!
i was very surprised. she did not tell a single person they were trying for a baby. just announced it on the 4th of july
label: surprised
response: ha!  what a neat day to announce it did they do any special kind of announcement?  i see so many videos of interesting and neat ways to make that announcement.

situation: i was excited to go biking today, but then it was raining.
dialogue: oh no, what did you do instead? did you watch netflix?
i do watch netflix sometimes.  do you watch?
yes, i do. i recently watched the series "dark." it is the german one.
label: disappointed
response: i have not heard of that one.  what genre does it fall in?

situation: one time i was going to a court hearing against my former place of employment to repeal a decision made to cancel my unemployment. i knew i would win because i had so much evidence against them and their shoddy work practices.
dialogue: i went to a court hearing for unemployment with my former employer, and i felt great about it since i was so prepared with all of the documents and everything i needed to show the court i was in the right for quitting.
did it go your way?
yes, i actually ended up winning it and they gave me 6 months of unemployment pay.
label: confident
response: that is great have you found another job yet?

situation: today no matter where i drove today the other drivers were terrible. they kept cutting me off and not signaling among other things.
dialogue: today traffic was horrible and was so frustrating!
i hate traffic too, it makes me angry
yes! people were constantly cutting me off,not signalling and slamming on their brakes
label: annoyed
response: people are so rude when they drive these days

situation: when i was 10 years old i watched the film "the grudge" and was so scared of the dark that i could not navigate around my own house.
dialogue: the grudge scared me when i was 10 to which i could not navigate my own house.
i can imagine! that was a terrifying movie.
and yet i still felt as if i had to see the sequels when they came out too.
label: afraid
response: that happened to me too. with the other exorcist movies and the ring movies. even though they scared me, i was too curious to not see the others.

situation: my friend ended up passing her semester with flying colors, despite the fact that she has 2 children and did not do well in high school. she pushed hard to overcome her circumstances.
dialogue: my best friend did amazing in school, despite having 2 children and not doing great academically in school. she ended up getting honors in her first 2 semesters.
she sounds like a person with great ability. great choice of friend.
she has been my friend for 19 years. she pushes me to do better too.
label: proud
response: that is great. i wish i had someone so close like that!

situation: today when i went outside to check my banana plant i noticed the leaf was wilted.
dialogue: today when i went outside to check my new banana plant i noticed the new leaf was turning brown.
is that a bad sign? perhaps the plant is not getting enough nutrition or sunlight?
i do not think that is the problem. i am worried about a drainage issue. i am going to check back in a couple days.
label: sad
response: oh, i see. i am not much of a horticulturist but it makes sense that it could be over-saturated.

situation: i decided i wanted a puppy and put out the word i was looking for one. on the way to get my new puppy after getting a call about one i was so thrilled.
dialogue: i decided a few months i was ready for a puppy, so i put the word out
put what word ? you mean published the info?
basically, yes. i made a classified ad. i was beyond thrilled after getting a call to get one!
label: excited
response: so what breed did you get ?

situation: i am grateful for my parents who helped me along the way when buying my first house. they helped with some groceries and with understanding my loan papers etcc.
dialogue: when i bought my first house i put down 20% of the loan, which made me broke quick. my monthly paycheck helped me with bills but my parents bought me groceries for a month until i got on my feet. so grateful for them
i would be too! you did what you had to do!
yes, i am always better off with them as my parents, they want to see us succeed
label: grateful
response: do you find the home buying experience worth it?

situation: i was really jealous of my best friend, who is a surgeon, and makes six figures a year, while i am at half that.
dialogue: my friend is a surgeon and we were discussing salary. he easily makes 200,000 a year and he is only 32. it is crazy and i was jealous of him.
you should not, because that is  a very stressful job
yeah, that is a good point. i also realized he has a high malpractice insurance, and is on call a lot.
label: jealous
response: and do not forget how many years they have to study in order to get a license for surgery

situation: i talked with my student adviser the other day. i did not realize i only had 7 months until i graduate and start my new career.
dialogue: i am in college and i was talking to my student adviser the other day about the future
really? do you know what you want to do when you graduate? i know sometimes it is tough to settle on a path.
i want to be one to run the office part of a physicians practice but that is not set in stone. i am thrilled to start my new career path
label: hopeful
response: that sounds like a great career plan. you will be filling a very important role in the physician's practice!

situation: i have a dog that lives near us and his owner never picks up his poop. it makes me feel sick!
dialogue: that is disgusting! what can you do about about it?
i am not sure. what would you do?
you could chat to them and complain!
label: disgusted
response: maybe i will try that. do you think it will work?

situation: when i was kicked out of my step parent's house for no reason, my best friend immediately took me in. i was so thankful for that opportunity.
dialogue: one time when i was kicked out of the place i was staying at, my best friend immediately told me i could stay with her until i got on my feet.
oh no, that sounds like an awful situation. what did you end up doing after that?
i stayed with her for about a year until i got my own apartment. we are getting an apartment together in a few months.
label: grateful
response: so exciting! it can be fun to have a roommate

situation: last week when i heard about toys r us closing it made me think of other memories from my childhood. i started reminiscing about the toys, music, games and so much more
dialogue: last week when toys r us closed it really made me start thinking of the 90s and my childhood
i have heard a lot of people say something similar. did you go there a lot?
i did! i was talking to my husband about the different toys i had. even started talking about the music and shows from that era
label: nostalgic
response: where i grew up did not have one nearby so i get a little jealous hearing about it.

situation: i came across a post on facebook showing all of the old toys, trends, and food from the 90s.
dialogue: the other day i came across a facebook post showing all the old stuff from the 90's. it took me way back to my childhood.
good lord you must have had facebook for a long time! i started mine in college so there is not anything from my younger years.
oh no, it was just a post someone shared that covered all the old trends, food, toys, tv shows, etc. i had facebook back in 2010 but not earlier than that.
label: nostalgic
response: oh ok. i completely understand. i had a friend share a post about making mix tapes from the radio with a cassette player. totally remember doing that!

situation: nothing makes me more furious than bullies. playground or politics, i find them intolerable.
dialogue: i hate bullies. playground or politics, i find them intolerable.
me too, bullies are part of the reason that i homeschooled.
good for you! did you find other ways to interact with kids on better terms?
label: furious
response: well, i was referring to my own kids. they have adjusted well at 17 and 19.

situation: i was going in to watch a certain movie recently that i was expecting to be pretty bad but turned out to be really good.
dialogue: i expected the new incredibles to be pretty bad but to my pleasure it came out good.
i also saw it and felt like it was pretty good. much better than the my little pony movie. that was torture.
oh i cannot imagine. i do not think i would pay more than a quarter to see that movie.
label: surprised
response: yeah it was so boring. even my kids got bored and they had been dying to see it,

situation: my parents keep taking my money
dialogue: my parents keep taking my money
that is not nice of them. why do they keep taking it??
they need it for other stuff. i never get a chance to save any of it.
label: angry
response: sorry to hear that. i found that it helps to have multiple savings accounts, so whenever you get a certain amount of money (like $5, $10) save it and be strict not to spend it.

situation: i get annoyed when adults do not seem to be able to clean up after themselves, especially at work! who do they think will clean up after them?!
dialogue: so when adults do not clean up after themselves in a business environment, what is that ?! why do they think a "mommy" will come along to clean up after them?!

lol! this is perfect timing because i had the " you are an adult not a child" conversation with my girlfriend not too long ago. i had left popsicle wrapper on the night stand and it got sticky. i argued if you are willing to date someone who likes to eat popsicles in bed, then you have to deal with the consequences.

lol! okay, y'all are a sitcom. i have to ask what flavor. (and yes, i side with your girlfriend. if for no other reason: ants. you do not want ants marching into your bed toward any potentially sensitive regions. okuuurrrrrr?)
label: annoyed
response: okay, it was not just one, it was three: one cherry, and two grape. how anyone can eat just one at a time? oh, the number of wrappers was also brought up. like, i do not care if yuo bought them for the kids, i am part of this household as well. i tried to make it a teaching moment about how if you do not get the popsicles first someone else would, but i think my arguments have been falling on deaf ears for awhile now,

situation: a friend let me know the morning of christmas of 2007 that my best friend had fallen off of a roof and died.
dialogue: the hardest time in my life was when my best friend died on christmas of 2007.
wow. i am so sorry to hear that. that would be incredibly hard. what happened?
she fell off of a roof. she fell asleep and when she got up, she slipped.
label: devastated
response: that is horrible. i am really sorry about your friend.

situation: there was a time a few years back where i was given a car. we only had one and needed a second and it was so helpful. i was blown away by someone's kindness.
dialogue: a few years ago, there was a time that i really needed a car. i had to go to school and my husband worked full time.
did you not have a car? that is hard. i do not have one now and use uber and lyft all the time.
we had one car we shared but i had a little girl and we were just stuck at the house or got rides. we did not really have uber and lydt yet. but someone gave me a car out of the blue!
label: grateful
response: that is incredible! i swear some things in life are determined by fate. i am glad you were able to get a car.

situation: a few years back, all i wanted was a surprise birthday party. i begged my husband to throw me one every year. then one year, he actually planned one, and i almost did not get there in time!
dialogue: have you ever had a surprise birthday party planned for you? i did a few years back.
yes.my first was when i turned 18.
that is awesome! what a good year to do it. i remember begging my husband to throw me one every year.
label: surprised
response: lol.you had to beg your husband for a surprise party??

situation: it was raining hard one night and the power shut off.
dialogue: it was raining hard one night and the power shut off
did you have candles or a flash light to help yous see?
only lighters. now we are stocked on candles
label: terrified
response: well atleast you have something to help you guys.

situation: i studied a lot for my psychology exam and ended up acing it with a 98%.
dialogue: one time i studied my butt off for my first psychology exam. it was hard and i studied all night.
how did you do
i ended up actually getting a 98%!
label: prepared
response: that is great! my b.s. ( i always hate saying that because i have to say i have my bs in psychology) is in psychology.

situation: i love our new cat to death but he is such a night owl. he goes crazy all night and i can never sleep.
dialogue: do you have any pets?
pet? like dogs and other?
yes. we got a cat not too long  ago and he drives me crazy! he is such a night owl and is always banging into stuff.
label: annoyed
response: wow, seriously i hate those pets being around me

situation: my son graduated highschool.
dialogue: my son graduated.
from where?
highschool.
label: proud
response: congrats ,that is a step forward

situation: i went through a divorce, i had to leave my husband and daughter behind. it broke my heart and i felt so alone.
dialogue: one of the hardest times in my life was when i had to leave my husband and daughter when i went through a divorce.
i am so sorry. i cannot imagine what you must have went through.
i felt like i had no one. the two people i loved most in life i barely saw and was disconnected from.
label: lonely
response: that must have been really hard.

situation: my husband has a cousin who is good at everything. he is so young yet he owns his own business.
dialogue: i know this guy who is so young, yet he owns his own major business. it is really impressive.
really?  what kind of work does he do?
he owns his own coffee shop. he started roasting when he was 16 and now he is only 26 but distributes beans across the country.
label: impressed
response: wow. that is impressive.  are you guys still friends?  maybe he could get you a job in one of his stores.

situation: my mother has always been sentimental. she thinks i do not want to keep anything but i am just not as sentimental as she is. it hurts her feelings.
dialogue: i feel slightly bad. i think i hurt my mom's feelings last week because she told me about a necklace i got rid of when i was a kid. she is a packrat and i am really, really not.
awww. reminds me of the show hoarders when the family members argue over silly things like that.  what was the necklace all about did you make it or something?

i feel like her and my aunt kind of could be on that show. :/ i am all about less stuff to pick up! eh.it was a necklace she gave me when they found out they were pregnant. it said "special sister". i am probably a jerk.
label: sentimental
response: well why did you have it if it belonged to them?  did you pawn it?

situation: whenever i hear certain songs, it brings back so many memories. mostly of when i was young and dumb staying up late with friends.
dialogue: have you ever heard a song on the radio and it just takes you back to a different time? like an escape?
all the time.  that is part of listening to music i suppose.  the songs remind you of when you first heard them.
yeah, i guess that is fair. it happens all the time to me too. sometimes makes me wish i was reliving those moments but i do not think i would really want to go back.
label: nostalgic
response: i know what you mean.  however, the older i get the more i want to go back.

situation: when my daughter got her first cat, it only lived with us a few weeks until it was hit by a car.
dialogue: i was just thinking about how a few years ago, we lost our cat.
oh no!  what happened to it?
it was the first time he had gotten outside and he did not come back that night. he was hit by a car.
label: sad
response: so sad!  i am sorry.  do not feel too bad its natural for them to want to be outside.

situation: my dog is getting really old and i am afraid to lose her. i care about her so much.
dialogue: i am sorry to hear that. i had a dog die once too.
it is so sad to know but my mother is rather sick of flu and not dying
the flu sure makes it feel like you are dying haha
label: caring
response: oh yes but it is not as bad and you cannot call it dying like in cancer patient

situation: i once ate a raw oyster and got food poisoning. i have never felt so gross.
dialogue: once i ate a raw oyster because my uncle offered me some and i contracted food poisoning. things were coming out from both ends, so gross.
did you get sick afterwards
extremely, but it passed after a day or so. never consume raw shellfish, unless sushi because they properly prepare it
label: disgusted
response: i do not think sushi is that good too. the best option is to stop eating them in any form of food

situation: one time my friend played a prank on me where he acted dead. i came down stairs and there was a red substance on the ground near his head, but it was just ketchup!
dialogue: i recently had a prank played on me. my friend pretended to be dead and used ketchup as a prop!
damn that sounds like a pretty good one! how did that turn out?
i ended up being very upset at first and then laughed it off!
label: surprised
response: that is how all pranks should be!

situation: my boyfriend of five years and i broke up. i do not know what to do with my life.
dialogue: my boyfriend of five years and i broke up. i do not know what to do with my life.
i am so sorry to hear that. is there any chance you might be able to reconcile???
i do not think so. he wants to join the military since his dad has passed away and i am not sure if that is the lifestyle i want.
label: lonely
response: oh that is too bad. ): i do not want to overstep but i always like to encourage people to hold on to their love for each other no matter what trials come up.

situation: i recently found out the girl i am very attracted to might not like me in the same way. this makes me sad because we get along incredibly well.
dialogue: i recently found out the girl i love may not feel the same way. this makes me sad.
so sad,you can never force someone to love you. you will find the right person for you.
i hope so. maybe one day, but i am not so sure.
label: disappointed
response: do not give up on love.it the best feeling ever to experience. wish you well.

situation: i recently felt hopeful towards my chances with a dating prospect. i hope that she likes me, and i think she is giving me more and more thought as time goes by.
dialogue: i feel pretty hopeful towards this woman that i really enjoy. i am trying to date her.
do you have a good chance with her. have you talked to her about it?
i think she has expressed interest in me in the past, but she recently moved, but she is not too far away. i might ask her on a date the next time i am around.
label: hopeful
response: that will be better. talk to her before you lose her

situation: i knew my birthday was coming up but was shocked to find all my friends in the bar at the same time!
dialogue: i am very lucky, my friends are so great. what is the best birthday you have had?
probably one where i got a limo with all my friends and went to this restaurant, it was great. what about yours, what makes your friends so great too?
wow, i am impressed! my friends just show me love and buy me tequila aha!
label: surprised
response: i wish my friends bought me alcohol, that would make for a hell of a night!

situation: i recently had an argument with my sister. the debate grew heated and we ended the conversation both very annoyed with one another.
dialogue: hi are you there?
i recently had an argument with my sister. it made us both very annoyed.
label: annoyed
response: that must be hard i always wished i had a sister though i have a brother

situation: i recently heard what appeared to be gunshots on my street. i locked all my doors and closed my windows.
dialogue: i recently had a scary experience. i heard gunshots on my street.
oh my! you must have been terrified! did everything turn out ok?
everything turned out fine. i think somebody in the nearby neighborhoods may have been hurt, though.
label: afraid
response: that is not good at all. that is a very scary situation.

situation: do you know the feeling of drinking hot cocoa on a cold winter's night?
dialogue: do you know the feeling of drinking a mug of hot cocoa with marshmallows on a cold winter's night?
i have not tried yet, but i feel like it would be enjoying and full of delight
next time you get a cold front in your area you should try it. it is extremely relaxing and sleep-inducing haha
label: content
response: i live in a place where it only snows once in 10 years. so, i think i am passing on that

situation: i have been thinking that i really love my mother. she does her best to still provide for me to this day.
dialogue: i love my mom. she does her best to provide for me, even to this day.
you are so lucky. mums are the best. what do you do for her?
i tell her i love her and also send her gifts from time to time. she does not live too close to me but i try.
label: grateful
response: you should spend time with her whilst you can. my mum died and i wish i had been with her more.

situation: i tried my best for an exam, i still failed!
dialogue: you know, that is tough, but it happens to the best of us. what went wrong?
nothing went wrong, we just have different lives in different places. i go visit every now and then.
but you failed the exam? did you revise?
label: disappointed
response: i did not revise. sometimes exams are failed and things are not corrected.

situation: my mother recently helped me purchase a car. she knows a lot about the subject and helped a lot.
dialogue: my mom helped me buy a car. she is the best.
that is great that you have an awesome mom!
she is amazing. do you love your mom?
label: trusting
response: yes i do love my mom very much.

situation: i recently found out that the girl of my dreams does not like me. i feel very sad about the whole ordeal.
dialogue: i think that the girl of my dreams likes somebody else. i feel very sad about it.
ooh, am so sorry about that. have you tried to talk to her?
it is tough because she has been out of the country for a month, so i will likely discuss it when she returns.
label: sad
response: that will help you know her stand on your relationship

situation: i hate it when my husband goes away for work. there is no one else here but me.
dialogue: that sounds tough. what do you do/
well i am a mover so i have to bring heavy furniture up and down stairs.
that sounds like hard work. i hope you are paid well.
label: lonely
response: it pays decent and feeds the kids so i cannot complain.

situation: i recently felt hopeful about my chances to complete college. i have a great gpa and i see the light at the end of the tunnel.
dialogue: i have only a few more semesters in college. i feel very hopeful about my chances of finishing.
that is awesome. what are you majoring in?
environmental engineering! i enjoy it, but i would not say it is my passion in life.
label: hopeful
response: sometimes it is good to have something you enjoy make money so you can pursue your passion without worrying about it.

situation: i watch so many scary movies that i have not been able to sleep alone in years due to fear.
dialogue: i watch so many scary movies that i have not been able to sleep alone in years due to fear.
that is such a bummer. why did you keep watching them?
i honestly do not know. i have always been fascinated with them since being a little girl and that fascination has never gone away.
label: afraid
response: i understand being fascinated by them they can be very intriguing. maybe you should stop watching as many though.

situation: donald trump was elected to the presidency. this makes me lose faith in humanity, to be quite honest.
dialogue: donald trump is now the president. it makes me feel bad about life.

oh yeah, donald trump is such a charlatan. he has some really shady history too. i am actually a christian and a conservative but i am appalled that everyone on the "right" have fallen for this guy. he is so against what the real conservative values are supposed to be.
i agree. i am glad real conservatives are in opposition to him, too.
label: disgusted
response: yeah, i am sad about the whole left vs. right thing in general. ultimately we should all be uniting against the corrupt people that are running amok in the government.

situation: i recently got admitted into a master's program for school. i will be attending the university of florida.
dialogue: i am now going to be a master's student. i will got to he university of florida
awwww. congratulations. what is your major
environmental engineering is my major. i enjoy it.
label: excited
response: lovely. that is really great. wishing you all the best

situation: i recently felt very faithful towards my lover. she is the best and loves me infinitely.
dialogue: i have been feeling very faithful these days. my lover treats me so well.
that is interesting, how does he buy you stuff or is he just really nice?
he is really nice and provides for me well. he is also very sweet and very respectful.
label: faithful
response: i am happy for you wish i could find a nice lover like that.

situation: do you like to go through old family pictures?
dialogue: do you like to go through old family pictures?
yes, i think they offer a great bridge to the past. do you?
absolutely. i love to hear my mámá tell me stories from her childhood trapping nutria and trawling with her family.
label: sentimental
response: that is great. it sounds like a very good situation to be in.

situation: i found out the woman i love likes another man. this makes me feel very hurt inside.
dialogue: i recently found out that the woman of my dreams like another. i am incredibly jealous of him.
:( i am very sorry. have you tried telling her how you feel? that could affect her decision.
i have not told her as much as i need to. i am trying to build the courage.
label: jealous
response: i know it is hard to build the confidence needed to do something like that, but you do not want to keep them to yourself. if you really think she is the woman of your dreams then you have to try

situation: i used to love university. it has been so long.
dialogue: how long?
i am not quite following. anything you want to tell me about?
about what exactly?
label: sentimental
response: well did you have any story or anything that you had in mind that you wanted to tell me? i told you a story of mine before so you owe me haha.

situation: my mother recently took out a bunch of money on my behalf from the bank. i trust her so much!
dialogue: my mother recently went to the bank for me. i love her so much.
that is really nice of her.  it is nice to have someone to help you do things sometimes.
nice people are the best. empathy is something we all need more of!
label: trusting
response: yes.  too many people these days are mean to one another!

situation: my father was recently put close to his death bed. fortunately he is alive, but his recent health issues have been devastating.
dialogue: my father almost died. his recent health problems have been devastating.
that is so sad, i hope you've gotten over it.
it is tough, but i think i will make it.
label: devastated
response: that is good, death is a natural part of life.

situation: a friend of mine recently bought a new corvette. it makes me so jealous!
dialogue: my friend bought a new car. this makes me so jealous!
no,u do not have to be
it makes me feel inferior. hopefully i will get over it.
label: jealous
response: yes,u will surely get over it

situation: i very much like this new female friend of mine. i just want to give her all of my love.
dialogue: i recently met a new person that i am very fond of. i want to give her my love and care.
that is very special and i am so happy for you.
i am very happy, too. do you have someone special in your life?
label: caring
response: yes, married for 15 years and it is still great.

situation: i am very appreciative of my family structure. they care about me a lot.
dialogue: my family is very loving. they care about me so much.
that is good to have a loving family.
i agree. i hope you are also close to your family!
label: grateful
response: i am i love them very much. however we live on opposite parts of the country.

situation: i stole a pokemon card from a friend when i was young. i feel guilty still.
dialogue: i stole my friend's pokemon card when we were 7. i still feel guilty about it.
wow, 7 years? you were really young then
yes
label: guilty
response: but did you tell your friend about it later?

situation: i once took a dive into the pool. i came up with no swim trunks.
dialogue: i one time lost my trunks in the pool! people saw me in a way i did not want!
oh no! that must have been super embarrassing! how did you react to that?
i covered my body and then went to the bathroom and got a towel!
label: embarrassed
response: my goodness, well i guess that happens to all of us at least once.

situation: i recently graduated from college. i feel great about my accomplishments.
dialogue: i recently graduated from college. i loved it and now i feel great about my life!
that sounds fun, starting a new life is always great!
i agree. i am thinking about moving to the west coast of the usa.
label: proud
response: west coast is fun, but it can be expensive.

situation: she told me she was not pregnant after the doctors visit. but then later that day while browsing a furniture store, i found a bookmark hanging on the ear of a wooden horse. it said our nicknames on it + baby!
dialogue: we went for a doctor visit because she was
because she was what?
sorry. because she was "late". but she told me the result was negative, not pregnant. so then we went to a furniture store just to browse
label: surprised
response: i think that is a good news for you both since you are not married

situation: when my daughter went to university, and wife travelled abroad for work, i had the whole house to myself. i found the place became empty really quickly.
dialogue: having the whole house to your self sometimes is not as good as it may seem!
i can imagine the loneliness someone can experience.
my whole family is out the house for a few months. i am going to be so bored with no one around.
label: lonely
response: get your self a friend to stay with for a couple of months.

situation: i entered a competition to win a ps4. i was told i was in the last 3 to win!
dialogue: i have a huge chance to win a ps4!
wow, please make it real.
there is only 2 other people in the final round! winning a ps4 will be awesome!
label: excited
response: wow, i belief u can make it.

situation: i told my son to not eat any snacks before dinnertime. he raided the snack cupboard, eating all my favourite snacks, and he made a mess out of it.
dialogue: my son really needs to cut down on the amount of sugary snacks he has!
who is supplying these snacks?
well, my wife gets them on deals, so likes to hoard them in the cupboard.
label: disappointed
response: sounds like a cupboad cleaning is necessary. if they ain't around, they cannot be eaten.

situation: day four now since my wife went to visit her family. the house is too quiet now. i have started sleeping with the light on
dialogue: the house is very quiet now that she is been gone for four days visiting with her family
why did she go visiting?
because she hasn't seen them in almost 2 years. misses them
label: lonely
response: really? so she would have travelled with him

situation: i was on my way home from work, and a seagull threw up all over my suit in the middle of the train station! i was a total mess, so may people were watching!
dialogue: in the middle of the station, on my new suit, a seagull threw up on me!
that sounds horrible. you must've been mad.
i was! i had to travel all the way home with a huge mess on me!
label: embarrassed
response: where was this?

situation: i always give my best at work, and i am turning a bit old these days. i was passed over for promotion, by someone new and much younger than me. i should have got that job instead!
dialogue: i cannot believe someone half my age got promoted instead of me!
well,it can happen like that atimes
have you ever missed out on a promotion?
label: jealous
response: yes,it really hurts

situation: i went to my mother in laws funeral last sunday. my wife was very tearful, and needed to have her family around her in the difficult moment.
dialogue: my wife cried quite a lot at her mothers funeral. they had a very close bond.
am sorry to hear that. what happened to the mother
unfortunately she passed away, hence the funeral.
label: sad
response: soryy, may she rest in peace, please try comfort your wife

situation: i applied for a really high paying job last week. i am over qualified, so this should be easy, and i should get the job without any effort.
dialogue: getting this new job should be easy. i am easily the best person that applied.
damn, very confident huh? what job did you apply for?
ceo of apple. i figured they need a steve 2.0 to take them forward!
label: confident
response: oh wow, that outta pay very well.

situation: even though i felt she was not in love with me any more after five years of marriage, i still remained faithful until the end
dialogue: ok, so after 5 years and the baby, there was disconnect. things like not sleeping at the same times, not even hardly talking. just avoiding each other really
oh boy that is the worst, so frustrating! has there been any change since?
plenty. kicked them out long time ago. now with new wife of 5 years haha. but point is, i never cheated even during those 8 months of feeling alone, heck, being alone
label: faithful
response: hahaha you put the hammer down good for you bro. how are things with the new wife going?

situation: i cannot believe my son took my car without asking me! i missed an important job interview because i could not drive!
dialogue: my son is such a rascal! he took my car for a joy ride!
oh my god! how old is he?
he is only 13! i did not even think he had that in him!
label: furious
response: you really need to let him know not to do that again, he could've really gotten himself and others hurt!

situation: i cannot believe my brother is dating a super model. she should be dating me instead, i am much more interesting!
dialogue: my brother.dating an a list supermodel. i do not know what to think!
really? what makes them a list?
he is dating kylie jenner. have you heard of her?
label: jealous
response: yeah i have. what is your brothers name?

situation: i cannot believe i did not fit into my old wedding dress. the years have not been kind, and i need to start making changes.
dialogue: have anything to tell me about?
not being able to fit into an old wedding dress, is one of a womans worst nightmare.
oh wow, i can imagine. how old was it?
label: disappointed
response: the dress was a few years old, i could not believe it did not fit.

situation: i ordered a medium latte, no sugar from starbucks. they completely got my order wrong, it was green and frozen!
dialogue: starbucks always get's my order wrong!
i like starbucks. but they are a little expensive for me to go there often.
they definitely are expensive. what is your favourite drink to get?
label: furious
response: a latte.

situation: my son finally graduated from harvard. he is worked so hard for this his entire life.
dialogue: i am so happy for my son, went to his graduation from harvard last week.
wao,thats great,congrats!
thank you! looks like there is going to be another doctor in the family!
label: proud
response: that is good to know,keep it up

situation: i was carrying a large pizza from my favourite pizza place. almost at the door home, just taking the keys out of my pocket. and then the delicious pizza fell out of the box and all onto the floor!!
dialogue: my pizza i bought fell all over the floor on my way home!
wow, that will be so devastating for you
the pizza was from my favourite pizza shop as well! quite the sad moment.
label: devastated
response: so, how did you now do it

situation: i ordered a big mac no lettuce from mcdonalds. they gave me so much lettuce! i sent the order back 5 times, before i finally just walked out and took my money elsewhere!
dialogue: why does mcdonalds always get my order wrong! i said no lettuce!
report to their management
sometimes i think the management do not even care!
label: angry
response: just give it a trial

situation: my wife baked a huge bunch of cookies for a charity bake sale. i felt so bad eating so many, but they were so good.
dialogue: i ate so much of my wife's cookies, but she should not make them so irresistible.
haha, how did she feel when she found out?
she made me pay twice what they would have sold for at the bake sale. the cookies were for charity, you see.
label: guilty
response: oh no! those cookies sure do sound delicious though.

situation: on my way home from work, i stepped in a huge pile of dog mess. in my brand new gucci shoes, which were so expensive!
dialogue: just my luck i step into a huge pile of dog mess.
dang, i hated that. at least it is not cow poop, that is worst.
that is true, cow poop is much worst! but i was wearing brand new gucci flip flops!
label: disgusted
response: oh man, you gotta super clean it, have the professionals do it even

situation: when i make my world famous chicken and rice, i like to cut up all the ingredients into small containers. then i follow the cooking instructions down to a second. makes the best rice, everytime.
dialogue: the key to making good chicken and rice, is following the recipe precisely
how do you make it?
you've got to cut up all the ingredients, and put it in small containers, before finally cooking all at once.
label: prepared
response: good to know.  i will do it like it next time.

situation: when i saw the ultrasound and knew it was a boy! it was very funny and made me happy
dialogue: we asked the doc to put the ultrasound in an envelope so we could record our reaction to the gender reveal. i was very happy when i finally saw it!
