congrats! what gender did your child end up being?
thanks. no mistake about it, it is a boy!. takes after his father ;)
label: joyful
response: that is great my man! i cannot wait for my first son. so far 6 daughters

situation: i cannot believe my son failed his exams. he spent too much time playing football, and not enough time studying.
dialogue: my son failed his exams! can you believe it! i do not know what to do!
do not panic, and do not be harsh on the kid. perhaps spend time going over the subject together? or maybe he is having other trouble that is affecting his studies
he spent all his time playing football instead of studying! i warned him about this!
label: disappointed
response: it is better to do what you are passionate about. do that and success follows

situation: i prayed, and prayed for weeks that i would do good in a test. luckily god answered my prayers, and i passed!
dialogue: without prayer, i do not know if i would have passed that important test!
that is cool.  for what class
it was a test in numeracy, so counting 1 100. i have always found that difficult, but god made it possible!
label: faithful
response: god works in mysterious ways

situation: i saw a blind man play guitar very well and was very impressed
dialogue: hey! i saw a blind man play a guitar once. was so surreal and i was so impressed
wow. i would be too. i love guitar, it is my favorite musical instrument. i wonder if he was born blind
yea. i think he was. his story was crazy too. he is an orphan
label: impressed
response: just goes to show that people can be amazing. just never give up, persistence is the key

situation: on the way to the airport the other day the car broke down. did not know if was going to make it to the flight
dialogue: we were 20 mins from the airport and the car broke down, overheated and would not start !
oh no! that sounds annoying. did you end up getting help?
had to hitch hike. made it on time for check in though. now the cars been in the shop 4 days, no progress. kinda getting worried about it
label: apprehensive
response: that sounds terrible! i hope everything gets sorted! be positive

situation: my wife after a 6 hour labour just gave birth to our first boy! i am going to name him after me, he looks just like me!
dialogue: my son was just born, my first boy after 11 girls!
that is amazing, congratulations. 12 kids your amazing.
it is easier if you had 12 different baby mamas, that is my trick anyway. this last labour was 6 hours long!
label: joyful
response: haha, your a player.

situation: i was walking around my mansion at night one cold day in october. i then heard spooky sounds, and saw the ghost of michael jackson.
dialogue: some times at night, i can hear some shouting "ahhhhhhh", "hee hee".
that is creepy. what do you think they were, hyenas?
no, the spooky thing is. i think it is the ghost of michael jackson. i even saw him dancing to billie jean.
label: afraid
response: must have been quite a sight.

situation: i was on a bank robbing spree with my best friend. he got caught with half the cash, and is currently doing 30 years. i managed to escape to the bahamas, and sometimes i still think about him.
dialogue: my best friend is doing 30 years in prison. i miss my good friend.
oh,will u be going to pay him a visit?
i cannot visit him. i have had to flee the country. we were robbing banks together, and he got caught with half the cash. i am currently in the bahamas.
label: guilty
response: hope u will not indulge in such act like theft again?

situation: my son got his first professional contract with a football team. he worked so hard, and really deserves it.
dialogue: my son worked for many years to be a footballer, he finally signed a pro contract!
wow, that is a great news
he is just joined juventus. cannot be more happy for the lad.
label: proud
response: wow, that is a really good club

situation: expecting a baby boy. it has taken 3 months of saving but i did and now i feel much more prepared for him
dialogue: 4 months later he will be here. it has taken me around 3 months to save up enough money to be ready for him when he is born
is this your first son?
yes it is. i am very happy
label: prepared
response: awesome! any daughters? what will be your sons name?

situation: i was walking home from work one day. then this huge bat came out of nowhere, and chased me for a whole hour!
dialogue: on my way home from work, a massive bat chased me!
holy moses! i hate them things. flying rats is what they are.
i know! this one was absolutely huge, almost human sized. chased me for a whole hour. the more i think about it, it might have been the batman! i should not have stolen those diamonds!
label: terrified
response: lol. do not do the crime if cannot face the bat ;)

situation: i am grateful to jesus for saving me from certain doom. i will keep my promises to him!
dialogue: every day i thank god for my blessings. i would be in hole right now if it were not for him
praise god man! he really is amazing and we should always be grateful for we have
especially since he takes care of us even though do not deserve it
label: grateful
response: amen! so true. its especially awesome when he picks us up in every fall. his love never fails

situation: during an important school event, my shorts fell down when i was running and my whole team was counting on me
dialogue: once during an important school sporting event, my entire sports team was counting on me but mid-way through my event, my shorts fell down and i tripped
for real? that must've been embarrassing. sorry to hear about that
yea! it was! i thought everyone would be annoyed at me but the next day when i went back to school, everyone just made it a joke so its alright. this was about 5-6 years ago now haha
label: ashamed
response: well that is good and bad. hopefully the joke did not carry on too long

situation: right now i am listening to songs on youtube. tupac. takes me back!
dialogue: i love youtube. been listening to all my classic tracks. tupac forever
i love me some tupac. real talk.
i started out with one hit wonders but ended up at pac. i miss my youth
label: nostalgic
response: me too. i always end up on the 90s hip hop station on pandora.

situation: when my dog died when i was younger.
dialogue: when i was younger, my dog died. he was getting up there in age, but he was still on the young side. later, we heard the pet food we had been feeding him had been recalled because of similiar fatalities.
sorry to hear that. did someone do anything against the company selling the food?
no, they just had a recall. apparently they did not clean out their machines properly when making the food, so it got contaminated.
label: sad
response: someone should have sued them.

situation: seeing the less fortunate and people who have nothing, makes me so grateful and content with the life i live
dialogue: seeing people who have less than me just makes me so grateful for the blessings i have been given
oh yes, at least, you will be in a position to help them in return
absolutely! always give to people who have less than myself
label: content
response: that is good. you have a good heart

situation: for a long time i was not sure what would happen. but almost 2 years on and no sign of them
dialogue: hiding for almost 2 years but i am still not over my paranoia that one day i will have to pay for what i did. do not ask what it was
you must feel awful,  why do not you come clean, maybe you will feel better.
no way. i just pray she can forgive me. i could never admit to this sin. jesus save me
label: anxious
response: yes jesus can save you if you ask him.  he always forgive.

situation: when i was younger, this little kid was going around tripped other kids and being a jerk in general. he was picking on kids smaller than him, which really annoyed me. so, i tripped him with a hoola hoop.
dialogue: when i was a kid, i went to this group with other kids my age, it was in a big gym. there were kids of different ages, and one of the kids (8 years old or so) was picking on the littler kids. so, when he had his back turned, i looped him with a hoola hoop and tripped him so he fell flat on his face.
he deserved that, i think.

yeah, i was pretty amazed in the moment, he was flat as a board in mid air before he landed flat on his face. i had to watch for a moment in awe, before i realized he was getting up and i was about to get smacked. so, i ran towards where the parents were seated, stopped when i turned the corner, and walked calmly over to my mom, taking a seat on her lap. i looked innocent as could be as the mean kid came around the corner, and i forced myself to sit still so that when he smacked me in the face with the hoola hoop, i looked like a helpless victim.
label: angry
response: wow, interesting.

situation: she got a job and a new car then suddenly i became unimportant. she would stay out until 3am with her new friend from work
dialogue: after she got her 1st job and new car, she started doing girls night out. out until 3am one morning. i checked her chat history and sure enough she had kissed another guy
wow, you must have felt jealous
jealous is not the one i felt. i wanted to rip her apart
label: furious
response: hahahaa, its not easy though, i would have done same

situation: my dad worked his ass off at a job he did not enjoy, doing back breaking work. always amazed that he was able to do that as long as he did.
dialogue: my dad always worked his ass off at a job he did not like in order to support us, doing a lot of back breaking work as a caretaker. he even had a second job at wal-mart for a while. i have no idea how he managed to do that sort of thing.
when you have responsibilities that you really care about, you do what you have to. i commend him. its hard raising a family,

yeah, especially because we were single income. my mom homeschooled my brother and i. i think he took only a handful of sick days his entire time working, had something like 600 days saved up when he retired.
label: impressed
response: oh wow. i have never heard of that many sick days.

situation: she went behind my back to return her ex's t-shirt. lied about it. i found out through her facebook messages
dialogue: my instincts are never wrong. i found out her lies when i checked her facebook chat history.
so, what was she lying to you about?
she arranged to meet up with her ex to return his t-shirt! why do that behind my back? we had just started seeing each other. made me so mad
label: devastated
response: oh, she should not have done that

situation: i thought she wanted to do it. i did not force anything
dialogue: i never thought she would tell anyone and make it seem like i did something wrong. i did not force her
oh no how horrible
ye and so i had to leave the country because of her
label: ashamed
response: oh no

situation: when i was 12 we had to shower after gym. well i did not want anyone to see me naked but had to go through with it
dialogue: public school really sucks sometimes. making boys shower all together. i did not want to but had to or else fail pe
i hate public schools ooo
yes. well it was a long time ago but i have not forgotten
label: embarrassed
response: but it is really cool atimes

situation: my mom home schooled me basically through my entire education besides college, since she knew it would be better for me.
dialogue: my mom homeschooled me when i was little. i was in public school till first grade, but after that i was homeschooled. did take a semester in grade 11 though to make sure i was up to current standards.
that is cool, i did online school in high school
really? i did not even know that was an option. then again i am 25 so it may not have been available then.
label: grateful
response: well were pretty close in age

situation: when i was 17 i found out brandon lee had died during filming of my fav movie the crow. this sadness is still with me as i am also a big bruce lee fan
dialogue: i still have not got over it. brandon lee rip. i was 17 when i found out he died during filming. i visited the area he took his last steps a couple years ago
i remember him, he was going to be a great actor.
now the remake is well on its way. maybe it can lift this depression i feel if they stay true to the story. jason mamoa is not bad looking
label: sad
response: yeah he might do a pretty good job as that character.

situation: after years of trying and failing, i had to change and become better. now i am ready to take on any life challenge and survive
dialogue: i had to adapt to life. i had to change to survive. now i feel better
adapting to life is always good to do.
i am reminded every day that i can survive anything. a friend gave me a special bracelet (paracord)
label: prepared
response: that is a great attitude to have. you should keep with that.

situation: i recently found out that a good friend of mine has been cheating on her fiance with multiple different men for years. i was aghast and horrified that she would behave this way and even more upset that she tried to justify the behavior.
dialogue: i recently found out a good friend of mine has been cheating on her fiance for years.
how awful! how do you feel about it?
very angry and frustrated that she would behave that way. it makes me think less of her as a person.
label: disgusted
response: yes i understand, it is really sad when you find that people you have known a long time can be very different from what you thought.

situation: i was sucker punched when i was 17. he broke his hand and ran away. i never got to punish him.
dialogue: i was sucker punched when i was 17. the guy broke his hand and fled the scene. i saw him one time after this riding a bicycle but did not do anything.
lols why did not you do anything
i was not confident. now i regret not punishing him.
label: furious
response: awww but it is still good that you did not push him, cox it might lead to something else

situation: i felt pleased with myself when i completed my masters degree at nearly 40 years old.
dialogue: i recently completed my masters degree in education at almost 40 years old. i feel really pleased with myself.
oh my goodness! how wonderful! that is so awesome! congratulations.
thanks! it was a huge challenge, and i am so glad to have it behind me!
label: proud
response: wow! i better! i stopped at associates of general studies, because i wanted to be a mom more. so that is a huge step for you!

situation: i am happy with where i live, my house, my income, and i am grateful to god.
dialogue: i feel happy about the new house i have and that i can work from home. thanks be to god
congratulations! i hope to get a house next year
it took me 9 months of determination and sacrifice. but worth it.
label: content
response: i bet! hard work pays off

situation: when she fell down the steps i blamed myself for not being close enough to catch her. i cared for her for months after that until she was better.
dialogue: i blamed myself for her fall because i was not close enough to prevent it. i took care of her for months afterwards.
things happen that are bad, i am sure it was not your fault.
i was distracted by the sound of running water.
label: caring
response: i am sure they forgave you in the end.

situation: today i have been listening to all my favorite songs from when i was in my early twenties.
dialogue: i cannot get enough of music today. especially all my songs/bands from when i was in my twenties.
music always seems to be better from the past, i understand all too well.
its true though, they cannot make good music these days. not in any genre.
label: nostalgic
response: i totally agree, new music is not as good.

situation: i get paid today and this new game i have been wanting is coming out today. i have been waiting to get it and today i will!
dialogue: i get paid today and i am getting this new game i have been waiting on to be released!
i get paid today as well! what game are you thinking about getting?
i am thinking about getting farcry 5. i pre-order for the early release! i am really excited about it.
label: anticipating
response: did not that game come out a few months ago? i got it shortly after i released and i was not very impressed. it was not a bad game, but it certainly was not the best game.

situation: i joined a organization 6 months ago as a sales representative. but, with my hard work and talent that god has gifted me i went on for a position of junior manager were i manage 5 supervisor in just 6 months. being junior manager in just 6 months is being grateful to me.
dialogue: hi, i joined a firm 6 months ago and then i got a promotion for junior manager
congratulations. that sounds like the fast track.
yes, they thought that i have some extraordinary talent and that is the reason i got that position
label: grateful
response: cool. maybe next year you will be a partner!

situation: i have appeared for a driving license thrice and still i have not being able to crack it.
dialogue: hi, i have applied for a driving license thrice and i have failed in all the thee
i am so sorry to hear that! is there a particular section you are having trouble with?
yes, i am a little uncomfortable driving backwards. i just cannot do that.
label: annoyed
response: ah! that is quite understandable. it is tricky at first and non-intuitive. i practiced driving in reverse with cones in an abandoned lot.

situation: i was accepted in to university after years of being an alcoholic restaurant industry worker, often working for minimum wage.
dialogue: i still cannot believe my life is where it is at, especially if you look at the past few years. i would never believe you if you told me i would be here.
why what is the matter?
well, for many years i was an alcoholic, working for near minimum wage in kitchens. but that all changed when i was accepted to university!
label: joyful
response: hmmm! that is just annoying being an alcoholic. i purely understand your situation as i have gone through it. well! life goes on.

situation: i was standing in a lift yesterday morning and a guy standing next to me just looked curiously to me. i was confused and then he slowly whispered in my ears that your zip is open please close it without anyone noticing it.
dialogue: yesterday, i was standing in a lift and a man next to me whispered in my ears that your zip is open.
that is creepy honestly
it was just very creepy situation
label: embarrassed
response: yeah whispering in someones ear is weird

situation: i just want my husband to get a ob
dialogue: my hubby lost his job a couple of months ago but he has an interview this friday so i pray he will get that job
nice! what job is going for
armed security
label: hopeful
response: cool.  hope he gets it, i hear they pay pretty well

situation: i am junior manager and one night i have to stay at office for whole night as i was having excessive work that day. so, everyone in the office left and i was all alone in the office. there was pin drop silence there and even i can hear the ticking of the clock. even a single noise scared me that time.
dialogue: i stayed alone at night in a office due to excessive work and was much scared.
just you. no security?
no, i was on a 10th floor and security was down. i was scared even with a single noise.
label: afraid
response: i would be too.

situation: i just got my degree in marketing and i have achieved it with flying ranks.
dialogue: i have been awarded with a degree in marketing.
that is nice, how long did it take you ?
it took 4 years but at last got it
label: joyful
response: fantastic, now do you have a job lined up?

situation: i got in a car wreck one time. a guy pulled out in front of my. i hit my brakes, but could not stop in time. it totaled both of our cars.
dialogue: hey, have you ever been in a car wreck?
i have been in a fender bender not a total wreck.
i was in one about 2 years ago. no one was hurt, but it totaled both of our cars.
label: surprised
response: man, how was your insurance policy for that?

situation: i once found out my step father was stealing money from my mother to buy drugs. i confronted him about it and got in a fist fight with him.
dialogue: have you everr been in a fist fight with anyone?
yes, several times in my life. mostly me and my older brother when we were younger.
i got in a fist fight with my step father once. it was not a fun experience as you can imagine.
label: furious
response: what started the fist fight in the first place?

situation: the other day i installed everquest. a video game i played as a teen. i played it for several weeks.
dialogue: have you ever played and old video game called everquest?
i have not heard of it
it came out in 1999. i used to play it when i was a teen. i installed it the other day and had a good time playing.
label: nostalgic
response: everything old makes a come back!

situation: i went to hardee's the other day and got a slider burger for almost 2 dollars. it was the size of a krystal burger. it was just so unsatisfactory.
dialogue: have you ever eaten at hardee's?
one of my favorite places to eat. i love the swirled ice cream cones.
i like it too, but i am not a big fan of their new sliders. they are so tiny, and just one of them cost almost 2 dollars!
label: disappointed
response: over priced food is no fun. i like dollar menus.

situation: one time i had a dream where i was being held down by a shadow demon with red eyes. i could not move or scream even though i wanted to. it was the most scared i have ever been.
dialogue: have you ever had a sleep paralysis dream?
yep! not really that fun to have since you see things at times.
yeah, in mine i saw a smoke looking shadow over me with red eyes staring at me. i have never been more scared in my life.
label: terrified
response: man that is scary! granted i like to hear things about that.

situation: when i worked as a machinist, i was the only person on my shift that could program a certain lathe that had 6 axis. it was when i was at the top of my abillitys.
dialogue: have you ever rode on a roller coaster?
yes when i was young i did all the time, but i think after i turned 18 i got this weird fear of being so high up in the air. what about you?
i hate riding them, but i used to machine components for their drive chain when i was a machinist.
label: confident
response: wow that is really cool! you must be happy to know about that stuff its interesting!

situation: i felt upset when i had a friend's boyfriend that tried to have an intimate relationship with me. even though they were with my very good friend, and they knew i was married. i have been married almost 23 years and love my husband.
dialogue: a while back my friend's boyfriend tried to get me to have an intimate relationship with him. he knew i had been married a very long time, as well as he was in a relationship with my friend. i turned him down flat, as i love my husband very much.
what a creep. i hope that you told on him.
yes, i let him know that was wrong and disgusting. i could not believe he did it!
label: faithful
response: some people are like that. did you tell your husband?

situation: i am going overseas and i am super ready
dialogue: i am going overseas and i think i packed everything i need!
where are you headed ?
going to kazakhstan. that is where i was born. my parents still live there and i miss them so much
label: prepared
response: great, i hope you have a nice trip. how long will you be staying?

situation: my girlfriend got let go of a job a while back, and she ended up getting a better job with better pay!
dialogue: hi, my girlfriend was recently let go of her job, but she put so much work in to finding a new job and got one with better pay!
that is great! it was meant to happen then
yes i agree, she was so happy when she found out the job was hers
label: proud
response: i would have been too. i have never been fired. i always quit

situation: nearly a year ago now, my girlfriend completely surprised me with a puppy!
dialogue: so about a year ago now, my girlfriend decided to surprise me with a puppy!
oh wow, puppies are nice.  what kind of puppy did you get?
yes, so nice! it was the best thing that could've happened! it is a german shepherd!
label: surprised
response: that is a nice breed of dog.  i just went on a camping trip with a relative who has one, they are very loyal and smart of course.  was he/she your first pet?

situation: at the bar a girl tried to cheat.
dialogue: there was this one time i was fairly drunk at a bar and this attractive girl was trying to make moves on me, but i did my best to ignore it all. having a girlfriend and all.
that is good! you should be proud of yourself
i was very proud definitely when i woke up the next morning and knew no mistakes were made!
label: faithful
response: that is great! i hate when people cheat

situation: when my girlfriend kept me waiting on our date.
dialogue: there was this one time my girlfriend and i had plans to meet a longhorn steakhouse for a date. she ended up keeping me waiting inside 30 extra minutes! i was pretty frustrated.
i can only imagine having to wait at the table alone, wondering if she'd show up. at least, it sounds like, she finally arrived.  did she specify a reason for being so late?
yes, she actually had a legit reason so i could not be too mad at her. she definitely made it up to me!
label: annoyed
response: that is good. i can somewhat relate. i think the longest i have waited on someone was a colleague who was supposed to meet us at happy hour, and ended up getting delayed by our boss for 45 minutes. we were glad she made it out, but i did feel worse for her than for all of us.

situation: thank god it is friday
dialogue: i am just so happy it is finally friday!
ahhh! me too, there is so much that can be done on the weekends!
i just want to sleep in and then watch movies all day long. but i am a mom so i do not sleep in. ever
label: joyful
response: i understand that! i have a bunch of pet snakes that wake me up thru the night!

situation: i had decided to go visit my brother out of state by driving, but as soon as i got on the road it started snowing heavily.  the farther i drove the worse the snow got, and i was unprepared for it.  i was in a very rural area, hundreds of miles from a major city, and the snow started covering up the road such that i could not even see the lines or where the ditch started.  i ended up turning back and cancelling the trip.
dialogue: i had to cancel a trip to see my brother after it started snowing heavily.
actually that has happened to me, during thanksgiving
yes, when the snow builds up on the road i get nervous, and during this trip i could not even see where the road was and where the ditch began.
label: afraid
response: i am from nc mountains, it can be tricking driving when the snow is latying fast

situation: when my parents got a divorce.
dialogue: when my parents got divorced when i was a kid, it was one of the hardest things for me.
i understand your pain. my parents are also separated.
it does definitely get easier over time i suppose. now that i see my life i guess it was for the best.
label: sad
response: it just makes you mature faster. just look at it like blessing in disguise.

situation: when it was storming before going to the beach.
dialogue: just the other day my girlfriend and i were getting ready for the beach, but right before we left it started to pour rain.
that sucks.   did you end up coming up with an alternate plan?
well, when looking outside you could see a clear patch in the distance. so we kinda just hoped for the best to wait it out. we finally did get to go!
label: hopeful
response: that is good to hear.  how was the beach?

situation: i was on my way home from work and my gfirleind suprised me with a bunch of friends and family for a party.
dialogue: there was one day after work that my girlfriend was planning a surprise party with a bunch of friends and family.
that would take away from her time with you. was it for you?
yes, the party was for me! i was so shocked and had no clue it was coming.
label: surprised
response: that would be a really nice surprise then!

situation: i stole a shirt i liked from my friend.
dialogue: there was this one time i stole a shirt from my friend, and i feel pretty guilty about it.
why'd you steal it
because i really liked it, and did not think he'd care.
label: guilty
response: oh yea what kind of shirt was it

situation: my girlfriend went on a business trip, and i did not have anyone to hang out wiht.
dialogue: my girlfriend recently went on a business trip for a week, i was very lonely during this experience.
what did you do to pass the time?
i mainly just played video games and watched tv.
label: lonely
response: i love video games.

situation: i had to give my pet up for adoption because my new apartment would not take them.
dialogue: i moved to a new apartment and they did not accept my dog breed, so i had to give her up.
that sucks, why did not you find a new apartment?
because here in my area in florida, there is not too many options for me.
label: sad
response: maybe you should leave florida.

situation: when my mom went out of her way to get me an awesome gift.
dialogue: my mom does not have a ton of money, but last christmas she made sure to get me some awesome things!
oh that is nice, what was she able to get for you?
she got me a brand new laptop i had been wanting for gaming!
label: grateful
response: thats awesome of her to be able to get you something you really wanted

situation: when i went on the slingshot ride, it was horrifying!
dialogue: i went on this ride at the beach called the slingshot. it shoots you super high up in the air. it was so teriffying, i had so much faith in the ride i would not die!
omg, i have seen one of those!
it was seriously so scary, i almost pooped myself!
label: trusting
response: i believe that!

situation: when i saw my girlfriend talking to this guy at a bar.
dialogue: there was this time i went to the bar with my girlfriend and once i came out of the restroom, i saw her talking to some guy!
what did you do?
well i get super jealous and angry of course. but in the end it was just a work friend. oops!
label: jealous
response: did she get mad at you?

situation: when my dog took a pee randomly on the couch! like who does that!!
dialogue: my dog randomly got up on my couch last week, and just started peeing. like what!?!?!??!?!
haha that sucks! did you take him/her out to pee recently?
not since lunch, so it is actually been about 4 hours. i hate living on the top floor!
label: surprised
response: what did you have for lunch?

situation: when i graduated college. so long to get there!
dialogue: i finally graduated college last year, it felt like it took so long!
that is amazing, good work.
yes, i am so proud of myself for finally accomplishing it!
label: proud
response: how long did it take you?

situation: when my girlfriend saw me cheating
dialogue: my girlfriend saw me kissing another girl, who was kissing me at the bar. i was very drunk.
oh wow. did she break up with you?
no. i realized the mistake i made and took action so it never would happen again.
label: ashamed
response: do not sweat it man. there is plenty of fish in the sea anyways.

situation: when i saw a guy on a bike doing a wheelie.
dialogue: there was this one time i was driving down the road, and this guy on a sports bike popped a wheelie. it was so sick!
nice, i wish i could do a wheelie!
i know! i do too. i think i need to learn to ride a sports bike first. hehe oops!
label: impressed
response: yeah, i tried skateboarding in my childhood but was too scared to break something,.

situation: when i came home to my dog dead.
dialogue: when i was younger, i came back to the house with my family to find our family pet dead.
oh no, i am so sorry to hear that. did you ever figure out what happened?
he was very old, so i guess we were all expecting it. he lived a good life!
label: devastated
response: oh, well that is a somewhat happy ending i suppose.

situation: when my dog chewed up a hole in the carpet.
dialogue: my dog chewed a hole in my carpet 2 weeks ago. i was very disgusted to say the least!
haha i am sorry! my dog is chill now but he ate a hole in the wall when he was a puppy
oh dang, i guess i cannot complain too much then, that is brutal!
label: disgusted
response: yeah what breed is yours? mine is a golden so he loves eating stuff. now it is thankfully just actual food.

situation: i shouted to my mom
dialogue: i have to go to confession at the church. i was a little mean to my mom, sometimes its difficult to be always nice
yea, i am like that, too. did you apologize?
well yes when i shouted and i inmeaditelly apologize but i feel really bad
label: guilty
response: it happens. like you said, we cannot all be perfect.

situation: i went out with the children this morning to the park, i took the day to be with them, i felt very well
dialogue: we walked, we ate ice cream, we rode a bike, we laughed a lot, we enjoyed the outdoors, we were exhausted
who did you do all those things with? sounds like a wonderful day!
i had time that i did not share with the children and that was something that was pending in my soul
label: joyful
response: they must have been really happy.

situation: i am mesmerized by the beauty of this world
dialogue: the world is very beautiful
there are so many spectacular views on this planet
exactly. look at the beautiful scenery around you. nature at its very best. i am surprised people do not notice
label: impressed
response: it is a shame that people are letting these marvels pass them by.

situation: i felt so disillusioned when i discovered someone who i admired for their vision was a jerk on a day-to-day basis.
dialogue: i can remember feeling so disillusioned when someone who i really admired as a visionary turned out to be a real jerk on a day-to-day basis.
that can really make you lose your faith in wanting to trust people
well, it definitely makes you a little more realistic when you may be tempted to put someone on a pedestal. not really fair to them *or* to yourself, is it?
label: disappointed
response: no not really because we are all human and make mistakes.

situation: i was so scared of tornadoes growing up, whenever tornado warnings happened, i was extremely frightened!
dialogue: as a kid, i was so frightened any time there was a tornado warning. not sure if it was the wizard of oz effect or what, i just remember being frozen with fear.
oh, wow! my son was terrified of tornadoes because of that darn movie, and we do not really even get tornadoes where we live! did you ever live through a tornado?

that is the thing, no! i mean, there were some that were kind of close, but nothing like what so many folks have to deal with. i just remember wanting a basement soo badly, not something that is common where i grew up!
label: terrified
response: aw, poor little thing! how did you overcome this? or, are you still afraid of them?

situation: i feel so bad when i think back to times that i yelled at my kids for no real good reason.
dialogue: i feel so bad when i think back to times that i got angry and yelled at my kids for no real good reason, just a combination of the day's events and feeling irritated, really.
we get carried away with our emotions sometimes. did you explain it to them?

yes! that i feel good about! making a point to use it as an opportunity to talk. i have definitely used it when it comes to the way others might act, emphasizing that it is not about *them*, it is really about the person and where they are at.
label: guilty
response: i am glad you are not too prideful to admit your mistakes to your kids and used it as a teaching opportunity.

situation: i was so excited the first time we were going to make an overseas move! i actually loved all the intense preparation, because of what i looked forward to as the payoff!
dialogue: i was so excited the first time we were going to make an overseas move! i looked so forward to what i knew would be a life-changing adventure!
that is pretty awesome, i know if i ever got the chance it would change my life as well.
i highly, highly recommend it. not always easy, culture shock *is* a thing!, but such a great way to enhance one's perspective.
label: anticipating
response: i understand that, as long as i could understand the language i think i would be great anywhere.

situation: in my birthday my friend will give i phone that is the most praising moment
dialogue: i would fear my gift
tell me more about this
my partner gave me a an i phone it is very memorable and pleasure to me
label: surprised
response: if its an older iphone i would treasure it

situation: i am so glad to have such a wonderful husband
dialogue: i have such an amazing husband! he works so hard so i could stay home with our baby
what does he do for work?
he is an armed guard
label: grateful
response: oh wow, that is a dangerous job.

situation: i hate driving at night because my vision is not that great
dialogue: i have a pretty bad vision so i am so scared to drive at night
have you had it tested ?
yes, i even have glasses but because of astigmatism i do not see good at night even when i have glasses on
label: terrified
response: so you have like tunnel vision where ?

situation: when i am in the grocery store and everyone is in a rush. they are rude and bump into you.
dialogue: it seems like today everyone in the grocery store was in such a rush. hurrying around!
yeah, that can be annoying especially in walmart since so many people go there. it stresses you out when you do not need it to.
yes! they cut in front, and bump into you. plus being rude while they do it
label: annoyed
response: yeah, everyone just seems miserable, so it kind of drags you down, too. but it is a necessary evil.

situation: i was so tired and i yelled at my baby
dialogue: i am so sleep deprived and my baby wanted to play in the middle of the night and i just yelled at him i feel so terrible
that is why i am scared to have kids, that sounds terrible
i love being a mother but sleep deprivation is so horrible
label: guilty
response: that seems to be the case, you win some you lose some i guess

situation: i have been really worked up lately waiting for my niece and newphews to visit. they are so important to me and we only get to see them for a few weeks a year.
dialogue: i love being around them and it is great to see them each year.
who would that be?
o i am sorry, my niece and nephews, only seem in the summer. do you get company during the summer?
label: anticipating
response: i love seeing mine too. i know how happy that must make you feel. mine are local.

situation: my kids are growing up well but fast. they are about to go to their next grades.
dialogue: my kids are going into 7th and 8th grade in a couple weeks. they really are growing up well
thats good to hear.  my kids will returning to school soon as well.  i cannot wait!
my oldest daughter has some learning disabilities so i am really proud of how she is doing. they are both growing up so fast
label: joyful
response: thats cool

situation: i paid all my bills today, i feel great
dialogue: i paid all my bills today, i feel so relived and good
every little accomplishment counts! what bills did you have to pay?
rent and electricity. we have been struggling financially so it is such a relieve to pay bills
label: content
response: sorry to hear that. well, at least this will be a weight off your shoulders.

situation: i studied for 3 months straight in order to pass my bar exam and become a lawyer.
dialogue: i studied so hard for my bar exam so that i could become a lawyer. i prepared for almost 3 months straight!
wow, you are so determined! did you pass your exam?
i did pass! it was a rough 3 months, but once i got there, i felt like i was ready.
label: prepared
response: yay! congrats! that is really awesome. you should be proud of yourself

situation: so i am flying with my baby and i was surprised when they told me i do not need to pay for my baby's ticket
dialogue: i was about to book a flight for my baby and i and i was so surprised to find out i did not need to pay for my baby'sticket
that is really exciting! i would be so happy about that.
i know! now i can spend the rest of the money on something cool
label: surprised
response: that is what i would do too. do you have something in mind?

situation: my husband called me a punk today for nothing
dialogue: my husband called me a punk today for no reason. and then when i told him he hurt my feelings he did not even understand why
forget him. get yourself a real man.
no. i love him. but he can be such a punk sometimes
label: angry
response: if he really loved you, he would pay attention to your every need. kick him to the curb.

situation: when i first got my driver's license, i was so scared of getting into an accident.
dialogue: when i was younger, i got my driver's license. i was sooo scared to drive, because i did not want to get into an accident.
be positive. do not deviate your mind while driving. concentrate completely on driving. you can.
i tried to tell myself that, but my dad got into a really bad accident once, and it has scared me ever since.
label: apprehensive
response: sorry to hear this. hope you will get out from this fear and become a good driver.

situation: i started a garden and eventually got into trying to propagate plants by planting cuttings, eventually i had multiple tomato plants from a single small plant. infinite tomatoes!
dialogue: i recently started learning to propagate my tomato plants by planting clipped off branches.
sounds cool.
yea, i put them in a glass of water for a week or two and they grow their own roots, was not expecting much.
label: surprised
response: do you cook a lot with tomatoes

situation: it seems like no one lately can drive right. they are always speeding or cutting you off. also no blinker use.
dialogue: around town it seems like traffic has been horrible lately. driving around town is just crazy.
people just do not seem to pay attention when they are in a hurry.
yes, exactly! they are always speeding or cutting you off. and of course no blinker use!
label: angry
response: that is the part that bothers me the most. when they just cut in front of you with no warning.

situation: i met a friend online once and we met up in person.
dialogue: a few years ago, i became friends with someone through an online video game. eventually we trusted each other, so we met up in person!
i know a lot of people in real life through that kind of stuff. has been pretty great for me after 11 years. how is it for you so far.
i would say it is going pretty well, we eventually got married! how did you meet your friends?
label: trusting
response: well we met through going to conventions and i even visited some myself. really great bunch of people and i see places.

situation: i acre for others when they are sick
dialogue: okay. i care for everyone
well you sound like a good person
thanks, i hope i am. you sound like one too
label: caring
response: why thank you!

situation: i recently had an experience with a girl i used to love. we had a one night stand and it was crazy!
dialogue: i recently had a one night stand with a woman from my past. it caught both of us off guard
oh wow. that is crazy.
yes, it was a very interesting time. i wish to continue talking to her despite living in different locations
label: surprised
response: i am glad you made amends then and no drama.

situation: my wife was able to get a job with microsoft, and she did not even need a 4-year degree!
dialogue: my wife was able to get a job with microsoft without going to a four-year college!
that is pretty amazing. she must be skillful regardless.
she really is. it just shows that you do not need to have a four-year degree in order to be successful.
label: proud
response: yea, experience and skills matter a lot more.

situation: i walked my dog and she still pooped inside!
dialogue: i walked my dog outside, and she still pooped in the house! ugh.
i am familiar with that.  that is frustrating.
yeah.even though i take her outside, 10 minutes later, she will poop or pee in the house. why!?
label: annoyed
response: i ask myself the same thing.  sometimes i think they get mad at something we do.

situation: every time i see my husband i know i could never cheat on him. we are both flirty people but know that it will never be worth messing up what we have.
dialogue: i think being with my husband makes me a better person
that is good. do you have strong feeling for each other?
definetly, he is my best friend forever.
label: faithful
response: that is cute

situation: i was home alone the other night and i heard a loud crash in the other room. it turned out to just be the dog ran into a shelf and knocked something down but it was scary.
dialogue: i really do not like when things happen when noone is home.
things? like what kind of things?
like stuff falling off shelfes because a dog runs into them! hah, crazy i know.
label: afraid
response: i know what you mean! i am literally doing the same thing right now, babysitting my neighbor's dogs in her big two-story house, all alone. makes me feel like someone's watching me..

situation: i really love my life. this may seem crazy to some since it is fairly simple. i work online, i play games and then i read and watch tv and then i do chores.
dialogue: i really love my life right now.
that is really good to hear.  whats going on?
nothing really! i just love that i can work at home and have time to clean or cook whenever i want.
label: content
response: i work from home too.  its so nice to be able to do laundry and things on my breaks.   i am so productive around the house

situation: i got home and all of my friends were waiting for me to have a birthday party i did not know about!
dialogue: so i just got home and all of my friends were there for a birthday party i have no clue! can you imagine my reaction?
yeah, of course i can! that sounds heartless. maybe that shows you who your friends truly are, and you should maybe look elsewhere. could be a wake-up call.
well the party was for me, hahaha they really got me on that one!
label: surprised
response: oh, i misunderstood! i thought you meant you were not invited to one that you later found out about. hah! then i guess the wake-up call is you have really good friends! so, you like surprise parties then? i never did.

situation: i recently forgot i owed a little bit of money to my mother in law for something. it ended up being ok but being reminded was not that pleasent.
dialogue: its not fun being reminded of things you've forgotten.
what kinds of things are you talking about?
owed money to my mother in law for something, $15, she reminded me in a less then nice way.
label: guilty
response: that is not very fair, a kind reminder could've gone a long way.

situation: i recently got to take an amazing day trip to san antonio. there was so much to see and do.
dialogue: i went to san antonio the other day, was great to see that city.
i have been there many times.
o really? what is your favorite thing there?
label: joyful
response: i love going to the spurs games.

situation: i gratuated from college with the highest score in the past 20 years
dialogue: i just got back from my graduation! can you imagine after 5 years i graduated with the highest score of my college in the past 20 years!
wow that is a long time ago.
yes! i studied so hard, can you imagine how i feel? i cannot believe it!
label: proud
response: yes, where did you go to college?

situation: i really was grossed out when my nephew threw up the other day. he had eaten to much sugar and was sick off and on for hours.
dialogue: i hate the sight of someone throwing up. my nephew did that the other and day and man.
that is so disgusting.  i hate seeing that!
yea, he had eaten to much sugar and well, it did not end well
label: disgusted
response: sugar will do that to kids every time.  just do not let them on a  roller coaster to make it even worse.

situation: i step on a lego that my son left on the floor
dialogue: i came home from work and step barefoot on one of my sons legos, i was so pissed!
that sounds really painful!  you should pick them up.
yes, i was so mad i always tell them to pick the toys up.
label: angry
response: they must not listen very well.

situation: my mother in law got to eat at one of my favorite places today. qdoba- she was traveling back from ohio and the airport had one.
dialogue: my mother in law got to eat qdoba today, one of my favorite places i have not had in awhile
qdoba is the bomb! although, i think i prefer chipotle slightly more.
no way. queso all the way! they do not have one near by but she was traveling and the airport up north did.
label: jealous
response: yeah, but chipotle has queso now! but, yeah, it is not as good as qdoba queso.

situation: i saw a 3 year old boy who can talk 4 languages
dialogue: yesterday i watch on tv a kid who could speak 4 different languages at age 3, i was in shook!
wow! how is that even possible?
well they are called wonder kids! i was in wonder, i also read about one who just graduated from college at age 11
label: impressed
response: i wonder if they ever feel like they do not get a childhood?

situation: i think my husband is great, in just 3 years he has become the best assistant manager in the his market.
dialogue: my husband is quite impressive to me.
sounds like you are lucky.
yea, he is become the best manager in his market in just 3 years.
label: proud
response: that is great!

situation: my son scored three goals in his soccer match today!
dialogue: this afternoon i went to my sons soccer game and he scored three goals! happiest dad ever!
i figure your son is pretty happy as well.
yes! i love him so dad, but i feel like my own achievement since i teach him how to play, he dedicated the three goals to me!
label: proud
response: could not ask for a better day

situation: i had to do a talk and tried to tell an amusing story to break the ice.  it apparently was not amusing in the slightest and everyone just stared at me.
dialogue: i was doing a presentation for work, and tried to tell a story about something kind of related to break the ice.  no one laughed or even really cracked a smile, so it put me off for the rest of the presentation.
that is no fun, you always hope that first one hits so they are more receptive the rest of the time
yeah, and i really thought it was a decent story.  nothing ground breaking, but at least should have gotten a chuckle.
label: embarrassed
response: well there is always next time!

situation: my wife has been in europe for the past month for school.  i have been mostly alone since she left, as we only recently moved and i do not really know anyone outside of work.
dialogue: my wife went to germany to attend a language course at the end of june.  i have been mostly spending time with my dogs while she is been gone since we recently moved and i do not really know anyone outside of work.
you should take the dogs to a dog park after work and meet people!
that is a good idea.  i do not know where there is a dog park near me, i should look into that.
label: lonely
response: definitely. i think even waze app will tell you in you search 'around me'.

situation: i felt this morning i left the house and my neighbor gave me some flowers .. incredible i did not expect it
dialogue: something i did not expect from a neighbor, this morning he gave me some beautiful flowers
wow, that is sweet of him, does he have a crush on you?
it was a nice gesture on his part. but i do not know
label: surprised
response: huh, well maybe he is starting his campaign

situation: my neighbor had her dog outside on the walkway between our condo units.  this dog is loud and does not like my dogs, so we have to avoid when it is outside.  i needed to walk my dogs and could not because it was out there.
dialogue: my neighbor has a really annoying little dog that she always brings outside when she is smoking.  it barks constantly at everything and she does not try to keep it quiet.
what type of dog is it?
a pomeranian.  i do not have anything against that type of dog specifically, but this one is just terrible.
label: annoyed
response: i get that, some are just not well trained at all

situation: my husband received a call this morning and he became very nervous, which put me in a bad mood,
dialogue: this morning my husband received a call, he got nervous, i think it was a woman . difficult
oh? that is not good. do you think he has lots of secrets?
i think so . i am a little worried, because of the situation
label: jealous
response: i am sorry i do hope things can be worked out

situation: i was looking at pictures from my wedding, specifically one of a bunch of my friends and i having a drink.  i got a little wistful for hanging out with friends like that.
dialogue: i have a great picture from my wedding where my friends and i are in a circle having a shot, makes me want to go hang out with them again.
i assume you do not get to see them often?
yeah, we moved away a few months after the wedding for my wife to go to graduate school.
label: sentimental
response: that is too bad. i bet you miss them.

situation: yesterday i remembered the anniversary of my mother's death, something hard, hard to remember
dialogue: yesterday, a difficult day, the anniversary of the death of my mother
sorry to hear about the bad news.
thank you for your solidarity
label: sad
response: how long ago did she die?

situation: i had interviewed for a job i really wanted.  i was waiting for a response for a little while.
dialogue: i went for an interview for a job i really wanted and ended up waiting a long time before i heard anything.  i managed to keep my spirits up for a good long while.
i hope you got it.
i did actually!  it is a good job, especially since the market where i am is not great for my field.
label: hopeful
response: congrats! you deserve it for keeping your faith!

situation: my daughter told me she did not love me because i scolded her
dialogue: my daughter is angry with me, she says she does not need me, because i scolded her
how old is she?
she is 9 years old but she is a very focused girl
label: sentimental
response: well, you know she will get over it, but it does hurt.

situation: for the kitchen test tomorrow, i studied well and i feel winner
dialogue: hello, tomorrow i have the cooking test and i feel safe. i am sure that i will approve with an excellent rating
oh, how nice. what are your plans in that regard for the future?
have my own restaurant
label: prepared
response: what a dream come true for you that'll be.

situation: i made enough money to pay my bills
dialogue: i am so happy i made enough money yesterday to pay my bills!
oh man, bills. that is awesome!
yes, such a relieve!
label: proud
response: does anyone help you with the bills?

situation: i am happy with my friend, she has been an angel, she has not left me alone in difficult times
dialogue: sometimes we have angels, called friends, i am happy because god sent me mine
awh that is so sweet how long have you two known one another?
we are 12 years old, but we have had difficult moments, but we have overcome it
label: grateful
response: sounds like a great friendship!

situation: my son misbehaved with his friends and i had to punish him
dialogue: my son behaved badly with his friend, i treat him badly, i had to punish him
oh no. how old is he?
he is 12 years old, but he must understand that friendship is something sacred
label: disgusted
response: friendship is special. did he do something to his friend?

situation: when my brother got out of college he had a job and a car and was doing so fucking great for himself. everything was lined up and he was ready to take off in the world. the moment i graduated college i have nothing that i can do. i took the same degree but that 5 year gap has led me to have nothing compared to him.
dialogue: when my brother got out of college he had a job and a car and was doing so fucking great for himself. everything was lined up and he was ready to take off in the world. the moment i graduated college i have nothing that i can do. i took the same degree but that 5 year gap has led me to have nothing compared to him. it was so fucking annoying
man, that is gotta be a horrible feeling. i think it would help if you try not to compare yourself to others.
i do my best but sometimes that is super hard. i guess that is just one of those things everyone got to deal with.
label: jealous
response: i hope things turn out better for you. keep fighting.

situation: i had a job interview and went in feeling very good about it.
dialogue: i went to a job interview a few days ago, and i feel like i totally rocked it!
oh man, that is awesome. i hope you get it!
thanks a bunch! it pays much better than my current job, so i really hope i do, but i think i got it in the bag.
label: confident
response: glad you rocked that interview. sounds like it is gonna be a sweet gig.

situation: i was digging through my old stuff yesterday, and i found my old security blanket.
dialogue: i went through some of my old stuff yesterday, and i found my security blanket that i used when i was a kid!
awww i bet that brought back memories.
it really did. it kinda made me sad, because it was all tattered and dirty. i ended up washing it.
label: sentimental
response: what will you do with it now?

situation: it really bothers me seeing all the back to school shopping. parents are more worried about appearance than education. it is about school supplies not buying jordans.
dialogue: you know, i see all the back to school shopping and i think parents have their priorities mixed up.
how so?
parents are more worried about appearances than learning. it is about school supplies not new jordans or under armor.
label: disgusted
response: that is pretty much teaching their kids to worry about appearances than learning, too. that is too bad.

situation: i found a stray kitten and nursed him back to health.
dialogue: i found a poor stray kitten on the side of the road, and i nursed him back to full health. poor thing.
did you name it?
i did! his name is alphy.
label: caring
response: that is cute. i bet he is happy.

situation: its hard to deal with when your kids are getting older and have to handle their own problems. as a mom you cannot just step in and fix everything like you want to.
dialogue: it is hard as a parent, when your kids are teenagers and have to handle their own problems
you kinda want to hold their hand, but you know it is best they solve some problems on their own. you cannot be with them all the time.
i know, they mommy in me wants to just jump in and fix it all like i used to
label: sad
response: it is truely for the best. try not to worry.

situation: my wife got a new job with microsoft.
dialogue: my wife called me this morning and told me she scored a new job with microsoft!
that is amazing! she must be excited.
she is so excited. she is even making more than i am.
label: proud
response: must be nice to have more income coming into the family.

situation: my dog has been scratching at his ears a lot. we took him to the vet and got him meds. now he is not feeling good today and i want to take care of him.
dialogue: i felt bad my dogs ears have been bothering him. we had to finally take him to the vet yesterday.
is he going to be okay?
yeah, it was ear mites and he got medicine for it. you can tell he is not feeling good from side effects so i have been babying him.
label: caring
response: well i bet he appreciates that. we all want to be babied sometimes.

situation: i bought my wife a chocolate bar, and i intended to give it to her, but i ended up eating it.
dialogue: i bought a chocolate bar for my wife at the store, and i was going to give it to her, but i ended up eating it.i feel bad.
lol. did you tell her? you can just buy another one.
lol i did not tell her.should i?
label: guilty
response: just buy another one and do not eat it.

situation: my boss scolded me for something i did not do.
dialogue: do not you hate it when you get in trouble for something you did not do? my boss got mad at me for someone else's mistake.
that is sucks. does the culprit know?
yeah, that is the worst part. they warned me that i was going to get yelled at because of something they did.
label: angry
response: that is unacceptable. what are you going to do?

situation: i am going on a cruise to alaska.
dialogue: i am taking a vacation and going on a cruise to alaska next week!
that sounds so fun!
i have never been, so it is going to be an amazing experience. i am a little nervous that i will get seasick.
label: excited
response: take some medication with you just in case.

situation: the color of your eyes, the sweetness of lips, the beauty of hair, is a memory that i will not forget
dialogue: hello, i think i will not forget the beauty of her hair, the sweetness of her lips and the clarity of her eyes
so.what happened to her
she died . my mother
label: nostalgic
response: in real life? or are you making this up

situation: i saw a dog devouring a bird .. i was so impressed by the violence
dialogue: hello, i never imagined the violence that can unleash a dog attacking a bird . i was impressed
i have never imagined something like that before. where did you see this?
in a big dog . in the park
label: terrified
response: that is nuts. did the owner do anything?

situation: i really feel for my neighbor. she just lost her husband of 40 years last year and she has been a bit lost with out him, so i have helped her out a few times.
dialogue: my poor neighboor is suffeing a lot without her husband
i suffer a lot too when my wife is gone. what happened to him?
he passed away from cancer.
label: caring
response: ah, the evil cancer. took my grandmother as well. i am sure he is off in a better place now.

situation: i had a pleasent event happen the other day. i found out a nephew of mine wants to come live in texas for a year with the family he has down here.
dialogue: i enjoyed my day the other day, found out something good! newphew may come to live with us for ayear.
nice! how old is your nephew?
11, he wants to see us for more then 2 weeks a year.
label: surprised
response: that is good. gotta build and maintain those family bonds. i should be doing the same once my nephew gets older.

situation: i made the mistake of loosing a piece of my mother in laws tupperwear. i left it outside and someone stole it.
dialogue: i lost something of my mother in laws the other day, i feel so bad.
that sucks. can you make it up to her somehow?
i will have to buy her another piece of tupperwear, it seems silly but it is expensive stuff!
label: ashamed
response: at least those things come in sets, so you can keep part of it?

situation: i was waiting to see if i was going to receive an award
dialogue: i was waiting to see if i was going to receive an award
it is a work award or something?
its an award due to achieving my work i have worked hard for
label: anxious
response: i am sure you are going to get it.

situation: i recently took a job offer at a new company. i was hesitant to take the offer due to low pay, but the quality of job seems higher than my current position.
dialogue: wow! congrats on your new job! i can understand why you are apprehensive, but it sounds like a good opportunity.
why thank you!
no problem! everything will work out in the end. no need to worry.
label: apprehensive
response: thanks for being so understanding!  i feel a little better now.

situation: i felt so nervous going into my latest job interview.
dialogue: i felt soo nervous going to my last job interview! nerves must occur in proportion to how badly you *want* something!
i know what you mean. did you get the job?
i did! the company does something that i actually like, a panel interview vs a series of one-on-ones. have you ever had an interview like that?
label: apprehensive
response: i have not. what is it?

situation: it really bothers me when people let their toddler run around the mall. none the less smelling like a litter box that hasn't been cleaned in a month.
dialogue: i know i am not a perfect parent but some just are not good at it or do not care.
there are some bad parents out there, that is for sure. is it hard to be a parent?
it is when it comes to all the unexpected stuff. went to the mall today and lady was letting her toddler run all over the mall smelling like a dirty litter box. it smelled horrible.
label: annoyed
response: lol, that is terrible. she should have changed his diaper before leaving the house what the heck..

situation: it always feels like i am not being listened to. my family seems to be deaf when i speak, when of course, i know they are not.
dialogue: i always feel like no one hears me. like when i speak it falls on deaf ears.
that sucks. maybe it is time to get new friends?
well, for the most part it is my family. my husband, kids and pets. i know they are not deaf and it is frustrating!
label: angry
response: do not worry, it will get better. i know you deserve better

situation: my daughter is a teenager now, so we do not get to spend much time together. today we had a girls even out, went shopping and out to eat.
dialogue: my daughter is a teenager now so we do not spend as much time together as we used to.
i know exactly what you mean. my sister is entering her teenage years. i feel like it is all i can do to just not be annoying to her, so i cannot even imagine what it is like for a mom.
yeah, luckily we had a fun girls evening out today. we went out to eat and did a bunch of shopping.
label: joyful
response: that is good! all it takes is a good day once in a while to keep things on track until they get older. my mom just tries to be as patient and considerate with my sister so that she still feels motivated to communicate with her.

situation: i am really looking forward to this trip i have planned next week.
dialogue: i am really looking forward to this trip i have planned next week.
where are you going?
i am going to visit the national parks in california. well the ones not on fire.
label: anticipating
response: i have never been to california.

situation: i was bathing my dog in the backyard this weekend, and she got loose. she then went and rolled in the dirt getting extra filthy.
dialogue: i was bathing my dog in the backyard this weekend, and she got loose. she then went and rolled in the dirt getting extra filthy.
that must of been terrible.
it was. since she was wet, the dirt got stuck inside her fur. she was even harder to clean the second time around.
label: disgusted
response: did anyone help you?

situation: been having a good day, relaxing on my couch watching netflix. i got a nice cup of hot chocolate and my cat curled up in my lap.
dialogue: been having a good day, relaxing on my couch watching netflix. i got a nice cup of hot chocolate and my cat curled up in my lap.
you are making me want to do the same thing. that sounds great!
yeah, it is been a great day. thinking about moving to the bed and going to sleep next.
label: content
response: nothing like relaxing and getting your body ready for a night of good sleep!

situation: i had a job interview yesterday. i was really nervous before it started.
dialogue: i had a job interview yesterday. i was really nervous before it started.
was it on the phone or in person?
it was in person. we mostly interviewed in a conference room, then we took a lab tour afterwards.
label: apprehensive
response: how did you do?

situation: i am very faithful because my attitude is good
dialogue: i am very faithful
what are you referring to?
yes my behavior refereed to people
label: faithful
response: that is nce

situation: yes i am going to one restaurant for survey is very guilty
dialogue: thank you
thank you for what?
nothing
label: guilty
response: okay

situation: yes i am going to coffee shop the man speech is  so guilty
dialogue: thank you
you are welcome, but for what?
nothing
label: guilty
response: ok then

situation: yes my attitude is better than coworker but coworker is not happy
dialogue: i am going to garden
cool. that is a fun hobby.
thank you
label: jealous
response: well habe fun i guess.

situation: once i got the wrong order when i paid 600$ for my television. what?
dialogue: it was bad and ontop of it they refused to admit their mistake
oh no, what happened?
placed an order online and the appliance place did not have it, so they gave me something else without telling me
label: furious
response: oh, that is odd! i am sorry they did not tell you what was going on.

situation: i was working the night shift for the summer. my job was working alone. i saw no one for weeks. it got to me
dialogue: i really was distraught
really?
yes. makes me value human-human interaction a lot more. i had to go to the grocery store to feel ok
label: lonely
response: ok

situation: i watched the president of my work association speak and i did not know he could speak that well. i and the rest of the room was with awe
dialogue: it made me proud he was my rep
who was your rep?
the president represented us at this association
label: impressed
response: aha. what was the association?

situation: the house has been really quiet since she went on vacation.
dialogue: it has been very quiet in here since she went on vacation. no one to talk to.
did you got bored?
i kept myself occupied with movies and video games. but it was not the same as having real company.
label: lonely
response: i understand.

situation: that i will get to visit the south side and eat my favorite take out
dialogue: i cannot wait to travel south to get my favorite take out. cannot find it here.
that is a very long drive! how long will it take to get there?
about an hour. but it will be worth it.
label: hopeful
response: it must be very good, if you are willing to go that far!

situation: i am happy with where i am at in life.
dialogue: i am quite happy with where i live. i have 3 swimming pools to use anytime i want and also a gym.
wow, you are very lucky. do you share the facilities with other people?
yes but there is hardly anyone else who uses them because they only come for 2 weeks out of the year for a vacation. i am here permanently.
label: content
response: which part of the country are you in? are you by the beach?

situation: i could not believe for my 40th birthday, i came home from work that evening and the house was quiet. i walked in and the house was filled with people shouting happy birthday. that was quite a shock.
dialogue: i have never been so shocked than when my husband threw me a birthday party without me knowing.
was it fun?
it was so much fun. i thought is was going to be another normal day. wake up, go to work, etc. but i was wrong about that!
label: surprised
response: was it recently? happy birthday

situation: after almost 3 weeks she finally came back
dialogue: it was a long 3 weeks but i am so happy it is over and she is back now
oh goodness, what happened for the past 3 weeks?
she went to visit her family
label: joyful
response: oh, i was thinking something bad happened.

situation: for the death of my mother, my soul was destroyed
dialogue: it was a very hard experience in my soul to lose my mother
sorry to hear this! i can understand your pain.
thank you for your solidarity
label: devastated
response: take care of yourself and your family.

situation: finding out about baby boy
dialogue: we knew she was pregnant, but did not know the gender yet. imagine my shock when i saw the ultrasound for the gender!
i am sure it will be fine, do you have a preference
well it is a boy. which is what i have been wanting since we met
label: surprised
response: i am happy for you then

situation: i remain loyal to my wife always
dialogue: even though there are plenty of flirts around, i remain loyal to my wife.
that is good, it is very important to be loyal in a healthy relationship!
it is the most important thing to me. i have told her since day one, which was 5 years ago now.
label: faithful
response: good for you! i wish more people were like this, unlike my ex!

situation: i have a friend who got a new truck, it is basically my dream truck. i am really envious of him for having that truck.
dialogue: my friend got a new truck, i am really envious of him.
you should channel that envy into motivation!
i agree, if i work hard i could buy that truck.
label: jealous
response: exactly, be positive and you can buy one for yourself!

situation: today i think it is going to be a wonderful day. i am going to enjoy it
dialogue: hello, i feel that today is going to be a wonderful day . i will enjoy it
that is a great attitude to have!  it is great to have an optimistic approach to life.
if i really like to be positive, despite the difficulties
label: joyful
response: i feel the same way.  we are a glass half full kind of people!

situation: wife is not well lately
dialogue: i have been looking after my wife this week. she has the flu
oh poor thing, is she at least getting better?
it seems so. sleeping all day today
label: caring
response: haha that must be nice too though, you get your own alone time for the most part!

situation: to see in the mornings that beautiful and leafy tree in the mornings .. it makes me feel that god exists
dialogue: this morning and i saw a tree, i never detailed it, but this time i saw it beautiful . i realized god exists
i see, you must have felt hopeful
i gave thanks in spite of the difficulties
label: grateful
response: good, one should always be positive

situation: i was impressed by the way my daughter sings .. it is wonderful .. i did not hear something like that
dialogue: today i realized that my daughter sings wonderful, i enjoy it a lot . i was impressed
thats adorable how old is she?
she is 9 years old . she is a nice girl
label: surprised
response: she sounds like it

situation: i feel bad because i do not feel anything for my husband .. but i feel bad i do not dare to tell him
dialogue: hi, i feel bad because i have realized that i do not love my husband, but i do not have the courage to tell him
that is a pretty heavy realization.better tell him now that regret it later
you are right
label: guilty
response: best of luck to you

situation: i have started searching for a new job, and i am feeling pretty good about it.
dialogue: i am looking for a new job, and i am feeling pretty good about my options.
what are your options?
there is a lot of openings for tech jobs lately, especially technical support.
label: confident
response: oh yeah that is always going to be up and coming for sure

situation: my wife went out of the country for 2 months, leaving me alone with the dogs.  we had just moved so i did not really know anyone at the time.
dialogue: my wife just went out of town for school for 2 months.  i do not really know anyone here, so i do not know what i am going to do while she is gone.
it is an excellent opportunity, to know other people and places, to open up to the possibility, i assure you that it will go to you very well
i am sure it is great for her, but it makes me feel a little unsure of what to do with myself.
label: lonely
response: you do the same thing .. the opportunity is for both

situation: yesterday i made a serious mistake i made a comment without bad intentions of the elders and my father heard it and corrected me on good terms, but i felt so bad
dialogue: hello, i made a serious mistake. i made a comment without bad intentions of the elders. i related them to the dinosaurs, and my father heard it . he looked me in the eyes . and he told me that you too could be one of them . i felt bad
that sounds like it is rough, did your father accept your apology?
yes, but i feel like a cockroach
label: embarrassed
response: well, i am sure he understands, and you should not feel too bad, as long as you apologized you are fine.

situation: i am on a diet and i ate three chocolate bars yesterday.
dialogue: i am supposed to be on a diet, but i could not help myself and i ate three chocolate bars.
it happens we have to reward ourselves sometimes. dark chocolate is actually good for you!
but i am supposed to be on a diet! i cannot lose weight if i have no self control
label: guilty
response: hey it was just one day! you got this.. work extra hard for the next 5 days!

situation: my husband god a job!
dialogue: my husband lost his job a couple of months ago and yesterday he finally got a new job!
that is awesome
he is such a hard working man! he works so much so i could stay home with our baby
label: grateful
response: i am sure your supportiveness inspires him to work as hard as he does

situation: i was trying to take a nap and my neighbor had her loud tiny dog outside.  it kept me up and she would not shut it up for anything.
dialogue: i was trying to take a nap the other day and my neighbor would not shut her tiny barky dog up.
i totally feel you on that. i swear my neighbors have to be the loudest at night slamming their car doors and yelling outside right in front of my bedroom window.
ugh, that is the worst.  thankfully we are on the second floor so we do not have to deal with car noise too much.
label: annoyed
response: my bedroom is first floor, and literally maybe 4 feet from the parking lot. lucky me. lucky you tho too with animals.

situation: i lost my favorite hoodie somewhere, how could i lose a hoodie!
dialogue: i lost my favorite hoodie somewhere. i am so upset. like how could i lose a hoodie? it is so big, did i just leave it somewhere?
did you retrace your steps
i have been to so many places on that day it would be really hard to do it
label: disappointed
response: i used to lose stuff all the time.  then i learned to relax and actively imagine all the places i would been to.  it worked for me then, found a g-shock watch a pair of nikes and my wallet

situation: i am going to see my parents in 3 weeks!!
dialogue: i am going to see my parents in 3 weeks! i did not see them since 2014! i am so excited
that is great! i bet they are equally excited if not more are you travelling alone?
no, with my little baby. they've never met my son, they cannot wait
label: excited
response: oh i bet! you guys will have such a wonderful time together

situation: my wife was out of the country for a couple months, and when she came back i went to get her from the airport.  we spent the whole day doing random things together.
dialogue: my wife had been out of the country for 2 months for school.  i left early to get to the airport to get her when she came back because i was excited to see her.
i would be too, that is a long time!
yeah, it is especially long since we only recently moved and i do not really know anyone outside of work.
label: joyful
response: wow that would make for a lonely timeframe

situation: the other morning at 4 am i was woken by my neighbor's smoke alarm going off. at first i did not know what was going on, then i realized and did not appreciate it!
dialogue: i wish my neighbors were more considerate. they woke me up at 4am recently.
wow did youcall someone about that?
no point. their smoke alarm went off and management do not care anyway.
label: angry
response: wow, that sucks, that is why i wanna live all alone!

situation: my friend came over yesterday and i farted right in front of her
dialogue: my friend came over yea=sterday and we were sitting on the couch chit chatting and when i got up i accidentally farted. so embarrasing
oh my, did they notice you farted?
she did, she did not say anything but i know she heard it
label: embarrassed
