response: must have rather awkward. remember, farting is just natural and i am sure she understands that.

situation: my girlfriend went on a trip with her friends, and left me alone at home.
dialogue: my girlfriend went on a week trip with her friends, and left me alone to fend for myself.
i am sorry, how have you been passing the time
mostly been playing video games, but it is so boring without her.
label: lonely
response: i love video games, you should buy a switch!

situation: for the good things and those that are not so good, i must give thanks .. the good ones make me feel good, the others make me grow
dialogue: hello . i give thanks for the good things and the things that do not, the good things make me feel good and the satisfaction and the bad things are internal growth
that is a very optimistic way to look at life . i should actually look at life that way too instead of getting overwhelmed when things do not go my way
for me it was a hard learning . but after many blows . i assimilated it
label: grateful
response: how long have you looked at life this way? is it sustainable ?

situation: i lost my mother to breast cancer several years ago and i am still grieving the loss.
dialogue: i lost my mother to breast cancer several years ago and i am still grieving the loss.
i am so very sorry. have you had time to talk about it
yes, i talk about it but it really does not help much. i pray a lot and that gives me some comfort
label: devastated
response: that is good prayer can comfort, maybe you should talk to your pastor

situation: i was hoping to move across the country, but i am nervous.
dialogue: i had plans to move from florida to california, but i am starting to get cold feet.
ooh, that is a big jump. i was considering the same thing, but i' one state above
ohh! did you change your mind? i am trying to convince myself that it is going to be better for me to make the move.
label: apprehensive
response: i put it on hold until i fly up there this year to check things out. it is quite a big decision, and i would recommend going there for a while just to see what it is like

situation: one day is .. one more day of learning, one more day to smile, one more day to give a hug, a day to make someone happy
dialogue: today i think today is a day to learn, to hug, to smile, to make someone happy
yes, realistically i wish it were possible to do that everyday but general stresses of life get in the way
that is right . but i dedicate an hour to do that, to my children i kiss them, my neighbor smiled at him and from life i try to learn something
label: hopeful
response: maybe that is a good idea, to try and set aside a small amount of time a day to do it instead of trying to do it all the time along with everything else going on. good idea!

situation: i am just sitting here alone in the room.. no friends, no love
dialogue: i am so lonely. i mean. i have no friends, no husband, no kids. i wish i had at least somebody in my life
do you have any hobbies that may help you to meet people?
not really. i love playing video games and watch tv. i am socially awkward
label: lonely
response: same here.  try to take advantage of your gaming and be more outgoing during gametime.

situation: my wife was coming back into the country after 2 months away.  i left early to get to the airport because i wanted to see her so much.
dialogue: my wife has been out of the country for almost 2 months.  i cannot wait to go pick her up at the airport!
you must be ver
i am assuming you got cut off somehow :p  i am very happy she is coming back.
label: excited
response: *very excited.  (oops).  where did she go?

situation: i am so thrilled to be able to go on a short but long overdue vacation.
dialogue: i am so thrilled to be able to go on a short but long overdue vacation
where are you going
a short weekend trip to the ozarks for a float trip on spring fed white water.
label: joyful
response: that sounds like fun, where in the ozakrs?

situation: when planning my wedding the caterer we were trying to hire was completely ignoring my wife every time she tried to talk to her.
dialogue: i was planning my wedding and trying to get a caterer.  the one we were looking at was completely ignoring every time my wife tried to communicate with them, to the point where i told them off and went with someone else.
sounds like you made the right decision.  what a bunch of a-holes
yeah, it was weird, the caterer was a woman so i cannot imagine it was like a sexism thing, but she responded to me almost instantly every time.
label: angry
response: hm maybe she liked you ha

situation: i ordered a pizza from domino's and it took forever to get to me.  when it finally came i asked the delivery girl if it was supposed to be free because it took so long.  she was not sure because this was literally her first day, but she did not charge me.  later i went on their website and could not find any description of such a free-pizza policy and i felt terrible, wondering if the store was going to take the cost of the pizza out of this girl's paycheck.
dialogue: i got a free pizza from domino's but felt bad about how it happened.
free pizza is good! how did you get it?
the pizza took forever to get delivered so i asked if it was free.  the delivery girl, who was brand new, did not know so she just did not charge me.
label: guilty
response: that is awesome!

situation: when you expect more you have been disapponted more
dialogue: how was your day?
it was fine how about you?
yeah good. whats your name?
label: hopeful
response: i am not sure i feel comfortable telling you as we just met.

situation: when you expect more you have been disapponted more
dialogue: hello how was your day?
my day was great so far!  how about you?
yeah fine great day
label: disappointed
response: that is good to hear!  i am am sure you are grateful to experience such a good day!

situation: once, i was in a college in a classroom. i was sitting there and suddenly i realized that i have worn wrong pair of socks. no one was knowing it as i have worn shoes. but, when we have to go in church we have to remove shoes. so, at that time, a friend of mine spotted me. that time, that made a fun of me and i was in a little awkward situation.
dialogue: i wore wrong pair of socks to the college. but, no was there to spot it. but, when we have to go in for a church we have to first remove the shoes. at, that time friend of mine spotted with with wrong pair of shoes. they made a fun of me. that was very awkward situation.
oh that sucks maybe organize the socks better?
my room was messy as there was a party last night in my house and friends were enjoying in whole house. that is the reason.
label: embarrassed
response: ah. well, chalk it up to one of those funny but awkward moments of life then!

situation: i interviewed for a job and thought the interview went decent.  i just had to wait to hear back from them.
dialogue: i went for a job interview, and it seemed to go pretty well.
that is great! when will you find out?
it should be a couple weeks, assuming they go at the pace they said they would.
label: hopeful
response: good luck! i hope you get it.

situation: my wife and i moved for her to go to school, and sometimes i really miss my friends from home.
dialogue: i moved far away from my hometown for the first time so my wife could go to grad school.  it is hard to be away from my friends.
i know how it feels to be homesick, but you have to put your wife first.
yeah, definitely, that is why i went ahead with the move.  i am just not very good at meeting people, so it can be tough.
label: lonely
response: you and your wife should go out to events and try to meet new people.

situation: i dropped my wife off at the airport for her 2 month trip out of the country.  i felt really bad all the way home.
dialogue: i took my wife to the airport for her trip out of the country for 2 months.  i felt really bad on the way home.
ohh man, that is a long time to be alone.  what are you going to do while she is gone?
mostly work and hang out with the dogs.  we just moved recently and i do not really know anyone outside of work.
label: sad
response: i am sorry.  where did she go?

situation: i was in a drive-thru line and someone cut in front of some other people.  i confronted the guy about it and he basically told me to take a hike.  i was furious and blew up at him.  finally he left the line but he flipped me off when he did.
dialogue: i almost got in a fight in a drive-thru lineup.
what happened? did someone bump on your car?
no, the person cut in front of some other people.  i confronted him about it and we got into a shouting match.
label: angry
response: be carefull , you do not know the cray people that is out there.

situation: i was supposed to meet a friend on his boat at a marina. i would never seen his boat but he described it to me.  unfortunately when i got to the marina he was not there, so i got on the first boat that looked like what he described.  but it was not his!  fortunately my friend saw me before the boat's owner did and i got off and on the right one.
dialogue: i got on a stranger's boat by accident at the marina.
that must have been awkward.
fortunately the owner did not see me before i got off, but i sure felt stupid about it.
label: embarrassed
response: do not worry about it. it happens to the best of us.

situation: i was looking at old pictures from my first apartment after college, and started thinking about all the times i had there hanging out with friends.
dialogue: i was looking at old pictures from my first "adult" apartment, and thinking about all the times i spent there with friends and roommates.
nostalgia can be wonderful, cannot it?
it can, but it can also hurt sometimes.  it is probably just nostalgia hardcore, but sometimes i wish i could go back to that time.
label: sentimental
response: i feel the same when listening to 90s alternative music

situation: last night i was trying to get some time to myself, but the kids were screaming and my friend was fighting with her mom.
dialogue: last night was crazy. i could not relax even though i really wanted to. i was in a house full of people screaming and yelling.
what was going on!?
my friend and her mom were fighting about money, and my friend's daughters were wanting attention.
label: annoyed
response: sounds like a lot of drama ugh i hope you get some rest tonight

situation: i had a job interview today and i think it really well.
dialogue: i had a job interview today and i think it really well.
that is really good you feel pretty secure about it then?
the interviewer told me that i was his favorite interview so far. and i think my qualifications are a really good match for the company.
label: hopeful
response: oh wow then that is really good! for someone to say that! you should be very proud of yourself.

situation: i just called someone out for stealing a picture of my dog for internet points when it turns out it was not my dog just a similar looking one.
dialogue: i saw a picture of a dog on reddit that looked a lot like mine so i called out the person saying it was a picture of my dog, but it turned out i was wrong.  whoops.
thar was an embarasing moment for sure
yeah, i do not like calling people out in general, do not know what made me think to do it this time.
label: embarrassed
response: maybe you are felling lonely these days?

situation: after a stressful day at work i found my car's tires had been slashed! i could not help but scream.
dialogue: i am surprised the police are going to let they get away with it.
did you have an enemy or someone as a suspect?
i think the mailman might be mad at me because i keep ordering heavy items.
label: furious
response: weird reaction. i feel like he should just do his job and not key your car.

situation: i am a bit worried this morning. i get the results of some tests my doctor did on me. hope everything's ok.
dialogue: my test results come back today. i do hope everythings ok.
what are you worrying about?
i had an abnormal ekg and they did a stress test on my heart to make sure everything's alright.
label: apprehensive
response: well, i hope it is alright, heart problems is not something you should take lightly.

situation: i went back to my home where i grew up and a flood of good memories came bavk to me. i had so many fun times with my best friends when i was a child.
dialogue: i went back to my home where i grew up and a flood of good memories came bavk to me. i had so many fun times with my best friends when i was a child.
what is your favorite memory with your friends?
playing outside in the summer time. many fun summer times. swimming holes, icecream, catching fireflies.
label: nostalgic
response: that sounds like so much fun! i am glad you got to go back to revisit.

situation: my parents gave me a car for graduating from college. it makes my life so much easier.
dialogue: my parents gave me a car for graduating from college. it makes my life so much easier.
you deserved for graduating.
thanks, now all i got to do is get a real career. i could not have done it with out them.
label: grateful
response: just keep working hard and make them proud.

situation: the more problems i have to more i faith, and faithful i become. i am stronger in my faith when bad things happen in my life and around me.
dialogue: the more problems i have to deal with, the more faith, and faithful i become. i am stronger in my faith when bad things happen in my life and around me.
i am glad to hear you have something you can lean on in hard times. i am personally an atheist but i can respect someone with faith.
i was told once by a dear departed friend that "what ever floats a persons boat it good because it keeps people sane as long as no one is being hurt.
label: faithful
response: i absolutely agree. as long as you are not hurting anyone, do whatever you please!

situation: i had a job interview yesterday that i thought went really well, but it did not. they just emailed me back and told me that i did not get the job.
dialogue: i had a job interview yesterday that i thought went really well, but it did not. they just emailed me back and told me that i did not get the job.
oh man, i am sorry to hear that! it does not necessarily mean it went bad, though. maybe they just had a more qualified candidate?
i am just pretty embarrassed, i was so confident. this whole job hunting adventure has been a complete nightmare.
label: ashamed
response: keep your head up! job hunting is usually stressful for most people. you got this!

situation: my coworker received a promotion over me. i am envious of his newfound success.
dialogue: i can understand why you might be jealous of your coworker. i would try to keep your head up.
i am not jealous of my co-worker though?  what makes you think i am jealous?
you said that you were envious of his promotion. it is understandable though.
label: jealous
response: i did not say that.

situation: i have to leave my poor dog at home while i go to work.
dialogue: i just got a puppy, but i have to leave him at home while i go to work. i feel so bad.
that would be sad, do you keep him in a cage?
fortunately, no. i let him run around the house, but i feel like he gets bored, so i keep the tv on for him.
label: guilty
response: that is nice, what does he enjoy watching?

situation: i stole a candy bar from a local gas station. i am not pleased with my actions.
dialogue: stealing is wrong. i would also be ashamed of my actions.
absolutely. although the world is not so black and white. sometimes a person may have to steal to survive. is it really wrong then?
if that is the case, i can understand why they had to do it. in circumstances where someone is stealing solely for unneeded person gain, then it is most definitely wrong.
label: guilty
response: i agree. stealing someone else's possession when it was not necessary for your survival is despicable! i hate a thief!

situation: while i was in college my dog ran away back home and was never found.  my mother had been taking her on a walk in a park and my dog fell down a cliff.  i dreamed about her every night for a month at school, and hoped i would get a call saying she was found, but she never was.
dialogue: my dog disappeared while i was away at college.
that is so sad, i am so sorry you had to go through that. how did it happen?
my mother was walking her in a park and the dog fell down a cliff.  she was never found or recovered.
label: sad
response: my goodness, that sounds like a tragedy. i am sure she was a great dog friend of yours.

situation: i am looking forward to my niece arriving from washington. i have not seen her in 2 years.
dialogue: i am looking forward to my niece arriving from washington. i have not seen her in 2 years!
do you have some big plans for the visit?
probably not, because she is 6 months pregnant. her husband is in the military and is away, so she will be here when she has her baby.
label: anticipating
response: uh oh, have you ever delivered a baby before?

situation: my mother just graduated from nursing school in her 50's. she put in a lot of effort, and she proved to herself and others that she could do it.
dialogue: oh wow, you must be very proud of her. that is quite an accomplishment.
what was the accomplishment again?
my mother just graduated from nursing school in her 50's. she put in a lot of effort, and she proved to herself and others that she could do it.
label: impressed
response: wow, that is amazing. what made her want to go back to school?

situation: i saw a homeless guy the other day on my way home.
dialogue: i saw a homeless guy the other day on my way home, and it made me reflect on my own life.
what about this homeless person had you reevaluating things?
lately, i have been thinking how miserable i am at my job. as terrible as it sounds, when i saw him, i thought life could be much worse.
label: grateful
response: what is been bothering you at work? are you not being fulfilled enough?

situation: a violent windstorm whipped through my town and downed a tree in my yard, along with a lot of other debris. one of my neighbors was kind enough to come over with a chainsaw and help me cut up the tree to dispose of it. then he helped me rake up all the other debris.  i did not even ask but was very appreciative of his help.
dialogue: a violent windstorm blew through my town and uprooted a tree in my yard.
oh no! i hope it did not fall on anything or anyone!
no, it missed everything but the lawn. and then my neighbor was nice enough to bring over his chainsaw and help me cut it up for disposal.
label: grateful
response: oh that is really nice! its important to help each other out when things like that happen!

situation: i knew someone who got exceedingly famous. it sort of eats me up how successful and popular they are.  what is worse is that i do not think they are very talented, and a lot of their success is due to a phony persona they maintain.  it really bothers me.
dialogue: i used to know someone who got incredibly famous.
who??? male or female.actor or singer?
she is a female singer. it sort of burns me up because i feel like she does not deserve it and she is rather manipulative.
label: jealous
response: please tell me who she is!

situation: i long for the good old days, when i was carefree and happy. the sun always shone, i had cash in my pocket and plenty of time for the things i love to do.
dialogue: years ago i used to have such a good time. i had money to spend, time to do the things i love. how i long for those times again!
i know exactly how you feel, i have been slipping back into paycheck to paycheck living recently. it was so much better when i had the money to pay for everything.
did not the sun always shine back then, when we were happy and young and had money?!
label: nostalgic
response: hahaha yes, you are so right. then again, i am a christian so i am also comforted when i remember that we have a real, more important and awesome life to look forward to one day.

situation: someone broke into my apartment last week. i was not home at the time, but now i worry that they will come back.
dialogue: someone broke into my apartment last week. i was not home at the time, but now i worry that they will come back.
wow, that is terrible. was anything stolen or damaged?
yes, my tv was stolen. they also clogged every toilet in my apartment. i think they have just eaten thai food.
label: afraid
response: what a story, it is just unbelievable how these robbers have absolutely no morals.

situation: i woke up this morning, and my mailbox had been smashed in. i think the neighborhood teens had smashed it with a bat.
dialogue: i woke up this morning, and my mailbox had been smashed in. i think the neighborhood teens had smashed it with a bat.
that is is awful.did you call the cops
i did, they are investigating currently. i hope they find the hoodlums.
label: angry
response: you should install security cameras outside your house.

situation: i did not get the job that i had interviewed for. i thought the interview went well, but i guess not.
dialogue: i did not get the job that i had interviewed for. i thought the interview went well, but i guess not.
that is rough man. got any back up interviews lined up?
not as of now. i have applied to a couple of other jobs.
label: disappointed
response: i hope that you hear back from them soon. it ain't going to be rough forever someone has got to recognize your worth eventually!

situation: last week, my pants fell down in gym class. the elastic strap holding them up broke.
dialogue: last week, my pants fell down in gym class. the elastic strap holding them up broke.
oh no, that is terrible! what happened? what did you do!
i ran out of the gym crying, and the whole class pointed and laughed.
label: embarrassed
response: i am so sorry that happened to you!

situation: i love my cat, but she is driving me crazy constantly rubbing up against my face. i have so much cat hair in my nose.
dialogue: i love my cat, but she is driving me crazy constantly rubbing up against my face. i have so much cat hair in my nose.
yuck, sounds like an unpleasant feeling. how do you even get hair up there!
she keeps walking across my chest and rubs on my face as she walks across. i know she is being sweet but it tickles.
label: annoyed
response: well, at least she loves you. maybe shoving all her hair up your nose is her way of telling you that.

situation: i am going on a vacation this thursday! i am very excited!
dialogue: i am going on a vacation this thursday! i am very excited!
oh really?! where you headed too?
we are heading to somalia! we had some business dealings to attend to, and we will be seeing the ocean as well!
label: anticipating
response: wow! that is on the east side of africa is not it?

situation: i clogged up the toilet at a female friend's house by accident. i did not tell them.
dialogue: i clogged up the toilet at a female friend's house by accident. i did not tell them.
did you have a severe diarreia or something?
yes, it is a legitimate medical condition. i have irritable bowl syndrome.
label: ashamed
response: i am sure your friend will forgive you.

situation: when i secured the first prize in an event at my college
dialogue: i won a prize at an event in my college and felt very happy, proud
oh cool! how did you win it?
it was for a chess competition.
label: proud
response: oh cool! i love chess! what did you win?

situation: i have a coworker that will not stop talking. he mostly talks about himself.
dialogue: i have a coworker that will not stop talking. he mostly talks about himself
wow that is annoying, my husband is always telling me about his co-workers being the same way.
yes, it is quite frustrating. i do not mind listening to people, but i would like them to ask how i am doing from time to time.
label: annoyed
response: yeah i see what you mean. hopefully he might realize eventually.

situation: i have been waiting on a package my friend sent me to arrive at my house. i heard a knock at the door but it was a package or my roommate.
dialogue: i have been waiting on a package my friend sent me to arrive at my house. i heard a knock at the door but it was a package or my roommate.
sometimes it is uncomfortable to have to wait for something or someone.
yeah it is. i just thought that is what it would be, so it dashed my hopes when it was not. i just got keep waiting, i guess.
label: disappointed
response: well, a wise man said that having patience was a virtue, i think you are becoming a more virtuous person by waiting.

situation: i fell walking up the stair today. there was a large group around, and people laughed at me.
dialogue: i fell walking up the stair today. there was a large group around, and people laughed at me.
i think you should always focus on your strength then it will not matter who is there and what they say
that is good advice. i feel better about this.
label: embarrassed
response: also having at least one  friend in such meetings  would help. next time  go with someone you know

situation: i was delighted the other day when i got to see a friend that i had not seen in 20 years.
dialogue: i was delighted the other day when i got to see a friend that i had not seen in 20 years.
that is great, how wonderful! i hope y'all had a good time.
it was like we just started where we left off over 20 years ago. it was like we just seen each last week, not 20 years ago.
label: joyful
response: how great, i am glad to hear that.

situation: i cannot believe what just happened! when i went to check the mail, my neighbor's baby was riding my dog like horse!
dialogue: i just saw the craziest thing! a baby was riding a dog like a horse outside!
how old was the child?
she could not have been older than one!
label: surprised
response: wow, that is awfully young for that kind of thing.

situation: i was doing some freelance work for a friend and it did not work out the way i had wanted to the results we got were less than stellar.  i worked as hard as i could but it was not enough.
dialogue: i was doing some freelance website work for a friend of mine and i did a lot of work for it.  sadly, it did not do as well as we had expected it to do, even though i put my best work and most effort into it.
oh that is not good. it is hard to put all your effort in and have it go nowhere
it is.  we are in the process of revamping and coming up with some new and different ideas so hopefully we can do some revisions and get better results.
label: disappointed
response: sometimes revamping leads to more amazing results than you could have orginially anticipated

situation: i was supposed to meet my aunt to give her keys to babysit this weekend, but she is not answering her phone.
dialogue: i am worried that if my aunt does not answer her phone, i will not be able to give her the keys so she can babysit for me this weekend.
oh no! are you going away this weekend?
yes, i am going on a business trip by my son has an important tennis match this weekend. i do not know what i will do if my aunt does not answer soon.
label: anxious
response: hopefully, she answers soon. maybe she is taking a nap or is in the shower.

situation: i am hopeful that i would be rich someday
dialogue: i am always suffering due to lack of money and i wish i could be rich someday
i am in the same boat, but i think that i can still be very happy and very content with the little bit of money or lack of i have.
that is good to know. no wonder we are here doing these tasks
label: hopeful
response: how funny! i know how you feel though. i have always been poor.

situation: i was really down after i found out that i was not going to be able to move.
dialogue: i was really down after i found out that i was not going to be able to move.
why? how did that happen?
becaue i am stuck at a mine site and no one will buy me out. no one wants to live at a mine site with land collapsing everywhere.
label: disappointed
response: that is so sad. i feel sorry for you.

situation: i am faithful to my parents for all what they have done for me
dialogue: they are very helpful and i always will be faithful to them
that is nice, i am glad you feel that way.
yes, what about you? do you feel likewise?
label: faithful
response: i do feel that way, i try to always have a christian attitude.

situation: my friend is so supportive
dialogue: i am so happy to be able to spend time with my best friend. i was not feeling good and she came over and cheered me up
that is nice of her! it is always good to have friends to fall on
yes, and she also helped me out and paid one of my bills when i was struggling with money
label: joyful
response: oh, that is even better. that is truly a friend you can rely on. you are very fortunate.

situation: i was watching a kid skateboarding and he pulled of a jump and trick that really rather blew me away, considering his age.
dialogue: i saw this kid on a skateboard the other day.  i thought he was gonna wipe out hard, but he pulled off some kind of multi-flip jump thing that really shocked me.
skateboarders have some serious skills! i can barely walk a straight line.
i know, right?!  i tried skateboarding once when i was a kid, made it to being able to kind of not fall over in a straight line, never managed to do anything else.
label: impressed
response: we all have different talents. mine do not lie in those kind of stunts either!

situation: i always say i hate when other moms shame each other but i do the same thing
dialogue: i always say i hate when other moms shame each other but guess what? i do the same thing!
maybe you could try to better that?
i definitely should! i should be nicer to other moms and do not judge them
label: ashamed
response: you could start a trend.

situation: i love my baby so much. he is teething right now and i do not really know how to help him
dialogue: i love my baby so much! he is teething right now and i do not even know how to help him
he will make it
i know he will, i just wish i could help him. i gave him tylenol but he was still pretty cranky
label: caring
response: it will help eventually

situation: i was walking my dogs and a guy had his dog off leash, and it ran up and freaked out both of mine.
dialogue: i was walking my dogs the other day and a guy came out with his dog off leash.  the dog ran up and freaked out both my dogs.
that must have been scary. it could have gone really badly.
yeah, i was really worried.  my bigger dog got really protective of the smaller one, but thankfully they did not actually get into a fight.
label: angry
response: i hope the owner knows better next time.

situation: when my dog was still potty training.
dialogue: i just recently finished potty training my dog, that was quite the nightmare with sooo many puddles needing cleaned up.
oh man! i hear you. i rescue animals and it is very hard to potty train them!
i can imagine a rescue, generally being a little bit older than a fresh 8 week old someone would get, can be much harder. it is a painful process for sure!
label: annoyed
response: for sure! it is much like potty training a kid. actually i think dogs are easier then kids!

situation: my dog had a medical emergency and i did not have the money to cover it, so my parents loaned me some money until i got paid.
dialogue: my dog started looking really sick and in pain, but i did not have the money to take him to an emergency vet, so i had to ask my parents for a loan until i got paid.
that is stressful.  are they ok?
yeah, he is fine now.  it was some kind of stomach thing, but he got medicine and rest and is good now.
label: grateful
response: that is really good to hear

situation: i was sitting on my back deck drinking a cup of coffee and just felt so wholesome and happy with life. it was great
dialogue: i was sitting on my back deck drinking a cup of coffee and just felt so wholesome and happy with life. it was great . you ever have any of those moments?
i certainly do.  lucky to be healthy and able
i always try to look for the small things. i got to see a hummingbird today and that was great. anything small in your life make a big impact?
label: content
response: good question.  i am thankful to be able to park my car in my garage!

situation: i was waiting to hear back about a job interview i went on.
dialogue: i interviewed for a job a while back that i was waiting on hearing about.  i felt like it went well.
i hope you get the job! what was the position you applied for?
a lab manager at a university.  i have got my fingers crossed!
label: hopeful
response: that sounds like it pays nice?

situation: recently, i have had to file for disability due to my ms. it is been very tough, but my father has been giving me $500 a month to help stay afloat. he really is helping me a lot.
dialogue: have you ever had to file for disability?
no. why do you ask?
i have had to recently. its been really tough.
label: grateful
response: i am sorry to hear that. how far along in the process are you?

situation: often times my kids like to come tell me every detail of what they are doing in a video game. it was cute at first but its getting annoying.
dialogue: do your kids ever do anything cute that turns annoying?
i actually do not have any kids right now
my kids love to tell me what they are doing in their video games. it was cute at first, but you can only listen to someone talk about stardew valley for so long.
label: annoyed
response: i heard that was a really fun game though!

situation: when my wife was sick recently, i had to take over a lot of chores around the house, and also help her a lot. it was very trying, but it we made it through.
dialogue: i have had to help take care of others before as well.
seems like we all have. some people shirk having to though.
yeah, i am not so lucky. my wifes been sick and i have been taking care of her recently.
label: caring
response: oh no.i hope she gets better.

situation: even though i failed my driving test 2 times, i was encouraged and passed on my third try!
dialogue: i failed my driving test twice, but i was really encouraged and did better the next time.
well that is good, sometimes it is our failures that really show us what we are made of.
i agree, i practiced and practiced and i was pleased when i passed my third time. persistence is key.
label: hopeful
response: congratulations. i am in my twenties and still cannot drive so hopefully i will get my license next year.

situation: i went to a restaurant and i saw a rat running through the back, it was horrid and gross.
dialogue: i once went a restaurant, and i saw rats running around in the back kitchen!
did you say anything to someone?
i reported it! i was shocked and grossed out, how can a place like that operate!?
label: disgusted
response: a burger king near me got shut down for that!

situation: the other day at the skatepark my daughter went down the big ramp! it was so cool to watch her go.
dialogue: do any of your kids play any sports?
no, i do not have kids. yours?
my daughter skateboards. she went down the big ramp the other day. it was so cool.
label: proud
response: i bet you were really proud!

situation: i once walked out in my underwear not knowing i did not have pants on!
dialogue: i was so late for work one day, i walked out and forgot to put on my pants!
wow. that is hard to believe.
i was so concerned about getting to work i forgot to throw them on, i was so in shock, even the neighbors saw. it was bad.
label: embarrassed
response: yeah, it sounds that way.

situation: i was at the grocery store today and had to wait in line for 15 minutes/ theres was only one cashier. i cannot belive the store did not have more employees working.
dialogue: i had to wait in line for 15 minutes at the store today. there was only one poor cashier working.
that must of been a pain! i hate waiting in lines for cashiers, they are so slow sometimes.
the cashier could not help it. the store should hire more people.
label: annoyed
response: stores should really open more checkouts when it is busy, especially during rush our!

situation: when i got my new puppy i was so excited, the joy of adding a new member to the family was the best!
dialogue: i was so excited when i got my new puppy, it was awesome!
man, i am so jealous of you. i love that new puppy stage, as tumultuous as it can be. there is just so much emotion and "new feelings" going on as you watch it grow.
i agree with you, the joy of adding a new member to the family is a wave of emotions, positive ones of course!
label: excited
response: yeah, but then there is also those late nights where you have to take them out because they are not used to holding their pee/poop in. and also them peeing and pooping in the house as they learn not to do that to begin with. they just have unlimited energy, so it is hard to keep up sometimes, but also fun!

situation: sometimes i look back to my childhood and i miss when things were more simple, like when i would ride around my neighborhood all day with my friends. we would just ride from sun up to sun down without a care in the world. only stopping back at the house to get an afternoon snack from our parents.
dialogue: those were simpler times, i wish i could go back and relive those days!
what were simpler times?
childhood when you did not have so much to worry about.
label: nostalgic
response: ah, i see. had a great childhood, hu?

situation: i felt like i was on top of the world when i won the science fair in middle school. no better feeling than that for a small child.
dialogue: i felt like i was on the top of the world when i won the science fair in middle school. no better feeling than that for a small child.
congrats! that would be really exciting. what was your project?

my project was to show what farm poop produced the most gas when it decomposed. i put the poop in a bottle with a balloon on top. whatever balloon grew the largest, was the one that released the most gas.
label: proud
response: that is a very interesting topic. i would have loved to have seen that!

situation: i am sleep training my toddler and i am so frustrated and overhwelmed
dialogue: i am sleep training my toddler, he never slept in his crib before. he is crying and it makes me feel so bad
i know what that is like. i have three kids.
how did you cope with all the crying? we have been co sleeping since birth and it is breaking my heart to hear him cry
label: anxious
response: they never slept in the crib. i will not even make my son get a haircut because he cries so much when the clippers get close. i am the wrong one to come to for advice

situation: i just got back from our beach vacation and it was so great! going there and having a beachfront condo was exhilarating!
dialogue: i just got back from my vacation. we stayed at a beachfront condo and spent time there, it was so much fun! we really had a blast!
that sounds heavenly
it was! we hadn't been able to go on a vacation for a couple of years, due to personal reasons, so you can imagine how we felt when we went!
label: excited
response: i envy you.  have fun!

situation: my son is now in college and of legal age for any situation. i feel very nostalgic when i look at him at times.
dialogue: as i look at my 21 year old son, i often reflect on when he was smaller. time really flies!
time sure does fly and change is inevitable
yes, that is true. i still can imagine when he was waking up christmas morning to see what santa brought when he was 5.
label: sentimental
response: thinking about past events can be very nostalgic

situation: my husband had to cancel a vacation for next month. it is because his other night manager is terriblke and they cannot afford to let him go.
dialogue: i want to go on a vacation next month but now i cant.
what happened?
mys husbands job sucks and they had to cancel his vacation because they arnt staffed right.
label: disappointed
response: time to find a new job it sounds like! good luck

situation: my son is going back to college and will graduate this year!
dialogue: my son is in his last year of college! we are so excited and looking forward to graduation time!
awesome! what is he in college for?
he is going to be an aerospace engineer! we are very proud of him and how dedicated he is to achieving his dream.
label: anticipating
response: holy goodness! that is really specialized. you should be very proud!

situation: we found out our son was not as sick as we thought he was and i was really glad.
dialogue: we took our son to the doctor and luckily he is getting better!
that is very good to hear, hopefully things truly turn around for him.
i hope so. do you have any kids?
label: grateful
response: not yet, i just have one dog.

situation: over the weekend, i visited the flea market, where i found a store specializing in old memorabilia,  video games, cards, comics, dolls, everything that i enjoyed as a child. it was like stepping into a time capsule of stuff i used to own, love, and covet. i especially loved looking through the beanie babies.
dialogue: i went to the flea market last weekend!
oh that is neat! did you find anything good?
well, kinda. i got a bunch of old beanie babies, haha.
label: nostalgic
response: oh i remember when those came out and everyone thought they were going to be worth millions someday!

situation: when my daughter makes something new, i feel really pleased with her.
dialogue: i came home the other day to find that my daughter had made all the beds in the house! she is 6.
wow, that is incredible. i do not even make my own bed.
haha me either most days! i was really proud of her and then she said she wanted more chore money!
label: proud
response: of course.. haha. why does not anyone pay adults to make their beds?

situation: when my pet got badly injured a few months ago, i thought for sure that she would not make it.
dialogue: my aggressive pet rat attacked the baby rat and left her a horrible gash on her abdomen!
wow, that sounds very disgusting.
it looked so horrible. i thought for sure the baby was as good as dead.
label: anxious
response: i hope the baby rat is okay.

situation: my mother became ill and she had to be hospitalized. i was very concerned, but she was much better after a few days there.
dialogue: my mother became ill a while back and had to be put into the hospital. i was so concerned, but she became better after a few days. such a huge relief!
i am so sorry but great to hear she is better now!
thanks, she is. she had a blood clot in her leg and we did not know it, so it could have been much, much worse. i cannot even express how glad i was when she was better!
label: grateful
response: well i am glad to hear it is resolved.

situation: fed a stray yesterday.
dialogue: i fed a stray cat that was hanging out in my yard yesterday.
oh that is nice, i love doing that. did the cat seem happy?
the cat appeared very relaxed, but i could tell it was very pensive about my presence. it took some time to develop some sort of trust.
label: trusting
response: well how nice, that must have been fun.

situation: running from a stranger in the woods when camping.
dialogue: one time i was camping out in the woods in california with some friends. i ended up getting lost on my way back to the camping spot in the middle of the night.
wow that must have been scary!
if that was not frightening enough, i ended up getting chased by a stranger while i was looking for my camp mates!
label: terrified
response: how long were you lost for?

situation: her
dialogue: i did not force her into anything. she seemed to know what she was doing anyway
wow back up there friend, what are you talking about?
i wish it never happened now.
label: ashamed
response: context, what the heck are you talking about?

situation: my friend recently went on a beach vacation and i really was ready to go on vacation myself. she had already been several times that year so i begrudged her vacation a bit.
dialogue: a little while ago, my friend went on another beach vacation. it was her 3rd one for the year. my family and i hadn't been on vacation for several years, due to issues beyond our control, so i begrudged her trip a bit.
being jealous of another person is a perfectly fine response. despite this, you never know what is going on behind the scenes, she may have taken out huge loans just to fund her trips.
yes, true, i know they tend to let bills go for things like that, which i do not do.
label: jealous
response: i bet you would go on many vacations if you did the same as her. instead, you are being a responsible person and doing what is best for your future.

situation: boy
dialogue: i am so happy it is a boy
you just had a baby?! i did not even know you were expecting!
he will be here in about 3 months
label: excited
response: i am so happy for you! have you decided on a name yet?

situation: i wanted to start a ketogenic diet, but i knew nothing about it. so i rented some books from the library and got a kindle unlimited subscription to check out the cookbooks on there. then i compiled some meal plans and grocery lists to start my diet.
dialogue: hey, i just started the keto diet!
good for you! i have heard many great things about keto. how are you finding it?
it is good so far. i was overwhelmed at first, but i rented some books from the library and got a kindle unlimited subscription to find some recipes and info.
label: prepared
response: props to you for researching the diet without understanding how it works. some people are just looking for ways to lose weight fast, but putting in effort goes a long way.

situation: pregnant
dialogue: imagine my surprise after 6 months of trying. now we also know it is a boy
you must be over the moon happy.
i am. especially when we saw the ultrasound. takes after his dad if you know what i mean haha
label: surprised
response: very funny. have you decided on a name yet?

situation: on my 16th birthday, i knew i was going to get a car. i told my daddy i wanted a pink one. at my party, he revealed the car.. and it was blue! that was not what i wanted at all!
dialogue: i just had my sweet 16 party.
happy belated birthday! did it turn out the way you had hoped?
well, about that. my dad knew i wanted a pink car for my birthday. but.
label: disappointed
response: what did you get instead?

situation: going for my degree
dialogue: i recently enrolled back in my university after dropping out 6 years ago.
really? that is a good move
i was scared about it at first, but so far i have all a's. i must say, i am proud of myself!
label: proud
response: you have as because you have high interest in studying

situation: lost 100 lbs
dialogue: over the past year i have been on a weight loss journey of over 100 pounds.
wow, that is truly incredible! what is your secret?
as well as exercise and diet, by far the most important thing is strong will and determination.
label: confident
response: that is so true! you are a true weight loss warrior i think!

situation: i never liked milk. i always had skim milk growing up. then i decided that maybe whole milk would be better, but i did not like that either. but now that i have had 2% milk, i can enjoy it.
dialogue: i never liked milk growing up, because my family drank skim.
do you like it now?
well, first i tried whole milk, and that was gross. but i just tried 2% milk, and i like it!
label: content
response: i like 2% as well.  it is perfect for cereal and chocolate milk!

situation: recently we had a 7 hour drive to get to our vacation spot, the rain was heavy and so was the traffic on the drive there. it made me very nervous!
dialogue: i just got back from our vacation, but the drive there was so nerve wracking. there was heavy rain and traffic, and some nighttime driving. had me on edge
so very bad ya
yes, well, it was just one of those things i know, but still was very tiring and can get to you after that drive.
label: apprehensive
response: ok

situation: ex's relapse.
dialogue: recently, i received the news about my ex boyfriend's relapse.
oh no!   how are you taking it?
it is definitely a hard situation to take in. he had stopped using when we started dating and was off it for 2 years until we broke up. it is very discouraging.
label: disappointed
response: dang.  please do not blame yourself.

situation: we went to florida for a vacation and when we got to the bridge and toll booths, the line was 30 minutes of wait, after a 7 hour drive!
dialogue: on my recent vacation to florida, there was a very long delay at the toll booths of at least 45 minutes. this was after 7 hours of driving! it was such a hassle!
that is pretty long, how did you manage?
i wanted to pull my hair out. but, knew once we were past it, there was the beautiful ocean on the other side.finally!
label: annoyed
response: yea, something calming helps during fraustrating moments, but at least you know how the route is now

situation: my boyfriend surprised me with flowers today. i thought it was so cool and thanked him for the gift.. then he said, "happy anniversary." i am completely mortified that i forgot.
dialogue: robby got me flowers today.
nice! who's robby? is that your husband?
yes, how could you forget? it was a nice surprise, but then he said. "happy anniversary."
label: ashamed
response: aha! was it actually your anniversary today? happy anniversary!

situation: caught kissing
dialogue: dad caught me kissing my half aunt
oh, wow. um, that is crazy. why did you do that?
i was attracted to her. she was older. the worst part was getting hit upside the head in front of her
label: embarrassed
response: i would imagine! i would do the same thing if i was your dad, haha.

situation: me found cave. me found paint of wife. me remember how wife hunt big mammoth. me smile.
dialogue: me found cave.
you sound like a caveman
me am caveman. in cave was paint of cave wife. wife hunt big mammoth.
label: nostalgic
response: why you no hunt and send wife instead.

situation: getting pregnant
dialogue: one of the scariest, yet happiest experiences in my life was finding out that i was going to have a baby.
oh i can relate to that especially if you are not prepared for it, it can get really scary
oh, we were totally unprepared. in fact, my partner and i were working out of state in a compromising environment. we had to double on back home to get our lives set up for the big change!
label: excited
response: you guys will be alright trust me i  experienced same with my partner and now we are fine. our kid is a teenager now. i am happy for you guys

situation: having a healthy baby.
dialogue: when i was pregnant, i felt ill until it was over. the doctors were worried that something was wrong with the baby.
oh no! i am not sure how all that works, but i thought that was fairly normal for a pregnat woman

usually the sickness stops within the first few months, so the fact that i fell ill so much was worrisome. despite it all, i had a healthy, bouncing baby boy. i never have felt more grateful in my life.
label: grateful
response: well i am glad for you! and for him! a new life is exciting

situation: felt helpless when my dog passed away.
dialogue: when my dog passed away, i felt so helpless. she was old and suffering and i felt angry that there was nothing i could do other than put her down.
that is so sad. you did your best. how old was she?
she was 14. i got her when she was a puppy. even though the situation was rough, i am grateful for all the years we did get to spend together.
label: angry
response: that is really good, though. it sounds like you gave her a great life.

situation: she got with him for money
dialogue: i had to sit in the front while she was in the back with him
was he with you or just someone you wanted to be with?
i wanted her. but he had the money. and that is what she wanted
label: jealous
response: in that case, you are better off without her.

situation: my son is going back to college for his junior year and we have saved to make sure we have all his financial needs ready.
dialogue: my son is in college and about to return for his junior year. we have made sure to put back ample saving to take care of his financial needs.
oh, wow, i wish my parents had done that! it would have saved me from the mountain of debt i have now
we felt it was best to make sure to get ready in advance and help as much as we can. but, i know all parents are not able to do that, or feel they should not, so i can see both sides!
label: prepared
response: well, i have always been of the mindset that (if they can) they should help the first 2 years as that is usually the break-in period. after that, the child should be able to manage

situation: playing with puppies.
dialogue: after a long few months of being a hermit, i went out the other day to the shelter to play with some pups!
i bet that felt good to get out and experience that!
it was definitely exciting for me! i have not been able to play with a dog since my own passed away.
label: excited
response: oh i am sorry to hear that. i also enjoy dogs. they are one of life's great joys in my opinion.

situation: overwhelmed with school work and life.
dialogue: i have been feeling a bit blue and overwhelmed lately.
you should take a vacation that will help you relax and see new stuff
i could definitely use one! however, i have a newborn so i will have to wait a little while before we can go on some adventures!
label: sad
response: oh ok. in that case let someone very close like your mother come around to help you out. having someone to talk to helps in times like this

situation: skin is good, good health, healthy diet, good grades. life is good!
dialogue: these days my skin has never looked better. my diet is good, my family life is good, i have got good grades. life is good!
that is awesome. are you using any special types of lotion?
nope! i believe it is mostly due to diet and lots of water. it is amazing how much the little changes can impact.
label: content
response: i will have to do the same! i wish my skin looked better than it does.

situation: not wanting someone to wear the same dress as me, i flew across the country to buy my prom dress. well, turns out becky still had to copy me! i cannot believe she wore the same dress!
dialogue: i flew all the way to new york city to buy a designer dress for the prom.
you must be wealthy. i would love to visit nyc
i am, thanks, but i would not go there. becky still managed to get the same dress as me! i am so mad!
label: furious
response: omg! i know how you feel

situation: old school arcade games
dialogue: i just love playing retro games. takes me back
oh, me too! i love digging out my n64 and snes from time to time.
oh yeah? cool. i like the old sega mega drive games. the music is just classic on those games
label: nostalgic
response: yes, that yamaha sound chip was magical. we call it the genesis over here.

situation: i was home alone. suddenly, i heard a loud bang. i went into the kitchen to investigate, and briefly saw a white dress flying out the window. i saw a ghost!
dialogue: one night, i was home alone, when suddenly, i heard a loud bang!
oh goodness, what was it?
it was a ghost! i ran into the kitchen to investigate, and i saw what looked like a white dress flapping out the window.
label: terrified
response: wow, that must have been a terrible experience.

situation: my daughter was voted "most artistic" in school and i really felt so happy for her. she is very talented and i think is going far with her talent.
dialogue: recently my daughter was voted 'most artistic' by her peers! she is so talented and we feel lucky to be her parents.
so very nice.your doughter.
yes, she has a natural talent, but really puts much practice and time into it.
label: confident
response: whove very nice ya and super talent.

situation: she went behind my back but i found out via social media
dialogue: what does that mean?
what does what mean exactly?
this has obviously gone all wrong somewhere
label: disappointed
response: well whatever went wrong, i hope it can be fixed somehow.

situation: i found an injured baby kitten in the road while driving. i took it home, nursed it back to health, and now she is my beloved muffin.
dialogue: a year ago, i found an injured baby kitten in the road while driving.
oh no! did you take the kitten to an animal hospital or care for it yourself?
i cared for it myself. now she is my beloved cat, muffin.
label: caring
response: awe, that is a sweet story! the kitten got a happy ending!

situation: she traveled all by herself
dialogue: i am proud that she traveled across the world all by herself. 2 big suitcases and all
that is great! who did the travelling?
wife. and she was 6 months pregnant to boot!
label: impressed
response: she must be a strong woman.

situation: i was very nervous when there was a strong storm at our house. there was a tornado watch very close to our house!
dialogue: there was a storm the other day, close to our home. there was a tornado warning near it, so i was afraid and nervous!
oh no. i hope you got somewhere safe while it was going on.
yes, it luckily passed our home, but you just never know!
label: apprehensive
response: that is good at least. living in an area with tornados is so scary!

situation: my brother recently proposed to his girlfriend. they are already talking about when they want to have the wedding, and making a few plans for what they want it to be like.
dialogue: my brother recently proposed to his girlfriend, i am really happy for him.
oh that is fantastic! i bet your brother was pretty happy too.
yeah, he gave her my grandmothers rings, since they were nice and we had them available. he is 23 so he is trying to save money, but still wanted her to have something nice.
label: proud
response: that is very sweet. i think they will have a happy and lasting marriage.

situation: going to get a new car soon
dialogue: i cannot wait to get a new car soon
that is exciting! what kind are you looking for?
i want a compact suv, like maybe something like a toyota rav4
label: excited
response: ah. hopefully something with good gas mileage!

situation: not yet prepared for baby, need fix up his room
dialogue: not yet ready for the baby, need fix up his room
ok ,have you done the need full?
not really. have not even started. got 3 months to go. yikes!
label: prepared
response: ok get started already. a stich in time saves nine  !

situation: the store i am ordering from will not ship to canada, even though i found the perfect present for my brothers birthday.
dialogue: i could not buy my brother his gift from an online retailer that starts with an a, because apparently they do not ship to canada from their .com website.
oh i think i can guess which retailer you are talking about. i have had so many problems with them over the years

yeah, it is horrible. i mean, what is so difficult about shipping to canada? you can pay for other people to ship the item to you from their address, you would think it would be just as simple for a big company like that.
label: annoyed
response: i know. canada is not even overseas in the literal sense, it is just over the border!

situation: she took me for $1600 in just 2 weeks
dialogue: she took me for $1600 in just 2 weeks. what a trap
unbelievable. you must be very angry with her (whoever she is).
it is been 7 years and i am still not over it
label: furious
response: neither would i, i dislike such greedy people

situation: 10 days alone and no car
dialogue: sat here by myself for 10 days straight. car was in the shop being repaired
wow that must have been frustrating.  i hope it did not cost too much.
it did actually. made me so mad. now i have to save up again
label: lonely
response: i know how that is.  at least you have your car back!

situation: was lied to about moving in to our own place
dialogue: for 8 months we were led to believe we would move in to our own place. lies
i am sorry to hear that. it sounds very rough. what happened to it?
instead her stupid grandma moved in to it!
label: disappointed
response: oh jeez that is really awful. can you get it back?

situation: felt bad afterwards
dialogue: at the time i did not think it was bad. but after she told me she did not actually like it, that made me think differently
what did not she like?
well she had never done it before, so i thought it was special
label: ashamed
response: well that makes sense.

situation: proud of my wife
dialogue: i am very proud of her for traveling alone at 6 months pregnant
congrats you have a baby on the way
yes. it is a boy
label: proud
response: how many kids do you want in total?

situation: i was supposed to go on a work trip but my child go sick. i was so worried to tell my boss that  i would not be able to go. it was an important trip and it was too late for someone to replace me.
dialogue: my child got sick and i had just made arrangements to go out of town on business.
oh no. how did you handle having two such big priorities come up?
i had to tell my boss i could not go and i was so stressed about that. it turned out the weather was bad and all flights go canceled so no one could go.
label: anxious
response: oh, sorry to hear. i am sure your child was glad you were home. is she or he feeling better now?

situation: she sat with them instead of me in champagne room
dialogue: i wish i had money. then she'd sit with me instead of him
sit where?
in the club
label: jealous
response: the club is not a great place to find the right kind of girl anyways.

situation: i do not feel bad. it is not like i made her do it. she wanted to
dialogue: i do not feel bad. it is not like i made her do it. she wanted to
what happened!
she knew what she was doing. i do not care how old she was. she knew
label: guilty
response: this somehow seems inappropriate.

situation: i know i will save the money i need
dialogue: i know i will save the money i need for the baby
what is your plan to accomplish that?
just to keep on working as much as i can everyday
label: confident
response: just do not over do, you have to enjoy being a parent, that is a key to happy kids.

situation: i wish i never did it now
dialogue: i wish i never did it now. i thought it was not going to come out
did you spill something?
kinda. i thought it was a secret
label: ashamed
response: was it liquid ?

situation: i did not shower for a few days and had an important meeting. i could tell that they could smell me. i became a tomato
dialogue: it was brutal
what was brutal?
"i did not shower for a few days and had an important meeting. i could tell that they could smell me. i became a tomato".
label: embarrassed
response: really? no shower for few days?

situation: i feel really bad about cheating on my girlfriend with a mutual friend. i cannot even look her in the eye
dialogue: i feel really bad about cheating on my girlfriend with a mutual friend. i cannot even look her in the eye
i would feel terrible to that is really bad, you should just tell her and change!
it was a one time thing. if i tell her that would break her
label: guilty
response: the truth can set us free, probably better for her and you both.

situation: i was heartbroken when my dad passed away. still not over it.
dialogue: i was heartbroken when my dad passed away. still not over it.
sorry to hear that. they say time heals everything but i disagree its been 9 years for me and it still feels like yesterday. how long for you?
5 years.
label: sentimental
response: i am really sorry for your loss! i hope that someday it gets better for the both of us.

situation: i was proud to see my kid winning in painting competition. she seems like a born artist
dialogue: i was proud to see my kid winning in painting competition. she seems like a born artist
oh i love seeing kids achieve things! adorable. good for her!
yeah. me and my partner are so proud of her
label: proud
response: i am sure, i would be too of my daughter. you sound like an awesome parent.

situation: i felt really guilty about lying to my parents when i was a child. yeah, its been a while, but still i feel bad about it
dialogue: i have always felt really guilty about lying to my parents
oh. well i understand. but that was a long time ago right?
yeah, but still. that feeling never went away
label: guilty
response: come clean to them about any major lies, you will feel better

situation: i am someone who wants to know that i have everything packed right before i go for a trip. i did it last time when we went to italy as well
dialogue: i never get anxious about knowing that i am fully prepared before i go somewhere
haha. i feel you. my mom feels the same way
well, i guess women are more detail oriented
label: prepared
response: amen sister! women always keep things in check

situation: i can never cheat on my girlfriend. this one time a super hot girl was so close to breaking me, but i held strong
dialogue: i feel like my girlfriend and i are soulmates. i can never cheat on her
thats really good of you. she is a lucky gal
yeah well. this one time this model-like girl was so close to seducing me, i escaped from there right awat
label: faithful
response: haha. i guess she was not as good as your girl huh?

situation: i felt heartbroken when my dog was hit by a van. she passed away eventually
dialogue: my dog passed away earlier this year
oh no, i am sorry to hear that. are you considering getting a new dog?
yeah. but its too soon i feel
label: devastated
response: i understand, mine just turned 15 and i am not looking forward to that day.

situation: i felt furious when someone drove past me in a really scary manner last week. i barely escaped
dialogue: some guy drove past me so fast last week. i was furious
jeez people just always have to be in a hurry to get no where right.
yeah. i barely escaped!
label: angry
response: people are just selfish and only consider their own lives!

situation: sometimes that i have been more apprehensive when i was feels upset and lonley
dialogue: what was that?
soory it was mistakenly typed.
label: apprehensive
response: it is okay.

situation: i am taking the california bar exam in february and i am suuuuper nervous.
dialogue: i am taking the california bar exam to become an attorney in february and i am sooo nervous!
that is pretty cool! what made you want to become a lawyer?
i played a video game when i was younger, called phoenix wright: ace attorney, and it made me want to become one!
label: anxious
response: great! i know it can be a tough job, i am sure you will do fine, keep studying!

situation: i have surprised when my friend surprise me ion my birthday
dialogue: once i had been hurt by girl friend and it hurts me more than anything in my life
that sucks.
yeah that really sucks.
label: surprised
response: well there are plenty more girls out there

situation: i fell down at work, and my khaki pants ripped open.
dialogue: i fell down at work, and my khaki pants ripped open.
oh no. did you leave?
i did not. luckily i had a spare pair of sweatpants in my trunk. i did end up looking rather odd with a suit jacket and sweatpants.
label: embarrassed
response: like you had a different kind of accident

situation: my grandpa is coming to visit!
dialogue: "my grandpa is coming to visit!
that sounds like you are excited for sure! when is he coming and what are yall going to do?
he is coming next week! we are going to play bingo at the local american legion every night!
label: joyful
response: honestly that sounds pretty fun to me i have not been to bingo in years. i love listening to the older people arguing when someone wins.

situation: i ate a gas station burrito for lunch. it was not very appetizing. actually, it was absolutely horrible.
dialogue: "i ate a gas station burrito for lunch. it was not very appetizing. actually, it was absolutely horrible.
yea i hear ya
yes, and now my tummy has the rumblies. my workplace bathroom is a one-seater right next to my work crush's desk. i am not sure if i am gonna make it.
label: disgusted
response: hope you feel better

situation: i have been prepared more for my future
dialogue: how was your day?
it was fine. how about you?
yeah its an another good day
label: prepared
response: nothing special.

situation: i had my t-shirt fly up in the wind and accidently flashed some people
dialogue: i managed to accidently flash a dozen people
how did it turn out
it was windy and the wind caught my shirt.  i was like "oops!
label: embarrassed
response: seems plausible

situation: i have been trusting my girl friend a lot then anyone else
dialogue: i have always more trust on my girlfriend
as you should
yeah i do. i love her a lot
label: trusting
response: thats cool

situation: i have a big exam coming up! my nerves are getting to me.
dialogue: i have a big exam coming up! my nerves are getting to me.
ohh good luck!
thanks! it is my final exam for a summer class studying database design. i actually should be taking it right now.
label: anxious
response: thats cool

situation: i get to go the the zoo tomorrow! they opened an exhibit showcasing two of my favorite animal, the sloth!
dialogue: i get to go the the zoo tomorrow! they opened an exhibit showcasing two of my favorite animal, the sloth!
oh that is great, what are the animals?
they have sloths, hippos, elephants, bears!
label: joyful
response: oh wow, i love hippos and i do not know what sloth look like will let google help me out

situation: i had a guest over that used my restroom, and they obviously have some sort of digestive issue! they did not event tell me about it!
dialogue: i had a guest over that used my restroom, and they obviously have some sort of digestive issue! they did not event tell me about it!
that is terrible.
yes it is. do you think i should confront them?
label: angry
response: maybe? is it that big of a deal to you?

situation: i have been more happy when my girl proposed to me
dialogue: i have been more happy
meaning you have been happier before or you are more happy now than you have been?
happier now beacuse i have been built a new house
label: excited
response: oh wow, that is great! i would be very happy too!

situation: it can be really hard coming up with all the money needed for back to school. for the most part i have it covered. there is an organization helping with some of it and even a small amount helps a lot.
dialogue: back to school time is always stressful because of how much everything costs now.
oh its hurts a little
i was able to cover most of it but luckily i had a little help covering the rest of what my kids needed. even a little help is a big deal
label: grateful
response: wow that is great

situation: i have been little disappointed
dialogue: i have watched races in tv
me too! have you ever been to one of them races?
nope iam a street racer
label: disgusted
response: oh cool, do you live in the city?

situation: iam feels good because i have been built a new house
dialogue: i feels happy
that is awesome!  is there a particular reason you are so happy?
because i built a new house
label: proud
response: that is something to be happy about!  congratulations!

situation: i have been feels really stressed and disappointed
dialogue: i have been more happy that i have bought a car
that is an exciting purchase! what kind did you get?
audi q7
label: embarrassed
response: that is a nice car! i know you are enjoying that!

situation: my wife bought me a new watch for my birthday! she is such a sweetheart.
dialogue: my wife bought me a new watch for my birthday! she is such a sweetheart.
that was such a nice thing to do! she seems very caring!
she is! it was a watch that i had been wanting for a long time. i have used the same g-shock watch for 6 years (which i love), but i wanted the upgraded version.
label: grateful
response: that is so nice that she made note that you had been wanting it for so long!

situation: i just graduated from college! i feel so accomplished.
dialogue: i just graduated from college! i feel so accomplished.
that is so exciting! i remember how that felt!
i am very excited about it! although i am a bit nervous about what is to come. i still need to find a job.
label: proud
response: that will come! the hardest part is over now!

situation: i am waiting to receive my final grade for a summer college class that i just finished. i took the final exam yesterday, and i am not sure what score i will receive.
dialogue: "i am waiting to receive my final grade for a summer college class that i just finished. i took the final exam yesterday, and i am not sure what score i will receive.
i remember how that felt! i always hated having to wait for grades.

i have, too. i actually took two classes this summer. i took an online final exam about an hour ago, and i scored the grade that i was needing. the grade i am concerned about is a strategic management course that i also was taking. the professor was a bit of a stickler when it came to grading.
label: anticipating
response: awesome! strategic management sounds difficult by itself, i hope you get the grade you need!

situation: i had sex with somebody that i hate. i feel terrible about myself and my values.
dialogue: i recently had intercourse with somebody that i hate. i feel terrible.
that sounds awful. are you going to see them again?
no, i do not think i should. this person does not make me happy.
label: ashamed
response: it is probably best that you do not see them, then. good thinking.

situation: when my mom got really ill and was in the hospital i was not able to visit her for about a week. it just also happened to be the week that she died. i was broken. i could not be there when she needed me the most.
dialogue: my mom got really sick for a long time before she died. i was doing my best to see are as often as i could but i had work and lived 6 hours away.
that must have been a difficult time for you.
the worst thing happened though. i was not able to see her for about a week because of not being allowed a bunch of time off
label: devastated
response: the company you work for is horrible. they should have gave you that time off because it was a family emergency.

situation: i recently went to eat a restaurant that was not very clean. the whole place had an odd odor and made me uncomfortable.
dialogue: i recently went to eat a restaurant that was not very clean. the whole place had an odd odor and made me uncomfortable.
ew, that is not good! i would not have been able to stay and eat.
i took about two bites from my plate and could not eat anymore. i will not be returning.
label: disgusted
response: i do not blame you!

situation: i recently returned to my childhood home, and it brought back a flood of wonderful memories. i am feeling quite sentimental.
dialogue: i recently returned to my childhood home, and it brought back a flood of wonderful memories. i am feeling quite sentimental.
that is awesome, i feel the same when i drive by my grandparents old home
yes, it definitely can be an emotional experience. were/are you close with your grandparents?
label: nostalgic
response: yes i was

situation: i was going through boxes the other day. i came across old pictures i did not know i still had. it really made me think back.
dialogue: i was going through some boxes the other day. i found some old pictures of my kids i thought were gone
that is exciting! i love having pictures to look back on.
yes, definitely! it really made us all start talking about those and other memories, good times.
label: sentimental
response: i love being able to reminisce on the past. time goes by so fast.

situation: we had to evacuate our home due to a hurricane. we knew it might happen so we got organized and packed what we would need and put it all in the car.
dialogue: we had to get out of the house because of hurricane matthew. it was a scary experience, but luckily we'd already packed what we needed into the car, so could just leave.
i had hurricane matthew come through where i live too! ne fl, i know how you feel, only i could not get gas for my car because there was no gas anywhere!
oh, you poor thing! thankfully, we'd gassed up and were good to go. the house survived too. were you ok?
label: prepared
response: yeah you thought ahead, me not so much. our house was fine but a huge mess to clean up in the yard and no power for 2 days. i hope your house was ok too!

situation: i was recently waiting to hear the results of a medical exam. fortunately, in the end it all turned out ok. but it was nerve wracking.
dialogue: i recently had a doctors appointment that made me very nervous.
was it a checkup or did you have some health issue?
it started off as a checkup, but then they requested additional testing.
label: anxious
response: did everything go well or do you not know yet?

situation: my neighbors built a treehouse for their children in just one week! i could not believe how fast they completed the project!
dialogue: my neighbors built a treehouse for their children in just one week! i could not believe how fast they completed the project!
oh man, i bet that is fun
yeah if only to be a kid again! have you ever built a treehouse?
label: impressed
response: no, i have always wanted one though

situation: i was partially raised by my grandparents and my grandmother recently passed away. she had a good long life though.
dialogue: i recently had to attend a funeral. that is never a fun day.
was it someone you know? sorry for your loss if it was.
unfortunately yes. it was my grandmother.
label: sad
response: i am sorry did you get to see her a lot before she passed?

situation: there was this time when i was suppose to have a doctors appointment at this certain time.  well i sat there for literally 3 hours waiting to see the doctor.  which honestly i would not have minded if he would have spent time with me at the appointment but all he did was spend 5 min and act like he did not want to be there.  it was annoying.
dialogue: i once went to a doc appointment where i literally sat for three hours in the waiting room and then the doc only spent 5 min with me
omg! that is terrible. they should really be considerate of people's time
i would not have minded as much if he actually seemed to care.  if they make you wait and then spend alot of time with you that is one thing
label: annoyed
response: right. did he at least apologize for the long wait

situation: i am waiting to take a big test coming up! i feel prepared, yet i am anxious.
dialogue: i am waiting to take a big test coming up! i feel prepared, yet i am anxious.
good luck! what is it on?
thank you! it is my final exam for a summer database applications/design class that i am taking.
label: anticipating
response: how much studying did you do leading up to it?

situation: i am taking a vacation to orange beach, alabama in a week! my wife and i visited the area about two years ago, and we loved it!
dialogue: i am taking a vacation to orange beach, alabama in a week! my wife and i visited the area about two years ago, and we loved it!
oh man, i bet that will be fun
we cannot wait! have you ever been to the ocean?
label: excited
response: i have, i love going when i can

situation: once my husband surprised me on my anniversary with a really pretty necklace and a trip to a bed and breakfast.   i was so suprised b/c he usually only takes me to dinner for our anniversary.
dialogue: one time my husband surprised me on our anniversary with a really pretty necklace and a trip to a bed and breakfast!
that is really nice of him! how long have you been married?
we have been married for 14 years.  another reason it was so surprising was b/c he usually just takes me to dinner!
label: surprised
response: well you made the right choice in man to marry. what kind of necklace?
