we shall see. i truly believe that he has done some much damage to our country in so many different ways.
label: surprised
response: he is like an angry child trying to make everything about himself!

situation: once i was suppose to go on a vacation to see my sister who i hadn't seen in awhile.  i ended up breaking my heal and was not able to go.  i was so disappointing b/c i missed her so much.
dialogue: once i was suppose to go visit my sister and nieces who i hadn't seen in forever but i ended up breaking my heal and big toe and was not able to go. i was so upset!
dang, that sucks. maybe they can visit you instead?
yeah, hopefully so.  it is not healing correctly is the problem or else i would just go in my cast.
label: disappointed
response: ah, gotcha. well i hope you heal fast!

situation: i recently went to alabama and felt strong feelings about my past with my grandparents
dialogue: over the summer my family went to alabama to visit family and i felt a lot of emotions
i guess you do not live in alabama? was it overall a good trip.or challenging? or both!
no, i do not live in alabama. we drove and trip was overall very good as sometimes it can be challenging when driving such a long distance
label: sentimental
response: well, if the drive was the most challenging it sounds like a good trip! too often it is family dynamics that are *more* challenging, and not so easily taken care of.

situation: it is easy to get irritated when you are working on a project and your teammates do not pull their weight, but then *you are* the one who somehow suffers the consequences!
dialogue: i was recently working on a project where unfortunately, my teammate really did not pull their weight.
that is the worst! i know that you must have been very frustrated with your teammate.
yep. especially when you feel that you get dinged for the overall project. and at the same time, you do not want to complain about it, because it makes *you* look bad!
label: annoyed
response: there have been a number of times where this has happened to me too. i hope that does not happen to you too much in the future!

situation: i have a nest of yellow jackets in my front yard
dialogue: i found out yesterday that i have a nest of yellow jacket bees in my front yard. they can be so aggressive.
i hate bees and wasps so much. maybe you should call pest control?
i will be able to take control of it myself as i have done so in the past. it still makes it difficult because i can not mow the grass until it gets taken care of.
label: annoyed
response: that sucks, i hope you get it figured out!

situation: i used to live in california. early one morning we had a smallish earthquake. it made me realize i had not put together an emergency package, so i immediately did so. never hurts to be ready for the big one!
dialogue: since that earthquake in the early hours of the morning i realized how badly off i would be if i did not get an emergency packet together. so that is what i did cash, water, important documents, a change of clothing.
wow, it must have been quite an experience
it was enough to wake me, but not the cat,. it just made me realize that the big one could happen any time and i would have been up the proverbial creek!
label: prepared
response: my prayers are with you buddy. stay safe

situation: i went back to a horse ranch where i owned horses over 20 years ago. good times.
dialogue: i went back to a horse ranch where i owned horses over 20 years ago. good times
awesome. what breed did you own?
a paint (black and white) and a red quarter horse
label: nostalgic
response: i love paints, and growing up we had 2 quarter horses that my dad used for calf roping.

situation: the other day i had a flat tire. i had my floor jack and 4-way lug wrench in my trunk and was able to change my tire and get back on the road in 10 minutes.
dialogue: the other day i had a flat, but i had my floor jack and 4-way lug wrench in my trunk and was able to get my tire changed and get back on the road within 10 minutes.
10 minutes is a good time to be able to change a tire. i do not think i could change a tire own my own.
i have had so many flats in my life i have gotten quick at changing them.
label: prepared
response: practice makes perfect, or makes you fast in your case.

situation: one time, my friends were daring me to jump into a cold spring with them from a height of like 40 feet. i was a bit nervous to say the least.
dialogue: one time, my friends were daring me to jump into a very cold spring from a height of around 40 feet. i was nervous, naturally.
i would be too! did you to it?
yeah, i ended up doing it. i jumped in and missed a rock wall by probably 2 feet. my legs went numb from the cold as soon as i landed.
label: apprehensive
response: so did you regret doing it? or were you super proud that you did?

situation: my good friend just started work at a fantastic golf resort up in michigan. i have seen it and it is stunning. why cannot i have a great job in a beautiful place with a view of lake michigan? because i am stuck here, that is why!
dialogue: my dear friend kris just started a job at a gorgeous golf resort on the shores of lake michigan. the green-eyed monster in me wants sooo badly to be there!
you must be so proud!
i am, but it is so gorgeous and it is a fantastic golf course. and i am stuck here, bored stupid! i know, i am being selfish.
label: jealous
response: i do not think you are being selfish, you are doing your best!

situation: i am so excited about some news about an upcoming life change! it is a move and a new adventure!
dialogue: i am so excited about an upcoming move and life change, it is a move to a verrrry different state, but should be interesting!
what state are you going to move to?
potentially alaska, anchorage, to be specific. we have lived in different places before, amsterdam, zurich, and hong kong. and even though it is a us state, it feels foreign somehow!
label: anticipating
response: oh that is nice, will you be going skiing?

situation: i feel so relaxed and at peace when i meditate.
dialogue: i feel so relaxed and at peace when i meditate
who does not.  everyone should do it!  have you ever had any mystic experiences while you did it?
no mystic events. i just feel really relaxed and happy.
label: content
response: i hear you can travel to different dimensions while meditating.

situation: i thought somebody was breaking into my house.
dialogue: once, i thought somebody was attempting to break into my house.
it must have being terrifying!
yes, i was truly frightened. it ended up being okay though. it was actually just a roofer inspecting my roof that nobody told me about.
label: terrified
response: tnank god! they should have let you know they where going to do the job.

situation: i felt so let down by a person who promised me a project, but then pulled out at the last minute. it would have been one thing if i would have understood her reasons, but it came from such a reactionary, unfair place.
dialogue: i felt so let down by a person who promised me a project, but then pulled it away at the last minute in a way that was very personal and reactionary.
that is terrible. people need to learn to commit to their promises.
especially when it is based on emotion versus honoring a commitment. and when they know it has a very real economic impact.
label: disappointed
response: i do not understand how so many people value emotion over logic and reason!

situation: having to give a presentation in front of the entire class
dialogue: i had to give a presentation in front of my entire university class last semester. i hate presenting things.
oh, that is nerve wracking. what did you try to do to cope?
honestly, i took a xanax beforehand. it was a group presentation also which helped take some of the spotlight off of me.
label: anxious
response: better living through chemistry! i am glad you made it through.

situation: i am disabled and have trouble getting around. last week i went to our local farmer's market and bought some produce. the farmer i visited, even though he was quite busy, took the time to walk me back to my car and put my purchases on the back seat. now that is what i call service!
dialogue: i went to the local farmers market and bought some produce from a farm stall. i am disabled and the kind farmer, despite being busy with other customers, took the time to take my purchases to my car. what a wonderful, kind man!
that is really nice of him.  did the other people get mad because they had to wait?
not at all. they were super nice, and just kept getting together what they wanted to buy. i love living here such nice people.
label: impressed
response: lucky you.  where i live people are not so nice.  can i move there?

situation: i was so afraid of going in my barn because i got stung by a wasp last year in my neck.
dialogue: i was so afraid of going in my barn because i got stung by a wasp last year in my neck in the barn.
ouch, i would try and wear something on your neck next time you go in there.
next time i will get stung somewhere besides my neck
label: afraid
response: hmm, wear something thick and long. maybe hockey pads!

situation: once gave the wrong package to somebody
dialogue: so i work at a ups store. i once gave a customer the wrong package that was valued at $700.
ut oh. what happened?
luckily, they were customers that we knew really well and they had a mailbox at our store. so they brought it back when we explained what happened. i felt awful though.
label: guilty
response: but at least you lucked out and they brought it back!

situation: i have been reminiscing recently about the good old days, when i was a kid and did not have to worry about bills and expenses.
dialogue: i have been reminiscing recently about the good old days, when i was a kid and did not have to worry about bills and expenses.
ah, i know what you mean! and remember *yearning* to be older?! (and of course the adults in *our* lives were shaking their heads, thinking the way we are now)
yes! i wished so much that i would be an adult so i could make my own decisions. now i wish i could have someone else make those decisions for me! haha
label: sentimental
response: as long as you keep your playful spirit, you are in good shape! sometimes it takes work to hold that awareness, but i can see it in you!

situation: i love what i do because it is about both inspiring and empowering people to be their best and to excell at their jobs.
dialogue: i love what i do because it is about both inspiring and empowering people to be their best and to excel at their jobs.
it is awesome to have a job where you feel rewarded through what you do. what do you do?
i work as a facilitator and team trainer, mostly with a company who i truly love and respect for walking their talk.
label: caring
response: that sounds like a lot of fun, it is so rewarding to have a position where you can engage with other people. you really seem motivating and inspiring, so i am happy you have that job!

situation: i was supposed to meet a good friend for dinner at a local pub recently. i waited 2 hours and then called him. he said he could not be bothered going out and had forgotten to call me. i am not too happy with him right now.
dialogue: i waited for a good friend of mine at a local pub recently 2 hours i waited. eventually i got hold of him and he said he could not be bothered going out and had forgotten to call. not too impressed, frankly.
what did you do after waiting for 2 hours?
i bought a pint of beer and a curry and joined another single woman at a table. we had a fine time, but i sure am wondering about my friendship!
label: disappointed
response: silver linings do happen, maybe is was a good thing your friend forgot about you.

situation: i was so envious of my friend when she won from a lottery ticket she bought for a buck.
dialogue: i was so envious of my friend when she won from a lottery ticket she bought for a buck.
i bet. how much did she win and did she offer to share?!
she won $5,000 and never offered to share.
label: jealous
response: that is a lot of money, to me anyway. perhaps she is got a lot of debt to pay off, or perhaps she has kids to take care of?

situation: i was very confident for my circuits exam
dialogue: i recently aced a circuits exam that i was very confident in.
good job! you must have worked hard and prepared. or are you just naturally really smart?
i would not say naturally smart, it took a good amount of planning to do well. we established a study group about 2 weeks before the test which helped alot.
label: prepared
response: well done! you should be proud.

situation: i am anticipating that the limestone mine in my area where i live at will be reclaimed.
dialogue: i am anticipating that the limestone mine in my area where i live at will be reclaimed.
if i am understanding you correctly, they are going to clean it up, right?
clean up, stabilize from future collapses, demolish vacant houses open closed roads, and so on
label: hopeful
response: wow, that is fantastic news indeed! how long has it been derelict?

situation: this past winter i was sitting on my porch at 4am (could not sleep). suddenly, out of the dark, came this tall bulky figure, dressed totally in black. my heart skipped as i tried to figure out what to do i am in a wheelchair.
dialogue: i had a rather unnerving experience this past winter. being unable to sleep at 4am, i went outside for a cigarette (i live in an apartment complex). suddenly, out of the darkness, appeared a tall bulky figure dressed in black. they were coming straight at me!
what did they or the person do to you?
well, i am in a wheelchair, so cannot move too quickly. i just sat looking at them, trying to figure out whether i could reach the broom at the corner of the porch.
label: terrified
response: broom would be a good choice, hit them in the crotch, that will stop them.

situation: my daughter just got married and moved across the country and is homesick. i have been talking to her every day to make her feel better.
dialogue: my daughter just got married and moved across the country and is homesick. i have been talking to her every day to make her feel better.
that is sweet. i am sure she will adjust in time. have you ever personally had to make a move like your daughter did?
actually, i did! i moved across the world to doha, qatar to teach for a couple of years. even though my husband and daughter was with me, it was very hard to be away. have you ever moved far away?
label: caring
response: no, i never have. i have always lived in my state i was born in. however, i did travel to utah which was about 1200 miles away and got a bit homesick so i can relate.

situation: giving a presentation at college
dialogue: i had to give a presentation in front of my college class and it did not go so well.
oh no! i hate speaking in front of crowds. what happened?
there was a lot of stuttering and red-face going on. also, technical difficulties.
label: embarrassed
response: i know you probably feel like you did a bad job- but i bet you did so much better than you think! be proud of yourself for having the nerve to speak in front of others!

situation: when people honk in traffic
dialogue: sometimes when people honk in traffic i do not know whether to get angry or be glad!
honking is a way to communicate. in some countries they honk just to let another driver they are there.
exactly, i think a lot of people are too cautious while driving, which makes things even less safe
label: angry
response: going too slow can be just as dangerous as going too fast. especially in the fast lane!

situation: accepted to engineering program
dialogue: i recently got accepted to an electrical engineering program at my school.
that awesome! congratulations! you should be very proud of yourself!
i was very excited when i found out. have you ever been accepted to anything that you really wanted before?
label: proud
response: yes, i have! it is a great feeling when all of your hard work pays off! best of luck to you!

situation: i was really frightened the other night. i was home alone and there was a big storm.
dialogue: i was really frightened the other night. i was home alone and there was a big storm.
there is a big storm coming where i am living now. did your power go out?
fortunately, it did not, but there was a lot of thunder and lightning. i think a lot of places are being hit by storms right now. please stay safe!
label: afraid
response: oh i will. also wanted to let you know that if your power does go out to be aware that this is when they come out to play!

situation: while i did not know him personally, i was quite distressed to hear of the passing of anthony bourdain. that a man with such talent who has given so much joy to so many people, should feel he has to take his life is just soul-destroying.
dialogue: i was quite distressed to hear of the passing of anthony bourdain. that someone who has given so much joy to a huge number of people should take his own life is just awful.
i know!  i was just watching his show on netflix!  so sad, especially since he had a little girl he is leaving behind.
indeed. depression is a terrible disease and there simply are not enough resources devoted to mental illness, imo.
label: sad
response: i agree.  he had so much to live for.  i guess it is hard to know what demons people are hiding inside.

situation: i tucked my work uniform in and had my name badge on
dialogue: my work supervisor came into my store recently. i tucked in my shirt, left home early, and even put my name badge on for the special occasion.
that is good. did you have a good time with your supervisor?
i had a great time keeping my job and not being fired! i was on the ball for his visit.
label: prepared
response: good job! maybe you will get a promotion too!

situation: i went to an amusement park recently
dialogue: i am going to my local amusement park tomorrow and feeling a certain way about it!
which way are you feeling? are you a thrill seeker?
i am indeed. i am ready to go and ride all of the rides, roller coasters especially! do you have a favorite theme park?
label: excited
response: yeah i really like six flags. they have some great roller coasters. have fun tomorrow!

situation: started putting money into savings account
dialogue: i recently started putting part of my paychecks into a savings account. i have almost $1000 now.
keep it up. soon you will have enough money to buy a new house.
that may take awhile, but for the moment i have a nice emergency fund and am prepared for whatever may come my way.
label: prepared
response: exactly, it feels great when your prepared for the unexpected.

situation: when my sister came home for christmas
dialogue: we all were excited when my sister came home for christmas. she brought her whole family.
that is fun. will anybody be dressing as santa?
haha! nobody ever dresses as santa, but the kids still believe in santa which is very fun.
label: surprised
response: maybe you could pay someone to come into your house as santa! and all the kiddies will be amazed!

situation: i was upset when my dog tore up my living room couch
dialogue: i was very upset when i came home to find that my dog had torn up my living room sofa.
that happened to me one. i had an american bulldog that had seperation anxiety and tore up my sofa cushions once. it was like a fluffy murder scene when i got home.
that is horrible, but looking back in the future it will be funny hopefully. my dog i thought had been trained, but she clearly had not!
label: angry
response: oh no. right now you are going crazy but it will be funny like you said in the future.

situation: i really am a softie, even semi sad moments in tv shows makes me want to cry. even if i know it works out or i have seen ite before!
dialogue: i think tv shows make me into a mushy person at times.
what types of tv shows do you like to watch?
everything really, i just know i am going to cry if it is sad even if i have seen it before.
label: sentimental
response: do you keep the tissue close whenever your are on the tv?

situation: i am going to busch gardens next week with my family!
dialogue: i am very much looking forward to going to busch gardens next week with my family!
i have been to busch gardens before.  they have some really cool roller coasters.  i hope you have a great time.
i do too. did you go to the one in williamsburg or in tampa?
label: excited
response: i have been to the one in tampa.  they have this new coaster that rotates forward and backward and spins around. it was equal parts fun and scary.

situation: i watched a little drop his candy bar on the ground. he then bent down picked it up and ate it! did not even wipe it off.
dialogue: little kids really have no clue about germs i think.
yea, i agree. or they just really do not care.
this kid dropped his candy bar and then picked it up and ate it.
label: disgusted
response: did he even hesitate?

situation: it is amazing how loyal my dogs are to me.
dialogue: i can not believe how loyal my dogs are to me. i am so thankful that they will let me give medicine to them without putting up a fight.
dogs are the best. are they ok?  what kind of medicine do you have to give them?
well, right now they both have an ear infection. both of them are golden retrievers and they both are very gentle dogs that let me administer medicine without any problems
label: trusting
response: awww golden retrievers are adorable.  my ex had one of them.  well i hope your dogs feel better soon.  ear infections are no fun at all.

situation: i had a tree limb fall on the roof of my house
dialogue: i had a storm come through recently. a massive limb fell on top of my roof and now i have to replace the entire roof of my house
that is intense! i hope the damage was not all that bad.
it was very bad. the entire roof will definitely have to be replaced.
label: anxious
response: yes, get it fixed as soon as possible. does insurance cover it?

situation: i recently went to a wedding with a friend from way back in the day. i saw other friends i knew from long ago, too.
dialogue: i went to a wedding. i saw many of my friends from my grade school past.
wow, you remember your friends from grade school? maybe if i saw them again those memories would come back.
yes i do. some of them i am still very fond of.
label: nostalgic
response: well, i hope you had a really great time. it sounds like you probably did!

situation: my family is coming to town soon and the house is clean
dialogue: i cannot wait for my family to come to town. my house is all in order for when they come.
that sounds like fun, do you have a big family?
no, i really do not so it is special. i would have what many would call a nuclear family, you know?
label: prepared
response: yes i understand, i have a big family so it is hard for us to all get together at the same time.

situation: i could not believe how well my friend's niece did at her dance recital
dialogue: i went to my friend's niece's dance recital this weekend. i could not believe how well she did.
i have never been to one of those.  is she really young or is she like a professional dancer?
she is very young, and she stole the show. she was hilarious and stood out from all of the rest of the girls.
label: impressed
response: thats awesome.  i wish i would have taken dancing lessons when i was younger.   i am a horrible dancer

situation: my son drove down to help me move. i was very relieved to have some help as the job was overwhelming.
dialogue: my son drove down and spent the whole weekend helping me move.
aw, that is so nice of him! does he live far away?
he lives about a couple hours away, but he is young and always busy. i was very relieved to have some help as it was a big job!
label: grateful
response: that is a great son. it is always nice to be able to rely on people close to you to help out when needed

situation: i have a job interview tomorrow and i can not wait!
dialogue: you know sometimes when you just feel like you have to leave a job? well, that time is now for me and i can not wait for my job interview this week.
yeah i have had that experience. one was so bad i left before getting another job. do not recommend doing that,.
it is so tempting you are absolutely right. i am going to try and hang on though, and thanks for the advice.
label: hopeful
response: stick it out until you have a backup. your bank account will thank you!

situation: i found a salad in the refrigerator that i forgot about and it smelled horrible.
dialogue: i found a salad in the back of my refrigerator that i forgot about. it smelled awful when i opened the container it was in.
gross. it would have gone straight into the trash here.
yes, it went straight to the outside trash container. i was very surprised that my entire refrigerator did not smell bad.
label: disgusted
response: you can use baking soda to get the smell out of it.

situation: my sister opened up her own retail store.
dialogue: last year my sister opened up her own retail store. it is doing very well, and i love going to see it.
that sounds wonderful! what type of store is it?
it has a lot of quirky things that most big box stores do not carry. it has everything from clothes for all ages, to jewelry and lots of other things.
label: proud
response: i love that! it must be so much fun to curate the types of things that go in to the store. do you help out or work there?

situation: i felt isolated when we moved to hong kong, i had a 6 month old, a husband that needed to start traveling to australia immediately, and just did not know anyone yet!
dialogue: i felt very isolated when we first moved to hong kong, i had a young baby and my husband pretty much needed to start traveling for business right away!
wow, i cannot imagine how you felt living in hong kong. that would take some serious adapting.
it did! but there was a very vibrant and concentrated expat community, that helped immediately!
label: lonely
response: i am so happy that you found that expat community. i have often thought about moving abroad, and i am glad that you adapted well.

situation: my parents have helped me recover from my sickness.
dialogue: i recently got very sick, and i had to spend a lot of time in the hospital. i am very lucky that i have a great family that watched over me.
that is unfortunate, but i am happy that you have a good support network to help you out.
not a day goes by where i am not thankful. i am still recovering and they are still there for me.
label: caring
response: i hope you recover well and i am sure you will with good support by your side.

situation: i find it pathetic how some people will rationalize someone else's bad behavior, simply to keep from admitting they made a terrible choice.
dialogue: i find it profoundly sad and disturbing how some people will rationalize someone else's unhinged behavior, simply to avoid admitting that maybe they made a horrible choice.
i completely understand that. did something like that happen recently?
we are living with it. and it is dividing us as a society. i truly hope that the upcoming months will bring big change. definitely working for that!
label: disgusted
response: yes, i know how you feel. all we can do is encourage friends to join us in helping to make a difference. i believe there is hope!

situation: so yesterday i found out my roommate has been dating someone for 3 months. i cannot believe he did not tell me.
dialogue: so yesterday i found out my roommate has been dating someone for 3 months. i cannot believe he did not tell me.
wow, that is a good amount of time. is he usually so secretive?
he is usually a very private person. he hasn't dated anyone in the over 3 years i have lived here, and he is only ever had one friend over.
label: surprised
response: ah, maybe he just wanted to make sure it was going to work before he told anyone.

situation: i get really upset when ever someone cuts me of in traffic. i just do not see why people think it is ok to do that.
dialogue: i got so annoyed the other day. got cut off in traffic.
it should be harder to get a license than it is.
i agree! do people just not care about risking their own lives never mind anyone else?
label: furious
response: it is as if some people think they are the only one's on the road.

situation: my parents have not gotten over the loss of my sister. they need to get some help from a trained professional.
dialogue: you know my parents still have not gotten over the loss of my sister.
oh my gosh, i am so sorry. may i ask how long ago it was that she passed?
she passed two days after christmas. she was very sick during the whole month of december.
label: afraid
response: they probably still just need some time. my grandfather still is not over the passing of my grandmother and that was over a year ago. i would just make sure to keep seeing and talking to your parents to make them feel as loved as you can.

situation: i have been passively job hunting for a few months now, looking for a better job. i have not had any luck yet and i am starting to feel like i never will.
dialogue: i have been passively job hunting for a few months now, looking for a better job. i have not had any luck yet and i am starting to feel like i never will.
please do not ever give up. i would definitely work harder to find a job by networking with friends that have jobs in different places.
well i do not have any friends that are in my field or even close to it. i am trying the best i can and am trying to find other ways to make money too.
label: anxious
response: go ahead and post your resume on as many job related forums that you can. i think it is great that you are trying to find other ways of making money too. you are a go-getter, and do not ever give up!

situation: one of my much younger sister's is starting college in a couple weeks. i am so excited for her.
dialogue: one of my much younger sister's is starting college in a couple weeks. i am so excited for her.
that is awesome. do you know what she wants to study?
she told me she wants to become a dentist, but she is a little fickle. i will see what she says she wants to do in a year.
label: proud
response: as long as it is something she enjoys. i am sure you are very proud of her!

situation: i spend a lot of june preparing for july. during july i have my niece and nephews visit for 4 weeks, it is crazy.
dialogue: june and july are very busy, june i prep plans for july. july i have company all month.
it has been really busy even for me at work , i feel your pain
so much for relaxing during the summer?
label: prepared
response: i know right ? unfortunately for us those are the perks of growing up

situation: i went jumping out of an airplane once. it was one of the most crazy things i have ever done.
dialogue: do you even know how crazy it is to skydive? i must have been absolutely nuts when i did it.
oh i do not think i could do that. i have a fear of falling from high places.
it gave me the biggest rush that is for sure. but on the way down i was saying my prayers.
label: terrified
response: i think i would pass out from fear.

situation: i have recently become vegan because of health reasons and i am very impressed with the food.  i have found some amazing recipes that make me not miss meat at all
dialogue: i have recently become vegan and i am very impressed with the food
that is interesting. do you miss meat or dairy at all?
i had to start eating this way because of health reasons and i have found some amazing recipes on pinterest.   it makes me not miss meat or dairy at all
label: impressed
response: that is good to hear. i wish you the best of luck with your new diet.

situation: when my mom had breast cancer a few years ago. i wanted to do everything i could to be there for her.
dialogue: when my mom had breast cancer a few years ago. i wanted to do everything i could to be there for her.
that is terrible to hear. were you eventually able to be there?
i was and she was had a full recovery.
label: caring
response: that is great news. i do not know what i would do if my mom passed.

situation: i saw a dodge viper in the parking lot yesterday. probably one of the coolest american made cars!
dialogue: i saw a dodge viper in the parking lot yesterday. probably one of the coolest american made cars!
those cars are pretty slick, what color was it?
it was blue with white racing stripes.
label: impressed
response: wow, one day i hope to have enough money for a car like that, that is awesome

situation: my dog chewed up one of my flip flops the other day. now i have to throw them out.
dialogue: my dog chewed up one of my flip flops the other day. now i have to throw them out.
ugh my dog has destroyed all of my favorite shoes.
this is the first one she tore up. my roommate was watching her while i was out of town. i am sorry about your shoes.
label: angry
response: i do not really like dogs for that reason.  they are fun to pet but taking care of them is a chore.

situation: my wife surprised me on my birthday with an amazing homemade dinner.
dialogue: my wife surprised me on my birthday with an amazing homemade dinner.
that sounds like you have a great wife.  what did she make you?
she made me ribs and a cheesecake for dessert.
label: surprised
response: yummy, you are making me hungry.  happy belated birthday!

situation: my long term boyfriend and i broke up recently. i am so lost right now.
dialogue: my long term boyfriend and i broke up recently. i am so lost right now.
when that happened to me i watched a lot of movies , for some reason the sad movies made me cry, but just be strong and patient one day you realize you can do better or find someone new
i know, it is just so frustrating after spending so long building your lives together.
label: sad
response: it happens to the best of us, and i totally understand where your coming from , spend some time with your friends or loved ones

situation: my grandfather invited me over and made us an awesome dinner today.
dialogue: my grandfather invited me over and made us an awesome dinner today. i was so hungry.
what did he cook that is such an exciting way to spend your day with your papa.
he made us a pot roast with carrots and potatoes. it is melt in your mouth good.
label: grateful
response: that sounds so delicious i would have loved a plate of that food any deserts

situation: i got a promotion in work. i am so excited for the raise and added responsibility.
dialogue: i got a promotion in work. i am so excited for the raise and added responsibility.
congratulations! sounds like you are ready for the new position.
thank you, i am so excited. it has taken 3 years of hard work to earn this promotion.
label: excited
response: what is your work area?

situation: had a great day! my daughter is learning how to say so many new words.
dialogue: my daughter can say so many new words, love to see her thrive!
that is so exciting! such a fun time in life to watch them discover new things and always be such a surprise with what you did not know that they already knew! ha ha, that is a tongue twister.
yes, thank you! having children is a wonderfull blessing. could not imagine my life without my daughter. do you have children?
label: proud
response: i do!  an 8 year old daughter and 5 year old son.  they are my life as well so i totally get what you are saying.  how old is your daughter?

situation: i have got all of my bags packed, passport ready, and i am not even leaving for vacation until next week.
dialogue: i have got all of my bags packed, passport ready, and i am not even leaving for vacation until next week.
where are you going
i am going to japan. i am so excited, i have never been.
label: prepared
response: oh wow, i hope you have fun

situation: parents took me out for birthday dinner
dialogue: so my parents took me out to dinner for my birthday tonight.
happy birthday!  did you have a nice time?
thanks! i had an awesome time. i went to a sushi place and it was delicious.
label: grateful
response: i love sushi.  did you get a spicy tuna roll?

situation: went for a bike ride in the park
dialogue: so yesterday i went for a bike ride in my city's park. the weather was perfect!
very nice, wind in your hair, exercise, and fresh air.  did you have a good time?
it was wonderful. i felt at peace as i rode by all of the flower gardens and fountains. do you visit any parks or gardens in your area?
label: content
response: i am actually home bound, but i love to live through other peoples experiences.  my wife and kids go out and bring back stories of their adventures.  i love it!

situation: it is been a hard night tonight, just sitting on the couch by myself watching tv.
dialogue: it is so quiet in my house, just watching tv by myself. wish my family was around.

i know how you feel.  i moved away from my family and friends this summer.  do you have family nearby at all? i often feel lonely when i am watching a movie by myself but then i remind myself that i am loved by a lot of people.
that is a great attitude to have, my husband is in the military so he is gone a lot to other countries. my family is about 2,000 miles away in alaska!
label: lonely
response: you are so strong!  please thank your husband for his service and thank you for being his support, no matter the miles between you.  take care of yourself and get out with friends when you can!

situation: whenever we have moved abroad, i have learned to trust my instinct and sense of adventure. so far, so good!
dialogue: whenever we moved abroad, i learned to trust my instinct and sense of adventure.
you sound like you are embracing life!
ah, thank you! definitely aware of wanting to live life to its fullest. we have recently gone through a tough time, so it feels lovely to focus on adventure again.
label: trusting
response: where did you move to?  i feel you. i am in the same place.  just reversed 13 years of lupus suffering by going plant based and now i want to live and see the world! i would love to move to italy.

situation: brother probably getting a better car than me
dialogue: it is my brother's 16th birthday in a couple days and he is probably getting a nicer car than i currently have. i am 24.
oh wow, i would be really jealous of him.
i certainly am! of course, i cannot be certain yet because i do not know what he is getting. my car is junk though so it is bound to be better.
label: jealous
response: well, hopefully you can get yourself a better car soon.

situation: my brother is turning 16 soon
dialogue: so my brother is turning 16 soon which means i do not have to drive him around anymore. score!
that is nice.
yes indeed! i am very happy about it. do you have any younger siblings?
label: joyful
response: i have one younger brother but he is old enough to drive on his own,

situation: i recently saw somebody i hadn't seen in years. it was a surreal experience!
dialogue: i saw somebody i hadn't in years. it was a nice meeting.
its always nice to catch up
yes it is. i am glad that i was able to speak with her.
label: surprised
response: i hope you keep doing thaty

situation: i love the adventure of living away from my home state, but that does not mean that i do not miss elements of it while i am gone!
dialogue: i love the adventure and perspective of living away from my home state, but that does not mean i do not miss elements of it while i am gone!
same here. i actually moved to the other side of the usa, and i do miss my home
are you able to visit often? that helps, but it is funny how things never feel *exactly* the same, you know?
label: sentimental
response: not as often as i would like. air travel is expensive after all. i know exactly what you mean though!

situation: i was at a bar once and a woman tried hitting on me, but i said i am not interested because i have a wife.
dialogue: i went to a bar a couple days ago and was hit on by a woman.
were you happy about that, or creeped out?
i respectfully told her i was not interested, i already have a wife so i need to be committed. i would never cheat.
label: faithful
response: you are a good guy. did she take it well?

situation: i recently saw my friend's play. he was fantastic in it.
dialogue: i recently attended a play. my friend's acting was significant!
that is really awesome that you supported your friend!
i am very glad that i went and supported him.
label: impressed
response: i am sure he really appreciated you support too!

situation: alone in a car
dialogue: sometimes when i am driving home after a holiday, such as christmas, i get an overwhelming sense of being alone.
aw, i am sorry. i know this is not the best solution, but have you considered listening to funny podcasts?
no i have not, but that is a decent idea that i may try. thanks for the suggestion!
label: lonely
response: no problem! i know you cannot always fix everything, but it is worth trying wierd ideas every now and then

situation: made buffalo sauce from a recipe
dialogue: so i recently made buffalo wing sauce from a new recipe i found and it turned out great!
oh wow, i love that kind of sauce
me too! it only took 10 minutes to make and now i feel way more sure of myself when making it next time.
label: confident
response: that is not long at all

situation: hoping for job promotion
dialogue: i recently completed some additional training at my job. perhaps a promotion is on its' way?
it is always good to keep our skills up to date. we never know. it could also help for a promotion also.
indeed. i feel that it is very important to stay caught up on the latest developments. and the potential for a raise is not a bad motivator either.
label: hopeful
response: i hope you get your promotion.

situation: i am so eager for my son to be born, i can not wait.
dialogue: i am so excited for my baby son to be born, i am so eager for it to happen!

oh man, your life is about to get so much more hectic. i feel for you. when my first was born, i was just as pumped, full of naivety and positivity. i felt like i could take on anything coming my way. i was exhausted after two weeks. it is such a long ride until they are able to even remotely look after themselves.
i know! hopefully the stress levels are kept to a minimal and i have a very supporting husband who will be there every step of the way. i hope for a swift and trouble free birth.
label: anticipating
response: i know you have a lot of work ahead of you, but i am sure it will be a rewarding feeling that will be unmatched for the rest of your life. as a man, i cannot imagine what you will have to go through, or what you will enjoy, but i really commend all women everywhere for the strength they give when having a child.

situation: watched scary video late at night
dialogue: so last night i was watching scary videos on youtube while home alone.
did it scare you?
yes, i had kind of an eerie and generally unsettling feeling. i wondered why i did that in the first place. can you relate?
label: afraid
response: yes, a little bit. when i was young, i did not like that much scary movies.

situation: nfl football started this week. i cannot wait for regular season and college football to start, i am really looking forward to it.
dialogue: i am ready for football season to start, nfl preseason started this week, and i cannot wait for regular season and i am really looking forward to the ncaa kickoff!
whats your favorite team?
in nfl it is the packers and college is alabama
label: anticipating
response: well for me, in the nfl i like the cowboys and college its alabama too.

situation: i saw a someone doing a double front flip at a bmx park with his bike, it was crazy.
dialogue: i visited the bmx park today and saw someone doing a double front flip with their bike, it was insane!
that is pretty cool. i bet it is pretty difficult to do something like that.
i agree, years of experience and a lot of guts are needed. you could easily get injured but he pulled it off. it was crazy to see it in person. it is the type of stuff you see on tv
label: impressed
response: i would love to watch people do tricks like this in person myself, but i am not sure if there is any locations near me.

situation: my friend went out of his way to pick me up from work after my car broke down. i cannot thank him enough.
dialogue: my car broke down yesterday but luckily my friend was able to pick me up from work while it was in the shop. i think i am going to take him to a nice restaurant to say thanks.
aw i am sorry that happened to you. i hope the repair did not cost you too much!
it was just the carburetor, which is supposed to be an easy fix. i am so glad i was not stranded at my office.
label: grateful
response: ah i see. something similar happened to my brother too recently while he was picking me up, so we were stuck at a coffee shop parking lot for several hours.

situation: i was so set on getting an a on my math test i studied so hard.
dialogue: i was so set on getting an a on my math test that i studied so hard to do good on it. i studied for days!
well at least you put in the effort. what grade did you end up receiving on this test?
i ended up getting an a actually. it was exactly what i wanted to get.
label: content
response: that is great! hard work pays off i guess.

situation: i learnt a few days ago my best friend passed away in a car accident. i am still in shock.
dialogue: my friend passed away in a car crash a couple days ago, i am still in shock.
oh i am sorry.  how are his family doing?
they've been really closed up about the whole thing, i cannot contact them or anything. they must be going through a tough time, i could not imagine.
label: devastated
response: it is pretty hard to deal with.  one of my friend's buddies died in a car crash as well.

situation: i was in shock when i realized i was pregnant, it was so unexpected.
dialogue: i realized yesterday i was pregnant, i was in shock!
woah, that is huge news. how are you handling the news.
i am still in awe, i think things will turn out fine but it was definitely not expected.
label: surprised
response: i am happy to hear that you will be ok. enjoy having no kids while you can!

situation: when the rain came down hard in our area, i was ready for the flooding that was going to happen.
dialogue: when the weather was getting bad and it rained hard in our area, i was ready for the flooding that was going to happen in our neighborhood.
that does not sound fun. what did you do to prepare.
i had an emergency generator, extra food and first aid kits at the ready. i did not want my family in danger.
label: prepared
response: that is very smart thinking!

situation: i once stole a candy bar and drink from a gas station. i felt so bad.
dialogue: i stole a candy and drink from the gas station once, i felt terrible about the whole ordeal.
how old were you? if you were a kid, that deserves a pass!
i was 17, at that age i should of known better.
label: guilty
response: you live and you learn, at least it was a petty crime and nothing serious!

situation: my friend has had the flu, and i have been making sure they get better and that they eat.
dialogue: my friend has had the flu, and i have been making sure they get better and that they eat.
that is sweet of you, the flu is a pretty gnarly sickness to go through. you sound like a good friend!
aw thank you. he seems to be recovering pretty well, just whiny.
label: caring
response: that is good, at least he is getting better, he will survive!

situation: i got the a honor roll at my school, i was so happy and a bit smug about the whole thing.
dialogue: i managed to get on the a honor roll at my school, i was a bit smug and happy for myself about the whole thing.
there is nothing wrong with that
i am just happy that i got it, it took a lot of hard work.
label: proud
response: you should celebrate too. i would

situation: i started thinking about the last time i hung out with a group of friends before moving away.
dialogue: the last time i hung out with a group of friends before moving we watched this really terrible movie.
that is always disappointing. did you have a good time with your friends anyway?
yeah, it was fun.  we ended up making the best of it, making fun of the movie while it was on.
label: nostalgic
response: sounds like you guys know how to have fun no matter what. you have good friends.

situation: i was waiting in the waiting room for my last job interview.
dialogue: i remember sitting in the waiting room before my last job interview.  i was sweating and could not stop my leg from shaking.
i too feel the same. what did happen at last?
the interview went well and i ended up getting the job, so i guess i worried for nothing
label: anxious
response: yeah, very good to hear! congrats!

situation: i was needing to take my dogs out for a walk before leaving for work, but my neighbor was outside with her aggressive loud dog in my way.
dialogue: the other day i had to take my dogs out before work, but my neighbor was right outside with her aggressive yappy dog smoking so i could not get out.
eww, i hate neighbors that have no class.
she usually cares enough to at least time her cigarettes so they do not get in the way with things like work, but not this time.
label: annoyed
response: maybe you should start a petition in the neighborhood to kick her out.

situation: i was at a pizza joint and my chair leg broke and i fell to the floor. everyone in the pizza place all was looking at me on the floor. my face was so red and the manager came over and helped me up.
dialogue: i was at a pizza joint and my chair leg broke and i fell to the floor. everyone in the pizza place all was looking at me on the floor. my face was so red and the manager came over and helped me up.
how awful! please tell me you can laugh a little about it now?
now i can laugh, but when i was on the floor i was not laughing, i just wanted to leave.
label: embarrassed
response: embarrassing things happen to all of us!

situation: so proud of my son! he finally learned how to use a spoon and a fork
dialogue: my son is 16 months and he finally learned how to use a spoon and a fork. i have been trying to teach him for a couple of months!
amazing! i wish i could see a pic of it!
he is still very messy but he really enjoys eating like a big boy
label: proud
response: oh he will be, but enjoy it, only babies once

situation: i was thinking about my wife and i's second date.
dialogue: when my wife and i started dating, our second date ended up lasting like 12 hours.
that is a pretty long date! where did you guys go?
lunch, a zoo, my apartment for a while, and a movie and dinner.  we just did not want to go home for the night :p
label: nostalgic
response: that sounds like a fun day! my wife and i used to go to movies a lot!

situation: years ago i found my beagle dead from kidney failure, he had not gone quietly.
dialogue: years ago my childhood beagle died from kidney failure.  i found him in the kitchen in the morning, he did not go easily
that is terrible.  was he already very sick?
yeah, he had diabetes for a few years by that point.  it was just a rough way to go and i hope it did not take very long.
label: devastated
response: i am sorry he went through that.

situation: when i first started working and was waiting for the first paycheck to come in i was so anxious. i had never made money before and i just kept checking the mail every morning in case it showed up early.
dialogue: i remember getting my first job and just working so hard for that first week cause it was retail
those were the days right. i loved those paychecks no bills. can we go back to that?
oh man the thing that got me was waiting for the first check to come in though. remember that? you are very first one
label: anticipating
response: yeah and i bet it was like a whole 100 or 200 bucks and we were probably feeling like a ceo.

situation: i was sitting on the bus one day and i realized that it was a cleaned up school bus. it made me think about how i miss those days sometimes
dialogue: i realized that my bus that i ride to work in every day is a revamped school bus
how does that make you feel? is that a dealbreaker
oh god no thankfully i have fond memories of it. i just realized how cheap the company is!
label: nostalgic
response: ah, i guess you have to save money somewhere

situation: i broke up with my girlfriend last week and it was really hard, we where together for 2 years.
dialogue: i broke up with my girlfriend last week and it was really hard
oh no i am sorry to hear about that, were you together long?
yeah we where together for about 2 years but i am getting over it now
label: sentimental
response: that is good make yourself available and open for others and you will find the next relationship

situation: i was walking back to the table my family was sitting at in a restaurant and somehow accidentally sat down at the wrong table.
dialogue: i was out at dinner with my family, and when coming back to the table from the bathroom i somehow accidentally sat down with a different family.
that is embarassing, but a good story at least!
yeah, it certainly lead to a lot of good natured ribbing from my parents :p
label: embarrassed
response: that is for sure, you can always count on parents for that

situation: my son is starting back to college in a few days. this made me think back to when he was smaller and realize how quick time goes by.
dialogue: we are getting our son to go back to college in a few days and it really made me stop and think back to him when he was smaller, and how time flies by so fast!
it does go fast. i was just changing my daughters diaper and now she is in junior high!
i know, that is about how i felt too! i think back to when he was much smaller and how adorable he was when he would call me mommy then!
label: nostalgic
response: i miss being called mommy. one day you will be called grandma

situation: the last time we went to the fair, i tripped over a big cord and fell! there were so many people around that saw me fall!
dialogue: the last time i went to the fair, i tripped and fell. there were so many people around that saw me hit the ground. you can imagine how i felt!
that is embarassing, but were you at least okay?
i scuffed my knees a bit, but i was okay. i was also with a person that i really liked, so that made it even worse. but, i jumped up super quick
label: embarrassed
response: well maybe they found that endearing in a way!

situation: couple days ago i saw my mom left some spare change on the counter, i took it without asking and felt really bad after, so i invited her out for dinner
dialogue: i stold some spare change from my parents
how old were you when you did it?
maybe like 19, but i felt bad after so i invited them to dinner
label: guilty
response: that was nice to repay them back with dinner

situation: when my sister passed away several years ago, i had such a hard time with the loss. i felt very much separate from others in dealing with my grief.
dialogue: my sister passed away several years ago. i really had a hard time with the grief and could not really relate to anyone that tried to help me with it.
i am sorry to hear that. i know exactly what you are going through. my brother tragically passed away 2.5 years ago. he was only 32

yes, i am sure you can relate as well. ironically, that was the same age that my sister passed away. she took her own life, which my mother and i found her, and it was very hard for us all. but, i could not burden my parents with my pain, i felt.
label: lonely
response: i know how hard it was for you. my parents and my brother lived in a different country so i could not even go there at that time to be with them. i felt heartbroken and alone

situation: i am happy today to my work willing to be the best
dialogue: having a good job is something to thank
to thank whom?
to life god to that higher energy
label: grateful
response: is that who got you the job?

situation: i was devastated when i lost my phone
dialogue: i was devastated when i lost my phone
did you find it ?
i did but it took a while
label: devastated
response: well that is good

situation: i was surprised when my family threw me a surprise party
dialogue: i was surprised when my family threw me a surprise party
how old did you turn ?
i turned 34
label: surprised
response: congrats

situation: i miss my family
dialogue: i did not see my parents since 2014! i miss them so much. it is so sad that i live in a different country
when will you be able to visit?
actually in 2 weeks! i am so excited about it. i am going there with my son! they've never met him
label: sad
response: oh boy, that must be amazing for him

situation: i was annoyed when my favorite show was not on
dialogue: i was annoyed when my favorite show was not on
what did you end up watching instead
i ended up watching impractical jokers
label: annoyed
response: thats cool

situation: recently had a to train a new customer on how to use our system. i was readu and had an answer for everything they threw at me.
dialogue: i love when i need to show someone how to do something and everything goes off without a hitch.
oh yeah, that is always nice. sometimes they just do not get it, though.
fortunately it is usually just not having the best answer for what they ask. i have learned and prepared a lot more this time.
label: confident
response: wow, you sound pretty confident! you must really know what you are talking about.

situation: i am about to take a cross country flight. i always get mildly nervous when flying.
dialogue: i am taking a long overdue and much needed vacation this week. i wish i did not have to fly.
i am afraid to fly too.
i usually do pretty good on short flights. longer ones make me a little nervous.
label: anxious
response: i know right, planes make me nervous.

situation: i did not invite my sister to a party she wanted to come to. she felt hurt.
dialogue: i did not think to invite my sister to a party i recently helped put on.
uh oh. i bet she was not happy when she found out.
no she wasnt. in all fairness it was a group of people i never would have thought she would have wanted to hang out with.
label: guilty
response: yeah, i can understand that. but it probably would have been best to invite her anyway, just in case.

situation: i got to spend my entire sunday doing as little as possible. it was a rare and welcome occasion.
dialogue: my sunday was great. all my chores were done ahead of time. it was a rare and welcomed day.
that is awesome. sundays are usually my veg out days.
i wish i could more often, but it rarely happens. especially during the summer. my yard grows like literal weeds.
label: joyful
response: mine is going crazy with mosquitos

situation: my husband travels extensively for work, so i have to have faith that he will be loyal and faithful to me when he is on business trips.
dialogue: my husband has to travel a lot for work. it can be hard on a marriage, but after almost 23 years of marriage, i have faith he is loyal and faithful when he does.
what does your husband do for work?
he is an iron worker, so he has to go state to state at times to build very large buildings.
label: trusting
response: my uncle use to be an iron worker, so i know exactly what you are talking about.

situation: many years ago, my husband was acting a bit too 'chivalrous' to a friend of mine, which i felt was a bit too friendly. he said he was just being nice, but i felt like he found her attractive.
dialogue: i have been married almost 23 years, but many years ago, my husband was acting a bit too "chivalrous" to a female acquaintance of ours. he said he was only being nice, but i felt he was being a bit 'too nice', which made me feel a bit upset.
that is very understandable. emotional affair is still a betrayal.

well, we really did not know her very well and she actually just came to one of our friends house while we were there, and she was intoxicated. he was trying to help her get up and situated, but he was very insistent about it, even when she did not want help. it looked bad to others.
label: jealous
response: well it is nice he is kind but yes that is a little strange. women can usually take that as something and try to get with your man.

situation: i am super impressed with my niece. she is being put into 2 advanced classes in highschool and special art program.
dialogue: my niece is super talented lately.
what is her best talent?
art, she was accepted into a special program for high school.
label: impressed
response: does she draw or paint? how any students are in this program?

situation: one day my daughter came home and told me a much older boy tripped her as she was going off the bus. he did it on purpose, and this made me very, very upset. she was only 10, he was a teenager.
dialogue: one day my 10 year old daughter came home crying after she got off the bus. a teenage boy purposely tripped her as she was getting off and she got hurt. needless to say, i was very, very upset!
that is terrible.  i do not know why teenage boys can be so mean.  what did you end up doing?

i actually knew his father, so i called and spoke to him about it. i let him know that if it happened again, i could not promise her big brother would not take it in his own hands to defend her, as he was not okay with anyone bullying her.
label: angry
response: that is good that she has a big brother that can defend her against the bigger kids.  it is just terrible that a teenage boy would act that way to a 10 year old.  no excuse for that.  i hope you do not have to deal with it again, though.

situation: i hate being alone so much, my husband works a lot of hours. he also works over an hour away that makes it rough.
dialogue: i really do not like my husbands job right now.
i am sorry, what is his job?
retail, but he is working nights at a store really far away and it sucks
label: lonely
response: hopefully they will give him a better shift.

situation: my husband usually gets a large bonus each year in the month of august or september. they are not guaranteed, but have been very regular for several years. i am wishing this year will be the same!
dialogue: each year my husband usually gets a bonus this month or next. it is not promised, but it has happened for several years now. i am really wishing it will be this year too!
hey that is awesome!  what are you planning to buy with it?
well, we have college tuition, just got back from an expensive beach vacation, etc. so, if anything replenish some savings, right!
label: hopeful
response: that is an awesome, very adult thing to do!  congrats!

situation: i was flipping through the channels today and saw a gruesome movie. it had a lot of blood and gore, which turns my stomach.
dialogue: i hate watching movies that are full of gore! i just saw one today and so gross!
i do not like them either. it makes me sick.
yes, i was just flipping through the channels and happened upon a man cutting his own leg off. yuck!
label: disgusted
response: oh my gosh! that is disgusting!

situation: my husband usually gets a large bonus each year around this time, but there is no guarantee. it is hard waiting, and not knowing!
dialogue: my husband usually gets a substantial bonus this time of the year, but there is no guarantee. it is difficult waiting, and not knowing!
what does your husband do for a job?
my husband usually gets a substantial bonus this time of the year, but there is no guarantee. it is difficult waiting, and not knowing!
label: anxious
response: you already told me that. is he in sales or something similar?

situation: i have been married a long time, but my husband has to travel for business so i feel a little bit by myself sometimes.
dialogue: i have been married a long time, but my husband is gone quite a bit for work. i feel a bit by myself at times because of this
that is no good! you need someone to be there and take care of you.
luckily, my children still live at home, but it is not quite the same. plus, it will not be too long before they are ready to move out
label: lonely
response: i have never been married, so i cannot imagine,  but i would want to be with my spouse every moment of every day.

situation: my youngest child started high school this year. it made me think back to when she was just started kindergarten, and how time flies!
dialogue: my youngest child started high school this year. it really made me think back to her starting kindergarten, and how time really goes by. i can just see her learning to read!
it is so hard and so rewarding to see them grow up.
yes, it really is bittersweet. but, the older they get, the easier it is to think back to the younger days!
label: nostalgic
response: i bet.  i really want to hold on to mine forever, but i know that they need to grow up.  i hope you are still able to make memories with yours even as they are getting older.

situation: i was so scared when i heard a gunshot sound the other day while i was walking through the street. i managed to get the hell out of there
dialogue: i was so scared when i heard a gunshot sound while i was walking through the streets the other day
that is pretty scary. did you find out where it came from?
no, i felt it would be better if i do not go looking for it. i managed to get the hell out of there
label: afraid
response: smart move. you do not want to get involved in a gunfight. glad you made it out safely.

situation: i always get down and blue whenever memories of my dad pops into my head. he passed away last year and i miss him so much.
dialogue: i feel so sad whenever thoughts about my dad come to me, he passed away last year
so sorry to hear that. may i ask how did it happen?
he had terminal stage brain cancer. we did all we could, but.
label: sentimental
response: how sad. feel better knowing that he is in a better place now buddy

situation: i was so angry when i found out my girlfriend kissed a friend of mine. i felt like punching the wall
dialogue: i was so angry when i found out my girlfriend kissed a friend of mine
oh, that is awful. what did you do? i would've dumped her and beat that dude's face in.
i have not confronted them. still thinking about it
label: furious
response: well, i gave you the solution right there, buckaroo. all ya gotta do is execute.

situation: i went to the beach last week. felt like one of those times i went there with my family and had fun
dialogue: i went to the beach last week
oh nice. did you have a good time?
yeah. so much memories of me and family spending time in beach came to me
label: nostalgic
response: aww, that is really sweet to hear

situation: i was so furious when my coworker badmouthed me to my boss. he said that i was stealing the office supplies just for the fun of it
dialogue: i was so furious when i found out a coworker badmouthed me to my boss
i do not have a normal job anymore but that would frustrate me as well.
yeah. i outperform this person, and he started throwing shade on me out of pure jealousy
label: angry
response: what a disgusting person. i am just being honest.

situation: i went to see hamilton last month in nyc. i sat there in such awe at the majesty of their performance.
dialogue: i went to see hamilton last month in nyc
oh the broadway musical? i heard really good reviews of it
it was such a stunning show. lin manuel should get a grammy for this
label: impressed
response: oh yeah, he is such a true genius of our times, he deserves it

situation: i was so embarrassed when i threw up in public one day. i was feeling really sick and i could not help it.
dialogue: i was so ashamed when i threw up in public the other day
oh. were you sick?
yeah, i felt like i was coming down with something. i rushed to get a cab, but i could not help it
label: ashamed
response: do not feel bad about it buddy, this happens to all of us sometime. feel better

situation: my girlfriend asked me to meet her parents next week. i am feeling all nervous and sweaty about it.
dialogue: my girlfriend asked me to meet her parents next week
oh dang. how do you think that is going to go down?
i am not sure to be honest. i am feeling so nervous about it
label: anxious
response: i am sure everything will be fine. just gotta be yourself!

situation: i felt betrayed when my girlfriend kissed another guy at a party. she was drunk, true. but still.
dialogue: i felt betrayed when my girlfriend kissed another guy at a party
oh no. that should have sucked for you. what did you do?
nothing. she was drunk, so i let it go. i still feel disappointed
label: disappointed
response: as you should. it will pass away, do not worry

situation: i was so upset when my daughter went in to labor and i could not be there. she lives in indiana and was not due for several more months.
dialogue: i was really upset when my daughter went into labor and i could not be there.
i am so sorry but what a joyous occasion.
she lives in another state and was not due for several more months. everyone is fine now though, so it has turned out to be very joyous.
label: sad
response: so happy for you. is this your first grandchild?

situation: i have never been more shocked the night my fiance proposed to me. we were at a concert and during a special song he got down on one knee and asked me to marry him. of course, i said yes!
dialogue: i was in total shock the night my fiance proposed to me at a concert.
that sounds like a great place to propose! how did it go?
they started playing one of our special songs and the next think i knew he was down on one knee. i said yes, of course!
label: surprised
response: that is so heartwarming! i hope your relationship works out very well!

situation: i admire my boss because he does not act like a boss. he acts more like a friend and he is so down to earth.
dialogue: i admire my boss because he does not act like a boss. he acts more like a friend and he is so down to earth.
that is nice to have a friendly boss.
he is not just friendly, he is a good leader and knows how to treat his workers.
label: impressed
response: i envy you. that is cool.

situation: i remember when i was a kid and in the summertime i used to catch fireflies and place them in a jar by my bedside at night.
dialogue: i remember when i was a kid and in the summertime i used to catch fireflies and place them in a jar by my bedside at night.
really?
the fireflies would blink in the jar all night long.
label: nostalgic
response: yes i did that too

situation: i went to bed early last night and still woke up tired. it gets on my nerves!
dialogue: i am so tired this morning, i went to bed early, but it seems when i go to bed early i wake up more tired. it aggravates me!
this happened to me also.
i hate it! i feel more energized when i get 4 hours of sleep than i do when i get 8!
label: annoyed
response: did you try to exercise?

situation: i am in contract to buy my first house, fingers crossed closing goes well and i close next friday!
dialogue: i am in contract to buy my first house, fingers crossed closing goes well and i close next friday!
that is so exciting! buying a house can be such a great experience.
i am definitely excited. the house just now got built and i saw it for the first time last monday.
label: hopeful
response: oh so it is brand new.  i bet you cannot wait to move in.

situation: my mother had called to set up a time to meet for lunch.  when the time came she could not make it because of health problems.
dialogue: my mother and i made plans to hang out and do lunch this past week.
really?
unfortunately she was unable to make it because her diabetes is wreking her health.
label: sad
response: so sorry about that

situation: i feel so bad that i have to work so much and cannot play with my grandchild as much as she would like me too. she would play 24 hours a day if she could, but there is always so many other responsibilities to take care of.
dialogue: i am feeling bad because my grandchild wants me to play all the time but i have to work a lot.
i know how you feel. i am working right now
she does not understand why i always have so many other things to do, but she would literally play 24/7 if i had the time.
label: guilty
response: can you blame her?   i mean, if i did not have bills that is what i would be doing.

situation: my four year old daughter showed my a picture she drew of me.  i was surprised by how detailed the drawing was.
dialogue: my four year old daughter came to me beaming with pride and showing me a drawing she did of me.
is not that the best!  my 3 year old the same thing!  i could not be happier or more proud!
i was really surpised.  i expected a stick figure, but she drew a lot of features including my beard and mustache.
label: surprised
response: she may be a natural artist!

situation: i had given my two older daughters a small math assignment to do in my absensents.  when i returned home they were playing video games and the work had not been done.
dialogue: i had to run some errands.  while gone i instructed my older daughters to complete some math assignments.
i see. did they complete them?
when i returned i found them playing video games, the math work was not even attempted.  i tunred their stuff off and we did it together.
label: angry
response: well, we were kids once too. we can understand their point of view as well. glad you got to spend quality time with them though

situation: i had a recruiter contact me for a job, so i am hoping to get a new job!
dialogue: a recruiter contacted me the other day about potential job openings, so i am hoping i may have a job soon!
that is really cool! i hope you get one very soon buddy
me too. i have been dying to get out of my current job, but having a recruiter makes me feel at ease.
label: hopeful
response: yeah, i can understand how that can be frustrating. do not worry, things will fall in its place soon enough

situation: i found a box in my closet that contained a lot of old photos.  i found pictures of my sister and i from when we were toddlers.  it brought back a lot of good memories.
dialogue: i found a box of old photos in my closet yesterday.
awh memories, what were they of?
a lot of them where photos of my sister and i when we were toddlers.  it was a good trip down memory lane.
label: sentimental
response: so cute, i love those memories i bet it was beautiful.

situation: i was disgusted when my dad left me
dialogue: i was disgusted when my dad left me
why did he leave you?
i am not sure. i guess he just did not want anything to do with me.
label: disgusted
response: that is awful and there has to be another reason for it. i cannot stand fathers who behave that way, despicable.

situation: i have a job interview next week that i have been getting ready for.
dialogue: i have been rehearsing for a job interview for a couple of weeks now, and i am so ready!
congratulations on getting an interview.  good job in prepping for it, i am sure you will do well.
i do not normally prepare for interviews, but i really want this job, so i put in a lot of practice.
label: prepared
response: what kind of job is it?

situation: i thought i saw an ice cream cake in the fridge.  it turned out to be some kind of pineapple cake.  i still ate it but it was a little dissapointing.
dialogue: i went to the fride and was surprised to find what i thought was an ice cream cake.
oh! was the ice cream cake for you?
it turned out to not even be an ice cream cake.  it was some kind of pinapple cake.  i still had a piece but it was disappointing.
label: disappointed
response: awww that is kind of disappointing. ice cream cake sounds tastier than pineapple cake.

situation: i was surprised when my wife left me.
dialogue: i was surprised when my wife left me
oh i am so sorry to hear that. how long were you married?
we were married for 10 years
label: jealous
response: it must have felt unbelievably hurtful for you. i hope you find someone very soon.

situation: i was annoyed when family missed my birthday
dialogue: i was annoyed when my family missed my birthday
i can understand that. i do not get nearly as many birthday wishes as i used to. i guess it happens as we get older.
yeah that is very true. does not mean we are not important though
label: annoyed
response: i agree. i think they think we do not care about our birthday so they do not care either. but they are wrong.

situation: when i interviewed for this job i had to wait for a couple weeks to hear back about it.  it was kinda rough.
dialogue: interestingly, i also had a job interview recently, although i have already heard back and i got it!
oh! i am so happy for you. congratulations. what was the job?
a lab manager for a physics department at a university.
label: anticipating
response: that sounds very interesting. i am sure you will do great.

situation: i was in the bathroom using the toilet.  when i looked to my right i saw a huge water bug on the tub wall looking at me.
dialogue: i had a terrifying experience what using the restroom yesterday.
what happened??
as i was sitting on the toilet i kept hearing a scratching noise.  when i turned to look a huge waterbug had climbed up the tub wall next to me.
label: terrified
response: holy moly! that would have scared me too! did you kill it?

situation: when i was younger, my dad got into a motorcycle accident and it made me not want to drive.
dialogue: when i was younger, my dad got into a motor cycle accident. it made me not want to learn how to drive for almost 2 years.
that is understandable.  such an experience can be tramatic.  did you eventually learn?
i did learn, but it took a long time to overcome my fear. i am glad i eventually did!
label: apprehensive
response: my wife had a similar experience, she still does not drive.  good for you for overcoming it.

situation: i had to replace my toilet the other day.  it was not pleasant.
dialogue: i had to replace my toilet the other day.  it was a new experience, and not altogether pleasant.
that sounds miserable!  did you do it yourself?
yeah.  it was not terribly hard, but it definitely took watching a few videos to feel confident.
label: disgusted
response: at least you saved money doing it yourself!

situation: an older woman in a class i took in college stole my ideas for a paper and presented them as her own.
dialogue: in college i was in a class with an older woman who stole my ideas for a paper.
oh wow! that stinks.  i am sorry
it is ok.  i am basically over it now, but it was really angering then.
label: furious
response: i bet it was. at least its over now

situation: i was grateful when i married my wife
dialogue: i was grateful when i married my wife
i bet.  i was the same way.  how did you guys meet?
we met at a store
label: grateful
response: nice.  that is a relatively unique way to meet.  what store?

situation: in a class in college an older woman straight up stole my ideas and work for an assignment.
dialogue: when i was in college an older woman in a class of mine stole my ideas for a paper.
i would be furious.  what did you do?
well, ranted about it to my girlfriend for a while then talked to the professor to make it clear what she did.
label: furious
response: what was the outcome?  did the professor believe you?

situation: my family and i are close to aquiring a new home.  it is a home in need of some repairs and we cannot wait to get started on renovations.
dialogue: my family and i are close to aquiring a new home.
that is awesome!  what kind of house is it?
iit is an older home in need of some repairs.  we cannot wait to get started on renovations.
label: anticipating
response: that is gonna be a lot of fun, but a lot of work.  good luck!

situation: i was excited when i bought my car
dialogue: i was excited when i bought my car
