dialogue: i like to help at the animal shelter walking the dogs. they get a chance to get out of their cages and be with a nice human like me.
that is really nice of you! i am sure they appreciate it
they do. they get to smell the grass, they play they get their exercise, they get to have fun, they get to be a dog!
label: caring
response: they get to enjoy themselves and have a good time!

situation: the power got cut randomly at our house in the middle of the night. no storms near by or anything. i was really worried something had happened!
dialogue: last night at like midnight the power cut out completely on my street
oh no, did you have candles and flashlights available?
we luckily had candles around! i was so worried cause it was so fast it was like someone cut our power
label: afraid
response: good thing, you have to be prepared for those situations

situation: when my cat broke my mothers urn i was so mad for the longest time. it hurt so much and mad me so mad
dialogue: a while back my cat knocked over and broke my mothers urn.
oh i am so sorry. cats can be very mischievous sometimes.
i was so mad for the longest time but i have gotten around to not being so made about it
label: furious
response: yea i feel you. at the end of the day you cannot blame the cat. it did not do this on purpose.

situation: i made me a bowl of cereal today and when i started eating i realized milk was spoiled
dialogue: i made a bowl of cereal for breakfast and when i started eating i realized milk was spoiled! i started gagging. it was so gross!
man i am sorry to hear that.i have wasted a good protein shake doing that once
do not you hate that? gosh, i did not eat anything the whole day because i do not have an appetite anymore
label: disgusted
response: oh well i was starving..i just rinsed it out with some mouthwash and ordered a big pizza

situation: i sat in my kitchen the other night and just listened to the rain hit the window for an hour. i felt so happy and whole.
dialogue: i was so calm and happy the other night just listening to rain hitting the kitchen windows
i use to live in an older house that had a tin roof, and i would always love hearing the rain beat on it! helped me sleep like a baby,.
it was the single most calming thing! i love the sound of rain on a tin roof too!
label: content
response: i wonder if that is a common thing? it is very relaxing.

situation: i got in a car accident and now i have anxiety attacks every time i drive
dialogue: i got in a car accident 2 months ago and now i get so anxious every time i need to drive somewhere
i am sorry for that. have you tried going to therapy?
not yet. i am so broke i cannot even afford it. i had to buy a new car and my premiums went up
label: anxious
response: i am so sorry but you will get there in time.

situation: one time when i was playing video poker, i put $10 in the machine. on my first deal, i hit the jackpot! when all was said and done, i cashed out $1000!
dialogue: though the odds are against you, i understand why people gamble. i remember a particular time i was playing video poker at a local dive bar.
i have never gambled. what happened when you were playing video poker? and is it fun?

well, take this with a grain of salt, but it can be a blast. i put in $5 like i usually do, and on the first deal, i hit $1000. i went nuts, cashing out immediately and started shoving $20 bills in to everyone is hands and pockets!
label: excited
response: wow, check out mr. moneybags over here! that must have been a real thrill though.

situation: i was buying some beer and smokes with a couple of old friends of mine. they were in from out of town and we had been partying in an abandoned lot with a bunch of my in town friends. on our way back from the gas station, we heard some noise, and went through a hole in the fence to find a full blown speakeasy!
dialogue: i honestly think new orleans is one of the most exciting places to live in the us. you never know what you are going to find around the corner.
yes, it does seem like a fun place. i would love to go to the mardi gras.

mardi gras is great, but stuff happens every day. one time i was showing some friends around from out of town, and we heard some voices on the other side of a fence. we ducked through a hole, and found a bar with a full band playing complete with couples swing dancing!
label: surprised
response: that sounds like a lot of fun! i wish i would have seen it!

situation: i loaned out a bike to someone who needed it to get to work. i found out later that he had stopped going to work all together, and pawned the bike for drug money.
dialogue: i hate when you go out on a limb for someone and they turn around and burn you for it. you know what i mean?
i would say that'd be a real disappointment to say the least.
you can say that again. one time, i loaned a friend a bike to get to work and back. a couple weeks later i heard he stopped going to work and had pawned the bike for drug money.
label: furious
response: end of friendship.

situation: i have been going for my friends wedding there was a small problem occoured
dialogue: i am not quite sure what you mean by that?
sorry that was sent by an mistake
label: ashamed
response: that is ok, it happens to the best of us!

situation: my girlfriend and i stayed the night out at her friends farm/homestead in virginia. it smelled like manure everywhere, and they had no toilet in the house. on top of that, the whole house was covered in mold.
dialogue: i do not think i am a judgmental person, but we all have our limits. i stayed on my girlfriend's friend's homestead for a day, and i can still smell it.
oh that little unfair
trust me, this place was out of control. they had the pig pen and the chicken coup within a stones throw of the main house. to top it off, they had running clean water, but no toilet indoors!
label: disgusted
response: oh enjoy dude

situation: i just finished working on a presentation i am supposed to give tomorrow.
dialogue: i just finished working on a presentation that i am supposed to give tomorrow.
congrats! how do you feel about it? and what is the presentation on?
i feel pretty good about it.  i have spent the last two weeks crunching numbers about our holiday projections.
label: confident
response: it is good that you worked hard on it. i hope you get a raise or a bonus for your labor!

situation: i was headed to a rave with a small group of friends. when we reached our last destination before the party, one of the people who was supposed to go called and told us she would be there shortly. we ended up waiting several hours only for her not to show up.
dialogue: sometimes you know your friends better than even their long term roommates know them. have you ever been in that situation?
i think so.  sometimes our friends show us sides of them that they rarely show other people.
that is definitely true! i am thinking of one person in particular to be honest. we waited all night at her house for her to join us so we could make this party. she never showed!
label: annoyed
response: did you make the party anyway?

situation: my mother gave me something very unexpected and appreciated. she paid a loan with a high monthly payment and interest! so unexpected and great!
dialogue: not too long ago, my mother unexpectedly paid off a high monthly payment and interest loan! i could not believe it!
wow. that is a blessing
yes, i did not have a clue she was going to do it and it was very much appreciated it.she is always so great thought, i am blessed.
label: surprised
response: i am going to always take care of my kids like that

situation: i was wanting to do the dishes the other day but could not so my husband did them all for me! i felt so thankful
dialogue: i broke a finger the other day and could not do any dishes! it was terrible
i hate doing dishes any way
i was super lucky though because my husband just went up and did them all for me!
label: grateful
response: that is sweet

situation: i managed to get all my school shopping done so the kids are ready for school next week!
dialogue: so i managed to get all my school shopping done this week so the kids have all their things ready to go for tomorrow!
cool i just finished today
i got an early start this year.  most years i start late and they are out of stuff i need by the time i get around to it.
label: proud
response: yeah we had a hard time today

situation: i know it is not much but i was so upset the other day when i dropped my last cookie on the floor. it just was bad on a bad day.
dialogue: i was having a bad day the other day and everything just kept going wrong
that happens sometimes
the worst part of the day though was when i dropped my last cookie i was really looking forward to
label: devastated
response: i probably wouldve cried

situation: i battled the crowds at the huge store in town and i won!  the kids are ready for school tomorrow!
dialogue: i fought off hordes of people shopping for school stuff all at the same time and i won!  i got everything on their lists!
was it like black friday?

yes.  *chuckle!*  school starts tomorrow here and it was absolutely insane.  the worst part was, usually i go to the store regularly before 10a because there is less people in there and i can just kinda stroll through the aisles.  oh no, not today.  it was just about elbow to elbow!
label: prepared
response: stick to your routine next time

situation: i went to go grab a cup out of the cabinet the other day and there was a spider sitting in the middle of the glass!
dialogue: the other day i was getting a glass out the cabinet and there sat a spider
ew, i hate spiders. we are in the process of getting them out of our garage.
i hate the little things too! it was in the glass at that!
label: surprised
response: oh no, throw it away!!

situation: i attended a play which advertised heavy audience interaction. there was someone modeling nude we were encouraged to touch, but i drew the line at eating mystery candy from an opaque box.
dialogue: it is not that i am adverse to avant garde theater, but this "play" i went to recently was a little too much.
how was it too much?
well, to their credit, they had advertised it as being quite interactive. a little contact is ok, but they wanted me to eat "mystery candy" from a box while blindfolded!
label: apprehensive
response: that sounds very strange

situation: my husband usually gets a large bonus this month or september. it is not a guarantee, so it is not easy waiting to find out!
dialogue: around this time of the year, my husband usually always gets a large bonus, but it is not a promise. it is not easy waiting to see if he will!
how big is the bonus usually?
it all depends, but always has been thousands. so, the waiting drives us nuts!
label: anticipating
response: wow, well i hope you guys get it this year then!

situation: i had only about $400 to my name, and my friend asked me to invest it all in to posters to sell at a music festival. i gave him every last dime, and we cleared $2000 a piece.
dialogue: when my friend told me to give him my last $400, i thought he was crazy. but in the end, i am glad i did.
why did you do that?
he has these crackpot schemes but they always work out. we turned that $400 in to $2000 a piece selling posters at a music festival!
label: trusting
response: wow, good for you guys!

situation: in highschool, i drank too much and fell asleep at a party. i passed out in front of the door and everybody coming and going had to step over me.
dialogue: not all of my high-school memories are fond ones. like the time i drank too much and passed out at a party.
how old were you?
i was about 16 at the time. the thing is, i passed out right in front of the entrance to the house. everyone coming and going had to step over me!
label: embarrassed
response: that is young, i wish someone had helped you!

situation: everyone in my calc class was stressed out over an exam. a few days before the test, a class mate announced she had made a study guide and would be glad to e-mail anyone a copy. it was because of her that i got a b.
dialogue: i do not know how you are with calc, but i can get pretty anxious before an exam.
math has never been my strong suit. i am more of a history type of person.
me neither! that is why i was amazed when this girl said she had made a study guide and would e-mail us all a copy. i ended up with a b!
label: grateful
response: that was very altruistic of her!

situation: my cat last night would not stop trying to get me to play with her. she kept jumping in the bed and meowing!
dialogue: my cat kept doing her best to wake me up last night
why she is doing that?
she was trying to wake me up to get me to play with her!
label: annoyed
response: ah ok i undestand.

situation: i had just turned 27 when i was accepted to a state university. i was admitted to the engineering college and started the following spring.
dialogue: i never thought i would be where i am today. if you would have told me i would go back to school at 27, i would have thought you were crazy.
why did you go back?

i had always wanted to be an electrical engineer, but had settled for life in the service industry (not knocking it). i re-taught myself basic algebra, and was accepted to a state university two years ago!
label: excited
response: good for you, best of luck!

situation: it was really hard for me when i heard i dint get accepted in my dream college, but i moved on and got into another one that was not as good
dialogue: i was so stressed when i found out that i did not get accepted in my dream college
oh no. did you have a good backup plan ?
yeah i got into another college that was not as good haha
label: devastated
response: maybe you can transfer after a bit ?

situation: my boyfriend has a female friend who he sometimes chooses to hang out with over me. we had a date planned last week, but he cancelled it to go to the movies with her. it is so frustrating.
dialogue: my boyfriend cancelled our date last week to go to the movies with his female best friend.
how did that make you feel?
annoyed. i feel like he chooses her over me a lot. i hate feeling like i have to compete with her.
label: jealous
response: i understand! i would feel the same way.

situation: im am really impressed on the video game growth this year, video games have come a long way since they came out
dialogue: i cannot believe the growth video games are having this past couple of years
what do you mean by that? i am not a gamer really
gaming has blown up this past couple of years
label: impressed
response: oh you are right, it has. i hear about it more and more

situation: roller coasters are my favorite things in the world. every winter, i miss them so much. by the time february rolls around, all i can think about is going back to the parks and riding all of them!
dialogue: i love roller coasters, but i hate that my favorite amusement parks close during the winter.
i hate that most parks close during the winter too. do you have any indoor type amusement parks near you?
not that i am aware of. when february rolls around, all i can think about is how much i miss them and how i cannot wait to go back.
label: anticipating
response: i feel you. you will just have to go as often as possible during the other months to make up for the winter time without!

situation: going to graduate college soon with a good degree. should be able to get a well-paying career!
dialogue: i am excited to graduate college and start my career soon! i have a feeling that my life will get much better once i do.
ooh, congratulations! i will be graduating soon too. what is your major?
i am an engineering major, electrical engineering specifically. and yourself?
label: hopeful
response: that is very cool. my dad's an electrical engineer, actually. i am a cybersecurity major myself.

situation: i feel very thankful for everything that i have, i live a really good life in my liking
dialogue: i really am thankful for everything that i have and had
what is your most prized posession?
it is actually a little medal my dad gave me when i was little
label: grateful
response: why is that?

situation: my brother has gotten really good at bowling. he spins it like crazy!
dialogue: my little brother has gotten really good at bowling recently and it kind of floors me!
oh wow, maybe he can get a scholarship! i know some colleges now offer bowling athletic programs.
perhaps! he is joining the high school bowling team so that may help his chances as well. do you like to bowl yourself?
label: impressed
response: you must be very proud of him! yes, i love to bowl with my family but i am not very good at it!

situation: it is so dark in my house. i keep hearing creepy noises.
dialogue: i keep hearing strange noises in my house. my husband is out of town and i am all alone. there has been reports of break ins on my street.
that is scary. do you have means of defending yourself?\
no i do not, i do have two dogs! they keep growling at the noises to!
label: afraid
response: maybe you can call a neighbor or something to see if they see anything suspicious outside your house! do not hesitate to call the police if you feel you should!

situation: i tried to spin my ball while bowling and ended up just throwing it. my face was so red!
dialogue: so i suck hard at bowling, but tonight i tried to be pro and putting spin on the ball. i ended up just throwing it down the lane instead.
ha ha! i have done that, too. so embarrassing.
yeah, my face was bright red when the ball almost went into the other lane! thankfully there was somebody that sucked even worse than me in my party.
label: embarrassed
response: phew, so they got most of the attention.

situation: my friend's boyfriend had made sexual advances towards me, which i turned him away. but, i felt very bad for not telling my friend.
dialogue: i have a very good friend and her boyfriend made sexual advances towards me. i never did tell my friend, for various reasons, but i feel really guilty and bad about it@!
it can be hard in those situation i know you do not want to loose a friend in the end.
yes, and there were financial and personal reasons of her own that is why i did not tell her. plus, i really hated to hurt her, but i guess i should have told her.
label: ashamed
response: yes you should but when you feel comfortable do not feel guilty you are the victim he is a sad case you got this.

situation: all of my friends have moved away, when i still live and work in the place where i grew up. many local people my age do drugs and stay out all night, so i just stay in and keep to myself.
dialogue: i still live and work in the place where i grew up, but all of my friends have moved away.
aw, that has to be tough not to see your friends. do they visit often?
no, everyone is so busy with their lives and work that it is hard to arrange. most of the people here my age do drugs or stay out all night, so i keep to myself at home, alone.
label: lonely
response: how awful! you are much better off staying at home. i hope you find new friends soon!

situation: school is starting up soon and i am worried i may not be able to keep up with all of the homework.
dialogue: so college is starting up soon and i am worried i will not be able to deal with the workload again.
school can be tough. how many credits are you taking on?
i wanna say 14 credit hours for engineering classes. i have a part time job too i work 20 hours a week at.
label: afraid
response: engineering is already tough. if you can get through this, i would say you will be very successful in life.

situation: i feel ready to take on this school year and pass with flying colors!
dialogue: so college is starting up soon and i feel more ready than ever to do well this year!
oh you are gonna be awesome i bet!
thanks, i am going to try! last semester was not bad but i procrastinated more than i should have.
label: confident
response: yeah that always happens, do not be hard on yourself as long you do great

situation: i just had an amazing dinner and now am relaxing in my room. i feel very rested and at peace.
dialogue: so i just had an amazing dinner and am now relaxing in my room. i feel very at ease.
nice. what was dinner?
surprisingly enough, a pizza from the bowling alley. i never said that i was picky!
label: content
response: i have not met a pizza i did not like yet.

situation: my son is in so much pain
dialogue: my son is teething really bad and he is so inconsolable that breaks my heart. i cannot wait till these molars cut thru
i remember my kids going through that. do you have teething rings for him?
i do but he does not like them. he can barely eat his mouth hurts so bad
label: sad
response: poor boy. i hope he gets through it soon.

situation: i am looking forward to monday. i know it is silly but a game i really enjoy is coming out that day.
dialogue: i think i will be very busy monday night playing my new game.
what is the game about you must love games it will take up your whole night.
world of warcraft. i'v got a deeper reason then it being a game- it is how i meet my husband.
label: anticipating
response: really that is a cool story to tell when asked how you 2 met did ya'll play online together a lot?

situation: i come home from work and my parents are always arguing. it frustrates me.
dialogue: i come home from work and my parents always seem to be arguing. it is very frustrating.
oh that is not good. do they argue about small things?
yes they do. they act like children and i am essentially the most mature/responsible one in the house.
label: annoyed
response: yikes, that should not be. i think you've really stepped up in this situation. hopefully they can see that and change their ways.

situation: last night there was a really bad storm and it scared me. the power went out several times and it scary how close the lightning seemed to be.
dialogue: i think storms are wonderful, except when the power goes out.
i love storms too but yeah, that is a nuisance.
it was extra loud and my husband was at work, bit scary.
label: terrified
response: yikes! lightning did not strike real close by, did it?

situation: i have a feeling that i will be doing much better with college homework this semester!
dialogue: college is starting soon and i am feeling like i will be able to stay on top of homework this semester!
that is good. will it be a difficult semester?
it probably will be, as i am studying engineering. i feel confident that i will not procrastinate as much this time though!
label: hopeful
response: that is good. i am sometime a procrastinator.

situation: i heard a music artist recently that brought me back to my childhood.
dialogue: i recently heard a music artist for the first time in a long time that brought me back to my childhood.
awww, what fun.  that must have been so nostalgic for you!  i wish i was back in childhood again sometimes.
it sure was! i enjoy reliving the memories, things were often simpler and more carefree back then.
label: nostalgic
response: i saw a toy that they are bringing back from a couple decades ago when i was a kid and wow, it was so neat to see!

situation: my brother is getting really good at bowling. i am shocked at his skill.
dialogue: so i consider myself a decent bowler but my brother came out of nowhere, he is actually really skilled. i am kind of shocked actually.
wow. sibling's got skills.
for sure. i am here doing the traditional bowling style and he is spinning the ball across the lane getting strikes often. he makes me look bad!
label: surprised
response: how long has he been bowling?

situation: i am nervous about starting my new job. i want to do well, but it is so different.
dialogue: i am so nervous to start my new job tommorrow.
i am sorry to hear that, i am sure you will be fine. what kind of job is it?
it is a desk job. its my first time in a place like this.
label: apprehensive
response: well, it should not be too bad. if you could not do the work i am sure they would not have hired you.

situation: i had a customer sign the wrong form today, i feel bad because i will have to ask them to sign something again.
dialogue: so i had a customer sign the wrong form today. i feel kind of bad because i will have to have them sign the right thing next time and i will look incompetent.
that is a bummer. at least you will be more attentive next time?
for sure, that is a silver lining. mistakes happen i suppose, cannot expect to be perfect!
label: guilty
response: indeed. if everyone got worked up over things like that, we'd all be out of jobs.

situation: i went on a road trip to utah a few months ago by myself and missed my friends
dialogue: so i went on a road trip to utah a few months ago after my friends backed out. it was awesome but i did miss them.
that sounds incredible. did you visit the great salt lake?
no i did not get around to that area! i did visit arches and canyonlands national parks though. even though i was by myself, would do again!
label: lonely
response: man, i definitely have to go there. sounds like a great place for sightseeing.

situation: my brother got my dream vehicle as his first car
dialogue: so my brother got my dream vehicle as his first car. i am feeling a certain way about this!
oh my god, do you think he got it just because you like it so much?
i do not think so actually, i have not let him know that i love that type in particular so much haha. i am definitely wishing it was mine though!
label: jealous
response: that is hilarious, in a cruel kind of way.

situation: i want to buy a new vehicle but am worried to take the plunge.
dialogue: so i want to buy a new vehicle but i am nervous about pulling the trigger on it.
ohh, i feel you. i felt the same way, when i was planning to buy a new car.
yep. like, my current car is dying, but i almost literally want to drive it until it no longer runs at all.
label: apprehensive
response: yeah. i believe you are emotionally attached to it!

situation: people who  steal make me crazy. i watched some people come into my driveway and try to take my spare gas can!
dialogue: people are crazy now a days. i watched people try to take a gas can from my yard!
wow why would they even do that?
it was during a power outage during a hurricane,  still made me mad.
label: angry
response: sheesh, people will take anything that is not nailed down these days.

situation: my car would not start today after work. i had to get a jump start!
dialogue: so my car would not start today after work. i kind of hate my car!
that is terrible to hear. is it old?
oh yes, very old. it is a 2002 and while i have had it for 6 years now, i am finally starting to grow tired of it.
label: annoyed
response: are you thinking of getting a new car?

situation: whenever i have to give a presentation, i get so nervous. mentally, i do not really care, but my legs shake, my heart pounds, and i speak too quickly. being the center of attention makes me feel that way
dialogue: i hate giving big presentations and being the center of attention.
me too. its nerve wrecking
i know! like, mentally, i do not care, but my body just responds by making my legs shake, my heart pound, and speaking too quickly.
label: anxious
response: maybe you should take some classes to help you with that

situation: i was dogsitting for my dad. i had to clean up dog poop around 10 times while i was there!
dialogue: i had to dogsit for my dad about a week ago. i had to clean up dog poop at least 10 times, it was awful.
ohh, cleaning dog poop is always been annoying, yet petting the dog is always amusing.
oh yes. i wish i could say petting the dogs counteracted having to clean up after them, but i would be lying.
label: disgusted
response: ha ha. i feel sorry for you though. no one likes to clean the dog poop!

situation: i was listening to old school rap in my car. the windows were down, and the car next to me started making fun of me.
dialogue: so i was listening to rap in my car with the windows down. the people in the car next to me were just staring at me. it was kinda awkward.
that has happened to me several times
yeah, not gonna lie my face turned a bit red and i rolled the windows up slightly. thankfully they are very tinted so they probably did not notice my shame.
label: embarrassed
response: lol. they probably just laughed about it over dinner

situation: i was really worried about how i was going to afford textbooks this semester. well, my boyfriend surprised me and bought all the books! it is so nice to know that everything's taken care of, thanks to him.
dialogue: i was really worried about how i would afford textbooks this semester.
were you able to get them?
yes, everything's taken care of, thanks to my boyfriend,  he surprised me with all of the books i needed!
label: grateful
response: that was so sweet of him! you are lucky to have such a sweet boyfriend

situation: i waas really happy after finishing my service in the military, it makes me feel so proud to think i fought for my country
dialogue: i was really glad i finished my service for the military
thanks you for your service
it is a pleasure i am really proud i did this for my country
label: proud
response: which branch?

situation: i really like my new car i did not expect it to be such a good veichle for the price
dialogue: i did not expect my car to be soo good for the price i paid
i have never had that feeling.
yeah it was a used car i was not expecting much but it turned out really well
label: surprised
response: well that is good. probaby saved a bunch of coins

situation: i hate watching my parents smoke, it makes me really sad to think they could face cancer as a concequence
dialogue: i do not like to see my parents smoke it makes me really sad
i would also cry with you!
yeah but it has turned into a normal thing now
label: sad
response: i cry at least a day!

situation: i hate when i am smoking a cigarrete and the ash drops in my work pants and leaves a stain, it is easy to get off but i have to wait till i get home
dialogue: i hate when ash from my cigarette drops in my work pants
oof that sucks really bad
yeah, i haave to wait till i get home to get the stain off, it is really embarrasing
label: angry
response: yea i can imagine it is

situation: it was really hard on my family when katrina hit texas, our house and belongings got kind of affected by it
dialogue: when katrina hit texas my family lost like half of their belongings
that sucks, are you going to leave texas or stay?
well when it hit we left but now we are ok and we recovered well
label: devastated
response: how much did the damage cost you?

situation: i hate when people do not flush the toilet on public bathrooms, they should have more manners
dialogue: i cannot stand people that do not flush the toilet
i do not even have a toilet.
oh, so where do you go to do your personal buisness
label: annoyed
response: i use the woods!

situation: i guess i will be selected as a next team leader
dialogue: i guess i will be the next team leader
really? is that a promotion?
yes. i was expecting that very much.
label: hopeful
response: good for you.

situation: we were at six flags. my kids wanted me to go on one of the roller coasters. i was very leery of getting on one because i have not ridden one in years. i finally got on and had so much fun!
dialogue: my kids and i went to six flags and they wanted me to ride the roller coaster but i had so many reservations about getting on it.
were you afraid of heights and high speeds?
the high speeds. it had been so long since i had been on one. i finally did get on and we had a blast!
label: apprehensive
response: i am glad you did. rollercoasters are thrilling and should not be missed out on!

situation: last year when i turned 40, i was trying to keep things very low key because i was not feeling great about getting older. my kids planned a party for me that i did not know about and invited all my friends and family. it really was just what i needed to cheer me up.
dialogue: when i turned 40 last year, my kids planned a birthday party for me that i had no idea about.
oh wow! that sounds very special!
it really was and just what i need as i was not really happy about turning that corner into my 40's.
label: surprised
response: im glad your family did that for you

situation: we were at a wedding a few weeks ago and everyone was having a great time. my 3 year old niece was dancing to the music while eating a carrot and started to choke on the carrot. it was one of the scariest moments ever. she is ok though, someone was able to help her
dialogue: a few weeks ago we were at a wedding. everyone was dancing and having fun and all of a sudden my 3 year old niece started to choke on a carrot. so scary!
oh wow! that must have been terrifying! were they able to help her?
yes, someone was able to do the heimlich maneuver and she was ok right after that. it was quite the panic for a few minutes though.
label: terrified
response: i could imagine. it must have been amazing to see her rescued though!

situation: an online payment distributor will not instantly verify my bank account
dialogue: so an online payment distributor company will not instantly verify my bank account even though the login info is correct. feels bad man.
that sucks. did they give you any reason why they will not verify it?
nope. i even double checked the login info and signed into my bank's website no problem. i feel a bit let down.
label: disappointed
response: well, i hope they can get you taken care of soon. i know i hate it when i cannot get to my money i have online.

situation: i am annoyed today is my off day and i wanted to sleep in, yet here i am awake early.
dialogue: today is my off day and i wanted to sleep in, yet here i am awake early.
i am the same. woke up at 6 for no reason
it sucks. i guess my body does not want me to sleep in any more.
label: annoyed
response: lol i hate that

situation: i was dog sitting at my dad's house and i heard strange noises.
dialogue: i was dog sitting at my dad's house last week and i heard strange noises in his house.
what happened?
i do not know, it was very odd. i would go in the kitchen and the sink would be running a little bit even though i did not turn it on. kind of spooky.
label: terrified
response: i understand those kind of situation could scarry.

situation: last semester, i had to give a presentation. my stomach hurt from the nerves.
dialogue: last semester, i had to give a class presentation. my stomach was full of butterflies from the nerves.
how did it go?
all things considered, pretty well. i definitely had some anxiety about it though. presentations are my least favorite thing in the world.
label: anxious
response: i hate those as well

situation: my aunt recently passed away after a long battle with alzheimer's disease. i am so sad at the loss.
dialogue: my aunt recently passed away after a long battle with alzheimer's disease.
i am so sorry to hear that.
thanks. it is been especially hard because she was almost like a mother to me.
label: devastated
response: i truly hope you can recover from this major loss in your life.

situation: i asked out a girl from my class and she said yes.
dialogue: so i asked out a girl in my class and she said yes. was a big morale boost.
im glad to hear that!
thanks! we are getting coffee this weekend. hopefully something comes of it!
label: confident
response: good luck to you! i wish you the best

situation: i always carry a multi-tool and a small 4-1 screwdriver on me. i feel like i can fix almost anything with that.
dialogue: i always carry a multi-tool and a small 4-1 screwdriver on me. i feel like i can fix almost anything with that.
i think you had good skills with tools
i would like to think so. i just like to be ready for anything.
label: prepared
response: thats cool of you

situation: i am starting a new position at my job very soon. i am really looking forward to it!
dialogue: i am starting a new position at my job soon.
oh that is great. what are you going to be doing?
i will be managing consumer relations at a law firm. i am really looking forward to it!
label: anticipating
response: oh wow, that sounds like a tough job, but i bet you will be good at it.

situation: my car is about to die. i am expecting to get a new car very soon.
dialogue: my car is on it is last legs. i think i see a new car in my future very soon.
oh, i am sorry.  what are you thinking of getting?
i would love to get an x-terra! i am a big fan of the suv platform.
label: anticipating
response: nissans are very nice and rugged.

situation: after dropping out of college 6 years ago, i decided to go back this year
dialogue: after dropping out of college 6 years ago, i decided to go back this year.
that is a great move!  i did the same thing.
i have high hopes for myself, as i have all a's so far. i hope i can keep up the momentum!
label: hopeful
response: good job, keep up the good work!

situation: i just had a delicious breakfast and am now casually relaxing in my room.
dialogue: i just had a delicious breakfast and now i am casually relaxing in my room. life is good!
what was for breakfast?
pancakes and sausage! how can you go wrong?
label: content
response: you cannot! sounds like a wonderful morning!

situation: i have been saving money and now have enough for any emergency.
dialogue: so i have been saving money for about a month now and should have enough for any kind of emergency that may happen. feels good man.
that is awesome, it is not easy to do that so kudos to you!
thanks so much! it definitely relieves some stress knowing that i have a safety cushion. hoping i do not have any emergencies though!
label: prepared
response: i will keep my fingers crossed that you won

situation: having a baby caused me to have a more optimistic view on life.
dialogue: having a baby 3 months ago really changed my view on life for the better.
oh awesome!  congrats!  how has it changed life for you?
i was a heavy drinker, and looking back now, i know i was in a downward spiral, i just could not tell at the time. now i am pursuing my education and have become much more healthy and responsible.
label: excited
response: that is really fantastic!  i am glad to hear you turned your life around.

situation: my husband and i are going on a cruise with another couple that we have been friends with for years. we let them book the cruise and we just give them so much money each month, until the cruise is paid for. it takes all the stress of booking/planning away for me, and we can just enjoy the cruise when its time.
dialogue: my husband and i are going a  cruise with a couple that we have been friends with for a long time,
that sounds so great. who was the one to come up with this plan?
we kind of all came up with it together. they booked it and we just pay them a certain amount of money each week, until our part is paid for.
label: trusting
response: i see. i wish i had a partner and we could go to such places together too. maybe some day hopefully

situation: i am so proud of my sister
dialogue: i am so proud of my sister
what did she do?
she bought me a car
label: proud
response: wow! that was really nice of her! what was the occasion? you guys must be very close.

situation: i am sad that my parents did not attend my birthday
dialogue: i am sad that my parents did not attend my birthday
do they live in a different state than you?
no, they just are not wanting to come to it
label: sad
response: sorry to hear that.  remember those who mind do not matter and those who matter do not mind

situation: i was at home at the end of a long work week.  i was sitting on the couch with my wife watching tv while our dogs were lying by each of us.
dialogue: last week at the end of the week i got home from work and was pretty tired.  i ended up just sitting on the couch with my wife and dogs watching tv.  it was nice.
souds like you were content.
quite a lot, actually.  it was a nice way to spend the evening.
label: content
response: i feel you. sometimes its nice to veg out and just watch tv.

situation: i had to go to a wedding far out of the city i live in, and needed someone to watch my dogs.  a friend took over last minute and agreed to watch them for the weekend.
dialogue: i was going to a wedding outside of my city, and had arranged to have my dogs watched while i was gone, but the person backed out really soon before i had to leave.
oh no! that is awful!  i watch animals for a few different people and i would never do that.  that is very unprofessional. did they have an emergency?
something like that, they were vague.  it was through a company so i could not really get much out of them.  luckily a friend stepped up and watched them for me.
label: grateful
response: that is ridiculous.  i was going to see who might have helped you.  i am so glad your friend helped.  hope you had a great time!

situation: last night i decided to go to bed a little early, as my wife is out of town and i was not doing anything.  i lay in bed with my dogs for a while watching tv before going to sleep.
dialogue: i was tired last night and my wife was out of town, so i went to bed early.  i ended up lying with my dogs in bed for a while watching tv before falling asleep.
what kind of dogs do you have?
a wire haired dacshund and a shephard mix thing
label: content
response: do you like to watch tv with you doggies?

situation: my wife has been out of the country for school for a month and a half.  she gets back in a couple weeks, but it is starting to get tough being alone with just the dogs.
dialogue: my wife has been out of the country for school for a month and a half.  she gets back in a couple weeks, and it is getting tougher to wait.
do you talk with her on the phone?
i do, every night.  it is still hard going from having someone around every day to never, but i will get through.
label: lonely
response: will you throw her a comeback party?

situation: i found out a couple days ago my favorite childhood book had been found. i remember holding it in my hands just remember all the good times.
dialogue: my dad was cleaning out his attic when he found a box of my old stuff from childhood
oh, that is cool. did you find any good memories in there?
i did! he found my favorite childhood book of mine and i just sat there thinking about all the memories
label: sentimental
response: nice! it sounds like a really good bonding experience.

situation: my wife is out of the country for school.  she was having a really bad day the other day and i could not really do anything to help.
dialogue: my wife is out of the country for school, and the other day she was having a really bad day.  i could not really do anything to help, and it made me feel bad.
i am so sorry.  i know you must've felt helpless but coming from a wife's perspective; i would know my husband could not be right next to me but his words and love make all the difference.
thanks, that is actually really helpful.  it is been tough being apart for so long, we have not been apart more than a couple days since we started dating.
label: sad
response: i totally feel you.  my husband as gone for work so much for a couple years.  it will just be a season of life and then you will be back together!  communicating even more than ever and encouraging each other can help so much.  you are doing great!  i hope you are together soon!

situation: a guy cut in front of some people in a line at a store and i confronted him.  he flipped me off and we exchanged very heated words.  the confrontation almost got physically but finally he left.
dialogue: i almost got into a fight the other day at a store.
so who annoyed you?
a guy budged in front of some other people, i confronted him about it, and we got into an extremely heated exchange.
label: furious
response: so did it result in a brawl?

situation: my husband was really sick for a while and i just did everything for him i loved him so much
dialogue: for a while my husband was really sick with the flu
i am sorry to hear that. i hope he is feeling better now.
he is but i just felt so much love for him because there was not anything he could do
label: caring
response: he is lucky to have you there.

situation: i hate when people make me wait it really makes me anxious, i expect people to arrive at the time they said they would
dialogue: when people make me wait, i get really anxious
i can understand that. do you try to find ways to fill your time while you are waiting?
not really, i just look at the clock and wait for the time to come and when they do not arrive in time i start getting anxious
label: anxious
response: yeah, waiting for someone can be a real pain.

situation: i really love dogs they are a great company when you are sad and about all the time, i love my puppy i got
dialogue: i love dogs very much they are always great companions
i also love dogs.
i got a puppy not to long ago and love him with all my heart
label: caring
response: puppy's are the best. i love puppies!

situation: my cat had to have surgery on her leg and i was so scared and worried for her
dialogue: my cat broke her leg not too long ago and had to have surgery one it
how much did you pay for the surgery?
i was lucky cause i know my vet personally so i only paid 175 usd i was so scared for her
label: anxious
response: uhmnnn! scared of your cat or the vet?

situation: it was really hard to hear that there was a shooting in a gas station near me and there was 3 vitims i was really devastated
dialogue: there was a shooting in a gas station near me i was really devastated
holy hell, that must have been scary! did you see it happen?
im not sure but there was 2 victims i was devastated
label: devastated
response: i am sorry to hear that. i really hope you are able to get over this and feel at ease again!

situation: i was sad when my dog died
dialogue: i was sad when my dog died
i am so sorry!  that can be a devastating time. i have been there before.  how long did you have your dog?
i had him for 10 years. it is just so hard because he was my whole world
label: sad
response: i completely understand.  something that helped me was to have pictures up and also have a little remembrance each year with some other family that loved him as much as i did.  just take it a day at a time.

situation: i am so lonely because i am all by myself
dialogue: i am so lonely because i am all by myself
aw, i am sorry, well i am here to talk to you!
i appreciate that. it is just tough because i go daily without talking to anyone. it is nice to talk to someone
label: lonely
response: i feel you.  i have been in that position, and it can get dark.  but there is always people online to talk to!

situation: i really makes me jelous when i say that my neighboor had a new bmw 2018
dialogue: i was really jelous when i say my  neighboor had a new 2018 bmw convertible
that car is quite expensive, i wish i could afford one too.
yeah it is i wish i could have a car like that
label: jealous
response: work hard and maybe you could afford it.

situation: i am sad that my friends do not visit me
dialogue: i am sad that my friends do not visit me
that is sad, why do not you go visit them?
i do not have a car and they live far away
label: sad
response: that is a bummer, hopefully you can still talk to them over the  phone or online!

situation: i am disgusted that my food did not come out the way i wanted it
dialogue: i am disgusted that my food did not come out the way i wanted it
that is not good, what was wrong with your food?
it was burnt and not appealing
label: disgusted
response: did you ask for a refund when you realized the problem?

situation: when i was young i hit a car on the parking lot and left without saying anynthing beacuse i  did not see a mark on the other car
dialogue: when i was young i hit a car on the parking lot and did not say anything'
why did not you say anything?
i did not see any marks on the other car and was running late
label: guilty
response: well then i do not blame you. i would have done the same thing

situation: my sister is so caring, she took care of me when i was sick
dialogue: my sister is so caring, she took care of me when i was sick
that is very nice of her, family is one of the best things we have in this world.
that is so true. i am so very thankful
label: caring
response: as you should be, some people do not have anyone to lean on in their lives.

situation: there was a dog outside my house the other night just howling at my window. i do not own a dog and i am on my own 3 acres of land.
dialogue: i heard this god awful howling the other night at like 2am right outside my window
that sounds spooky
it was! i was so scared to be honest with you! the worst part is that i do not own a dog either
label: afraid
response: oh no i hope you stay safe

situation: i was surprised when my mom bought me a car
dialogue: i was surprised when my mom bought me a car
nice! that is a very nice surprise.  what kind of car?
its a ford mustang
label: surprised
response: wow, she went all out, hope you drive safely and have fun with it!

situation: i am very ashamed in my family
dialogue: i am very ashamed in my family
i am really sorry to hear that.  why are you ashamed?
because they never invite me to go places, and they never call me
label: ashamed
response: that is really too bad.  did you all have a fight?

situation: i am disgusted because of my friends pulling pranks on me
dialogue: i am disgusted because of my friends pulling pranks on me
that is not nice of them, are they meaning to be rude?
i do not know. they have been my friends for so long but these pranks are just making me mad
label: disgusted
response: you should let them know you are not ok with them doing that.  if they are real friends, they will stop.

situation: i was afraid when i got out of the movie theater
dialogue: i was afraid when i got out of the movie theater
how come? what happened?
i was watching a horror film and then i had to walk home alone in the dark
label: afraid
response: ohhhh.  yea i would be scared too then.  that sounds terrifying.

situation: i am very faithful that my family will make it home in time
dialogue: i am very faithful that my family will make it home in time
that is good, where are they?
they are in cuba
label: faithful
response: wow, did they go there on vacation?

situation: i am terrified that my wife is going to leave me
dialogue: i am terrified that my wife is going to leave me
why would she leave you?
because she is talking to other men behind my back
label: terrified
response: oh no, i am so sorry to hear that. i know your heart is broken. did you try to talk to her about it?

situation: i am sad that i will not get to see the movie i want to see
dialogue: i am sad that i will not get to see the movie i want to see
what movie did you want to see?
i wanted to see the first purge
label: sad
response: why will not you be able to watch it?

situation: we recently went on vacation to the beach and it was so great. we really enjoyed the time to relax and lie on the beach.
dialogue: we just got back from the beach two weeks ago. it was such a lovely vacation. we loved relaxing on the beach and just taking it easy.
oh yeah that sounds very relaxing! i hope it was good weather for you all!
it was very nice. there was a day or two of rain, but mostly perfect weather!
label: content
response: that is great!  i am glad you had a good time, its always nice to have a refresher to get away from everything for a little bit!

situation: my husband and i are going on our first ever cruise in december. i am so excited to be going. we are going with some friends of ours. i cannot wait to go.
dialogue: my husband and i are going on our very first cruise in december.
oh boy! where are you headed?
to the caribbean islands. we are going with another couple that we have been friends with for a very long time.
label: excited
response: congratulations! i hope everything goes well!

situation: i ate all of the candy we had in the house one night. i felt so bad afterwards but it was so great in the moment
dialogue: the other night i was just craving candy. i ate up all that we had!
oh, wow. its like that sometimes. you have to give into your sweet tooth.
sometimes you just have to! it felt so great then but i hated it the next morning!
label: ashamed
response: ugh, i hate the regret that comes with giving into food cravings. do not be too hard on yourself. it was just one time.

situation: i felt a sense on anticipation for the best when my husband told me that he was free from cancer
dialogue: my husbands cancer free now!
how awesome. my husband is 7 years cancer free
congrats! we are hoping right now that nothing comes back but it is so happy
label: hopeful
response: it is amazing news. congrats to you both. enjoy your time together

situation: i am so frustrated with my husband. he dismantled the bathroom to do repairs and still hasn't completed them six months later!
dialogue: i am so frustrated with my husband. he dismantled the bathroom to do repairs and still hasn't completed them six months later!
six months!  i would be so mad!  what are you going to do about it?
he promised he would complete it within a month and since it is been so long, i called a contractor today!
label: angry
response: good call!  i would have done the same thing!

situation: i have got a job interview set up for next week and i am really nervous!
dialogue: i have got a job interview set up for next week and i am really nervous!
i think you will nail it, are you prepared
i hope so! i bought a couple books on preparing for interviews and i have done a couple mock interviews with a friend.
label: apprehensive
response: good then you will do well!

situation: my parents always argue and it pisses me off!
dialogue: my parents always argue and it pisses me off!
i bet, have you told them how u feel about it?
i have but they rarely listen. they act like children and it can get frustrating. what can you do?
label: angry
response: i guess just walk away is all

situation: i had a performance review at work where i was surprised by the presence of my least favorite person in the company. the account manager part of my position was effectively dissolved and i was forced to answer phones.
dialogue: sometimes life just gives you lemons. at an old job of mine, i had what will probably remain the worst performance review of my life.
well you can get better

i am not sure it was really about my performance at all. i was surprised by the presence of my only adversary there, and informed that a large part of my position would be dissolved, and i would be answering phones.
label: angry
response: you will do better next time, i promise

situation: i am so excited that the kids go back to school in just one week!
dialogue: that is must be a relief for you.  i am assuming you have children?
i do not have those
so i guess that sending anyone off to school is not a big deal to you?  do you attend school?
label: excited
response: i do not attend school

situation: my father unexpected passed away around 2 1/2 years ago. we never thought he would be leaving us this soon and it was very traumatic to me.
dialogue: my father passed away about 2 1/2 years ago. it was totally unexpected and really was very traumatic and hurtful to me. he was still quite young and my family and i had no idea he had a life threatening health issue.
i am sorry to hear that, i hope you had some time together before hand
i was pretty close to my father and always lived close by. but, you always wish you had more time. but, the last words i said to him was that i loved him, and i am grateful for that.
label: devastated
response: that is good at least, you had some closure at the worst

situation: there was this one time i was invited to my friends birthday party.  we were all about to walk in the house and i ran smack into the glass door.  it was very clean.  later on i won the door prize
dialogue: once when i was younger i went to a friends 16th birthday and had a crazy experiene happen
what happened?
we were walking in the front door and it had a glass door apparently but i did not see it.  it was a very clean door. .  later on that night i won a door prize.  which was pretty funny]
label: embarrassed
response: what did you win?

situation: i lost my temper with my daughter the other day and was a bit ill with her. i felt so bad that i had raised my voice and hurt her feelings.
dialogue: my daughter caught me in a bad mood the other day and was being a bit argumentative. i lost my temper, yelled and really hurt her feelings. i felt bad that it happened.
oh that sucks.  those are the types of situations where you cannot help it, but you know you did wrong the second after it is over.
yes, i was already not in a good mood, and then it seemed like she just pushed the right button. but, i knew i should not have done it as soon as i saw the look in her eyes, i felt very bad.
label: ashamed
response: well, there are not any rules against apologizing to your kids?

situation: an old man (appearing drunk at first) stopped me on the street, saying he was stranded and needed to go home. i got him a cab and gave the driver $20 to take him home.
dialogue: you never know what someone else is going through, and looks can be deceiving. like this old man that seemed like any other drunk.
yeah you can judge someone like that
it was hard to tell honestly, but it turned out the guy was lost and diabetic. he had lost track of his friends and had no way to get home, so i hailed him a cab and paid the driver $20.
label: caring
response: that is a nice gesture from you

situation: we finally were able to go back to the beach for vacation! we were so thrilled and happy to do that, it was great!
dialogue: we hadn't been to the beach and years and really wanting to go back for vacation. we were able to a few weeks ago and it was awesome. i was thrilled!
oh man, the beach always sounds nice
it is was great. the weather was perfect most of the time, and we were able to relax and enjoy it so much. we were really hyped to go!
label: excited
response: that sounds like it was lovely

situation: the last time i went to the fair, i tripped over a big cord and fell down. there were so many people around and i wanted to run and hide!
dialogue: the last time i went to the fair, i tripped over a big cord. this led to me having one of those running falls, that seem to last forever! i wanted to disappear at that moment!
i am sure not many people noticed
oh no, there were tons of people that noticed. i can laugh now, but not at that moment.
label: embarrassed
response: i can imagine, sorry

situation: i miss my puppy. she passed away recently and it was really sudden and sad.
dialogue: i lost a puppy recently and i am still broken up about it.
i am so sorry i have been there so many times
it is never going to be ok, but it will be a little less painful in time.
label: sad
response: i am sorry you had to go through that

situation: i had to go to a store to return a toy my nephew took. he is only 4 so he did not realize it was wrong but still, not fun.
dialogue: it is not fun when a 4 year old does something he shouldnt.
what did they do
took a small toy, put it in his pocket. took it back to the store and made him return it.
label: embarrassed
response: oh well, he will learn

situation: as a mom i sometimes treat myself to something tasty when i make it out alone. i snuck an ice cream cone the other day.
dialogue: as a mom i sometimes sneak a sweet treat when i make it out alone.
you do what you want, you earn it!
still feel bad when i got an ice cream the other day
label: guilty
response: why?

situation: i have been so upset lately, the house has been a mess and my husband hasn't been helping clean.
dialogue: i have had a rough week! the house has been a mess from my dogs and toddler. my husband hasn't been helping out much, its fustrating!
why is he not helping?
i am not sure! he has been busy with work but also has been going out with friends a lot
label: angry
response: oh, well work can be tough too sometimes

situation: i was proud of my niece today, she graduated from her nursing school. she is planning to work for an oncologist.
dialogue: my niece made me proud today, graduated from her nursing school.
i bet you are proud
yea, she is over come a lot for it.
label: proud
response: i am sure she did

situation: it was my birthday today! i came home from work to find a big pink cake and flowers from my husband!
dialogue: since it was my birthday today, when i came home there was a big pink cake and flowers waiting for me
that is sweet, who from?
my husband! i did not see it coming at all, thought we were going to wait till the weekend to celebrate.
label: devastated
response: wow, how sweet of him, you are both lucky!

situation: i had to clean out my storage building to some roof damage. i found a box full of really old pictures. we enjoyed looking through all of our memories.
dialogue: we had to clean out our storage building because of roof damage. i found an old box of pictures!
what of?
my family and all kinds of old memories, birthdays, festivals, swimming, and other stuff
label: sentimental
response: oh, that is awesome, i love those trips down the old memory lane

situation: it was super hot last night so we had the windows open and there was this huge fly that kept buzzing around the room
dialogue: it is so hot and our ac just broke. we had to open the windows to be able to sleep!
oh wow, talk about bad timing
the icing on the sweaty cake was that a giant horse fly kept buzzing around the room and the moment you got comfy would land on you
label: annoyed
response: oh no, i hate flies

situation: we are moving to arkansas at the end of this year. excited for the new opportunties for my family. new start
dialogue: i am so excited! my family and i are moving to a new state at the end of this year!
i am ready for a new start for my family and a better paying job!
that is nice. having a better paying job is always good.
label: hopeful
response: yes! and new opportunties for my family. we need the fresh start on life. i do not like living in texas.

situation: starting to work out again! getting back in shape has raised my self esteem!
dialogue: i have got back in to running this week, i missed it! it is a great stress reliever!
wow, i do not know how you runners do it. i cannot stand running. how many miles do you run per day on average?
i love to run, did track and field in high school! right now i am only running 3 miles till i build my stamina back up! what do you do for excersise?
label: confident
response: i usually jog in the backyard, but not really running. i am too fat to run.

situation: my huband cooked dinner and cleaned house today. he also helped with laundry and let me sleep in. he has been so kind and helpful.
dialogue: you will not believe the day i have had! i got to sleep in this morning, i have not done that in months!
its always nice to get some sleep
yes, my husband even cooked dinner for me today, and helped clean the house! he has been very helpful today.
label: impressed
response: oh wow, that was nice of him

situation: life has been great. my husband has been very helpful around the house and our marriage is great. we have been blessed with great job offers and opportunties.
dialogue: this has been a great week! well actually a great year for my family.
i am glad for you. i hope it continues
thank you, my husband got two great job offers!
label: grateful
response: oh nice, its good to have options

situation: i was so shocked with my daughter today. she is learning how to share at pre-school and is doing so well. love that she is learning so fast.
dialogue: my daughter is growing up so fast!
how old is she?
she is 4 and in pre-school! she is doing so well learning how to share and also knows her colors!
label: impressed
response: wow, they do grow up fast, appreciate the time you get!

situation: saw a family house burned down today. it was struck by lightening. worried about them and hope they are all okay.
dialogue: i live in central texas, it rained and lightening stuck a house here and caused it to burn down!
oh no, that sounds scary
yes, i hope the family is okay! no word yet if anyone got hurt.
label: sad
response: i hope they are

situation: my baby is sleeping my house is clean
dialogue: my baby is sleeping, my house is clean. it is just so nice and peaceful right now
that is not something to take for granted, enjoy yourself!
i just hope tonight will not be that night when my baby wakes up every 30 minutes
label: content
response: i hope so too, best of luck with that!

situation: i ate way too much today! was suppose to be on a diet. ate a cupcake and pizza.
dialogue: i feel like a failure,  i am suppose to be on a diet but ate too much today!
you can always start tomorrow
thanks, i keep telling myself to stick with it but its hard!
label: ashamed
response: it can be hard, but you can do it

situation: my boss has been a pain lately, he dosen't understand how long it takes to get certain tasks done. i am at my whitts end, thinking about quitting.
dialogue: i am thinking about quitting my day job!
why is that?
my boss has been unreasonable and a pain. he dosen't understand how much time i put into the company!
label: annoyed
response: i get that, best of luck friend!

situation: the other day i got to take my kids to the beach for the first time. i could barely contain myself on the trip there!
dialogue: tuesday i got to take my kids to the beach for the first time.
did you have a good time?
we had a blast! i could barely contain myself on the trip there!
label: excited
response: they will always have good memories of the beach.

situation: my dog hasn't had any accidents in the house. he is finally potty trained, i thought it would take longer then a week
dialogue: my new dog is doing so great, she was potty trained in a week!
what kind of dog
she is a jack russell, she loves to cuddle in my lap.
label: surprised
response: she does sound adorable

situation: i moved to a new house recently, but i really miss my other house very much. i hope i get to feeel the way i use to feel in my other house
dialogue: i moved to a new house recently and miss my old one
how long did you live in your old one?
10 years, i hope i get to feel the same way i did in my old house
label: nostalgic
response: it will take some getting used to.

situation: when ever i play soccer for my team i feel like i am one of the best in my team, i always do what is needed to win
dialogue: i feel like i am the best player on my soccer team
sounds like you practice a lot to get good.
yeah i do i am always the one that steps up in the game
label: confident
response: are you the captain?

situation: i have been having anxiety attacks
dialogue: i have been having anxiety attacks lately. everything is great and suddenly i start thinking about something bad happening and i have a full blown anxiety attack over something that did not even happen
is this a common occurrence?
no, it just started happening. i would say it started a couple of months ago. i will see a doctor in 2 weeks
label: anxious
response: that is good. i hope it is controllable.

situation: i was feeling pretty reminiscent when we went on vacation. i starting thinking about the last vacation we had with my father before he passed away.
dialogue: we recently went on vacation and it made me feel reminiscent. it made me think of the last vacation i was able to spend with my father before he unexpectedly passed away.
i am so sorry for your loss.
thank you. i do not think it matters how old you are when a parent passes away, it is very painful. the vacation did bring back great memories with him though.
label: sentimental
response: he sounds like a great guy. i am glad you have fond memories of him.

situation: my friend can eatanything and she is so skinny
dialogue: my friend can literally eat junk food all day long and stay skinny! she does not even work out. and here i am, eating healthy, working out and still loking fat
she may be skinny, but it does not mean she is healthy.
that is true too! but i just wish i looked like her
label: jealous
response: yea, i totally understand that. she won the genetic lottery there.

situation: it was my birthday and my friend sent me a birthday card with a gift card in a mail.. i never got it, somebody stole it!
dialogue: it was my birthday and my friend sent me a birthday card with a gift card in a mail. i never got it, somebody stole it! and we actually have a cluster mailbox so only i can open it. it means that usps worker stole it
have you tried speaking with the post office?
i did, the lady told me they cannot do anything about it because it did not have a tracking number.
label: disappointed
response: that is ridiculous, they should have to do something.

situation: my cat was playing with a toy and decided to bring it to me. it was a dead mouse!
dialogue: my cat was playing last nigh and brought it to me.
that sounds like fun. what did it bring to you?
well, it was not one of his toys like i thought. it was a dead mouse
label: disgusted
response: eww.. that is pretty gross. i had a cat once that would bring me dead birds too. i think that means they like you!

situation: my son is potty trained
dialogue: my son just used a potty for the first time! he is only 16 months. i am so proud of him
watch out! next thing you turn around, and he is driving.
i know! they  grow up so fast! i feel like i just gave a birth to him and look at him now
label: proud
response: i hope you got some photos.

situation: i bought tickets to an expensive concert ($50) that a friend and i planned to attend. the day of the concert the show was rained out, and no one was refunded.
dialogue: sometimes things do not work out like you planned. it can be a real let down though.
what happened?
i got two tickets for a friend and i for a concert. the day of the show, it poured and no one got a refund.
label: disappointed
response: that is bad. you should have got refunded.

situation: my family was on a road trip earlier this week and had to stop at a gas station to use the bathroom. the bathroom looked clean but the 2 roaches said it was not.
dialogue: my family went on a road trip this week and had to stop at a gas station for the bathroom.
how'd that go?
well the bathroom seemed cleaned but the roaches told me otherwise.
label: disgusted
response: oh god, roaches. did you guys use the bathroom anyway?

situation: while riding my bicycle to work, i was hit from behind by a woman in a car. she stopped, and even against my pleas (i was in shock), called for an ambulance.
dialogue: it sounds crazy to say, but even though i was hit by a car on my bicycle, it could have been much worse.
are you okay?
i am quite fine now (my knee has a plate and six screws). i am just glad that the driver stopped and called an ambulance!
label: grateful
response: oh my gosh, a plate! that kinda sounds serious.

situation: i had an extremely grueling spring semester this year. all said and done, i pulled 4 as and 2 bs.
dialogue: last semester was probably the largest challenge of my life. i go to school for electrical engineering, and i took 6 courses.
that is a lot. most i ever took at one time was 5 classes and i cried at least twice that semester.
oh my gosh then you know! i have to say though, it all came out in the wash 4 as and 2 bs!
label: proud
response: damn that is impressive congrats. i took 1 class last semester and got an a

situation: i took a job fixing a computer for a client who was leaving town. i had less than 24 hours to pull it off and was biting my nails.
dialogue: waiting for something to come in the mail can send me in to a tizzy. it is even worse when it is parts i need to finish a computer repair job.
that is true. did you finish the job?
i did get it done in the end. it was a nail biter since the client was leaving the day after the parts came.
label: anticipating
response: that is really great. it is nice when everything works out in the end.

situation: once, i was showing some people around the downtown area in my city. while at dinner, i soiled myself, and had to wash off in the sink in the small bathroom. an employee opened the door, and there i was, washing my pants.
dialogue: have you ever lost control of your bowels as an adult?
oh, all the time. i have got to change my depens three times a day.
phew! i am glad i am not the only one. although for me, it happened in the middle of dinner at a small vietnamese restaurant, and an employee walked in on me cleaning my pants in the sink!
label: embarrassed
response: oh wow. i just would've blamed it on whoever i was with.

situation: i was on a trip to a heavy metal festival in las vegas. while there, my girlfriend broke up with me, and we were still staying in the same room.
dialogue: i went to a heavy metal music festival in las vegas a few years ago! i had fun, but to be honest it was a bit of an emotional roller coaster.
oh, i do not know why concerts make me feel a bit sentimental
i think it is because everybody can relate when it comes to live music. my girlfriend broke up with me the second day, but we had to stay in the same room.
label: lonely
response: that must have been horrible! i am so sorry you went thru that

situation: there was an event that i had a social obligation to attend and i was not looking forward to it. the day of, it rained out and i sat with my girlfriend watching the rain for hours.
dialogue: you know how sometimes things do not go as planned, but it feels like they turn out better in the end?
yes, some people call it fate.
you could call it that! i was supposed to go to a social event, but it got rained out and i ended up watching the rain for hours with my girlfriend.
label: content
response: that sounds so romantic!

situation: my father went to the hospital for abdominal pain. they found a tumor, but the operation to remove it went well. he passed away suddenly a few days after.
dialogue: my father was having abdominal pain, so he went to the hospital and they discovered a tumor.
oh no, was it benign?
it was cancerous, but the surgery to remove it seemed to go well. a few days later he passed away suddenly, with no exact cause of death.
label: devastated
response: that is so terrible, i am so sorry.

situation: when a new star wars movie comes out, a lot of kids (and adults to) dress up for the midnight premier. it reminds me of seeing episode i for the first time, where me and a friend dressed up as a jedi and a sith.
dialogue: i love it when the new star wars movies come out, seeing all those kids (and adults) dress up for the theater really takes me back!
do you dress up when the new movies come out also?
i do not anymore, but when i was a kid, a friend and i dressed up as the hero and the villain for the premiere of episode i.
label: nostalgic
response: ah, i bet seeing all of the kids now dressed up does take you back to an earlier time.  nostalgia has a way of getting to each of us.

situation: while out on our second date, my current girlfriend and i stopped at a dive bar. they had a pool table, and i showed her some of the basics. then i really let loose and she said later that she was impressed.
dialogue: on our second date, my girlfriend and i stopped in a dive bar on our way back from the beach.
what is a dive bar
like a hole in the wall. cheap drinks, sometimes a little dirty, but altogether relaxed the opposite of snoody. they had a pool table and i showed her some tricks.
label: confident
response: oh ok. we call them hole in the walls

situation: i have a watch of my grandfather's that my father gave me. he passed away, but when i look at the watch i remember all the good times we had.
dialogue: my father passed away a few years ago, but i still have my grandfather's watch that he gave to me.
are you going to pass it down too?
i honestly hope to. every time i look at it i remember the good times we had together.
label: sentimental
response: well that is nice

situation: an ex of mine was in town, and we met up for a couple of drinks. she made a pass at me, but i told her she should get some rest. my girlfriend was understanding about it.
dialogue: hanging out with old flames can be tricky when you are in a committed exclusive relationship.
oh yeah that can be a mine field to walk across. did not have any issues?
actually, an ex was in town recently and we went for a drink. she made a pass at me, but i told her to get some rest and went home to my girlfriend.
label: faithful
response: that is very faithful of you, and the right thing to do i would say.

situation: going near hights really makes me scared, i cannot go on reoller coasters because i am afraid of heights
dialogue: going near hights really makes me scared
did a specific experience cause this? or just instinct.
just instinc i think i have always been afraid of heights
label: afraid
response: that is interesting my mother has always been afraid of heights, not myself though.

situation: once i was at a large rave at an abandoned shipping wharf. the cops came and made the people throwing it shut it down. i was out of it, and worried i was going to jail.
dialogue: during carnival season, there is a big rave at an undisclosed location in the middle of the night.
i use to go to raves when i was in high school.
they are a lot of fun! i must admit though, i was pretty nervous when the cops showed up to shut it down.
label: afraid
response: did you get arrested?

situation: i was really sad when my girlfriend broke up with me, it was devastating but i managed to overcome it
dialogue: my girl friend broke up with me about a month ago
why did she break up with you?
we where just not getting along, and did not h ave enough time to see each other
label: sentimental
response: are you still friends with her?

situation: when i was little, haunted houses would scare me silly. recently, a friend of mine suggested we go to one with a group. it was supposed to be very terrifying and hands on.
dialogue: i was always terrified of haunted houses when i was little.
me too! the first one i ever went to traumatized me.
glad i am not the only one! my friend has a birthday in october and she wanted us to go to one as a group. i am still not sure if i will go,
label: apprehensive
response: that seems like a weird birthday activity.

situation: i hate when my sister snores at night she never lets me sleep, but i know it is not her fault i just get really angry
dialogue: my sister snores really hard every night it is getting really anoying
have you ever woke her up and told her to stop?
well it is not really her fault it just makes me angry hahah
label: angry
response: that is hilarious, my mother snores like a monster

situation: my friend and i saw a mini-golf course on the side of a state road. we had a blast playing, and they even let us go around a second time for free!
dialogue: my friend and i spotted a mini-gold course when we were coming back from the next state over.
yes! that is actually amazing, you have a good friend!
i know! we played a round and they let us play a second round for free!
label: joyful
response: you are lucky! who won?

situation: excited for baby shower
dialogue: i feel excited about our upcoming baby shower
yay! is it a family member having a baby
i am having a baby boy!
label: excited
response: what?!?! that is amazing! starting a family i imagine can be surreal

situation: i cannot wait to go to california on vactaion next summer, i think i am going to universal studios
dialogue: i am really exited for my vacation next summer
oh yeah? where are you going?
