california, i really hope i get to go to universal studios
label: excited
response: that sounds like a lot of fun

situation: sad: when she left for 3 weeks i was alone
dialogue: when she left for 3 weeks i was alone
did you do anything special during your alone time?
nothing at all. i was kinda depressed
label: sad
response: that is not good, you should try to find an activity for when you are alone

situation: i wanted to make sure i got as good a grade as possible on my calculus final. in the two weeks leading up to the exam, i studies for at least 4 hours a day. when i went to take it, i felt confident i was ready.
dialogue: my calculus final was no joke! i started studying hard two weeks before the test.
that is insane, i usually give myself like 2 or 3 days.
trust me it all paid off. when i went in to take the test, i was absolutely solid on the material.
label: prepared
response: that is right! that is such a good feeling, just breezing through a test.

situation: lonely: she left for 3 weeks
dialogue: felt sad when she left for 3 weeks
where did she go?
to see her family. it sucked though because my car had broken down.
label: lonely
response: oh, i bet that was frustrating. did you get evey thing squared away and taken care of?

situation: content: i am happy with where we are now living
dialogue: i am happy with where we are now living
where are you living at?
a very nice complex with 3 pools!
label: content
response: that sounds amazing

situation: some time ago, i interviewed for a new job. it would've been a huge pay increase and something interesting to do so i really wanted the job. the interview went well and i waited for the employer to call me back.
dialogue: i interviewed for a new job and the interview went really well.
that is great to hear. what made you think it went well?
the interviewer made all the comments you would expect from a good interview and seemed to respond well to my answers.
label: hopeful
response: those are good signs! sounds like you hit it out of the park!

situation: the first time i ever played pool with my friend, we had to play for the table. she ended up beating 5 guys in a row! she
dialogue: some people are just naturals. the first time i played pool with a friend of mine, she had to beat the guy running the table.
pool's always a difficult game to pick up. i am guessing your first time went well?
i shot so-so, but my friend ended up winning the table and beating 5 guys in a row.
label: impressed
response: wow. talking about cleaning up.

situation: while in college, i was in the running for a scholarship. despite being fully qualified to receive it and meeting the criteria, it was given to someone else. i really wanted that scholarship.
dialogue: i did not receive a scholarship in college that i really wanted despite being qualified for it.
are you still going to attend it?
yes, i will still attend but the extra help would've been nice.
label: jealous
response: of course, but at least you can still afford it.

situation: hopeful: i know things will work out in god's perfect timing
dialogue: i know things will work out in god's perfect timing
yes, i agree, are you hoping for something in particular.
yes i am. for everything we want for the baby to be gifted to us
label: hopeful
response: that is a good hope. good luck with that.

situation: my sister graduated from college after a long road of persistence and determination.
dialogue: my sister graduated from college after a long road of persistence and determination.
that is great, i bet she is very proud of herself.
yes, she is. my family and i are very happy with her accomplishments.
label: proud
response: as you should be, so many young people give up before reaching their goals.

situation: lonely: i like being alone, but not feeling bad
dialogue: i like being alone, but not feeling bad when no one is around to talk to
me time is very crucial for anyone, it help one clear hi or her mind. we are so much alike.
it is true i do need my alone time
label: lonely
response: sort of reduces stress,very crucial

situation: disgusted: dog ate grass and then threw up
dialogue: dog ate grass and then threw up
oh no! hopefully he is ok. did you take him to the vet?
well she was ok. should not have been so silly
label: disgusted
response: what a silly dog than! she will learn to not do that again!

situation: joyful: so happy to be having a boy
dialogue: i am so happy to be having a boy
that is great! congratulations! is this your first child?
thanks. yes it is. i already got a crib and baby bath.
label: joyful
response: congratulations, again. parenthood is truly a great and wonderful experience.

situation: when i was younger, there was a car i really wanted. i had worked to make the money for it, but needed a bit more. however, for my birthday, my parents paid the rest and gave me the car.
dialogue: when i was younger, i worked really hard to save up money for a car, but needed a bit more. but on my birthday, my parents paid the rest for me.
that is so cool of them. that is how parents should be
i agree. i really wanted to do it myself, but it is something i will never forget.
label: surprised
response: we all need a little help sometimes

situation: i recently went on my first international trip by myself.
dialogue: i recently went on my first international trip by myself.
great, where did you go?
to visit my family for about 3 weeks, i got married a few years ago and my husband and i live pretty far from them now.
label: anxious
response: was it a good trip overall?

situation: impressed: i was very proud of her for flying all by herself
dialogue: i was very proud of her for flying all by herself
yes, flying is very hard to do.
especially with 2 full suitcases
label: impressed
response: yeah, and so little you can actually care on instead of checking.

situation: apprehensive: i do not generally trust people
dialogue: i do not generally trust people.
why do not you trust?
upbringing. dad use to say never trust anyone before i left for school every morning
label: apprehensive
response: he is correct. but you should trust some people whom you think they are good.

situation: i took my car to my mechanic, who i thought i could trust. he quoted me $1000 in parts and labor. i took it to another mechanic and he fixed it on the spot for $100.
dialogue: you just cannot trust people any more. my mechanic told me it was going to be $1000 to fix my jeep.
wow that sounds pretty high to me. what was wrong with it?
turns out, nothing much at all. a guy down the street got it running for $100.
label: angry
response: wow what a crook that other guy was!

situation: joyful: i am so happy that we are having a baby boy
dialogue: i am so happy that we are having a baby boy
congratulations! is this your first child?
yes it is. i am over the moon
label: joyful
response: i am so happy for you. have you two thought of a name yet?

situation: i have just completed my first international flight/trip by myself.
dialogue: i have just successfully completed my first international flight/trip by myself.
was it any fun?
yes, i got to see my family so it was great! i had to be very organized. the flights and layovers were kind of intense.
label: prepared
response: yes, i wish flying was a bit faster.

situation: disappointed: i was so sad to find out what she had done. found it on her facebook message history.
dialogue: i was so sad to find out what she had done. found it on her facebook message history.
oh no, what did she do
she met up with her ex to return his t-shirt.
label: disappointed
response: oof, that can get messy.

situation: i am currently expecting my first baby, it is a boy!
dialogue: i am currently expecting my first baby, it is a boy!
congratulations! when is it due?
october, right around the corner!
label: joyful
response: are you excited? do you have a name in mind?

situation: i went on a tubing trip with my girlfriends old friends from college. the float was only supposed to last four hours but we ended up being on the water for eight. i have not had that much fun in ages.
dialogue: i recently went tubing on a river with my girlfriend and her friends from college.
did you enjoy it?
i had a blast! it is supposedly a four hour float but we were out there for eight!
label: joyful
response: amazing! did you go down rapids and do scary stuff?

situation: my girlfriend had a 17 year old chihuahua. he ran away from a friends farm and died after being struck by a car.
dialogue: my girlfriend's dog was a 17 year old chihuahua who emerged from a bathroom at a party in 1999.
emerged from a bathroom? intiguing. what do you mean?
he just sort of showed up and no one knew where he came from. he passed away recently after running away from our friends farm and being struck by a car.
label: sad
response: oh i am sorry to hear that, but it sounds like he had a bit of character about him

situation: the first time my girlfriend picked me up for a date, i was still a total slob. my room was in shambles and my house was falling apart. she asked to use the bathroom, and i almost died when she saw the inside of the place.
dialogue: i cannot believe my girlfriend was still interested in me after she saw the slum i was living in.
it must be true love!
something like that. my room was in shambles and the house was falling apart! i was mortified when she asked to come inside.
label: ashamed
response: i feel like that sometimes but people have usually seen worse.

situation: once, i came home from a night out and my room was ransacked. my roommate was an alcoholic, and he had even thrown some of my belongings in the bathtub.of course, he did not remember doing it either.
dialogue: once after a night on the town, i came home and my room had been ransacked.
oh no! i bet you were terrified!
the thing is, my alcoholic room mate was the culprit. he had even thrown some of my belongings in the bathtub!
label: furious
response: were you guys angry or frustrated with each other?

situation: i am expecting my first child. it is going to be a boy! we are preparing the nursery and getting everything in order for his arrival!
dialogue: i am expecting my first child. it is going to be a boy! we are preparing the nursery and getting everything in order for his arrival!
must be such an exciting time for your family!
yes, it is!
label: joyful
response: be sure to get plenty of rest thought! its easy to lose sleep in such a time.

situation: a few months ago, a good friend of my girlfriend's passed away from a drug overdose. what is worse is, both his ex and his lover at the time kept using. i worry about them.
dialogue: a few months back, one of my girlfriend's close friends died from a heroin overdose.
oh, i am so sorry. were you also close to them?
i only met him a few times, but he touched a lot of people's lives.
label: sad
response: what a sad way to go. if only he could have gotten help.

situation: i went to school with a girl who was very timid. she sat in the back of class and never talked to anyone. she invited everyone to see her band, and she turned out to be a guitar prodigy!
dialogue: an extremely timid girl in my physics class invited the class to see her band play at a bar downtown.
wow hidden depths. are you going?
i actually went last friday night. turns out she is an incredible guitarist a real shredder!
label: impressed
response: amazing. just shows that you cannot judge a book by it is cover

situation: i was in an elevator inside an old building downtown. suddenly, the elevator screeched to a halt and the lights went out. we were stuck in there for hours.
dialogue: i am pretty sure everyone is scared of being trapped in an elevator, and i can confirm it is quite a shock.
oh my, did it happen to you recently?
yes just a couple weeks ago. the elevator screeched to a halt and the lights went out, and i have to confess i screamed.
label: terrified
response: that sounds terrifying! must have been like a nightmare for you.

situation: grateful: i thank god every day for the many blessings. especially our new home
dialogue: i thank god every day for the many blessings. especially our new home
when did you move in?
5 months ago now. it is really nice here, there are 3 swimming pools
label: grateful
response: 3!! amazing

situation: right after i had my baby, my husband was working second shift so he did not get home until 2am. i was changing the baby's diaper and the changing table was right in front of a window. the front porch is right in front of that window. as i am changing her diaper, i hear people running up and down the porch and banging on the walls. after that, i changed her diaper in the living room until my husband got home. i am glad all the doors and windows were locked.
dialogue: right after i had my baby, my husband worked second shift, so he did not get home until around 2am.
wow that is a tough schedule. especially with a new baby.

yeah, but it was not really a problem, until one night around 11pm. i was changing her diaper. the changing table was in front of a window, and i could hear people running up and down the porch in front of the window and they were banging on the house.
label: afraid
response: why were they doing that?

situation: i am a youth leader and recently one of the youth in my group was asked to speak at a local church. it did a great job and showed that he understood the bible very well. i was proud of him.
dialogue: i am a youth leader, and just the other day a teen from the group was asked to speak at a local church.
oh that is awesome! what was the teen asked to speak about? are they nervous?
he was nervous, he has to prepare an original message. he did really good, and he really showed and understanding of the bible.
label: impressed
response: when i was growing up i know that my youth leader made a huge impact on me, so it is really a great thing that you do working with kids.

situation: furious: i get so mad when i have to repeat myself
dialogue: i get so mad when i have to repeat myself
try not to get so tense, that can harm your health
i know. but it makes me stressed out
label: furious
response: take a deep breath and calm the discomfort .. that helps

situation: today i am happy, we go with my children to the movies and then to eat pizza
dialogue: hello . today i am happy, we go with my children to the movies and then to eat pizza
cool. pizza is my fav food. what movie you guys going to see?
the incredible . they love . it is going to be fun
label: prepared
response: i love that movie also. have fun

situation: graduating from college after spending as much money as i had was a weight off my shoulders. i knew it would be a new chapter in my life.
dialogue: graduating from college was a load off my shoulders.
wow i am so proud of that
thanks, it was a long journey.
label: grateful
response: was it expensive ? any student loans ?

situation: once, i was turned down for a job that i really wanted and i felt i would be a good fit at. it was really downing.
dialogue: i was turned down for a job i really thought i would be a good fit at.
did they give you any reason for not giving you the job?
someone else interviewed who had much more experience than i did.
label: disappointed
response: well, at least a candidate that deserved the job got it.

situation: i went to a really sketchy part of town once. just being there put me on edge.
dialogue: i went to a sketchy part of town once. just being there put me on edge.
i bet. i am not a very confrontational person so i do everything i can to avoid places like that
it was for work so i had to do it, but i typically avoid those places as well
label: apprehensive
response: you should bring it up to your boss at work for a security guard to accompany you next time!

situation: we were over at our friend's house for a dinner and i was in the kitchen helping her cook. i had melted butter in a baking dish to make dessert, and i poured cold milk into it like the recipe said to do. it ended up cracking the dish. i felt bad. i offered to buy her a new one.
dialogue: we went to a friend's house the other day for dinner. i was helping her cook. i was following the directions of a recipe and accidentally cracked her baking dish.
did you offer to replace the broken baking dish that you accidently broke?
yes, i did, but she would not even hear of it. she told me it was fine.
label: guilty
response: that sounds like a good friend, forgive and forget. she new you did not intend on breaking the baking dish.

situation: i am looking forward to moving into a easy place to take care of.
dialogue: i am looking forward to moving into a easy place to take care of.
that sounds good. are you moving soon?
no, not moving soon, only wanting to and looking around to see what is affordable.
label: anticipating
response: i hope you find something that you like and are happy with. its really important to be happy with where you live.

situation: i had enough money to cover an emergency expense for my family
dialogue: so i had an emergency come up for my family and i had enough money to cover it. i feel great for preparing!
that is always a good feeling. such a relief.
definitely! and they are paying me back, so it is not like i am losing money either.
label: proud
response: it was nice of you to step up and help out.

situation: i drank a lot of alcohol at a bbq party and puked.
dialogue: i drank a lot of alcohol at my friend's bbq party, and i ended up puking and passing out. not my finest moment.
haha, i can relate to that. i did that too, and my friends took a wonderful photo of it. they like to stick it on our yearly christmas cards to each other
hahahaha! well, i guess we can make light of even our worst moments.
label: embarrassed
response: you have to everyone has bad moments and if you cannot laugh at them, then they just eat you up!

situation: my eldest son just graduated from high school and i was so happy for him.
dialogue: my eldest son just graduated high school i was so proud.
how exciting! that is a great accomplishment.
it is kind of a surreal feeling tho, hard to accept that he is grown.  now college is about to start.
label: joyful
response: i know how you feel. my oldest is in her sophomore year of college.

situation: a customer came into my work and started getting angry at me
dialogue: so a customer just came into my work and started yelling at me for something that was not my fault. i hate when people do that!
did you talk to them politely or yell back ?
no, i did not yell back haha. i would get fired.
label: angry
response: what industry are you in, i find that a lot in retail and service

situation: it makes me angry when people never notice me
dialogue: it makes me angry when people never notice me
why what is it that you want them to notice about you that they bypass.
everything. i do not have friends so it is nice to get noticed
label: angry
response: i completely understand think of it as maybe they are not meant to be apart of your life, you will find some good friends just be patient.

situation: i get excited when i go swimming
dialogue: i get excited when i go swimming
what is exciting to you about swimming?
the fact of relaxing in a large pool of water. it just grabs my attention
label: excited
response: so you prefer a pool to an ocean?

situation: my wife was sick in bed, so i took care of her.
dialogue: my wife was not feeling so well, so i took care of her and made her some soup 3
that is so sweet i love a caring husband has she gotten better?
she is much better now! i love her so much, so i try to take good care of her.
label: caring
response: as you should a good husband is what keeps us women strong also good for you she is lucky to have you.

situation: i am so grateful to my family
dialogue: i am so grateful to my family
i feel you! what do they do for you?
they help me with whatever i need and they are always their for me.
label: grateful
response: its rare to have that! i have it now too. it is great to know you have someone to rely on and trust!

situation: i was surprised when my parents threw me a party
dialogue: i was surprised when my parents threw me a party
i bet that was a nice feeling
it really was. i am pretty thankful for them
label: surprised
response: i bet you were

situation: a big wind storm blew through my town and knocked over trees.  i looked outside and saw one of the trees in my yard was uprooted.  i worried that at any moment i would hear the crash of a tree or branch on my room, or the sound of breaking glass.
dialogue: a big wind storm blew through town and uprooted one of the trees in my yard.
yikes! was anything damaged?
no, but that was my fear. i kept waiting to hear the sound of a branch or tree hitting my roof, or breaking glass.
label: afraid
response: that is pretty scary. i am glad there was not any damage and that you are okay.

situation: i took my dog to an agility competition and she won first place!
dialogue: i took my dog to an agility competition and she ended up winning first place!
wow, congratulations! that must have taken a lot of training and practice.
thanks so much! it did, but she is so hard-working and i could not have done it without her.
label: proud
response: what kind of dog is she, and how long have you been competing like this?

situation: i was sad when my parents left me
dialogue: i was sad when my parents left me
did you stay with other relatives?
i stay with my older sister now
label: sad
response: do you enjoy that?

situation: my brother got a really high-paying job and now travels all over the world.  he sends pictures and talks endlessly about everything he buys, everywhere he goes, and how much money he makes.  it makes me feel insecure and like a failure.
dialogue: my brother got a really high-paying job and now spends all his time flaunting his money.
i bet that is kind of a pain. how are you dealing with it?
not very well! i mostly just stew and complain about it and wish i had his money and lifestyle.
label: jealous
response: i bet. it is so annoying when people show off like that.

situation: i was disgusted when my food had a hair in it
dialogue: i was disgusted when my food had a hair in it
ewww did you get a refund or at least a voucher ?
yeah i got a refund. they were very sorry about it and i forgave them
label: disgusted
response: i would have blasted them on yelp

situation: i was anxious when i went to the theme park
dialogue: i was anxious when i went to the theme park
what about the them park made you anxious?
the roller coasters
label: anxious
response: they can be really scary for people who do not like them.

situation: i was furious when my friend made fun of me in front of random strangers
dialogue: i was furious when my friend made fun of me in front of random strangers.
why did your friend do that to you?
i am not sure. he told me he was sorry afterwards but i did not listen to him
label: furious
response: i am not sure i would be able to forgive someone of something like that, it is really rude behavior.

situation: i feel so lonely because i have no friends
dialogue: i feel so lonely because i have no friends
i am sorry to hear that. have you tried joining clubs or hanging out with people from work?
i have not.  i am too shy and i am scared of what people will say
label: lonely
response: i know how that is.

situation: i was jealous when my girlfriend was talking to other guys
dialogue: i was jealous when my girlfriend was talking to other guys
i understand how you would feel that way. do you trust her around other guys?
i do not. i have trust issues
label: jealous
response: ah. that can be tough in a relationship.

situation: i was terrified when i watched that horror film in the theaters
dialogue: i was terrified when i watched that horror film in the theaters
i understand. horror movies freak me out, too. did you watch the whole thing?
i did but it was really a challenge for me.
label: terrified
response: i bet. i do not think i could sit through a whole one.

situation: i was sad when my dad died
dialogue: i was sad when my dad died
how long ago did that happen?
it happened 3 weeks ago
label: sad
response: i am so sorry to hear, if you need to talk to someone about it, i am here for you

situation: i was sad when my wife left me
dialogue: i was sad when my wife left me
she must not have loved you
i just do not know why she would marry me then.
label: sad
response: people change over time, is she thinking of coming back ?

situation: my family and i went the the beach on tues. spent the whole day. i cannot believe i barely got sun burnt.
dialogue: my family and i went to the beach on tues and spent the whole day there.
was the weather good?
one small thunderstorm but other than that great! i am amazed i did not really get burnt!
label: surprised
response: that is awesome, i am sure you can not wait to go back

situation: when someone talks down to me, it makes me sad.
dialogue: when someone talks down to me, it makes me sad
perhaps try telling the person how it makes you feel
i am just too shy to say anything. i do not know how
label: sad
response: have confidence in yourself and be stern about it.

situation: i am super joyful when my family comes together to eat dinner
dialogue: i am super joyful when my family comes together to eat dinner
that sounds nice. how often does this usually happen?
usually once a week. its a great feeling
label: joyful
response: i hope this continues for you for a long time.

situation: i was surprised when my parents threw me a big party
dialogue: i was surprised when my parents threw me a big party
was it for your birthday?
it was. i had a great time
label: surprised
response: did you guys get to eat the cake?

situation: i am so annoyed that people are so mean to other people
dialogue: i am so annoyed that people are so mean to other people
its just the way the world is now, social media has ruined humanity
that is so true! i do not know where this world is heading.
label: annoyed
response: it cannot get any better than it already is now.

situation: i get so jealous when my parents do not pay me any attention.
dialogue: i get so jealous when my parents do not pay me any attention.
have you told them how you feel?
i have not because i do not know how to start that conversation.
label: jealous
response: just sit them down and talk about the way they are treating you

situation: i was furious when my dog ate the wires to my television.
dialogue: i was furious when my dog ate the wires to my television
that must have been so annoying. hopefully you can just get a replacement.
yeah but it will take a few days because i have to wait for my paycheck
label: furious
response: i hope he does not do it again.

situation: i was woken again at 3:45am by my elephantine upstairs neighbor, who was apparently getting ready for work. i uttered a few choice words, i can tell you!
dialogue: so what happens in the middle of the night? i got woken, again, by my upstairs neighbor thumping around. does she have to be so rude?!
that is so annoying, some people just do not have morals
no, they do not. well, this time i have had enough. i have told management i want into another apartment and explained exactly why!
label: angry
response: can you afford to move ?

situation: i am a very trusting person. it gets me in trouble sometimes.
dialogue: i am a very trusting person. it gets me in trouble sometimes.
how does it get you into trouble?
people take advantage of me
label: trusting
response: i am sorry to hear that. i guess at least if helps you know you can trust in the future and who you cannot.

situation: i am only 6 months away from having my aa in healthcare administration. i cannot wait to start my new career.
dialogue: i am only 6 months away from having my aa in healthcare administration.
so proud of yourself right ?
i really am, i cannot wait to start my new career!
label: excited
response: you will be making more money

situation: going to the dentist always worries me.
dialogue: going to the dentist always has me on edge. i hate it!
i hate going to the dentist, too. you just gotta go through with it.
i know.it is a necessary evil. but it hurts so much!
label: anxious
response: by now, wish it was less painful, hu?

situation: a very dear friend of mine, against a mountain of challenges, got his dream job recently and is doing really well. i have so much respect for how tenacious he has been in getting information together and contacting the necessary people.
dialogue: one of my very dear friends got his dream job recently. he was so diligent in finding information and contacts. i so respect what he is achieved.
that is cool. i wish i had my dream job
well, it takes perseverance and a bit of luck, but you can do it!
label: proud
response: my dream job is being born rich. its too late for that

situation: the other night we started watching the red sox game in the second to last inning. they were losing and the next thing you know they were up by several runs. the game went into overtime but they did win and we were extremely happy.
dialogue: we started watching a red sox game near the end and they were losing. next thing you know, they were ahead four runs.
whoa that is always exciting. baseball can be boring at times.
yes, usually i think so too. but this was really fun to watch and we were so happy because it did not look good at first.
label: excited
response: i love sports. i am glad you got to experience that.

situation: my car that i hate is going to die soon and i will be able to get a new one
dialogue: my car that i hate is going to die soon and i will be able to get a new one. score!
woot! that is great! which brand are you thinking?
i am thinking something reliable. maybe a toyota or mazda.
label: joyful
response: toyota is a great choice

situation: i am so scared of bugs
dialogue: yesterday my husband opened a window and a huge black bug flew in! i almost died!
ew omg did you kill it?
heck no, i told my husband to deal with it. i ran in my bedroom and locked the door
label: afraid
response: eek! sounds frightening!

situation: a few weeks ago a neighbor of mine knocked on the door and handed me some scottish cheese (i am scottish). she had been in sf and saw the cheese, so bought some. what a special thing to do!
dialogue: well, do not you know, one of my neighbors who works for aa was in san francisco recently and saw some scottish cheese (i am scottish). so she bought some and brought it to me. how nice of her to do that!
that was nice! what does scottish cheese taste like?
this particular one was a cheddar and it tends to be from smaller producers and is creamier and more flavorful than the cheeses we typically get here.
label: surprised
response: cheddar is one of my favorites. i live pretty close to cabot creamery and i love their sharp cheddar.

situation: my brother would've turned 34 today
dialogue: my brother would've turned 34 today. he died 2 years ago and it still hurts so much
i am sorry to hear that, that is very sad. were you two close?
yes we were. he moved to the different country but we spoke pretty often
label: devastated
response: that is a bummer, i am sure he is looking out for you up above!

situation: i was going go to the beach the other day and it rained.
dialogue: i had planned to go to the beach with friends, but it looks like it is going to rain.
ah man, that is a buzz kill, are you still going to rough it out in the rain?
nah, it said there is be thunder and lightning, so looks like we are stuck inside
label: disappointed
response: ah dang, well there is always next weekend!

situation: my family came to visit me last weekend, i was looking forward to catching up with them.
dialogue: i spent last weekend with most of my family, they live out of state and i do not see them often.
did you have a good time visiting with them?
i did, yes. work has been hectic lately so i was really looking forward to unwinding with them.
label: anticipating
response: what did you guys do?

situation: i hate how much conflict there is our country. it makes me frustrated knowing how divided we have become.
dialogue: i hate how our country is so divided right now
it is, but i think it was all along and people are just standing up for what they believe in more now.
true. i hope we can become less divided in the future and solve things
label: sad
response: maybe, but i think the best we can hope for is tolerance.

situation: my father passed away 2 1/2 years ago. we did not know he had a life-threatening illness and it really traumatized our family. the unexpected loss was so agonizing and painful for us.
dialogue: my father passed away about 2 years ago. it was so very difficult for me and very unexpected. we did not know he had a life-threatening illness and were not prepared in any way for his sudden departure from us.
i am very sorry to hear that.  losing anyone close to you, especially a parent would be very hard.  are you close to other members of your family and were you able to help each other through it?
yes, my family and i are close and we were there for each other. but, my sister had passed away around 6 years before, by committed suicide. the last few years have been very difficult.
label: devastated
response: i bet it has.  keep sticking by with your family.  i am sure you are all there for each other more than you know.

situation: my sister was recently in town to visit my dad and i did not go and see her. i avoided her.
dialogue: i feel like a terrible sibling right now.
what did you do to feel that way?
my sister, who lives out of state and i do not see often, was recently in town visiting our dad. i did not visit with them.
label: guilty
response: i am sorry to hear that, you could make it up to them by going to visit?

situation: i am going to a concert in a few weeks. one my favorite bands is playing and the starting act is great too.
dialogue: i am going to a concert very soon.
cool! who are you going to see?
imagine dragon and grace vanderwhall, do you know them?
label: excited
response: of course! grace is so talented! she was on america's got talent, right? i get all those reality talent shows confused.

situation: i went to our property management office to request, for the third time, that i change my apartment. a new girl was there and assured me there was one available in september. she then proceeded to email me the details the next day. i was surprised and very pleased she did this as the others promised everything and delivered nothing!
dialogue: our new property management person is remarkably efficient. she emailed me details of a conversation we had yesterday. the others promise the earth and do not deliver!
wow, that sounds amazing!
it is. i have been trying to switch apartments for months and this is the first time someone has actually done anything about it.
label: impressed
response: great news then!

situation: school for my kids started this past thursday. i actually had all of their supplies and plenty of new clothes in time.
dialogue: school for my kids started again this past thursday.
how was that? were you excited for some more quiet and for them to get back on a schedule? or are you sad that it shows that they are getting older?
it was good. i am dealing with a mixture of both emotions about them being back in school. i was happy i had all the supplies, clothes, shoes, and other odds and ends in time.
label: prepared
response: ah, that is interesting you say that. i thought you would just be like everyone else, who say, "happy to nudge them out the door!" you sound like a good parent

situation: i had planned a beach trip about a month before we actually went. i had so much trouble containing myself until the trip actually happened.
dialogue: i had planned a beach trip about a month before we actually went.
what beach were you heading too?
we went to virginia beach earlier this week. i was so giddy up that whole month i could barely contain myself.
label: anxious
response: who all went with you? that sound so fun.

situation: the lottery was over 100 millions dollars and i just had to buy a ticket. i waiting for the numbers to be drawn to see if i won.
dialogue: i bought a ticket last week for the lottery, when it was over 100 million dollars.
did you win?
i was so excited watching the numbers being drawn, but no i did not win. but someone did! i am sure they were happy.
label: hopeful
response: winning those huge jackpots is always a curse.  go for a smaller win

situation: my husband just found out that his company is going to start giving him a monthly bonus! this was great news and quite unexpected!
dialogue: my husband just found out he will start getting a monthly bonus! this was unexpected and great news
that is so exciting. a little extra cash can always help.
it sure does. it came as a shock, but a pleasant one.
label: surprised
response: yes, that would be a great surprise. it can also take a lot of stress off of you.

situation: my son has been saving for 3 years and just bought his first house!
dialogue: i just went today to visit my son in his new house.
how was it
it was great! he has saved for so long to buy it.
label: proud
response: thats cool

situation: my family cannot agree on what to eat for dinner and its making me so mad!
dialogue: so tonight we are suppose to go eat out as a family but i cannot get a single one of my family members to agree on a place.  so frustrating!
you should make a wheel you can spin to decide.  i did that once.
that is actually not a bad idea.  wish i had come up with that earlier.  it seems everyone wants something different.
label: furious
response: yes you put all the places on it and spin.

situation: i am so happy that it is friday!
dialogue: i am so happy that it is friday!
oh me too! do you have a monday to friday type job?
somewhat, i work 4 10 hour shifts and have a random off day during the week. yesterday was my off day. what about you?
label: joyful
response: oh that is a pretty good schedule. i am a teacher so i am off right now. it is wonderful.

situation: i have been more dissappointed
dialogue: feels disappointed because my friend fights with me
maybe its time for a new friend.
no i cannot because i love him a lot
label: trusting
response: ask him to stop being a jerk?

situation: i am on a new diet for my lupus and it is critical that this work b/c the next steps to take care of my lupus are very powerful drugs that i do not want to take
dialogue: i have lupus and it is getting worse.  i asked my doctor for a chance to try a new diet i found that is suppose to help me with it.
oh dear, that must be difficult. are there medications to take that will help?
yes, but they are quite powerful which i am trying to avoid.  i am already on one and i am hoping that through this diet i can get off b/c the next steps will not be fun
label: anxious
response: oh, i am really sorry. that is for sure a challenge.

situation: one day there were terrible tornado's in our city! it destroyed homes and a school, and i was so petrified and fearful it would come by our home as well!
dialogue: some time ago, there was a terrible tornado that came through my city. it destroyed many homes, a school and some people died. i was so fearful and petrified it would come by our home and destroy it, or harm my family!
i am glad you were safe. tornados are not a fun thing to experience.
no, they are so awful! they can destroy so much.
label: terrified
response: have you only had to deal with one?

situation: my husband took me  to the mall to get a new wedding band since mine was breaking. it was a lovely thing for him to do, i had no idea he'd been saving up for it.
dialogue: my husband took me to get a new wedding band recently
well, that is very nice. i am sure you were looking forward to that shopping trip.
i did not know ahead of time! mine had broken a bit and he saved up to get me a new one.
label: surprised
response: that is was so thoughtful and sweet! seems like you are a lucky wife!

situation: every christmas i get a bit memory driven for my moms excellant decroates around the house. i love driving around lookign at everyones.
dialogue: i love the holidays. driving around looking at decoration is my favorite.
that is a lot of fun.  what is your favorite holiday to drive around in?
christmas. it makes me miss my moms decor.
label: nostalgic
response: i am sorry it makes you miss your moms decor.  at least you have those memories to hang onto.

situation: i have a wonderful sister-in-law who i am so incredibly thankful for.  whenever i am going through a hard time she is always there for me to talk or to offer an encouraging word.
dialogue: i have a wonderful sister-in-law.  who is always there for me when i need her
that must be comforting!  it is good to have people in your life that are supportive.
i feel so lucky to have her as a sister-in-law and a friend.  she is always there to offer a supporting ear and encouraging word.
label: grateful
response: do not ever take her for granted!  make sure she knows you are thankful!

situation: we recently went on vacation to the beach and there were several days of rain. this sucked, since we hadn't been to the beach in a very long time and really looking forward to being at the beach.
dialogue: a few weeks ago, we finally got a chance to get back to the beach for our vacation. but, it rained several days, so we did not get to spend as much time at the beach as we wanted, which sucked. we were really looking forward to it.
oh, i am sorry to hear that. do you not live close to a beach?
oh, no, it was about a 7 hour drive! my daughter was quite young when we went and did not remember the first trip and she is a teenager now. so, a long time since we first went.
label: disappointed
response: that must suck not living close to a beach. hopefully you get to go back real soon.

situation: my husband just got a promotion at work!  he has worked so hard to get this and i am very excited for him!
dialogue: my husband just a promotion at work he was really wanting
hah, seems we both had some luck. good for him!
i know.ha ha!  he worked so hard for this and i am so proud of him.
label: proud
response: you guys should go out and celebrate!

situation: my daughter's teenage boyfriend was in charge of taking care of our animals and home while we went on vacation. luckily, he is a good young man so we did not worry he would try to steal anything. we felt it was safe and in good hands.
dialogue: we took a vacation recently and had to leave my daughter's teenage boyfriend a key to our house so he could take care of the pets. he is a good young man, so we did not feel uncomfortable anything would come up missing.
lucky! i would not trust anyone in my house!
we did not have much choice, as we had an outdoor dog and indoor cat, so if we did not, we'd come back to not having pets. but, i would not just let anybody, that is for sure!
label: trusting
response: i am happy for you!

situation: my mother-in-law told a secret of mine that she promised she would never tell.  it hurt me and i really had to work on trusting her with other things i tell her
dialogue: my mother-in-law once told a secret of mine that she promised she would never tell
oh no! that is my greatest fear that people will tell my secrets
i know it really hurt me and i had to work on trusting her again with other things
label: angry
response: aw, perhaps she just slipped up? it does happen even to the best of us

situation: one night my children and i came home, and i saw a shadow inside the home when i came inside. my heart jumped into my throat and you could hear my scream in the next town for fear!
dialogue: one night when my children and i came home, i saw a shadow inside! i was so fearful and afraid!
oh that can be scary. i do not watch horror movies because i know that i will do just that!
it was so scary! luckily, it was actually my shadow! the light made my shadow show up, but it first appeared to be an intruder!
label: terrified
response: well i am glad you were ok! sometimes it is not just a shadow

situation: last weekend, my children, husband and i enjoyed a delicious meal and watched a movie together at home. it was relaxing and a good time.
dialogue: last weekend, my family and i enjoyed a nice meal together, and then watched a movie. it was a relaxing time at home, just enjoying each other's company.
that is the best kind of day.
yes, it was drama free and a relaxing time.
label: content
response: must have been so nice, what movie did you watch?

situation: my dog, riley had to be put to sleep due to congestive heart failure.  it was one of the hardest things i had to do.
dialogue: my dog, riley had to be put to sleep due to congestive heart failure
i am so sorry to hear about riley, i know he was an important part of the family. how is everyone holding up after the news?
it was one of the hardest things i had to go through but i know that riley is not suffering anymore so that helps
label: sad
response: yes that is true. you know there is peace in another place. he will always be remembered.

situation: i did not tell my friend when her boyfriend hit on me. i felt very bad and wrong for that, even though i turned him down, of course.
dialogue: i did not tell my friend when her boyfriend hit on me. she was in a bad spot and needed him for financial support, and that is why i did not tell her. but, i still felt so bad about it.
i can empathize with you there.  do you think there might be another way to let her know?
well, she had custody of her handicapped grandchild and no job, plus she was very much in love with him. i thought it would just make things worse for her.
label: guilty
response: well money is not everything, one day it will come out and then the timing will likely be worse.

situation: i am trying a new diet to treat my lupus.  i really am hoping it works b/c the next steps are some powerful meds that really make me nervous to take
dialogue: i am trying a new diet to treat my lupus.
really!  good for you!  are you excited to start or nervous?
i am nervous b/c so much rides on if this works or not.  if it does not than i have to take some really powerful meds that i would rather not take
label: afraid
response: it is ok to be nervous, but do not let it stop you!  no risk, no reward!

situation: there is a woman at work that will not listen when you try to explain a work task to her and will end up making many mistakes, which causes the rest of us more work. it is very frustrating and aggravating!
dialogue: there is a coworker that will not follow instructions on work assignments, so she makes many mistakes. it is so frustrating and aggravating, since it causes others more work.
that sucks, i work with people like that and it is just more work for other people
exactly! you try nicely to explain it to her over and over, but she will not listen. such a nuisance!
label: annoyed
response: that is horrible, you should tell the boss and get her fired

situation: one morning my mother came to pick my daughter up for school and told me she saw my daughter's cat dead outside.
dialogue: my mother picked my daughter up for school to take in the morning, and found her cat dead. it was so hard for my daughter and made us all very upset.
i bet it was.  death is never an easy thing to deal with, especially for a child.
yes, she was only about 9, and loved her cat so much. it broke my heart to see her so upset!
label: sad
response: i hope she will be alright!  i remember how devastated i was when my last dog passed away and i was an adult.  a kids emotions seem to amplify everything!

situation: i bought a scratch off ticket the other day and won $1000. it was a good day.
dialogue: i decided to play the lottery the other day and won.
you are lucky!
not normally, so i was quite surprised.
label: surprised
response: how much did you win?

situation: someone packed into my car the other day at the supermarket and put a big dent in it. i have only had the car for 10 days.
dialogue: i have a bad experience at the supermarket the other day.
oh no! what happened?
someone backed into my new car.
label: furious
response: oh geez, that is terrible!  did they run from the scene?  hopefully they left some information.  i was in a hit and run about 4 months after i bought my new car and i felt sick that it was already hit.

situation: one time my husband was acting a bit to helpful to a woman we know. he said he was only trying to be nice, but i felt he was being too friendly. maybe i overreacted.
dialogue: many years ago, we were at a friend's house and one of her friend's was there and she was drunk. my husband was very insistent on helping her, but i felt he was being a bit to 'helpful'. it made me a bit angry!
wow. do think he had bad intentions?

well, she was attractive and at the time, i thought he was thinking that too. but, i know now he was just trying to help her get to a safe place, since she was falling down. but, it was hard to see it at that time
label: jealous
response: i understand.

situation: someone hit my mailbox last night and knocked it over. they did not even have the guts to stop and tell me about it.
dialogue: i had a bad morning when i went to check my mail.
oh man.i hate checking the mail.it could be something crappy
especially when you find your mailbox laying in about 10 pieces after someone knocked it down last night.
label: furious
response: oh god- do you live in the country?

situation: my aunt came into town today, she could only stay for dinner. it made me upset it was only a few hours and not for the night.
dialogue: my aunt came to visit today, we went out for mexican food!
that sounds nice.  did you have a good time?
yes, kind of upset she was only able to stay in town for a few hours, she is on a road trip!
label: sad
response: that is a shame.  at least she made a stopover!

situation: i have a big exam, i have been studying like crazy. i hope i do well, i need to good on this exam.
dialogue: i have a big exam for college coming up, i have been studying day and night.
what is the exam on?
it is for my molecular biology class, i feel pretty good that i am going to ace it.
label: prepared
response: i wish you good luck!

situation: i went and saw a hockey game. it reminded me of playing growing up, i miss those days and the bond with my team.
dialogue: i went and saw a hockey game today, it was really exciting.
that is really cool! was it your first game ever?
no, i use to play growing up. i have not been to a game since graduating highschool.
label: nostalgic
response: well i think it really cool that you were able to get back into something that you used to do when you were younger!

situation: i saw a loose dog today, i wanted to take it home so bad. it worried me that it would get hit. i could not catch it.
dialogue: i was on a run today, and saw a loose dog but could not catch it before it ran off!
that is so interesting because i saw someone post the same thing on a neighborhood app just today.  is that you? ha ha.
maybe if you live in central texas.haha! but i was so worried about that small dog getting hit!
label: caring
response: ha ha, guess you were not the one.  that would've been crazy!  i hope its okay!  i am sure someone will try to grab it.

situation: i am an emotional mess today, found out my dad passed away. want to attend the funeral but tickets are expensive.
dialogue: i got some bad news today, my dad passed away.
oh my goodness that is terrible, i am so sorry!
thank you, i am a mess. it is still hasn't hit me that he passed away.
label: sad
response: i can imagine! my dad is my best friend i would be devasted

situation: it so quiet and cold in my house. wish my husband was home to keep me company. trying to relax but keep hearing noises.
dialogue: its so quiet in my house, my husband is out of town for work.
hey i like alone time!  just gotta find some cool stuff to do!
true, i am trying but keep hearing creepy noises. guess i need to turn the tv up louder haha
label: lonely
response: oh no!  the ghosts are coming! yeah turn the tv up loud :d

situation: i am so happy, my husband was offered a better paying job in his hometown. we move in november.
dialogue: i got some great news today! my husband got a better paying job offer!
holy cow that is awesome!  what are you going to do with all that extra moneys??
not sure yet, but itll help us life more comforatbly! we move to his hometown in november when he gets out of army!
label: grateful
response: that is pretty cool!  congrats!

situation: i feel so bad about myself, ate too many sweets. i am suppose to be on a diet.
dialogue: i ate way too many sweets today!
theres always tomorrow!
thanks! being on a diet is hard, espically with family in town!
label: guilty
response: you can do it!

situation: i was running today and felt like a car was following me. i was so creeped out. i need to start carying maze
dialogue: i was running today and felt like this car was following me.
that is really creepy.
yes it was, i think i need to start carrying pepper spray or something
label: afraid
response: also some kind of sound alert. you think you could scream for help during those times, but a lot of people actually do not.

situation: watching the bold type, one of my favourite characters father died. it was hard to watch
dialogue: i am watching the show the bold type, my favourtie characters dad died
is that a good show? i have never heard of it
yes, it is a great girly drama! reminds me of sex in the city but modern.
label: sentimental
response: nice! what channel?

situation: it is been a peaceful night! i have a nice cold drink and watching my favouite show. life is good.
dialogue: it is been a great night! i am just relaxing with a cold drink and my favourite show!
that does sound like a great night! i think i am overdue for one of those myself!
yes defenitly, it dosen't get better then this! my daughter has been fast asleep since 8pm.
label: content
response: that is great. it is nice when we get some peaceful time for ourselves.

situation: we are moving. nervous about what the future hold for me and my family.
dialogue: my family is moving from texas to arkansas in a few months,  i am worried for the change.
that is a big change!  are you moving due to a job or something like that?
my husband is getting out of the army and moving back to his hometown where he has a few job offers! big changes coming.
label: apprehensive
response: yes, that is definitely a big change.  i hope you settle in quickly though change like that can be a drastic lifestyle upheaval, but it could also be the best thing ever!

situation: we recently was able to purchase a new home. we have been saving money for 4 years to be able to afford the home of our dreams. we are really thankful that we got it.
dialogue: i recently moved into a new home.
nice. do you like your new neighborhood?
yes, there are a lot of kids that our daughter can play with.
label: grateful
response: that is great. why did you move?

situation: i had a doctors appointment today and i had to wait over an hour of my appointment time before i saw the doctor.
dialogue: i had a doctors appointment today.
i am not a fan of doctors most of the time how did it go?
i was so mad because i had to wait a hour after my appointment time before they called me back.
label: annoyed
response: i cannot stand that they should not schedule people so close together if they cannot handle that pace.

situation: when i moved in to my new apartment, a cat would come every night begging for food. i eventually adopted him.
dialogue: i had just moved in to my new apartment, and every night this skinny little tabby came begging for food at my door.
aww did you feed the cat?
at first i tried to resist, but i ended up adopting him!
label: caring
response: that is how we have our cat also how funny!  they are just irrestible at some point are not they?

situation: someone called my house last night at 2 in the morning and woke me up. it was a wrong number but they did not believe me when i told them i did not know a bret.
dialogue: i received a wrong number call last night at 2 in the morning.
ugh!  i am assuming that it woke you up?
yes! it was so aggravating. they would not believe me when i kept telling them it was the wrong number.
label: annoyed
response: oh my goodness!  how irritating!  i hope they did not call back?

situation: i recently found out that i am having baby number 4.
dialogue: i recently found out that i am having baby number 4.
no way! congrats! i am having twins sometime this coming week
wow! that is great. we were thrilled because we did not know if we were going to have anymore and nature just decided for us.
label: surprised
response: that is nice! kids are great

situation: for halloween last year, i dressed as a plague doctor. i could not wait for my friends to see how scary i looked!
dialogue: halloween is quite a big holiday where i live. people get really in to their costumes!
i have always loved halloween! some people get crazy creative!
it is peoples creativity that makes it so entertaining. last year i went as a plague doctor, and everyone agreed it was terrifying!
label: excited
response: that is awesome! now that i have kids, i have even more of an excuse to go out and check out what creative ideas people have every year.

situation: last year we lost our home of 20 years to a house fire. we lost all of our belongings but thankfully nobody was hurt.
dialogue: last year we lost our home of 20 years to a house fire.
oh no!  i cannot even imagine that was everyone ok?
yes, thankfully everybody was safe. nobody was even home when it happened.
label: devastated
response: i am so glad that everyone was ok.  but i know that was devastating did you rebuild?

situation: once while on a road trip, a friend and i got lost in the dessert. we flagged down a man driving an old chevy, and he gave us directions back to civilization.
dialogue: when me and my friend got lost in the desert, i thought we were done for.
scary! how long were you lost for?
only a couple of hours. we flagged down an old chevy truck and the man driving got us sorted out.
label: grateful
response: oh good.. i was imagining days

situation: we just went to meet our daughters new teacher and i really liked her. she showed us her schedule for the year and told us about everything she planned to do with the kids and i was really impressed.
dialogue: i went tonight to meet my daughters teacher.
do you think she will be a good teacher for your daughter?
yes, i think she will be a great teacher. she showed us her plan for the year and i think it was great.
label: impressed
response: a good teacher makes a huge difference in how well the child learns and how much influence the parents are allowed to have i hope your daughter has a great year.

situation: i just finished watching a movie and it was so gross. i do not normally like watching gory shows but my husband wanted to watch it.
dialogue: i just finished watching the saw movie.
i just cannot watch horror movies!  did you like it?
i hated it! i did not want to watch it but my husband did. the gore is just too much!
label: disgusted
response: oh i am right there with you!  the last scary movie i watched made it where i could not sleep that night.

situation: i was just going through all my high school yearbooks and it made me miss old times. it is crazy how time goes by so fast.
dialogue: i recently went down memory lane was looked at all my high school yearbooks.
oh yeah?  do you still look awesome like you did back then?
well. maybe not as awesome. but i do try to keep in shape. it was good seeing all my old friends.
label: sentimental
response: yeah i bet.  do you still keep in touch with any of them?

situation: i was leaving the grocery store today and some man flagged me down. i was scared at first to stop but then he hollered that i left my purse on top of the car. i could not believe that i done that.
dialogue: i had this guy flag me down today after leaving the store.
what did he want?  it is kinda scary when that happens, you never know what they want.
i was scared at first and then he hollered and pointed to the top of my car and i had left my purse on it. boy, did my face get red.
label: embarrassed
response: well a good samaritan after all!  i am sure you were embarrassed, but also glad that you did not lose your purse!

situation: my daughter just bought her first car on her own. she saved for the last two summers to be able to afford it.
dialogue: my daughter just bought her first car on her own.
nice! what kind of car is it?
it is a 2008 mustang. she worked the last two summers to buy it.
label: proud
response: well deserved! i hope she enjoys it to the fullest!

situation: we are leaving for vacation tomorrow. we are going to florida for 10 days.
dialogue: i am leaving tomorrow to go on vacation!
hey that is awesome!  where ya goin?
we are going to daytona and orlando for 10 days.
label: excited
response: holy cow that is awesome!  that is gonna be a fun 10 days!

situation: my husband and i are planning a weekend trip together. we are going to the casino and have some fun! we are pretty happy about it.
dialogue: my husband and i have a fun weekend trip planned soon. we are going to go to the casino for the weekend, just the two of us. we are really looking forward to it.
that is a nice getaway
yes, it is been awhile since we had just some time for us. plus, we love blackjack!
label: excited
response: have fun!!

situation: i had a friend's boyfriend that hit on me, even though i am also married, and he was with my good friend for 5 years! he makes me sick!
dialogue: i have a very good friend and her live-in boyfriend of 5 years hit on me! i am married, and he did not care. he sickens me!
yikes that is pretty horrible
yes, i was really surprised and i find it terrible behavior.
label: disgusted
response: just seems so inappropriate and disgusting

situation: a time that i was feeling a bit nostalgic, was this last vacation a few weeks ago. it made me think of the last vacation with my father, before he passed away.
dialogue: we went on a vacation a few weeks ago, and it really made me think back to our last vacation. it was with my father, the last one before he passed away.
oh wow, i hope you cherished your time with him.
i did, but of course, wished i had more time. he passed away unexpectedly, so i was going over that vacation in my mind too. i miss him.
label: sentimental
response: sorry that that happened to you, i hope you are doing well.

situation: i recently won on a lottery ticket! i never win, so it was a pleasant shock.
dialogue: i was pleasantly shocked the other day when i won on a lottery ticket! i hardly ever win and i won $200!
what did you do with the money/
i just tucked it back for a rainy day. but, i may splurge with it this weekend, since it was unexpected.
label: surprised
response: that is smart. how often do you play the lottery/

situation: while in college, i received a prestigious award. while it had been available to be awarded for some years, i was the first recipient.
dialogue: i was the first person to receive a pretigious award at my college after years of the award being on offer.
that is great. where is the award displayed?
at the department office back at the school.
label: proud
response: cool. will you leave it there forever?

situation: a coworker mad me very mad one day. she slammed a large order of work on my desk and basically demanded that i do it! she has no right to do that.
dialogue: one of my coworkers really ticked me off one day. she decided she would delegate some work to me by slamming on my desk and demanding i do it. she had some nerve!
did you get mad at her?
yes, she does not have the right to do that. i have been that many years longer than her, and it was her work! i let her know it too.
label: angry
response: hopefully she will not do it again.

situation: i had a cousin that was not going to buy her child anything for christmas one year. my husband and i could not stand that, so we purchased his 'santa' gifts.
dialogue: one year my cousin was not going to get her young son anything for christmas. it broke my heart so my husband and i bought his santa gifts that year.
that was very nice of you.
the little guy deserved a christmas and we really loved him.
label: caring
response: that is showing the christmas spirit.

situation: i tripped over a big cord at the fair last year and fell down! it was in front of many people and i wanted to disappear!
dialogue: when i went to the fair last year, i tripped on a large cord they had going across the walkway. it was a long, running fall! i wanted to hide!
did you hurt yourself?
scuffed knees, but mainly my pride. i was also in front an attractive guy i knew so it was even worse.
label: embarrassed
response: he probably forgot about it already.

situation: my husband and i have been able to finally get a bit of savings and financial security. i am so appreciative that we can have that, as many cannot.
dialogue: my husband and i are at a point in our lives, we are able to save, afford all that we need and save for retirement. i am so appreciate we can, as i know many are not able to do that.
you must of been hard working.
yes, we have been working hard, as well as not always getting all the extras we would like at times. but, it is worth having some financial freedom!
label: grateful
response: that is great news. congrats.

situation: one day i fell at work while i was pregnant. luckily, me and the baby did not get hurt. but, i wished i could have quickly waddled away!
dialogue: one day at work while i was pregnant, i fell! luckily, the baby and i were not hurt, but i wanted to waddle away so fast!
oh no!  i bet that was embarassing
yes, it really was quite so!
label: embarrassed
response: i am glad you are okay.  did you have the baby yet??

situation: my husband really is away from home quite often, due for his job. it can be hard at times, and make me feel a bit alone.
dialogue: there are times i feel a bit alone and down. my husband has to travel out of town for work quite often.
do you not have friends?
well, yes, of course. but, that is not quite the same, is it.
label: lonely
response: true, but better than nothing.

situation: i was feeling a bit apprehensive lately, since my children are going back to school. one to college, the other to high school. they grow up so fast!
dialogue: my children recently started school again and it made me feel a bit apprehensive. they are growing up so quick, and i know it will not be long before they sadly move out of the house
oh man well at least its a good thing to see them grow
for sure! but, it flies by before you know it. i get my nerves on edge when i think about them all moved out of the house.
label: anxious
response: thats fair enough

situation: despite working until a few hours before, i scored highly on the act the first time i took it back in high school years ago. i thought i would do poorly because i was tired.
dialogue: despite working until a few hours before, i scored highly on the act the first time i took it back in high school years ago.
wow that is impressive!
thanks. i thought i would do poorly because i was tired.
label: surprised
response: that is what i thought when i did it but i got a 34.

situation: my husband planned a secret weekend trip for us not too long ago! i did not have a clue about it and loved going with him, so much fun!
dialogue: not that long ago, my husband planned a secret trip for us! i did not have a clue he was doing it and was pleasantly shocked. it was so much fun!
where did he take you to?
we just took a weekend trip to tunica, ms. we stayed at a really nice casino hotel and just played some blackjack, enjoyed good food and each other's company!
label: surprised
response: i love tunica. did you win at blackjack?

situation: i felt pretty bad one time when i lied to my mother about where i was going. i do not like to be dishonest with her, so my conscience was feeling rough!
dialogue: i lied to my mother one day about where i was going. it made me feel pretty bad and have a bad conscience.
oh no. hy did you do it?
she did not want me going with that friend, but i wanted to go, so i lied to her. i was much younger then.
label: guilty
response: did she find out?

situation: i won a free trip to florida. it is not the best vacation, but i will take it for free.
dialogue: i won a free trip to florida. it is not the best vacation, but i will take it for free.
why was not it good? florida sounds like an ideal destination.
i have been to florida many times before so it wears on you.
label: excited
response: i know what you mean but hey like you said, it was free.

situation: i won a lottery for a small amount of money. it is always nice to get something for free.
dialogue: i won a lottery for a small amount of money.
awesome, are you a millionaire now?
no, i wish. it was only a few hundred dollars.
label: surprised
response: at least you won something though. i have never won anything from the lottery.

situation: a good friend of mine moved away recently and we lost contact. i really wish we would still speak.
dialogue: a good friend of mine moved away recently and we lost contact. i really wish we would still speak.
i know how that feels. maybe try reaching out.
that is a good idea. maybe i will try that soon.
label: sad
response: sometimes you have to be the bigger person

situation: someone was speeding on the road and i got into an accident with them. my car was totalled because of their carelessness.
dialogue: someone was speeding on the road and i got into an accident with them. my car was totalled because of their carelessness.
dang that is really annoying.  is your insurance going to cover it?
yes, but not as much as the car was worth and it was not an enjoyable situation.
label: furious
response: yeah dealing with an accident is one of the most aggravating things.

situation: i let a friend watch my dog for a week while i was out of town. i would've been devastated if anything happened to him.
dialogue: i let a friend watch my dog for a week while i was out of town. i would've been devastated if anything happened to him.
trust your god feeling, everything will be alright
i hope so. i have only had my dog for a short time and this is my first time away from him.
label: trusting
response: did you buy all the essential items the dog will need?

situation: i have been very satisfied with life recently. my relationships are going well.
dialogue: i have been feeling great about life recently. my relationships have been going very well
nice! are you married?
i am not, but i have a person i am very fond of. are you?
label: content
response: i am forever alone. however, i hope you continue to have great relationships and a great life!

situation: i got a great gift in the mail yesterday. someone sent me a pretty vase that i think is gorgeous. there was no note or return address so i do not know who it was from.
dialogue: i got a surprise gift in the mail yesterday.
wow! what was it?
a gorgeous vase. it is so pretty. i have no idea who sent it.
label: surprised
response: i would like to see this vase. do you like flowers?

situation: my sister accidentally broke a vase of mine yesterday! i was super upset!
dialogue: my sister broke my vase. i was pretty enraged!
what did you do ?
i scolded her but then told her it was okay, but it is not the biggest deal!
label: furious
response: yea that is true

situation: my daughter called me last night to tell me my grandbaby is in the hospital. they live so far away and it breaks my heart that i am not there to help or just be there for her.
dialogue: i am am upset today because my daughter who lives really far away called and said her baby was admitted to the hospital.
oh no. what happeneed
he was premature so he is been having some breathing issues. i hate not being there.
label: sad
response: ah i hope it all turns out well for you all

situation: i am impressed by the contestants on face off and their abilities to imagine and create new creatures.
dialogue: i am so taken by the talents of contestants on the show face off, have you ever seen it?
i have, that is a very cool show
their abilities to both imagine and create their characters is incredible!
label: impressed
response: they are very talented on there

situation: most people know toys-r-us shut down completely recently. it really made all my friends and i think back on the times we had there.
dialogue: a lot people know toys-r-us has completely shut down not long ago.
yea i remember it seeing go away a few months back, sad.
yeah, a lot of my friends and i got to thinking of all our memories there. really makes you think back.
label: nostalgic
response: yea those were the gold ole days

situation: i forgot it was my sisters birthday. i just saw on facebook that it was yesterday. i feel so bad!
dialogue: i feel so bad, i forgot my sisters birthday.
oh no, i am sure you can make it up to her
yes i plan on it, its just been stressful time at home with a toddler, it slipped my mind
label: guilty
response: well you have busy, it happens

situation: i could not imagine ever cheating on my husband. i love him so much and do not want anything bad to ever happen like that.
dialogue: i love my husband so much i could never cheat on him.
love is a great thing, i am happy for you
yea, i would not want to hurt him, i cannot understand anyone who does.
label: faithful
response: yeah, people can be unpredictable sometimes

situation: it can be really tough when your kids are older and both them and your husband have electronics. i can be sitting in a room with them all and still feel as if no one is here.
dialogue: it can be really tough when your husband and teenagers have electronics.
you need to take them away!
i do for family time but sometimes i can sit in a full room and still feel no one is there
label: lonely
response: yea i just take them away and let them cry it out.

situation: i am going out to dinner with my husband tomorrow, it is his birthday! we have not had a date night in months!
dialogue: tomorrow is my husbands birthday!
that is great!  do you have anything fun planned for him
yes, we are going out for a nice dinner. we have not been on a date in months!
label: excited
response: that sounds like a good birthday.  i hope you guys have fun

situation: i get sentimental during the holidays. i think back to the ones i had as a kid.
dialogue: i love the holidays, that make think back to being a kid.
ah same here. if only we had more holidays in a year!
yea, that would really be great. or maybe we'd get bored.
label: nostalgic
response: i guess we'll never though unless something monumental happens, and we get another holiday.

situation: going through a big storm in my city, nervous about damage to my house from strong winds and rain. i hope i can sleep tonight.
dialogue: there is a big storm going on in my town right now!
o? same here. i love storms.
i do not, it makes me nervous with the strong winds and rain!
label: terrified
response: be careful and do not go outside then.

situation: i like that a game i love is coming out monday. i am really excited about this.
dialogue: my favorite game has an expansion on monday, i cannot wait.
nice! what game?
world of warcraft, it is been my favorite for years.
label: joyful
response: oh cool, i have heard of it but never played, i am not too good with games.

situation: i have been feeling so blessed! i randomly got a promotion at work, was not expecting it.
dialogue: i just got a promotion at my job!
i am happy for you. what kind of work
i work in human resources for a big company, i was not expecting the promotion! feel blessed
label: grateful
response: that sounds like a nice job

situation: i really like all the shelves in my house to be arranged just so. it really bothers me when people put random stuff on them, like cups or papers.
dialogue: i really like every shelf in my house to be arranged just so.
i feel you! do you have everything facing the right way?
i do, everything is in it is place. it thoroughly bothers me when someone puts random stuff on them, like cups or papers.
label: annoyed
response: oh well, it happens though, do not be too hard on people!

situation: i just found out my husband is cheating on me. i am so disgusted not sure what to do next.
dialogue: i just found out my husband is cheating on me.
that is terrible. do you know how long it is been going on?
a few months, i am not sure what my next move is. staying in a hotel for a few days to think.
label: angry
response: i am so sorry to hear that. what did he say?

situation: my daughter is finally potty trained! i am so happy and will save lots of money not buying diapers.
dialogue: my daughter is finally fully potty trained!
good for her! she must be quite proud of herself.
yes, i am very happy as well! no more buying diapers haha
label: proud
response: oh gosh. diapers are really expensive. i forget all about that.

situation: i have a new adorable puppy and it needs so much attention. but it is worth it, i am totally in love.
dialogue: so, my new puppy is adorable though maybe not as amazing yet as yours.
oh they are all amazing in their own ways!
she is so cute and fun, i love her already.
label: caring
response: what breed is she?

situation: i started doing more research on salaries for the degree i will have in 6 months. i am eager to see if the statistics are accurate.
dialogue: i started doing more research on salaries for the degree i will have in 6 months.
nice. how much do you expect to make?
it seems to be about 60,000 per year just out of college. i am eager to see if the statistics are correct.
label: hopeful
response: that is a pretty good sum of money. i hope you start there as well!

situation: i was jealous the other day when  a friend got an item i wanted in a game. it may sound silly, but sometimes it is the little things.
dialogue: i know it is silly, but my friend got something i wanted in a game the other day, bit sad.
we are all human so having a feeling like that is understandable.
i guess, little things at times right?
label: jealous
response: yea, i am always surprised at how much i sweat the little things.

situation: i saw lion king today with my daughter, reminded me of my childhood watching it with my mom.
dialogue: i watched the lion king today with my daughter, reminded me of my childhood.
thats a good movie, cannot wait for the live action version coming out
yes! i am excited for that as well. i watched the movie with my mom when it first came out!
label: nostalgic
response: thats  awesome

situation: i was sad the other day because i found out a friend is moving. it is not that far and i did not see her a lot anyway but still.
dialogue: opps. ok, i mean that i was sad the other day because a friend is moving.
label: sad
response: is it far away_

situation: i think i might loose my job over something that was not my fault.
dialogue: i have been having a rough week!
are you glad its over?
yes but i am afraid i might loose my job.
label: annoyed
response: i am sorry, any backup options?

situation: i think it is tragic what our country is like right now. we are falling apart as a society.
dialogue: i hate how our country is right now.
why do you say that
people just cannot seem to get along, makes me sad.
label: devastated
response: that is very true sadly

situation: i spent all weekend by myself, wish i was closer to my family.
dialogue: i spent all weekend alone, wish my family lived closer.
i know what you mean. my family is 800 miles away
