my family is over 2,000 miles away in alaska, its tough!
label: lonely
response: i feel for you. it really makes life tough when you cannot just take a drive down the road and see them.

situation: my husband woke up with a terrible toothache and his face swollen yesterday. i was his nurse all day, giving meds and anything else he needed.
dialogue: my husband woke up with his face swollen and a terrible toothache
that is horrible. did he get to go to the dentist yet?
not yet, but i was his bedside nurse all day. anything he needed i was sure to get.
label: caring
response: that is very kind of you to be there for him like that.

situation: my dog just passed away two nights ago. she was 12 years old.
dialogue: ah, it is been rough. my dog passed away two nights ago.
oh no that is awful. i am sorry for your loss!
thank you, she was 12 years old so i knew it was coming but still shook up about it.
label: devastated
response: yes, we can never be truly ready to lose our babies like that. i have been through it several times. at least they are happy and pain free now.

situation: i was startled last night by some bad storms. they knocked out the power for a few hours.
dialogue: i hate when it storms so bad the power goes out
me too. it worries me that all the food will spoil and my animals will get overheated
i agree.
label: terrified
response: does your power go out alot where you live? it only happens a few times a year here thankfully

situation: i was cleaning my closet and found a hundred dollar bill. it was so nice to have some extra cash.
dialogue: i found a hundred dollar bill when cleaning my closet!
wow. do you remember losing it?
no! i am not sure where it came from! and i live alone :o
label: surprised
response: that is weird

situation: there was a huge spider on my wall! i think it was a wolf spider.
dialogue: there was a huge spider on my wall, it ran away before i could kill it.
i am so afraid of spiders
me too, i think it was a wolf spider. i hope i can sleep tonight
label: terrified
response: i have no idea what a wolf spider is. it sounds terrible though

situation: i am so nervous, have a big exam coming up. i hope i do good.
dialogue: i am so nervous, have a final exam on tuesday!
do you think you will do well?
yes, i have been studying a lot but still worried. i need to get a good grade!
label: anxious
response: what class is it?

situation: i have to give a speech on thursday, i am so nervous. giving speeches is one of my least favorite thigns to do.
dialogue: i have to give a speech on thursday.
are you prepared?
yes. but mentally i am never ready to give a speech if i am being honest.
label: apprehensive
response: i relate, what is the speech on?

situation: i was satisfied last week when i made some money selling stuff i did not need. it made room in my house and got me some extra cash, win win.
dialogue: i sold some stuff i did not need last week.
did yo make some good money?
yea, enought to have great weekened anyway.
label: content
response: i cold use some money like that

situation: i think have faith in someone is important in life. i have that with my husband without a doubt.
dialogue: i think that my husband and me have so much faith in each other.
thats awesome to hear, a lot of people cheat on each other frequently and do not care anymore
i know, i cannot do that. i think it is very important to be honest in your love life.
label: trusting
response: i believe so too , if people are gonna cheat why get married at all

situation: ten years ago now, a massive hurricane forced my family to evacuate. i did not know if there would be anything to come back to.
dialogue: ten years ago now, a massive hurricane forced my family to evacuate. i did not know if there would be anything to come back to.
that is awful, but better safe than sorry. how were things when you came back?
pretty messed up, but the house was still standing.
label: afraid
response: that is a silver lining in all of it at least!

situation: was travelling 14 hours internationally. first flight got delayed and the airline would not apologize and provide altenative
dialogue: was travelling 14 hours internationally. first flight got delayed and the airline would not apologize and provide altenative
that is terrible. i thought they had to offer some sort of alternative. what airline was it?
british airways. they claimed because they do not have ties to the connecting, they could not
label: angry
response: i have never trusted british airways.

situation: i have felt excited when i found out i had won a place on a prestigious creative writing course, taught by someone who i knew could help me in ways that i would i not be able to through self-study alone.
dialogue: i have felt excited when i found out i had won a place on a prestigious creative writing course, taught by someone who i knew could help me in ways that i would i not be able to through self-study alone.
you are so lucky to be talented enough to achieve such an honor. was it as wonderful as you had imagined it would be?

thank you for the kind words. you know what? it was, but not for the reasons i imagined! it turned out that everyone in the class developed a really close bond and while the advice from the teacher was wonderful, it was the lifelong friendships and mutual edits that the students do for each other that has proved equally special!
label: excited
response: sounds like it was a once in a lifetime experience.

situation: i like going fishing, it reminds me of when i would go with my dad when i was a kid.
dialogue: i like going fishing, it reminds me of when i would go with my dad when i was a kid.
do you have any kids?
i do, i have a 6 month old boy. how about you?
label: nostalgic
response: i have 3- i bet you cannot wait to take him fishing.

situation: i dropped all my food in the cafeteria the other day. everybody was staring at me.
dialogue: i dropped all my food in the cafeteria the other day. everybody was staring at me.
was it at college?
no, it was at work.
label: embarrassed
response: oh wow! did you get it all over youself?

situation: i once accidently ran down the battery on my car when i mid-judged how long i could run the radio for without the engine running. it was 5am and i was in the middle of nowhere. i called the first person i could think of who could help and they came with crocodile clips and recharged the battery. i felt so grateful to be on the receiving end of a kind act. i was also embarrassed that i had let that happen and i learned from it!
dialogue: i once accidently ran down the battery on my car when i mid-judged how long i could run the radio for without the engine running. it was 5am and i was in the middle of nowhere. i called the first person i could think of who could help and they came with crocodile clips and recharged the battery. i felt so grateful to be on the receiving end of a kind act. i was also embarrassed that i had let that happen and i learned from it!
that sounds like a really stressful situation. it is really good to know that there are still helpful people out there!
yeah for sure! it was one of those things that once it happens once then you definitely know the limits of the car's battery power without engine running so you make sure it will not happen again!
label: grateful
response: i am glad you've put a positive spin on it

situation: i am ready for college football to start. i cannot wait for kickoff weekend!
dialogue: i am ready for college football to start. i cannot wait for kickoff weekend!
who do you support?
auburn tigers
label: anticipating
response: cool. do you play football too?

situation: i was in the grocery store and dropped a can of pasta sauce and it made a huge mess.
dialogue: i did something really foolish at the grocery store yesterday.
oh no! what did you do?
i was reaching for some pasta sauce and knocked a few of them over. they shattered on the ground a such a huge mess that two workers had to come mop it up.
label: embarrassed
response: oh yikes! that is a bummer. i am sure the employees see that kind of thing all the time, though.

situation: my brother graduated college from a prestigious school.
dialogue: i cannot believe he did it! i just went to my brother's graduation ceremony at princeton.
oh that is super excited! i am sure you are really proud of him.
oh yeah, definitely! he put in a ton of work and it all paid off!
label: proud
response: that is super great to hear! well deserved.

situation: i once had a long walk home from the railway station with two very heavy bags. it turned out that another person had also missed the last bus and had to walk much of the journey with me as his home was in the same direction as mine. the two bags i had had some expensive dj equipment but they were very heavy so when they guy who had to walk home the same way said he would help by carrying one of the bags i trusted him! he did not disappoint, he helped me get home earlier and without a bad back; while the kindness of strangers made what a potentially bad night to a reasonably pleasant one all down to trust!
dialogue: i once had a long walk home from the railway station with two very heavy bags. it turned out that another person had also missed the last bus and had to walk much of the journey with me as his home was in the same direction as mine. the two bags i had had some expensive dj equipment but they were very heavy so when they guy who had to walk home the same way said he would help by carrying one of the bags i trusted him! he did not disappoint, he helped me get home earlier and without a bad back; while the kindness of strangers made what a potentially bad night to a reasonably pleasant one all down to trust!
what a nice guy.  there are fewer and fewer of those every day.

it is one of those things that in the day time you might expect but this was like 1am so i am sure he would have wanted to get home as soon as he could but he chose to make his night harder to make my night easier.
label: trusting
response: are you goings going to stay friends?

situation: i was so mad when i went to work the other morning when i was going to work and my neighbors dog jumped up on me and knocked me over. i hurt my back and could not go to work. the dog needs to be on a leash.
dialogue: i was really mad when i walked out my door the other day to go to work and my neighbors big dog jumped up on me and knocked me over.
did you get hurt?
yes, i hurt my back and could not even go to work. should not the dog be on a leash. ugh!
label: angry
response: i hope you get better soon!

situation: my transmission in my car went out the other day, maybe it will not be too expensive to repair.
dialogue: my transmission in my car went out the other day, maybe it will not be too expensive to repair.
that is never fun!  large unexpected expenses are the worst
yes they are. i had just put a down payment on a house too, so my money is tied up.
label: hopeful
response: oh no! at least you have something to look forward to, the new house!

situation: i am still fuming when i think about the person that keyed my car the other day while i was at the grocery store. i do not understand why someone would do that on purpose. i saw them as i was checking out and i did not even know them.
dialogue: i am fuming. i saw someone key my car while i was at the grocery store the other day.
oh no! what a terrible thing to have happen! were you able to confront them?
no, i was checking out when i saw it happen. i did not even know them. i do not know why anyone would do something like that.
label: angry
response: that is just awful. now you will have to pay to have it repaired.

situation: had my first trekking expereince in the canyon last week. it payed off using all the things i learned during the scouts!
dialogue: had my first trekking expereince in the canyon last week. it payed off using all the things i learned during the scouts when i was small!
nice. did you like it?
i did. the scenes were really rewarding. also felt good to have all the tools and skills necessary
label: prepared
response: that is nice.

situation: last week i saw a three piece rock band that sounded so huge that i was sure they were playing with a backing track. i asked their tech, and checked their equipment and guess what!? it was just them!
dialogue: last week i saw a three piece rock band that sounded so huge that i was sure they were playing with a backing track. i asked their tech, and checked their equipment and guess what!? it was just them!
it was who,who were them?
i am sorry if i was unclear, i mean that the band were playing completely live (with no backing track).
label: impressed
response: ok,thats amusing

situation: i learned to two hand bowl yesterday and felt good about it!
dialogue: so i learned to bowl using two hands yesterday and it was my best game ever!
wow! that is great! i bet you feel proud of it!
yes, very! it is also way more fun for me to put spin on the ball than traditional style bowling.
label: proud
response: i bet you were full of joy and laughter yesterday!

situation: i came home yesterday to dog poop everywhere!
dialogue: so i came home to dog poop everywhere yesterday! it was gross!
oh no! were you gone for long?
we were only gone for 2 hours! you just cannot leave them alone i guess
label: disgusted
response: what a bad doggie.. hopefully they do not do it again

situation: i am starting a new phase in my life. completed all debt , new start
dialogue: i am starting a new phase in my life. completed all debt and off to a new start
i can hear the sigh of relief in your voice. i bet your anxious about what the next chapter will be.
yes very. but i know that it will be good.
label: hopeful
response: i can tell your proud of yourself.  i am happy for you!

situation: i think i can get much better grades at school this semester!
dialogue: i am feeling very motivated and good about school this year. i think i can get much better grades this time.
it is good you are motivated! that is a step in the right direction
thanks! i have realized that school is extremely important and i cannot squander my opportunity away.
label: hopeful
response: i agree. i wish i could go back to school and pay more attention

situation: my friend bought a house in a very cheap market town and 6 months later a very walthy company opened an enormous regional hq there. his house has doubled in price and he has paid off all his debt and now is very well off. i am pleased for him but envy a little luck
dialogue: my friend bought a house in a very cheap market town and 6 months later a very walthy company opened an enormous regional hq there. his house has doubled in price and he has paid off all his debt and now is very well off. i am pleased for him but envy a little luck
that is amazing and a very quick profit!  i am a little bit jealous myself.
yeah. it is one of those strange moments where a place can go from being a place in the cheapest third of housing markets to being in the most expensive third in just a couple years!
label: jealous
response: it is amazing the effect something so seemingly small, like the company headquarters opening, can effect an entire town like that

situation: i went bowling yesterday and the ball got stuck on my hand. i went with it.
dialogue: so yesterday i went bowling and the ball got stuck on my hand. i went with it.
yikes.  did you get injured?
no, but i was shocked at how a small 12 pound ball can carry you down the lane due to the momentum. it was quite funny.
label: surprised
response: yeah and the lanes are really slick.  that is pretty funny and maybe a little embarassing too.

situation: my brother got a 4runner for this first car! i lowkey am pissed at him!
dialogue: my brother got a nice new toyota 4runner for his first car! i am lowkey kind of mad at him for it.
i would be too! that is a really nice car for his first car!
no kidding! i hope he understands the value of it!
label: jealous
response: i do too. maybe he will left you drive it!

situation: i just got a new car and i love it! my old car was a piece of crap.
dialogue: i just got a new car and i absolutely love it! my old car was a piece of crap so an upgrade is awesome!
wow you must be so happy! nothing like a new car
i am very happy! it is nice to know that i do not have to worry about if my car is going to start or not either.
label: excited
response: having a reliable car really changes things for the best

situation: i was listening to a throwback hits playlist and it brought back some good memories
dialogue: i was listening to a throwback hits playlist and it brought back memories from the good ol days.
nice! what genre of playlist was it?
it was mostly hip hop and r&b. stuff like nelly furtado, 2pac, etc.
label: nostalgic
response: cool! i like to rediscover old playlists i made when i was younger.

situation: my little grandson was admitted to the hospital a few days ago. he is still having testing and it is so hard to wait around to get the test results back to find out what is wrong.
dialogue: my grandson was admitted to the hospital the other day. it is so hard waiting around for test results.
i can only imagine! how is he now?
they still have more tests to do. hopefully they will know something by tomorrow but it is so nerve wracking.
label: anxious
response: doctor's are good at what they do! i hope for a speedy diagnosis and recovery!

situation: after over a year of living in absolute misery due to my upstairs neighbors, i am finally moving to another apartment. i absolutely cannot wait. even if my new neighbors are a bit loud, they will be nothing like this lot!
dialogue: i am so excited after a year of misery due to my loud, inconsiderate upstairs neighbors i am finally moving into a new apartment!
that is great news!  i bet you are glad to get a fresh start somewhere new.
i just cannot wait! i have seen the new place, and it backs onto a forest, so there'll be peace there, at least!
label: anticipating
response: it is always exciting to move into a new place and make it your own

situation: i was bowling and i accidentally used the person's ball next to me
dialogue: i was bowling last week and i accidentally used the person's custom ball that was next to me!
oh , how he reacted next
it was a she! and she just glared at me. i felt awful when i realized my mistake.
label: guilty
response: its ok it happens with every one

situation: i cannot wait until next week. we have planned a family get-together and i have not seen my brother and sister for more than a year. i am really looking forward to seeing them and catching up.
dialogue: we have a family reunion planned for next week. i am really looking forward to catching up with everyone, especially my brother and sister.
yes, that will be awesome! how long has it been since you've seen everyone?
it is been over a year and we do not get to talk very often because everyone is always so busy. i am so excited.
label: anticipating
response: that is fantastic that you get to see everyone again! i hope you have a great time catching up.

situation: i recently hit a new personal record at the gym!
dialogue: i recently hit a new personal record at the gym! i was very excited.
that is a great accomplishment. i admire your dedication in obtaining that goal.
thank you! i did not feel like i would ever be able to do it, but consistency does seem to pay off.
label: proud
response: it is really hard to stick with something like that. i wish i could do it.

situation: i feel like the rest of this year is going to be really good to me. i just have a feeling.
dialogue: i have a feeling that the rest of this year is going to be great to me! i am already working out and just have good vibes about the upcoming months.
that great to hear! have you started a work out program before?
i have but i have never really stuck to it. this time is different though, i have been going for a few months and feeling great about the future
label: hopeful
response: you can do it! do not forget to reward yourself for all of your hard work!

situation: my brother bought a custom bowling ball and ever since he got it, he is been doing amazing!
dialogue: my brother got a custom-made bowling ball, and ever since then he is been killing the game! it is awesome to see.
sounds impressive, does he mainly play for fun or is he in competitions?
he is on his high school bowling team, but i think he mainly plays for fun. it is kind of cool seeing him get so much better over time.
label: impressed
response: very nice, i would be proud too.

situation: well, last night i was so fed-up with the racket coming from the upstairs apartment, i put jazz music on quite loudly and went to bed. i really should not have done that!
dialogue: ok, so the people upstairs were making a terrible noise last night and i would had enough. i put jazz on quite loudly and went to bed. i really should not have done that!
oh no what happened?
well, they were shouting and stomping around, so i lost it! this morning, they've been quiet as church mice, so i guess it worked
label: ashamed
response: that would really help if it was a permanent solution

situation: i was watching my dad's house last week and i heard some odd noises while i was there alone.
dialogue: i was watching my dad's house last week and i heard some odd noises while i was there alone.
i hate creepy stuff like that because i get paranoid.
no kidding! once i came back to the kitchen and the faucet was running even though i hadn't touched it.
label: afraid
response: that sounds more odd than what i am used too. hopefully nothing paranormal is going on.

situation: i am going to see my parents in a week!
dialogue: i did not see my parents since 2014! they live in a different country. i am finally going to see them next week and i just cannot wait!
that will be an amazing trip!
i know! and they've never met their grandson so they will be so excited to finally meet him
label: anticipating
response: that will be so great for them i can just imagine meeting my granson for the first time what a sweet time you are about to have.

situation: every year around christmas time, i think back to the good old days. all of our neighbors would get together and someone would dress up as santa. it was like everyone was one big family.
dialogue: i cannot help but think back to the good old days at christmas time.
christmas was always a nightmare for me.
i am sorry. that makes me really sad. we lived in a great neighborhood growing up and our neighbors were like family and always got together to celebrate.
label: nostalgic
response: i cried every year knowing santa was not coming to my house.

situation: the last time i went into a job interview, i knew as soon as i walked out that i would be getting a job offer. i felt i did really well.
dialogue: the last time i went into a job interview, i knew as soon as i walked out that i would be getting a job offer. i felt i did really well.
that is great! it is so awesome to feel confident after an interview!
definitely. you go through so many it is easy to feel down.
label: confident
response: yes it sure is. did you end up getting the job?

situation: last winter i was out on my porch at 4 am. i suddenly noticed a large figure dressed all in black approaching me. my heart was in my mouth!
dialogue: last winter i was out on my porch at 4 am. suddenly a large figure dressed in black was walking towards me. my heart was beating like a drum!
was it a ghost?

i was not sure at first and, being in a wheelchair, had nowhere to go. then the dark figure stopped in front of me. i thought i would had it. turns out it was my neighbor who could not sleep, walking her dog!
label: terrified
response: oh,that was so hillarious

situation: i stress eat but i did not eat sweets for a week!
dialogue: i stress eat a lot. i decided i need to control it and i did not eat sweets for more than a week. very proud of myself
that is great, keep it up if you can!
i will try to do my best. i think i will also need to see a doctor. i just do not wanna get obese
label: proud
response: it is good that you are being more proactive about your health now.

dialogue: my co-worker just bought a brand new car.
man, i wish i could get one.
i know, me too. i really envy them every day when i get in my beat up chevy that i have been driving for 10 years.
label: impressed
response: i also drive a chevy and have had it forever as well.

situation: i wanna sell my phone but i am scared to meet people from craigslist
dialogue: i wanna sell my phone so i posted ad on craigslist. i have 3 potential buyers but i am so scared to meet them . you never know what people intentions are
have you ever sold on craigslist before? i always have the people meet me in the walmart parking lot during the day. i have sold hundreds of things and have never had an issue like that.
i did but my husband was with me and now he is out of the country for a couple of months so  i will be alone
label: afraid
response: it will be okay. you could also have the people meet you at the local police station. the police do not mind and would rather you feel safe.

situation: i am so psyched! i move into a new apartment in three weeks. it looks onto a forest, so no cars driving by day and night. yeeha!
dialogue: i am moving into a new apartment in three weeks and cannot wait. it will be quiet as it looks onto a forest!
is it loud where you are now?  new places are always so fun!
not with traffic, but with the people upstairs they are a cross between hyenas and elephants!. my new place was quiet when i was there, so fingers crossed!
label: excited
response: oh that will be such a huge relief i am sure!  it is crazy that people behave that way, knowing they are causing other people such strife.

situation: i found out someone stole my identity. they completely cleared out my bank account and maxed out my credit cards. i am so mad.
dialogue: someone stole my identity.
oh no! how did that happen and how much damage did they do?
i do not know. they completely cleaned out my bank account and maxed out my credit cards. i am fuming.
label: furious
response: that is horrible! what will you do?

situation: i have food on my table, a roof over my head and clothes to wear.
dialogue: i have food on my table, a roof over my head and clothes to wear. i am happy and thankful
that is truly all you can ask for.
yes. some people take these things for granted. it is really easy to take things and people for granted
label: grateful
response: i try to never take anything in life for granted.

situation: i made a blanket it was so easy
dialogue: so i decided to make a blanket and i got a sawing machine and got patterns and stuff. it tuned out to be so easy! i actually made 3 blankets
wow, impressive. you must have natural talent. do you plan to make more?
thank you! i do want to take more and to give them to my friends who recently had babies
label: surprised
response: you can always sell them as well. i live in amish country in pa and the amish sell blankets for hundreds of dollars each.

situation: i remember a while back, being in scotland for a while, and being so happy to be flying to california to see my then boyfriend. i hadn't felt so happy in years!
dialogue: i remember being in scotland and arranging a trip to california to see my then boyfriend. i was so very happy to be seeing him again!
i bet! is it hard to have a long distance relationship?

very hard and this was before the days of smartphones and facetime. we spent a fortune on telephone calls. but it was so worth it to speak to each other and i was lucky i could afford to fly out to see him.
label: joyful
response: i can only image how hard that was before the days of smartphones! i am glad you were able to visit him!

situation: life hasn't always been easy, but i have many things to give thanks for. i try to remind myself of that everyday, especially when i spend time with my family.
dialogue: when i spend time with my family, it reminds me how lucky i really am.
aww. it is the things money cannot buy that bring us the greatest joy, no?
definitely. even when times get rough, there are still so many things to be thankful for. i did not always realize that, but glad i do now.
label: grateful
response: that is so true and it is a good perspective to have.

situation: my dog just gave me a bunch of kisses!
dialogue: my dog just gave me a bunch of kisses! i love her so much
dogs really are such great companions, what breed is she?
she is a golden retriever. do you have any pets?
label: grateful
response: yes i have a miniature pinscher, he just turned 15.

situation: school starts a week from today and i am getting fairly nervous!
dialogue: school starts a week from tomorrow and i am getting fairly nervous for it!
how come? it will probably be an exciting adventure for you to start
oh yes, i really like school and my classmates and stuff! i guess just because summer is coming to an end?
label: anxious
response: the summer is horrid. heat, sweat, mosquitos, rain, and crowds everywhere

situation: i always say i am not a judgemental person but i actually am
dialogue: i always say i am not a judgemental person but in my head i judge everybody and i am so ahsamed of it
i do the same! i think everyone does.
yes but when i catch myself judging somebody i feel so guilty and bad
label: ashamed
response: i think it is a normal human activity. you do not need to feel bad

situation: i have already gotten my school supplies! i am ready to kill this semester.
dialogue: i have already gotten my school supplies and everything is ready! i feel like i am gonna kill this semester.
that is the way to do it!  be prepared to kick it is butt and get good grades!
i will try! it will be hard with a part-time job but i bet i can manage.
label: prepared
response: always put your school first, you will be thankful you did later!

situation: my brother just turned 16 and he is about to get his first car! i am so excited for him.
dialogue: my brother just turned 16 and he is about to get his first car! i am so excited for him.
whoa that is exciting!  what kind of car we looking at?
probably some kind of suv, maybe an xterra or 4runner. should be awesome when he gets it!
label: caring
response: that is a really good/safe first car.

situation: i have been saving up for a new car for the past month and am making great progress!
dialogue: i have been saving up for a new car for the past month and am making great progress!
that is awesome!  what kind of car do you want
i want an suv, like an xterra or 4runner. they are pricy though!
label: proud
response: well i really hope you are able to save up and get it soon!

situation: recently my husband and i were traveling home from visiting his family when all of a sudden this car cut us off.  we had to slam on our brakes not to hit them.  it was so scary!
dialogue: recently my husband and i were traveling home from visiting his family when all of a sudden a car cuts us off
that is annoying, i hate how little attention most other drivers pay on the road.
i have no idea how we did not hit them but it was so scary
label: afraid
response: i am glad that you are okay! keep your eyes peeled for terrible drivers.

situation: my oldest child's birthday is next week. i always get emotional when her birthday comes around, remember the day she was born and life when she was little.
dialogue: my oldest child's birthday is next week and it always makes me emotional.
i can imagine. how old will they be?
she will be 30. it makes me feel so old, but also how fun it was when they were little.
label: sentimental
response: yeah but also just think of all the amazing movies she has done.

situation: i feel so much better about life in general since hitting the gym!
dialogue: i feel so much better about myself and life in general now that i
now that you what? tell me!
sorry, i accidentally hit enter haha. now that i have been working out for about a month!
label: confident
response: oh that is great! i have heard that exercise can really help mentally and physically!

situation: well, i have finally found my perfect restaurant/grocery store. i stopped by the other day and bought some food and could not have been more pleased with everything there!
dialogue: i just enjoyed grocery shopping for the first time in a very long time. i have found my perfect restaurant/store and spent a very happy 40 mins or so wandering around it.
that is great! did you get anything you are especially excited about? it is a restaurant and a store?
yes, it is both. i got a chickpea curry with basmati rice that a local indian lady made. and a bag of dragon tongue beans, which are delicious!
label: content
response: dragon tongue beans! i have never heard of them! what do they look like?

situation: i came home from work last night and my step dad scared me!
dialogue: i came home from work last night and my step dad scared me!
how did he scare you?
like he jumped out from behind a door and scared me. i was not expecting it!
label: surprised
response: i bet that gave you a good scare! gotta love dads and step dads!

situation: my step dad showed me his cut he got while working on his boat. i could see his muscle fibers underneath, ugh.
dialogue: my step dad showed me a cut he got while working on his boat and i could see his muscle fibers. i almost puked.
oh that sounds disgusting!
yeah it was gross. he probably should get stitches.
label: disgusted
response: i hope he gets that taken care of!

situation: i was incredibly sad to hear of anthony bourdin's passing. it just seems so unfair that such a wonderful man who gave so much pleasure to a huge number of people should be so unhappy.
dialogue: when i heard anthony bourdin had taken his own life, i was so shocked and upset. he gave so much pleasure to a lot of people, yet was miserable in his own life.
i think we never really know what is going on inside people's mind. celebrities like anthony and robin williams seems to live a good life, but in reality, they are suffering.
it is awful. i really wish far more resources were put toward mental health facilities and counselling in this country!
label: devastated
response: i completely agree! i think it would even help lower crime rates.

situation: i hadn't been able to visit my grandmother in a while b/c she lives really far away.  well i finally went after not being there in forever and it was exactly as i remembered it as a child.  it created some great memories for me
dialogue: i hadn't been able to see my grandmother in quite some time b/c she lives so far away
oh no. i am so sorry. can you video chat with her?
well i was finally able to go and visit her and the house and visit was exactly as i remembered it as a child.  it gave me such great memories!
label: nostalgic
response: how wonderful. that is what is important and makes life meaningful in my opinion.

situation: i remember being on holiday and trying to find a way to watch an f1 race. i caught the beginning of the race in a bar before it closed and saw that my favourite driver had had a puncture and fallen to last place. my mate asked me what the chances were of him winning from that position? i said 1000 to 1. by the time we were back at the hostel, i learned that he had indeed won the race in what many believe was the greatest single event in the sport's history!
dialogue: i remember being on holiday and trying to find a way to watch an f1 race. i caught the beginning of the race in a bar before it closed and saw that my favourite driver had had a puncture and fallen to last place. my mate asked me what the chances were of him winning from that position? i said 1000 to 1. by the time we were back at the hostel, i learned that he had indeed won the race in what many believe was the greatest single event in the sport's history!
wow! that is insane, too bad you did not bet with those kind of odds.

yeah, for sure! it was one of those nights where we were journey is what is fun rather than what you were aiming to do, if you get me. we went from sports bar to sports bar trying to see who would show the event and by the time we gave up we'd had such a funny night and the race had turned out great!
label: surprised
response: that sounds like a great time, one of those nights you always remember!

situation: i did not realize until now that the kids in school start having different classes for different subjects in 5th grade.
dialogue: i did not know until the other day that kids have different teachers for different subjects starting in 5th grae.
yeah the older they get the more teachers they usually get. i think it is good because they get a variety.
that is true.  i was a little startled b/c i do not remember changing classes for things until 7th grade.  just a reminder that kids grow up so much faster now.
label: surprised
response: yeah schools definitely start things younger now. kindergarten used to be voluntary back in the day!

situation: when i lived in california recently the farmer on whose land i lived encouraged me to get organized and have valuables etc. together in case a big earthquake hit. he also stockpiled batteries, water etc.
dialogue: when i lived in california my farmer friend and landlord had me get organized and have all my valuables together in case of a big earthquake. he stockpiled such things as batteries and water.
i can understand that as i live in florida and we prepare for hurricanes each year with a plan and emergency rations and supplies.
it feels good to get everything together, does not it? you feel as if you are ready for anything!
label: prepared
response: yes, you are correct. you can always "hope" for the best, but also "plan" for the worst. being prepared is a comfortable feeling.

situation: so proud of my son! he learned how to say please
dialogue: i am so proud of my son! he learned a couple of words this week. he now knows how to ay please
that is wonderful, they say children have a certain gift for picking up languages.
he actually speaks 2 languages. i teach him english and russian
label: proud
response: wow! that is impressive and a lasting skill for your child to develop.

situation: a few weeks ago my loud upstairs neighbors went away for a week. what a difference to the whole life experience here! i felt relaxed and as if all was right in my world.
dialogue: a while back my loud upstairs neighbors went away for a week. my life went from night to day. it just felt as if all was right in my world.
did you think about moving after that?
funny you should mention that in three weeks time,.
label: content
response: haha are you serious? did you move in with your girlfriend?

situation: i found a cat in my attic! i do not own any cats and do not know how it got there.
dialogue: i found a cat in my attic yesterday!
oh wow! i hope that it was ok!
my husband is allergic to cats to, i am not sure how it got there. we had to call animal control to get it out safely!
label: surprised
response: oh no. that sounds really stressful!

situation: i am full of admiration for my best friend. her long-term relationship ended just after her father passed away. instead of disappearing into a bottle or wallowing in despair, she pulled herself together and got herself a new, interesting life!
dialogue: my best friend's long-term relationship ended abruptly a while back, just after her father passed. i am so full of admiration for her instead of turning to drink or becoming crazy-depressed, she pulled herself together and made a new, exciting life her new reality.
that is very unusual. she should be proud of herself.
yes, she should. she joined a community garden and helps out there, she got a part time job and took up badminton not something she'd ever done before!
label: proud
response: wow, i wish more would follow her example. that is a recovery.

situation: i just got hulu live! it has blown my minds all the things you can watch on it. great value for the price!
dialogue: i just got hulu live. it is been amazing to watch tv again!
i have not watched actual tv in sooo long. what do you watch on hulu?
i love to watch home shows on hgtv and bachelor in paridise on abc. hulu live has been a great value for the price!
label: impressed
response: that is real neat, i might check it out. i have only ever used netflix, but netflix is pretty good too.

situation: my husband ran over a cat on accident. i feel so bad, we had to call animal control to pick up the body.
dialogue: my husband ran over a cat this morning on accident, i am so upset.
aw, i bet he feels horrible about it.  poor kitty!
yes, we had to call animal control to retreive the body! i hope it was not someone pet.
label: sentimental
response: aw, that is always sad, i lost a cat once and i assume that is what happened to her ;(

situation: i heard about a mom who lost all of her 3 kids in a fire. i could not imagine using my whole life in basically one night.
dialogue: i could not imagine losing all 3 of my kids in a fire.
that would be horrific.  do you know someone that this happened to?
yes, i heard about it. such a sad story.
label: sentimental
response: that is just horrible.  i think they would have to medicate me for the rest of my life if that happendd.

situation: my friends threw an unexpected birthday party for me. i thought they'd forgotten.
dialogue: my friends threw an unexpected birthday party for me. i thought they'd forgotten.
that is nice of your friend. i hope you enjoyed it.
i did! it was a very nice gesture.
label: surprised
response: you can return the favor one day. that is what friends are for!

situation: right now we are waiting on military orders. i am really hopeful we will get them next week and praying that turns out to be true.
dialogue: we are waiting on military orders right now, i am so hoping they come through next week.
do you have any idea where you will go? is it accompanied?
yes, we know where we are going just have not gotten the official orders.
label: hopeful
response: well i hope they get there soon so you do not have to wait longer.

situation: i get so annoyed and angry when i hear of people being mean to animals. these helpless animals have no clue why people are so mean either.
dialogue: i get so tired of hearing about people being mean to animals.
i am with you on this one.  what is up with people these days, i just do not understand how they could do that.
right, these poor animals have no clue why people are mean to them. some people are heartless.
label: disappointed
response: i think there should be stiffer penalties for people that do things like that, for instance more jail time.

situation: i was just thinking back to the christmases we used to have at home when i was a youngster. they were such fun, from decorating the tree to a delicious lunch on the big day with family.
dialogue: for some reason i have been thinking of our family christmases back when i was a kid. i so enjoyed decorating the tree, helping my mom with preparing lunch. and of course, eating christmas lunch! fun times.
i had a similar experience, i miss it too
it is nice to think back, tho' and relive the old days. we have our own traditions now, but the good old days will always remain just that!
label: sentimental
response: i totally agree

situation: i always find it crazy to hear how many people eat out so much. like we eat out once or twice a month maybe. i cannot imagine spending so much on food.
dialogue: do you know anyone who spends a ton on eating out every week? it is crazy to me how much they spend.
i know that when just the 4 people in my family do go out, it runs us about $65.  so we do it very rarely, it wastes a lot of money.
yes, exactly. a friend was telling me they spent almost $300 a week on eating out. i do not even spend that much on groceries.
label: surprised
response: a week!?  that is just crazy, and pretty irresponsible unless you are a millionaire.

situation: i am so happy we are moving soon. i am ready for us to have new adventures and have more stuff for my kids to do.
dialogue: we are moving soon and i am so ready to go.
where to?
texas, there is so much to do there so i am happy for the change.
label: excited
response: i spent some time there, when i was learning how to be an army medic. i really enjoyed my time there!

situation: they weather predicted a hurricane so we packed everything up and boarded the windows up. i wanted to make sure we were ready if bad weather came. luckily the storm was not as bad as they thought it would be.
dialogue: i was worried because the weather man said a hurricane was coming. so we got everything ready just in case.
it is better to be safe than sorry. you cannot overprepare.
so true. luckily it did not get as bad as they thought so we did not have to evauate.
label: prepared
response: i am glad you did not get hit. i know how stressful hurricanes can be.

situation: the other day my phone buzzed, and it was one of my cousins calling me on facebook messenger. she had my twin aunts with her, one of whom i hadn't seen in over 5 years. imagine how unexpected but delightful that was!
dialogue: my cousin contacted me the other day via facebook messenger. she had my twin aunts with her, one of whom i hadn't seen in over five years. it was such a delight to see them and chat with them!
i bet! i hope you were able to catch up!
oh yes, and then some! they both looked so well and had lots to say. what a laugh we had. i am so fortunate to have such a wonderful family!
label: surprised
response: you are very lucky!

situation: my dog has to have her teethe cleaned on
dialogue: my dog has to have her teeth cleaned on wednesday and i am really nervous b/c she got super sick last time afterwards
that is strange, i hope she makes it out ok this time though.
she is super tiny and they said with small dogs the stress of the procedure will give them stomach issues sometimes.  i would not even do it except she has an abcess
label: apprehensive
response: oh wow, i would never consider something like that hurting a dog.

situation: recently my grandma passed away.  she lived far from us most of our lives but at the end she was sick so we moved her down here and i really had fun connecting with her as an adult again.  it was a hard day when she died
dialogue: recently my grandma passed away.  she lived pretty far from us most of our lives but at the end she had alzheimer and so we moved her down to be near us
i am sorry to hear that. i hope she passed peacefully.
yes, it seemed so.  i really had fun reconnecting with her as an adult, so it was really hard when she passed.
label: sad
response: i am sure she appreciated your visit before her passing. she must have felt loved.

situation: i always make sure i have everything we need when we go on vacation. i packed medication, sunscreen, extra food and water. good think i did because we broke down and could not get help for several hours.
dialogue: we broke down and could not get help for several hours as we were out of cell range. good thing i had packed extra food and water.
that was a really smart call on your part! were you worried?
i was very worried but we were lucky eventually and someone stopped and helped and we went on with our vacation.
label: prepared
response: well, it was a very smart thing you did packing those extra supplies.

situation: we are moving soon. i do not know exactly when so i have just been packing and doing as much as i can ahead of time. i do not like to be rushed.
dialogue: i have been so busy packing, packing and more packing.
that sounds pretty stressful. are you moving soon?
yes, do not know exactly when but i hate being rushed so i have been doing what i can.
label: prepared
response: that makes sense. i hate leaving things for the last second as well. hopefully you will not have to leave everything boxed up for too long.

situation: now that i am older, i am very happy with the way things are in my life. i am happy with a regular routine and just got married to my best friend. we like things very low key.
dialogue: i recently got married to my best friend. we are older now and are happy with things being low key and staying on a routine.
that is great! you are lucky!
i do feel very lucky, especially to find someone who is as satisfied as i am in our old age.
label: content
response: it is a wonderful thing that you have someone to share your life with.

situation: i heard a lot of cool songs on a radio station i usually do not listen to. it really took me back to the 90s.
dialogue: i got to hear a lot of cool songs on a radio station i usually do not listen to.
nice! which ones did you hear!
mambo #5, missy elliot, and ricky martin. it really took me back
label: nostalgic
response: that one is a zinger! i remember listening to that when i took my grandma to prom!

situation: i took a test for college the other day, basically our midterm. it kills me waiting for it to be graded.
dialogue: i took a test for college the other day, it was basically our midterm.
how did you do?
i do not know yet. the wait is killing me and i am not confident i did well.
label: anticipating
response: i am sure you did fine. what was the subject?

situation: i love golf and watched the scottish open recently. i know a guy who was playing in it and he won! what a fantastic four days of watching and following him.
dialogue: i was watching the scottish open golf tournament a few weeks ago. i know a guy who was playing in it. guess what? he won! fantastic four days of baited breath and cheering him on!
that is great! can you call him and see if we could all celebrate together?
he is playing in the pga championship right now or i am sure he'd be delighted to,!
label: excited
response: well yeah, that sounds about right. he has to go to the championship first and win, then party time !

situation: i teach a lot of students how to skydive, and i feel confident flying with them and teaching them.
dialogue: i love teaching people how to skydive it is so much fun helping them to learn.
that is sound like a lot of fun! do you know where i can go get lessons?
there are skydiving centers all over the world.  what part of the country are you in?  it is an amazing sport.
label: confident
response: i am in va. i have been looking into it for quite awhile, but i think i would be too chicken to jump out of the plane.

situation: everyone in my family laughs at me b/c i am a super organized person and i like routine in my life.  i always joke that i use to be a boyscout b/c their motto is "always be prepared"
dialogue: everyone in my family laughs at me b/c i am super organized and i like routine in my life
nothing wrong with that. i am definitely with you on the organizational front. i bet they are not laughing when you get them out of a jam!
exactly!  i always joke that i use to be a boyscout b/c their motto is "always be prepared"
label: prepared
response: it drives me nuts when people are disorganized. my husband is hopeless i could throttle him sometimes!

situation: i was to see a house to hopefully rent. it was very nice and just perfect for me. the day before i was supposed to see it the property management lady called to say the owners had already rented it out. i felt so down how could they do that?
dialogue: you know when you see the perfect house to rent and someone beats you to it? that happened to me recently the owners rented it out the night before i was to see it
oh man that is really annoying!  have you found another one you like yet?
yes, but it is an apartment and this place was a lovely quiet 3 bed/2 bath place in a lovely neighborhood. such a bummer!
label: disappointed
response: oh man i would be so upset.  i totally understand!  i hope you will be able to enjoy your new place

situation: i was so sad when i found out my pet horse died of cancer last week while i was over in vacation
dialogue: my horse died last week i was devastated when i found out
oh no! do you know why?
yeah the vet told us it was cancer i was really sad
label: devastated
response: aw, i am sorry. i hope you get another horse that can at least help to replace that hole!

situation: i always make sure to be outside my house before anybody picks me up i like to anticipate things
dialogue: i am always outside my house beafore my friend gets here
do you know he is coming, or is it just blind luck?
i know he is comming i just like to be there couple of mins before he arrives
label: anticipating
response: that is very considerate of you, i bet he really appreciates that.

situation: the day i finished my doctorate i was extremly proud and thankfull for everything i have
dialogue: i was really happy the day i finished my doctorate
wow. that is quite an accomplishment! congratulations!
yeah it really took a lot of hard work to do it but it was worth it at the end
label: proud
response: what was is your doctorate in?

situation: my wife is getting back from a trip to germany for 2 months in like a week.  i am super happy and cannot wait to see her!
dialogue: my wife has been out of the country for 2 months, and is getting back in a week.  i am super pumped!
what has she been doing? undercover cia agent?
no, taking a language course to help her graduate studies.  good guess though :p
label: excited
response: *wink* *wink*

situation: my wife is returning from a trip abroad in a week.  i have got to get to work making the house look nice for her when she gets back.
dialogue: my wife is coming back into the country after being away for 2 months.  i have got to do some cleaning before she gets back :p
ha, yeah gotta make sure the house is back up to wife code before she gets home. other wise there is going to be a price to pay.
most definitely.  i am not worried about her being terribly mad, but it is nice to come home to a clean house.
label: anticipating
response: it always is, plus it gives you some brownie points as well.

situation: i recently burned my hair with my hair drier and it looks so bad, i wonder what people think when they see me with my hair like that
dialogue: i burned my hair with my hair drier i am so embarrased to go out in public
i am sorry to hear that, my wife has done the same thing. she wore a hat for almost a month when she left the house.
yeah it is the worst, i loook so weird with my hair like this it is so embarassing
label: embarrassed
response: well, like i told her, it will grow out, it will just take time.

situation: i went out to dinner the other day.  the food was subpar and the service was not very good.
dialogue: i had a bad experience out to eat the other day.  i do not do it too often, so it was a bummer.
that does not sound good. what happened that was so bad?
the food was pretty bad and the service did not help clear things up.  there were a lot of mistakes on top of everything.  just general bad eating out things.
label: disappointed
response: that sounds like an awful experience. i probably would not go back there anytime soon.

situation: i was at the grocery store the other day and i was not paying attention because i was looking at my phone. i hit a display and knocked everything over. i was hoping no one was around and would not notice but there were a few people staring directly at me and my face was bright red.
dialogue: i was walking through the grocery store the other day and was not watching where i was going and knocked over an entire display.
oh lord. did you try to set it back up, or did you try to sneak away?
it was too much of a mess to clean up and i could not sneak away because there were several people who saw me do it. my face was bright red.
label: embarrassed
response: oh no, that is really embarrassing! hopefully they let you off easy since it was just an accident.

situation: my wife is going to be back from out of the country for 2 months in about a week.  i am super happy.
dialogue: my wife has been out of the country for two months and is getting back in a week.
i know you are happy 😊
definitely  it is been a long and lonely summer
label: excited
response: i feel ya, lonely indeed.

situation: i recently moved from california to north carolina. it was ok while my friend (who drove me across the country) was here. but after he left i realized i knew absolutely nobody. it was not a good feeling.
dialogue: i recently moved from california to north carolina and suddenly realized i knew absolutely nobody. it was a horrible feeling.
that sucks. why did you move from california?
my rent tripled in three years. i could not afford to stay just too expensive. anyway, a friend had driven across with me and it was not until he'd gone that i realized i was alone. silly, huh?!
label: lonely
response: that is really common actually. there is a big exodus from there.  they voted for high taxes and now people are abandoning the state beacuse the cost of living is too high.

situation: a while back i decided to move from florida to california and wanted to drive. i have driven west to east, but never the other way. i knew i could do it though just take my time and enjoy the trip!
dialogue: a while ago i drove from florida to northern california. it is a long trip, but i knew i could do it just fine.
that is a long trip.  did you do it all in one go or did you take breaks?
it took about 5 days. i would drive a few hours and stop for the night. i would already made the trip from west to east, so kind of knew what i was doing.
label: confident
response: that is not bad, i was thinking you were doing it in like a couple days.

situation: my wife was sick the other day.  she was stuck in bed for most of a day, it was rough.
dialogue: my wife was really sick the other day, she was stuck in bed for most of the day.
oh, poor lady. i do hope she is feeling better. what was wrong with her, if you do not mind my asking?
not completely sure, maybe just a stomach bug or something.  she is ok now, though her appetite took a bit to come back.
label: caring
response: well, i am really glad to hear she is recovered. stomach bugs are awful they really take their toll on you.

situation: im really happy i am starting school again, summer was so boring for me i spent it at my house the whole entire summer
dialogue: summer was so boring for me, i am really happy school is starting again
why was it boring, nothing exciting to do where you live?
not really, i just stayed home all summer because my parents worked the whole summer as well as i did
label: content
response: ah yeah, that sucks. no time for anything fun.

situation: my mom is having weight loss surgery.  i am worried the risks are too dangerous.
dialogue: my mom is having weight loss surgery next week, i am nervous.
what kind of operation is it? i am unfamiliar with weight loss surgery. but typically surgeries like that are very safe, but it is natural to feel nervous about someone you care about.
she is having gastric bypass surgery, i feel like it would be too dangerous due to her medical state. she will not listen to me!
label: afraid
response: well, everyone is entitled to their own life choices. i am sure she will be alright.

situation: i hate getting last, i have always loved winning and there is nothing that makes me more angry than losing in something
dialogue: there is nothing i hate more than losing in something
yeah, that is never fun. did you lose at something recently?
not recently but gettting last at a race really makes me angry and motivates me
label: angry
response: i agree, it makes you just want to try harder next time.

situation: it has been a wonderful monday! i found out i got a pay raise and we are planing our holiday vacation.
dialogue: it has been a wonderful monday!
that is great, what specifically has made it so good for you?
i found out a got a pay raise at my job, we are starting to plan a cruise for the holidays in november!
label: joyful
response: wow that all sounds very exciting, congratulations!

situation: i read in the news a family had a house fire and lost all of their animals. it makes me upset to think about how they died.
dialogue: i read in the news about a family who lost all six of their animals in a house fire
thats so sad oh no! that is terrible.
i know, it made me upset! my two dogs are my babies could not imagine loosing them.
label: sad
response: they are honestly just like children so its really sad.

situation: my dog is over at the vet for 4 days and it makes the house feel super lonly, i really am looking forward to my dog comming back
dialogue: my dog is over at the vet for 4 days and makes the house feel so alone'
awww, i totally know that feeling. i hate even going on vacation and not being able to bring my dog along. she is family!
yeah i am really looking forward to getting him back
label: lonely
response: i can imagine! is he doing okay?

situation: my wife went out of the country for school for 2 months at the beginning of the summer.  dropping her off at the airport was really hard.
dialogue: my wife went out of the country for a couple months at the beginning of the summer, dropping her off at the airport was really tough.
it must have been! have you guys been apart before?
not for more than a few days.  it is been a rough couple months, but it is almost over!
label: sad
response: ah so you've gone through it a couple of months alrready. how much longer is she going to be away for?

situation: my wife and i had to move far away from home recently for her grad school.  my parents were kind enough to cosign on a loan for a condo.
dialogue: when my wife and i had to move for her to go to school, we had a lot of trouble finding a place to live until my parents were nice enough to cosign on a loan.
you must be so thankful!
we are.  they've helped a lot during my life, but this might have been the biggest one.
label: grateful
response: they are really wonderful. do you have plans to show how thankful you are?

situation: i am really happy to visit all my family back home, i live around 22 hours away from them in plane so i do not see them often
dialogue: i cannot wait to visit my family back home they are so far away i do not get to see them a lo
when will you be going ?
in a couple of weeks i am really happy to see them it has been 5 years
label: sentimental
response: wow, i hope you have a really nice trip.

situation: spiders make me scared to my bones i cannot see them anywhere does not matter if it is in a picture
dialogue: i cannot get near spiders, even if i see them in pictures they freak me out
just cause of the way they look or you had an incident involving one?
not really i was just born afraid of them hahah
label: terrified
response: yea i am right there with you on that one along with snakes heh

situation: a few years ago i came home to an unexpected party for my birthday.  my wife (who was my girlfriend then) had planned it all with my friends without me knowing.
dialogue: a few years ago, before we got married, my wife planned a party for me for my birthday completely without me knowing.
that sounds like a pleasant surprise!
it really was!  i walked into my apartment to like 15 more people than i expected.
label: surprised
response: that is so sweet of her and what a great memory to have!

situation: it really annoys me wheen my little brother throws food on the table and eats with his mouth open just to bothern me
dialogue: i hate when my little brother throws food on the table just to annoy m e
that is a terrible waste of food, how old is your little brother?
he is like 11 but he does it when my parents are not home it is really anoying
label: annoyed
response: well, i hope he soon sees that is not something that he should be doing.

situation: i was stopped at a red light and a woman in a truck scraped all along the side of my car.  she seemed high or something, so i do not know what was wrong with her.
dialogue: i was stopped at a traffic light when a woman in a truck scraped slowly along the side of my car.
that is brutal, did she get out?
yeah, we both stopped and pulled over.  i think she was high or something, she was really off.
label: angry
response: did she have insurance?

situation: i was eating at a really fancy restaurant and found a little ball of hair in my food i was really disgusted
dialogue: i found a little ball of hair when i was eating at a fancy restaurant
awful! did you complaint?
yeah i did, they gave us a refund and we did not come back to that place again
label: disgusted
response: food should be made hygiene. we should not compromise on health.

situation: my husband ate the last of the bread and did not tell me. he ruined my entire dinner plan
dialogue: i had made plans for dinner and had set everything out and i found out my husband ate all the bread!
that is annoying, was it garlic bread?
it was not even garlic bread! it was generic bread to dip in soup!
label: angry
response: what did you say to him after he did it?

situation: i was feels more surprised that my boy friend give me a gift for my birthday
dialogue: i feels surprised
how so?
my boy friend gives me a birthday gift surprisingly
label: surprised
response: that is awesome!  i love getting surprises!

situation: when i moved into this apartment my next door neighbor had an old beagle. he was a lovely pooch. the poor dog had cancer and just before thanksgiving he had to be put to sleep. i looked for that wee dog for weeks afterwards.
dialogue: my neighbor used to have an old beagle a lovely pooch. he died of cancer just before thanksgiving. i looked for him for weeks i miss him.
that is so sad.  i have lost dogs before.  i know how you feel
yeah. i used to see him when i was out on my porch and he'd come out for a sniff around or a tinkle. he was so sweet and gentle.
label: sad
response: yeah dogs are man's best friend.

situation: i do not cook very well but when my husband started putting chocolate in chilli i freaked out. i love him though so i put my trust in him.
dialogue: i am not a very good cook but sometimes my husband scares me with it!
oh wow haha that is not good
he was putting chocolate right into the chilli the other night!
label: trusting
response: that is an interesting combination, maybe you should try to keep him out of the kitchen

situation: my son came home today and was working on homework. he said he did not know it then proceeded to get it all right.
dialogue: my son came home today and was working on his homework.
what grade is he in?
in 7th and they are doing pre algebra. he said he did not know it, then proceeded to get every question right!
label: impressed
response: awesome! that had to be a great confidence boost for him!

situation: i have been practicing for a marathon and i am starting to beat my best time!
dialogue: i have been training hard for a marathon next week, and i am beating my record time!
that is amazing! how long have you been running?
for a few months now, but i have been training pretty hard just these past few months.
label: prepared
response: that is pretty cool. i hope you win!

situation: i am very socially awkward
dialogue: i am very socially awkward and tomorrow i am going to have a playdate with some local moms and i am so anxious

i am right there with you. i still feel pretty introverted, but since coming to college, i have been forced to socialize more, and it is help me at least "fake it until i make it." i still prefer to be alone a lot of the time, but at least i can somewhat manage without making myself look dumb. maybe you can just think of some topics/things to talk about to have in the back of your head for the times when things get quiet?
that is a great idea! thank you for a great advice.
label: anxious
response: i hope it goes well! if it makes you feel any better, most of them are probably just as nervous and are looking for any excuse to relax and let their guard down, too. good luck

situation: i visited an underground cavern that was like 23 stories beneath the surface, i was uneasy to say the least.
dialogue: i recently went to ruby falls, an underground cavern with a waterfall.
that sounds awesome. have you ever been before?
not that particular one, no. i had butterflies in my stomach on that elevator going down 23 stories.
label: apprehensive
response: i wish i could go sometime that sounds like quite the experience.

situation: lifting some weight i did not think i could handle.
dialogue: i had some hesitations when i was at the gym today, thought i would not be able to handle the weights
how'd it turn out? congrats on deciding to lead a healthier life, by the way.
i decided to focus on the music that was blasting, just tried switching up what i play in the gym, it sounds like vikings are bringing me into battle
label: apprehensive
response: i am the exact same way in the gym. music is a huge motivator for me. one time my phone died while in the gym and the rest of the workout was so low energy.

situation: i got into a car crash when i was younger. a person t-boned my car when they failed to yield. i can still remember the squealing tires, and the sound of glass breaking.
dialogue: have you ever been in a car crash before?
yeah i have, it was not serious but i got rearended
i got t-boned once, i will never forget spinning around in that car, hearing the tires squalling. it was really scary.
label: terrified
response: that is terrifying, i am so glad you are okay

situation: recently, my wife has lost a lot of loved ones. i have had to hold her in my arms several nights in a row while she cried to sleep.
dialogue: my wife has been really sad here recently, i have had to hold her while she cries herself to sleep at night.
that is very sad. did something recently happen to her?
shes lost a lot of loved ones this summer. we have been to 4 funerals, and the most recent one was really hard on her.
label: caring
response: that is absolutely horrible. i hope she has a moment of happiness very soon. no one should have to deal with that much loss.

situation: i have had a savings account with the same bank for over 10 years. i did not use it for a long time, but decided to use it again. i got a heck of a shock when i saw they'd been deducting $15/month due to inactivity. they did not even tell me!
dialogue: my bank, which i have had a savings account with for over 10 years has been deducting $15/month from me for "inactivity". how about that?
death by a thousand cuts, i call it! they will try to make a buck off anything!
very true. they did not even tell me. that was the last thing i expected! i only just decided to use it again.
label: surprised
response: did you try talking to them about it? i can only assume it would not go well but you never know.

situation: earlyier this week my brother in law committed suicide. the was only 28 years old. i could not breathe when i heard the news.
dialogue: have you ever had a friend or loved one commit suicide.
yes, i have.  one that actually died and one that was miraculously saved.  it was a dark and tough time.  did that happen to you recently?
yes, my brother in law/childhood friend took his own life. its been very hard to comes to terms with.
label: devastated
response: i am soo soo very sorry.  its so hard to understand everything surrounding a suicide so its hard to be at peace about something that did not have to happen.  i pray you and your family will find closure and fight for awareness for people who are struggling with those feelings.

situation: my new puppy keeps pooping in the house. we let him out and he poops outside too, but i am so tired of stepping in dog poo at 3am!
dialogue: have you ever had a new puppy?
yeah, i have. do you?
yeah, he keeps pooping in the floor! he is learning to go outside, but i am so tired of stepping in doggy poo at 3am!
label: annoyed
response: it happens. hope your dog will poop outside soon.

situation: i went to the fridge looking for my last piece of chocolate i was saving and it was gone!
dialogue: i store my chocolate in the fridge to make sure that it stays cold and solid. i was storing my last piece in there
always sucks when you forget to save it and wake up to a melted blob of brown.
last night i was not in a great mood and wanted that last piece to help cheer me up a bit and it was gone!
label: disappointed
response: oh wow! i hate when you get the urge to eat something and then you get to the fridge only to realize it is gone. do you know who ate it?

situation: i ran into my neighbor's mailbox but did not stop to leave a note. when i saw him replacing it, i felt so bad that i had to confess. he was angry that i did it, but glad that i came forward.
dialogue: i ran into my neighbor's mailbox with my car but did not stop and leave a note.
that is horrible! you should tell them as that is their property. what if someone did that to your stuff?
i agree, i felt so bad about it. when i saw him replacing it, i went out and confessed.
label: guilty
response: good on you!

situation: do not know how we gonna pay rent
dialogue: i am so stressed. we are struggling financially and i do not even know how are we going to pay rent this month
i know how you feel, financial problems are rough. i know you will figure out a way to make it.
thank you for your support! and to make things worse i broke a ceiling light yesterday and we are renting this apartment so i have to replace it and it is expensive
label: anxious
response: that really stinks! do not worry too much though, things will work out.

situation: i found an old scrapbook my mother put together of pictures and memories of our family growing up.
dialogue: my mom made a pretty awesome scrapbook and gave it to me for christmas several years ago. i recently dug it out and went through it.
that is awesome, what was in it?
photos from my whole life growing up, with sections about my relationships with each sibling. pretty awesome.
label: sentimental
response: you must be happy to have it back, those are the best memories.

situation: i was traveling internationally literally the day after a high level travel alert was issued for the region i was going.
dialogue: i once was taking a big trip i had been looking forward to and the day before we leave for an international flight a high level travel advisory was issued for the area we were going.
ugh! i hate it when stuff like that happens. were you able to get a refund on your tickets?
no. we went ahead and went on. it actually turned out to be a great trip with zero incidents.
label: afraid
response: awesome!

situation: i had planned a trip to florida to see some old friends and go canoeing on the river. at the last minute (a day before) the people riding with me had to cancel, and i was forced to cancel the trip.
dialogue: i hate it when plans fall through. i really wanted to spend my time on the water this last weekend.
i hate that too, what were you going to do?
i was going to florida to go on a multi-day canoeing and camping trip. at the last minute, the two people i was going with backed out, and i simply could not afford to go alone.
label: disappointed
response: maybe i could come with you, i am near florida.

situation: i never believed my grandpa was a rockstar until he jumped onto the stage and bit the head off of a bat. then he belted the words to 'crazy train' and jumped out into the audience! wow!
dialogue: my grandpa always said he was a rockstar back in his day, but i never believed him.
why do not you believe him? he made have been quite the big name back in his day.
i do not know if he was famous, but the other day, he got on stage, bit the head off of a bat, then belted the words to crazy train. it was unbelievable!
label: impressed
response: wow, that sounds amazing. i wish i could have seen that!

situation: i used to work a flooring job, one time we had to remove the floor where a man died, there was bodily fluids and it was gross.
dialogue: i used to do flooring work, we had to deal with some pretty strange situations sometimes.
that sounds interesting.  what kinds?
well, one time we had to replace the subfloor where a man had died and his cats had started to eat him. was revolting.
label: disgusted
response: oh that is awful!

situation: it really bothers me that my son keeps putting dirty socks in his toy box. no matter what i have tried he still does it.
dialogue: it really bothers me that my son sticks his dirty socks in the toy box
is that like the child equivalent of under the bed?
i guess so haha but no matter what i try to keep him from doing it, it still happens
label: annoyed
response: that is kinda strange. i assume that is something he will grow out of.  how old is he?

situation: i recently had my hair cut for the first time in years. it is not perfect, but in the end, my hair looks much thicker and healthier, so i am happy.
dialogue: i recently had my hip-length hair cut for the first time in years.
wow, that took some guts! what made you want to cut it?
it was kind of scraggly on the ends. it took me some time to get used to the new cut, but it looks much thicker and healthier now.
label: content
response: and just think about how much you are saving on shampoo and conditioner!

situation: i went around work all day today with a hole in my pants, right on my bottom. nobody told me until i was leaving. i have no idea how many people noticed!
dialogue: i went around work all day today with a hole in my pants, right on my bottom.
ahhhh! i have done that before, but i noticed it quick.  did you not know til the end of the day?
yep! no one told me. i have no idea how many people noticed or saw it.
label: embarrassed
response: that is embarrassing, ah, i am sorry.  just play it off tomorrow at work!

situation: i paid $1000 for a mystery box on ebay. it said it would be filled with all sorts of cool and expensive items. when i opened it, it was nothing but literal garbage.
dialogue: i paid $1000 for one of those mystery boxes on ebay. it said it would be filled with all sorts of fun and expensive items.
please tell me it was not full of oriental trading company rubber ducks and cheap tchotchkes.
i would've happily taken that! instead, it was filled with literal garbage, like a bunch of those empty 99 bananas bottles and candy wrappers.
label: disappointed
response: oh man! i feel bad for laughing but "literal garbage" is pretty funny. that sucks, can you report them to ebay?

situation: i had a final exam today. i know i aced it because i prepared for weeks.
dialogue: i had my final exam for chemistry today!
how did you do?
i am pretty sure i aced it! i have been studying for weeks.
label: confident
response: that is good. i was never good at chemistry

situation: it can get really rough when you have a problem and just need to vent. it is even more hard when you realize you do not really have anyone to talk with.
dialogue: it can be rough when i have a problem and need to vent to someone
i understand, anything you need to talk about?
you are sweet because part of the problem is when i realize there really is no one to talk to. thank you
label: lonely
response: buck up little camper.

situation: i am training a new girl at work. she is doing so good for her first week!
dialogue: i have been training a new girl at work this week!
how is she doing
she is doing great, especially for her second week on the job!
label: proud
response: i am happy for you and her

situation: i am already shopping for christmas, it is my favourite time of the year! it makes me feel so happy
dialogue: i have already been shopping for christmas, i am excited!
i cannot believe christmas is in 4 months it is crazy
i know, it is my favourite time of year! makes me happy
label: joyful
response: mine is the fall. halloween, thanksgiving..what is not to love.
