situation: i had just spend 100 dollars on rolling a slot machine. after i just left and did not win anything, someone came up and hit triple 7s at the machine i was just at.
dialogue: i was just at the casino, spent almost 100 dollars on a single machine. i did not will anything.
well the casino won! did you at least get some free drinks?
haha, yeah i got a little sauced. the worst part though was as soon as i got up, someone sat down and  rolled triple 7s.
label: jealous
response: hah. at least you had fun it sounds like

situation: running up the stairs in the dark when i was a kid.
dialogue: i used to get supremely scared when i wanted to go up stairs when the lights were off
i do hate when the lights are off too
yeah, so i would book it up the stairs as fast as possible
label: terrified
response: i am sure i would too. just be careful

situation: i had just met a new girl on match.com. i was looking forward to our first date and hoping to make a good impression.
dialogue: i just got matched up with someone online. it will be my first date in a while.
i am happy for you. are you excited?
yeah, i am really hoping to make a good impression. other wise that would feel pretty bad.
label: anticipating
response: i bet you will be fine. just be yourself

situation: i have been working on a big proposal for weeks. tomorrow, i have to give the presentation to the client and in-front of my team.
dialogue: tomorrow is the big day, i have to deliver my proposal to the client.
are you ready for it?
i have been preparing for weeks, but in the back of my mind i still have doubts.
label: anxious
response: i am sure you will do well

situation: my boyfriend's cat wakes me up every morning at 4 am. he just stands in the hallway and meows, even if he is been fed. it drives me nuts!
dialogue: my boyfriend's cat wakes me up every morning at 4 am.
that must be annoying for you, but i love cats.
i love him, too, a lot. but i do not know why he just stands in the hallway and meows nonstop, even when he is been fed.
label: annoyed
response: what is his name?

situation: i am so close to obtaining my associate's. i only have three more classes to take. i have been at it since 2011 (!), but i just got serious in 2016.
dialogue: i am finally almost done with my associate's degree! i technically started wayyyy back in 2011, but i just got serious in 2016.
oh that is great! congratulations on your upcoming finish!
thank you. i only have three classes left to take. i am so excited.
label: proud
response: that is amazing. i wish you the best of luck with the remaining classes!

situation: when i was a teen, i worked as a server at a restaurant. my family, including my grandmother came to sit in my section, and the host informed them i was picking up my grandmother from the airport. i was mortified.
dialogue: playing hookey can be really fun. but sometimes it backfires.
ohh what happened?

when i was a teenager, i called in to the restaurant and told them i had to pick up my grandmother from an aiport hours away. would not you know it my family came in (including my grandma) and asked to be sat in my section!
label: ashamed
response: sometimes things like these happens. do not worry. but playing hookey is a fun though

situation: i had planned a bicycle tour with a friend of mine. at the last minute, he was unable to come on the trip with me. i ended up only doing about half the trip and flying home.
dialogue: sometimes i enjoy being alone, but not on a long trip that takes me far away from home.
i know exactly what you mean.  it gets so lonely on the road.  have you had to go away recently?
this was a while back, but i planned a bicycle trip that went across several states. although i had a buddy coming with me originally, he ended up bailing and i went alone. i called it quits halfway.
label: lonely
response: that is still quite a long ride.  do you do a lot of long distance biking?

situation: last night i met a beautiful girl at the bar. one thing let to another and we ending up spending the night together.
dialogue: i have a beautiful girl friend. but i met someone else.
on to the next one, as they say!
i am trying to figure out how to kick her out of my place.
label: guilty
response: have the new chick there when she comes home

situation: i have just watched the first ring movie. i keep having nightmares and cannot sleep with the lights off.
dialogue: i just watched the ring movie for the first time.
oh yeah.  i have never seen it, i cannot watch horror films.  how did you like it?
i cannot even sleep with the lights off now for the last few days.
label: terrified
response: ohhh boy.  i hope you have a person or an animal to snuggle up to to help you feel better.

situation: once i took a sip of iced tea while i was driving and it went down the wrong pipe. i had to pull over so i could try to breathe again.
dialogue: once i took a sip of iced tea while i was driving and it went down the wrong pipe. i had to pull over so i could try to breathe again.
that is scary when that happens
yeah it is. i thought i was about to die
label: afraid
response: some people do die from choking, be safe!

situation: i stole some candy from the grocery store. i wanted to see if i could get away with it.
dialogue: my cashier gave me extra change back and i did not say anything.
why is that?
because i had also stolen some candy and wanted to get out as soon as possible.
label: guilty
response: oh that makes sense, well be careful

situation: one time someone came to my door with a gun. he came to the house asking for money but i did not have any, so he took some items from the house
dialogue: a man came to my door with a gun, asking for money.
whoa, that is scary! did you know him?
i did not know him. he took some items from the house as i did not have any money on me
label: terrified
response: i am glad that you are okay!

situation: reading a book that i forgot about
dialogue: i like finding little resources or tips that change old habits i have been coping with in what seems like "1 easy step"
hahaha, sounds kind of like clickbait
exactly, i started taping my mouth closed at night, finally woke up before noon, mission accomplished
label: sentimental
response: hahahaha, that is so funny

situation: finally figured out why i was not getting good sleep
dialogue: i started taping my mouth closed before bed, and now i am no longer tired when i wake up, feels like i am born again
that is weird but amazing! does it work?  if it does, i will get my husband to tape his mouth shut.  he snores like a freight train because his tongue slides back i guess.  is that true for you?
yeah, it
label: joyful
response: do you have any advice on what kind of tape?

situation: i went for a walk in the park with my girlfriend, to our usual spot near the museum. when we got there, a giant festival was happening with games, performances and a fireworks display at sunset. it was delightful!
dialogue: sometimes life just hits you on the head with a good time. like the other day when i went to the park with my girlfriend.
that sounds like a nice time!
it was, but not just because of a romantic walk. when we arrived, there was a festival with games, performances and a fireworks display after sunset! it was incredible!
label: surprised
response: wow that worked out perfectly

situation: one time i was trying to study for a final but my neighbors were being really loud. i found it really hard to focus
dialogue: i was trying to study for a final but my neighbors were being really loud, and i had a hard time focusing
did you go over and ask them to turn down the volume?
no, i am shy and try to avoid confrontation as much as possible
label: annoyed
response: well, i hope you have some really good earphones or that they quiet down it is a big egotistical to think that no one around you cares when you are that loud.

situation: one day my debit card suddenly stopped working.the fraud prevention said it was the bank, and the bank said it was fraud prevention. after trying to use it again, i went back to the band and was informed they would need to send me a new card.
dialogue: i really should have switched banks a long time ago. nobody over there knows their head from their butt!
i know what you mean. once i had a bank where the teller's literally had butts for heads. it was so distracting trying to talk to them.
that sounds truly bizarre! i guess i am still angry because the other day they froze my card, and due to a teller's mistake actually had to take my current card and mail me a new one!
label: angry
response: well it was an upgrade from the bank i had where the tellers were actually robots. i cannot believe the cost-cutting measures in place today!

situation: a decade or so i designed an arcade machine for some friends of mine that owned a bar. they no longer own it, but i went back recently and our machine was still running. playing it made me miss my buddy and all the good times we used to have.
dialogue: i went to a bar i used to go to in college, and i was surprised to see an arcade machine i built with a dear friend of mine!
wow  that is nostalgic!. it must have brought back lot of good memories
yes, playing the machine we built together reminded me of all the good times we used to have.
label: sentimental
response: does the machine is in good condition now?

situation: i went to the dentist for the first time in five years recently. i had a toothache and wanted to get it looked at
dialogue: i hadn't been to the dentist in five years but made an appointment recently because of a toothache
what happened?
i just started to feel a sharp pain in one of my teeth. it might be a cavity or something worse
label: apprehensive
response: are they going to pull the tooth?

situation: i waited in line for tickets to the new star wars movie for 2 days. after selling two tickets to the person in front of me, they informed me they were sold out for the evening.
dialogue: i cannot believe i am telling you this, but i actually camped out to buy tickets for the new star wars movie.
that is not strange at all
i am glad you do not think so. the kicker is, when i got to the front of the line the guy in front of me got the last two tickets!
label: disappointed
response: that sucks. what did you do?

situation: the day of the big parade, my girlfriend sprained her ankle on the way down her stairs. instead of going, i stayed home with her watching netflix and eating icecream.
dialogue: my girlfriend and i were going to a big parade with some friends. as we were leaving, she tripped on the stairs and hurt her ankle.
oh no, the poor girl. was she able to walk afterwards?
unfortunately, it swelled up and she was in no shape to go anywhere. so instead, i stayed with her and watched netflix while we split a pint of icecream.
label: caring
response: you are a terrific partner. you guys can do something outdoors next time, right?

situation: i was astonished when the cat came through the window
dialogue: my cat jumped through the window in the basement and it was the most shocking, but ultimately underwhelming thing
hahaha why was it underwhelming?
i guess because furry things do not really scare me, i was like well that was a waste of a reaction
label: surprised
response: lol how do you feel about spiders?

situation: when i was listening to music at the gym
dialogue: i was getting mad at the weights in the gym to see how much i could lift
why were you getting mad?  were you not lifting as much as you wanted?
no not really, just seeing how much energy i could summon from within
label: angry
response: i see,  i do that too sometimes.  it helps with motivation

situation: wondering about the future
dialogue: there is too many things to think about
you are good at generalizing are not you?
yeah, what am i getting myself into
label: anxious
response: i have no clue. really i do not!

situation: i just won a large lottery. i bought a couple scratch cards and made $20,000.
dialogue: i just finally won some money playing scratch lotto tickets.
how much did you win?
close to $20,000, i think i am going to spend it on traveling.
label: excited
response: that is sounds like a fun trip or 8

situation: i went to a play recently that took place around a pool. it was an adaptation of "the last unicorn" with parts of performed in the water and parts of it performed on a giant trapeze. it was magical!
dialogue: i went to a play recently that was unconventional in a really fun way. it actually took place at a pool.
that sounds cool.
it was an adaptation of "the last unicorn". it had parts that took place in the water, and parts that took place on a giant trapeze!
label: joyful
response: wow. i would love to see something like that

situation: one time i was given a puppy. she was very cute and playful
dialogue: i got a new puppy. she is really cute and playful
what did you name her?
i named her layla.
label: joyful
response: that is so cute!

situation: i recently went to a steely dan concert with my lady, and it reminded me of those crazy days back when we used to get in so much trouble. times were so much simpler then.
dialogue: i recently went to a steely dan concert with my lady.
oh you must have enjoyed it!
yeah, it was awesome reminiscing about those times when we used to get in trouble back in the day. times were so much simpler then.
label: nostalgic
response: yeah indeed it must have been then

situation: i just got a new puppy. it is a lot of work to care for it, they need a a lot of attention
dialogue: i just got a new puppy, names fido.
so cute! what kind of dog is it?
it is a german shepherd. it takes a lot of work caring for it, definitely needs a lot of attention
label: caring
response: that is amazing, i wish i could get a puppy too, but my cat is not friendly

situation: on my way to work, a goose stole my toupee. we just hired a new secretary, christy, and i need my hairpiece in order to impress her. i am so furious with that goose, i could wring its neck.
dialogue: on my way to work, a goose stole the toupee i needed to impress the new secretary, christy.
that is crazy did you ever get it back?
no! i am so furious with that goose, that i could wring his neck! i cannot get any ladiez with this chrome dome of mine.
label: angry
response: i am so sorry maybe you will have better luck next time.

situation: i was doing the dishes. a huge roach crawled out from underneath the dish washer. i almost threw up in my mouth.
dialogue: i was doing the dishes and a huge roach crawled out from underneath the dishwasher.
eww, it may be time to call someone to take care of them.
i almost fell over trying to crush it, i forgot i was not wearing shoes and stepped on in with my bare feet.
label: disgusted
response: oh, that had to be super gross!

situation: i was out walking down the street at night, it was scary and dark and i felt like i was surrounded by unnatural beings.
dialogue: i was walking down the street at night, i felt like i was surrounded by something unseen.
how creepy!
every time i turned around to try and catch something there was nothng there. just the feeling of something watching me.
label: afraid
response: at least nothing happened to yo

situation: one time i had an in person interview for a job. i did not really feel prepared for it
dialogue: i had a job interview that i did not really feel prepared for.
that is rough. did you end up getting the job?
i did not get it unfortunately.
label: anxious
response: well, there is always next time. at least you can chalk it up as a learning experience.

situation: one time, i smelled an odd smell coming from my car. i opened my hood and took off the engine cover and found a dead squirrel rotting! it was so repulsive.
dialogue: one time, i smelled an odd burning smell coming from under the hood of my car.
that is strange. what did you discover under there?
well, when i went to lift the engine cover, i noticed a dead, rotting squirrel on top of the engine block! it was so repulsive.
label: disgusted
response: oh my! that is repulsive indeed! i would've taken it home for dinner. waste not want not!

situation: i was driving across the street. i got rear ended while i was just trying to go out and get some milk and bread.
dialogue: i went to the store, just trying to get some milk and bread, and i got rear ended by a driver.
oh no!  are you okay?
yeah, it was more of a shock than anything, was not expecting someone to hit you when you are just crossing the street.
label: surprised
response: yeah i bet!  did they stop and check on you?

situation: i was giving a speech to try and get funds to run for local office. i had worked long and hard to sound prepped but also authentic.
dialogue: i have been working and prepping a powerful and moving speech.
oh yeah? is it on par with "i have a dream"?
i can only dream. no it is more on par with lord of the ring's final battle.
label: prepared
response: woah now! i was not thinking of a speech on that grand of a scale! i hope you blow gimli's beard clean off his face and make 20 horns of gondor sound!

situation: i was in a huge hurry and needed to get through the checkout. if i did not get through i could not make it to the bank before it closed.
dialogue: someone let me cut in line at the store so i could check out faster.
wow that was really nice of them
yeah, i was in a huge hurry and did not have much but i really needed to make it to the bank before it closed.
label: grateful
response: most people now a days will not do that. make sure to pay it forward!

situation: i took a math test and thought i had done horribly on it. i actually did really well on it as the grade i received was 103
dialogue: i thought i bombed my math test but i got a 103 on it.
that is great, man! did you study hard for it?
i reviewed all the homework and the test questions mostly had the same problems on them. i did not feel like i understood how to do the problems but i remembered the answers.
label: surprised
response: well, that is all that matters! just gotta pass those exams!

situation: i was looking at old photos of my family. it made me feel sad and nostalgic about the past.
dialogue: i just found a photo book of me and my family growing up.
aw, that is awesome, did it bring back memories?
it was pretty nostalgic , how young we all looked growing up.
label: sentimental
response: yeah, it is always nice to take a look back and reflect on the early days.

situation: i had finally got to see a baseball game at a stadium. it was amazing how high up we were in the stadium and yet could still see everything perfectly.
dialogue: i finally got to see a baseball game live this last week.
nice! who did you go see? did you catch a homerun?
it was the rockies, no home-run though, it was pretty high up there i felt like i could see the world.
label: joyful
response: that sounds amazing. all i have is my lowly senators sea level stadium..i am mad jealous.

situation: my friend asked me to help clean his grandma's house after she had died. she was a hoarder, and kept 10 cats in the house with her. the house was covered in paper, bugs and cat feces.
dialogue: when my buddy asked me to help him clean out his grandmother's house who had recently passed, i was not prepared for what we found.
oh dang. was she a hoarder? what did you find?
you hit it right on the money. she was not only a hoarder but a cat lady, and the mix of paper, bugs and cat feces was an affront to the senses.
label: disgusted
response: i cannot even imagine the stench..did you make out with any buried treasure?

situation: i let my dad borrow my car and he got in an accident. it made my insurance rate increase.
dialogue: i let my dad borrow my car and he got in a minor accident.
oh that is terrible.  is he alright?
yeah he is fine and my car was not damaged. my insurance premium is probably going to go up though.
label: angry
response: that really stinks that that happens.  are you pretty upset about it?

situation: when i bought my new car, i could not believe how smooth the ride was. i thought it would be much rougher.
dialogue: when i bought my new car, i could not believe how smooth the ride was.
i do love a smooth ride. what kind of car is it?
it is a chevrolet camaro.
label: impressed
response: that is awesome! i am mad jealous that you have my dream car!

situation: i was so happy to get my acceptance letter for grad school.
dialogue: i studied for 7 months to take the gre exam, it was stressful.
wow, you were dedicated, did you do well on it?
i did, and i was accepted to my number 1 program, which meant that i was going to be paid to learn!
label: excited
response: congratulations, all the hard work paid off!

situation: i studied all night for my final exams. i needed to pass them to graduate from college.
dialogue: i studied all night for my final exams. i needed to pass them to graduate from college.
that must of been pretty stressful. but did you get enough sleep?
i did. i was able to sneak in a few hours here and there.
label: prepared
response: sleep is just as important as studying hard. you can kill your performance without it.

situation: i went to a movie and afterward my wallet fell out of my pants. i did not notice till i was half way home. it was the last showing and i did not know if i could get it back.
dialogue: i left my wallet in a movie theater, and did not notice till i was half way home!
that is terrible! did you get it back with everything still inside?
i was able to get back in and find it, it was pretty well hidden in between the seats. no harm no foul.
label: terrified
response: at least you have a happy ending for that story.

situation: i recently went to a rock concert. we were not going to go, but someone gave her 3 free tickets. we went and had a great night.
dialogue: some people are just so generous. really makes you feel like there is some humanity left out there.
i agree. i think i am one of them, considering i gave my whole life savings to charity yesterday.
that is incredible if true, but i have trouble believing you for some reason. i was talking about some stranger who gave my friend 3 free tickets to a rock concert we had such a blast!
label: grateful
response: that is really great, but i swear it was true! it was a whole 50 cents. looking back on it, i am kinda sad i did it because now i cannot buy that fancy fidget spinner at the supermarket. hopefully some orphan uses it wisely.

situation: watching my daughter perform her first solo dance competition routine.
dialogue: i was so proud of my daughter over the weekend.
that is good to hear, what did she do to make you proud?
she performed her first solo dance in competition, but she had been in leg braces for the last 2 years.
label: sentimental
response: oh wow! that is amazing, i am sure that was a really touching moment!

situation: i was hoping to go on vacation this summer but could not get the time off.
dialogue: i am grateful for the work hours, but bummed that i cannot get time off.
sorry to hear that. maybe you can talk with your boss about changing the schedule a bit.
well, i have worked without a break for the last 3 years, i just want to get away abit.
label: disappointed
response: wow, that is a long time! that shows how dedicated you are to your job, and that you deserve some time off!

situation: i have been really diligent in my studies, and will be in two clubs this coming year. i think by next summer i will be able to score a paid internship!
dialogue: i have been extremely diligent in my studies so far, and am participating in two clubs this upcoming year. the future is looking bright!
that is awesome.  what are you hoping to do?
i am an electrical engineering student, and i am interested in quite a few things at this point. i think after this year, i will be able to get a paid internship next summer!
label: hopeful
response: that is the dream, to get paid in college.  i wish i could have done that.  congratulations!

situation: the garbage company for my town went under and left us without service.
dialogue: i am so tired of hauling garbage to the county dump.
are you cleaning out a house or do you not have garbage pick-up?
the company in my city just quit picking up for any of the residents, so the dump has a line every day.
label: furious
response: that is insane! i have never heard of anything like that before.  you all should start protesting!

situation: i recently went to a dinner with some of my partner's old friends. they actually cooked and served bread made with "cockroach flour". i appreciate the gesture but, no thank you!
dialogue: oh really? what was it they served?
i should have known better, as these friends are on the "crunchier side". they had a loaf of bread that they made with flour that had cockroaches added to it!
oh wow. i really cannot imagine eating it knowing it had those in it.
label: disgusted
response: i lost my appetite completely! i will be sure to get takeout before hand if we ever go to another one of their dinners.

situation: i am looking forward to hearing from my mother about her last cancer check.
dialogue: my mom is supposed to call me regarding her test results.
i hope she hears some good news. is it pretty serious?
she had stage 3 cancer, but she was clear last screening a year ago.
label: hopeful
response: i will be praying for her, i hope she continues to stay in the clear in the future.

situation: i was at a wedding reception with a bunch of old friends. my buddies wife, who had quite a bit to drink, was hitting on me when he left to get a drink. i told her to sober up and let my friend know he should probably take his wife home.
dialogue: i went to a wedding recently, and something happened that put a damper on it. i felt bad for my buddy, but at least he knows he can trust me.
oh no, it is awful something happens on that special day that should be full of joy and whatnot.
yeah, his wife got drunk and paid a pass at me. i told her to sober up, and let him know what had happened.
label: faithful
response: yikes. well, at least you did the right thing by passing that long, as painful as it might have been.

situation: annoyed: i am highly upset that i am the only one concerned with earning money for our bills
dialogue: i am highly upset that i am the only one concerned with earning money for our bills
am sorry about that, what are others doing about it
not much. it is all on me. it sucks
label: annoyed
response: sorry, just tryy to be patient with them

situation: nostalgic: i love playing old school video games. the music is amazing
dialogue: i love playing old school video games. the music is amazing
old school video games are full nostalgic memories for me. that is why i try to avoid them as they evoke many emotions in me
for me it is happy emotions
label: nostalgic
response: it is just that i miss my friends a lot with whom i used to play. i wish i could just rewind time and go back

situation: my girlfriend and i really like going to breweries. unfortunately, there hadn't been any in our small town. then, we got the news that one will be opening a few weeks from now!
dialogue: the micro brewery explosion in america has been awesome for my girlfriend and i, as we love craft beer. until recently, our town did not have one though.
i love beer! i wish i could try your guy's beer.  is it a hard process?
we actually do not brew our own, and hadn't been able to try many because we live in a small town. but we just got the news that a micro brewery was opening here in a few weeks!
label: excited
response: awesome, that is great news!  hope you guys make a great tasting one and become big!

situation: jealous: i hate it when other guys look at my girl
dialogue: i hate it when other guys look at my girl
ooh, you should not be, she should be appreciated for looking good
she is for my eyes only. at least she does not pay them any attention. or i would flip!
label: jealous
response: aha, that is funny though

situation: anthony bourdain was a huge inspiration for me when i worked in a kitchen. everyone i have worked with has read "kitchen confidential". when he passed away i felt we had lost an ally and a friend.
dialogue: everyone i have ever worked with in a kitchen has either already read "kitchen confidential", or i have made them read it. we were all devastated when anthony bourdain passed away earlier this year.
oh, i have not read it, but i was also sad to hear he passed
he started from the bottom and worked his way up. he had a passion for people as well as food, and we all still look up to him.
label: sad
response: yes, too bad he was struggling with his depression and could not seek help

situation: my husband and my friends planned a baby shower for me without me knowing. on the day of the shower, my husband took me out to lunch to give my friends time to set up. when we got back to my house, everyone was there. i had a great time and it meant a lot to me that they would do that for me.
dialogue: my husband and friends planned me a baby shower without me knowing.
aw, that is so nice of them! was it fun?
yes, it was a lot of fun and it caught me off guard. it meant a lot that they did it for me.
label: surprised
response: that is great! it is so nice that you have people around you who care

situation: i gave twin fawns in our yard some fresh peaches and they loved them.
dialogue: i gave twin fawns in our yard some fresh peaches and they loved them.
ohhh.i would love that experience! how special!
i enjoy helping the wildlife in our area. it is alway a good feeling to give a helping hand.
label: caring
response: i love that too! i try feeding everyone awesome!

situation: my wife is getting back from being in germany for 2 months in a week.  i cannot wait!
dialogue: in a week my wife will finally be back from being out of the country for 2 months!
oh geez! why was she gone for so long?
she was taking a language course in germany for her graduate studies.
label: excited
response: that is pretty cool! that would be hard though! were you all able to talk a lot?

situation: i just told my next door neighbor that i am moving out. he said he'd be really sorry to see me go. i really did not expect him to say that we only really see each other when he is walking his dog.
dialogue: i am moving into another apartment and just told my neighbor i was leaving. he said he was sorry i am going!
how long have you been there ?
about a year and a half. i really did not expect him to say that we do not know each other that well.
label: surprised
response: sometimes we affect people that we do not realize.

situation: my boss made me work overtime yesterday and i did not even get paid for it!
dialogue: ugh.my boss made me stay late yesterday, so i had to work overtime, but i did not even get paid for it!
that does not seem fair. how are they getting around not paying you for it?
i am technically salaried, so i do not get paid overtime. it is still really irritating.
label: annoyed
response: it sounds like your boss needs to be more considerate when it comes to his employees.

situation: i went out to my car one morning to go to work.  some kids in the condo complex had thrown food all over the top of my car.
dialogue: i went to my car one morning and found that some kids in my condo complex had thrown food all over it
wow, did you ever get them in trouble?

sadly, no.  there is no actual proof of who it was, but we have seen them doing random stuff like that all over the place.  he did have the cops called on him for unrelated things once, so i will take that as a victory.
label: angry
response: there you go, take victories where you can get them!

situation: my husband went to a job fair today and got tons of offers! he gets out of military in november. ready for a new start in a new town
dialogue: my husband went to a job fair and got a lot of job offers!
great, what is his field ?
he is currently active duty army, but is wanting to go into transportation/logistics.
label: hopeful
response: i see. i hope for all the best for you and him.

situation: having a great day today! the sun is out and i am on my second cup of coffee. about to make lunch.
dialogue: it is been a great day so far! the sun is out and i am on my second cup of coffee!
sounds super relaxing! i bet your enjoying it!
yes i am, about to make some soup for lunch. this day has been just what i needed!
label: content
response: that is awesome! what kind of soup do you make?

situation: when i applied for the job i have now, it took them almost a month to get back to me.  i contacted them two or three times and they kept telling me they were working on it.
dialogue: when i applied for the job i have now it took them like a month to get back to me with a final answer.  it was pretty stressful.

my brother just graduated and is on the job hunt, and he is described his experience as the same thing. seems like he has good interviews and they are receptive to him, but they do not really respond or give him an answer. sorry to hear you guys go through that. cannot imagine how frustrating it is
super frustrating.  it worked out in the end, but i had to bug them a few times to make sure they hadn't abandoned me.
label: anxious
response: good on you for being aggressive and opportunistic. maybe they found that to be the motivating factor to give you the job. i hope it is been good so far.

situation: my friend took early retirement recently and he and his wife are jetting all over the world, having a wonderful time. i wish i could do that!
dialogue: a friend of mine took early retirement recently and he and his wife are traveling all over the world.
that sounds like so much fun!
i know i wish i could do that. they've been to france, italy, croatia and chile so far i am sitting in nc!
label: jealous
response: i totally get why you feel that way.  your time will come soon.

situation: my wife has been out of the country for school for 2 months.  she gets back in a week, i am super excited!
dialogue: my wife has been out of the country for 2 months, she gets back in a week.  i cannot wait!
that is good! i bet you missed her a lot.
i really did.  it will be great to have her back
label: anticipating
response: i am sure she will have a lot to tell you about her trip!

situation: when i interviewed for the job i have now, i did not hear back from them with a solid response for a month.  i kept having to check with them to make sure i hadn't been forgotten.
dialogue: when i interviewed for the job i have now, they did not give me a solid answer for like a month after the interview.
that is a long time to kind of hang in limbo. i am sorry you had to endure that for a month.
it worked out ok, but i had to keep bugging them to make sure they hadn't given up on me.
label: anxious
response: well, at least that story had a happy ending. it could have went much worse.

situation: my wife has been out of the country for 2 months for school.  it is been a little tough being alone at home ever night.
dialogue: my wife has been out of the country for the last 2 months for school.
aw, i bet you miss her a lot.
i do.  she is getting back soon, but it is been tough being along with the dogs every night.
label: lonely
response: well, at least the dogs still have you for company. i am sure you will be happy when she gets back though.

situation: i had an interview for a job a while back, one that i really wanted to get.  it felt like it went well, but all i could do was wait.
dialogue: when i interviewed for my current job, i felt like it went well but all i could do was wait.
what kind of job is it?
a lab technician at a university.
label: hopeful
response: interesting! what kind of things do you do?

situation: my parents bought my brother a brand new iphone.
dialogue: my parents brought my brother a brand new iphone. he always gets the newest stuff and i get stuck with nothing.
aw man that sucks how come he gets to get one but not you
i have no idea. he is the "golden child." it is super unfair.
label: jealous
response: well after a certain age parent's start to treat children differently

situation: my wife has been out of the country for 2 months for school, and she was having a really bad day one day.  i felt terrible that i could not help her.
dialogue: my wife has been out of the country for two months, which is really hard when one of us is having a bad day and we cannot help the other.
when does she return?
she gets back in a week, so it is almost over.
label: sad
response: well that is good

situation: my husband opened the door and a huge wasp flew in! it was so nasty
dialogue: my husband opened the door and a huge wasp flew in! i hate insects. they are so nasty
did you go running like crazy!?
heck yes i did! i locked myself in the room and told him he needs to kill that thing before he goes to work
label: disgusted
response: i would have done the same glad no one got stung!

situation: i hate going outdoors during rain season there is mosquitos everywhere i go i cannot stand them
dialogue: i hate all the mosquitos that grow during the rain season
they are bad now too, they are so annoying
yes i hate going out when it is rainny season there is so many of them
label: annoyed
response: it can be irritating to deal with this time of year

situation: i had to kill a giant spider yesterday
dialogue: both me and my girlfriend are super scared of spiders, but she made me kill a huge one yesterday.
come on, the worst that can happen is that it kills you.
exactly! is not that enough to fear them?!
label: terrified
response: it is certainly a good enough reason to kill them.

situation: i am going skydiving for the first time!
dialogue: i am going skydiving for the first time with some friends!
wow, are you nervous at all
a little bit, but i love doing extreme stuff like this.
label: excited
response: that is exciting. i would never have the guts to do it so kudos to you.

situation: i forgot about a glass of tea outside the other night and when i went to get it today it was full of bugs!
dialogue: the othern ight i was having tea outside and forgot my glass outside all night!
that kind of stinks. sorry to hear that! well, at least there are worst things to forget outside. maybe this is an easy learning lesson!
it was gross though when i went to go and get it! it was all full of bugs!
label: disgusted
response: i did not even think of that! that is one thing about tea with me, that i have never gotten into it because you get it and it is so hot, so you have to wait forever to drink it. you set it down and then ultimately forget it!

situation: i have just been to see my orthopedic surgeon. he has suggested an operation to fix my hip. i am worried about it as surgery is quite stressful.
dialogue: on my last visit to my orthopedic surgeon he suggested surgery to fix my hip.
yikes that sounds scary but overall good for the end results. how do you feel about it?
nervous. surgery is a big step and i am afraid something will go wrong.
label: anxious
response: i understand i would be too but now a days technology is really good just make sure its a reliable hospital!

situation: my friend helped me to pack
dialogue: i am about to go overseas and i was so overwhelmed with packing and getting ready and my friend came over and helped me to pack
that is a good friend you got there.
she is wonderful! she helped me out so many times i do not know what i would do withiut her
label: grateful
response: never take someone like that for granted. they are so rare.

situation: my cell phone played a video out loud, which i had never watched, and it had profanity. this happened while i was checking out at the store yesterday.
dialogue: cell phones are great, but sometimes they can cause situations that are uncomfortable.
what types of situations are you referring to?
usually they just interupt with a ring. but youtube is on my lock screen and it played out loud while i was inline, and it was not an appropriate topic!
label: embarrassed
response: lol, did everyone around you make funny faces?

situation: my dog died today. she had cancer and we were not able to save her. my daughter is upset, and will not stop crying.
dialogue: my dog died today
i am so sorry to hear that. was she able to go surrounded by you guys?
yes, she had cancer so we knew she was going to pass soon. my daughter will not stop crying.
label: sentimental
response: it is hard to lose a family member like that. you guys should take some time to grieve.

situation: my daughter went on vacation with her friends and the house feels really alone without her
dialogue: my daughter went on vacation with her friends and the house feels so lonely
where did they go?
they went to the beach for 1 week
label: lonely
response: that sounds like so much fun!

situation: i am moving to a new apartment in a few weeks and am so psyched about it. i will finally be away from my loud, obnoxious upstairs neighbors!
dialogue: i am moving to a new apartment in a few weeks and cannot wait! no more obnoxious upstairs neighbors!
that is great!  i have got to deal with loud neighbors too.  anything specific they do?
stomp around at all times of the day and night, screeching into their cellphones and playing loud video games. what do yours do?
label: excited
response: loud running toddler who pitches fits at random times, day or night.  sounds like a similar level of noise :p

situation: my wife is coming back into the country next week after being gone for 2 months.  i am super excited!
dialogue: my wife has been out of the country for two months, and is coming back in a week!
oh wow, i bet you cannot wait! i remember when i had to spend a summer overseas and it was awful to be away from my husband.
it sure is.  it is just been me and the dogs all summer, i have gotten super bored :p
label: joyful
response: well, she will be back soon and you will have loads of catching up to do. i bet the dogs missed her too!

situation: i had such a huge spider ran past me in the bathroom. i am so grossed out by all the bugs here!
dialogue: i hope you do too! applying is a huge step in the right direction!
could you elaborate as to why?
i had such a huge spider ran past me in the bathroom. i am so grossed out by all the bugs here!
label: disgusted
response: oh no could you call an exterminator?

situation: i really feel like i am going to win my soccer game next week, i feel with my skill i will make my team win
dialogue: i feel that with my training lately i am going to win my next week soccer game
i am sure you will do great!  how long have you been training?
for this specific game for about 3 months
label: confident
response: wow, that is a lot of dedication!  i believe in you!

situation: after moving i went through a decently long period of unemployment.  it was starting to get tough not having a good source of income to support myself.
dialogue: after my wife and i moved i went through a while of unemployment.  it was really tough not being able to support us.
i can imagine, i have been there and it is the worst just belive in yourself
it is gotten better now, but it could still get even better.  just got to keep on moving.
label: sad
response: yeah it always gets bbbetter that is the good thing

situation: i cannot wait for my trip next summer i have been planning it for over 2 years it is going to be great
dialogue: i am really happy for next year i have a trip planned to go to india
that sounds like fun! i have always wanted to visit india.
yeah i have been planning this trip for over 2 years
label: excited
response: nice. i hope you have a great time!

situation: when my neighbors were away for a week i enjoyed a new lease of life. peace and quiet, able to do what i wanted, when i wanted. it was lovely.
dialogue: i had the most wonderful week recently. my neighbors were not here and i could do whatever i wanted without them stomping on my head!
that sounds like a relief.
it was. i cannot even brush my teeth at 8am without one or the other of them thumping around upstairs.
label: content
response: it seems like it is a lot of ruckus, i have visited friends who have your situation and i can only imagine.

situation: i went to work with my pants inside out.
dialogue: i went to work with my pants inside out, and i did not notice until my secretary pointed it out.
omg i would have been so embarrassed! :o
it was very embarrassing! at least i did not go the whole day like that.
label: embarrassed
response: thats true imagine if you had! it takes a lot of talent tho to put your pants on inside out and still manage to button them. ha ha

situation: i was really scared when i got off a plane in los angeles and no one was in the terminal at 4 in the morning.
dialogue: the airport was completely empty the other day.
that is awesome, i hope that happens to me on my next trip, where where you going
home, but i thought la would be crowded even at 4am, it made the hair on my arms stand up it was so creepy.
label: afraid
response: well you are really lucky to have an empty airport

situation: i really miss my family dog back home i have not seen him in 2 years and really looking forward to seeing how much he has grown
dialogue: i cannot wait to see my dog back home it has been 2 years since i see him
i would go mad, were you away at college or in the service?
college, but i will be seeing him very soon i think
label: nostalgic
response: that is great, i am sure he misses you and will be so happy to see you. he will smell you coming and know your there even before you get in the door.

situation: i was so proud of my youngest child going to school today.
dialogue: so my youngest went to his first day of kindergarten today.  so proud of him.  silly i know.
that is not silly at all! i am sure he will love it.
i hope so should be home really soon.  cannot wait to hear all about it.  it goes by to fast!
label: proud
response: yeah, he will be all grown up before you know it!

situation: a few months ago we were planning our wedding and i could not wait for the actual day. it was a small wedding, but it was still just as special and i am so happy i married my best friend.
dialogue: a few months ago we were planning our wedding and i could not wait until the actual day finally arrived.
did it turn out how you expected it
it was even better then expected. it was very small, but so happy how it turned out.
label: excited
response: i am glad to hear.. weddings can be stressful

situation: it makes me really angry when the neighboors door poops on my yard and she does not pick it up
dialogue: i hate when my neighboors dog poops on my yard and she does nothing, i do not care if he poops if she picks it up
maybe put the poop back on your neighbors yard?
hahaha i mean he does not do it often but it is not a bad idea
label: angry
response: its the only way to get them to learn

situation: my husband was ordained to be a minister last year. he has worked so hard and he studies all the time. he is completely devoted to god and serving him. i was so happy for him, when he was finally ordained.
dialogue: after studying and preaching for a few years, my husband was ordained to be a minister.
that is wonderful, it is always good when hard work pays off like that!
yes it is and he is so devoted to god and living for him. i was so happy for him.
label: proud
response: i bet so that sounds nice

situation: this morning, my dog knocked down a box of cereal and it all dumped unto the floor. as i tried to clean it up, she was trying to eat it, so she almost knocked me down. i was not very happy with her.
dialogue: this morning, my dog knocked down a while box of cereal and it spilled everywhere.
oh wow, that sounds like it was a big mess.
yes, and to make it worse, when i tried to clean it, she tried to eat, so she almost knocked me over too. i was not happy.
label: annoyed
response: i hope she did not eat too much of it, it might make her sick.

situation: i was really lookingforward to trying this new resturant that opened up down the road. they were terrible! i was so upset.
dialogue: there was a new resturaunt that opened up around the corner and everyone was raving about it
oh yeah? did you go give it a try?
i did! it was terrible! i was so upset! it was expensive, small, and bland!
label: disappointed
response: that is a shame. i hate it when a place does not live up to the hype.

situation: i can remember a job i had where the vast majority of my co-workers had very different beliefs to my own. rather than just agree with them i stayed true to my own thoughts.
dialogue: in my last job most of my co-workers had different beliefs to me. it was a little awkward at times.
that can be a bit uncomfortable for sure. did you try and avoid conversations
if things got a bit much i would excuse myself and go elsewhere. i did not want to get into an argument, but was not going to compromise my own beliefs by lying.
label: faithful
response: if it gets to be too much be sure to walk away.

situation: my husband had to repair something for the house and we had to buy a large amount of wood. i was so shocked when i saw him carrying it all in like it was nothing!
dialogue: my husband had to repair something and we bought a ton of lumber. he was able to carry so much at once!
he must be really strong!
he is! i was so shocked but super attracted to him too!
label: impressed
response: sure,  i strong men is very attractive! you must be proud of him!

situation: i was really sad when my dog died last year, my i am over it now
dialogue: i was really sad when my dog died last year
that is hard thing to go through. i hope you are feeling better about it now.
yeah i have been over it for sometime now but it is till hard to talk about
label: sentimental
response: i bet. losing a pet is much like losing a loved one. it gets better but still hurts sometime.

situation: a friend was supposed to come an visit me this summer, but he got a job up north and had to cancel. i had so been looking forward to his visit.
dialogue: a good friend was supposed to visit me this summer, but he got a job and had to cancel.
aw, that sucks. but at least he got a job, right?
yeah, and it is one he really wanted and enjoys. i am really happy for him, but would have really liked to see him.
label: disappointed
response: well, hopefully he can schedule another time to come visit you.

situation: my husband's grandmother and i were very close. we hung out and talked every day. one friday she called me and asked me to go to breakfast with her. while at breakfast, she told me that her and her husband were going on vacation. she was so excited. they left the next morning and i called and told her to have fun and be safe. she told me she would and that she loved, and i told her i loved her. early the next morning, we found out that she had a heart attack and had died. i was heart broken.
dialogue: my husband's grandmother and i were very close. we hung out and talked everyday. one friday, we went to breakfast and she told me that her and her husband were going on vacation the next day. she was so excited. the next morning i called her after they had left and told her to be safe, have fun, and that i loved her. she told me she loved me too. the morning after that phone call, we found out that she had a heart attack and died.
oh my. that is very unfortunate.
yes, it hit our whole family very hard. that was in 2013, and sometimes i still pick up the phone to call her and tell her something.
label: devastated
response: i know that feeling.  i am sure she is looking down on you all.

situation: i found my cat the other day. she had been missing for 3 days. i found her on the side of the road, guts in the gutter
dialogue: my cat went missing 3 days ago. i found her.

that must have been a little bit of a roller coaster. that is kind of why i am not wild about cats, is because they are so independent, and the outside cats can just go hang out somewhere for days and not have a care in the world about you. but i guess that suits some people.
i found her on the side of the street with her guts hanging in the gutter. i was so upset and sad
label: sad
response: oh man. so that was really a roller coaster then. i am so sorry. i hope you are not overwhelming yourself with guilt about it. it sounds like something you could not have any control over.

situation: i injured my hip a while back and am having to learn to walk again. i love to play golf and am keeping my fingers crossed i will be able to play again.
dialogue: i love to play golf, but injured my hip a while back. i really want to play again.

my nephew is getting into golf! it seems like a cool enough sport, albeit a little expensive. i hope you are able to get back to playing again. i have taken up running and swimming, and it is interesting how much those physical activities relieve stress in our day.
it sure is! good on your nephew it is a great sport. and good for you, too. it is all too easy just to sit back. i have to force myself to do physical therapy so i can walk again!
label: hopeful
response: well, often people just give up and relegate themselves to just sitting in a chair and watching tv. even if you have to force yourself, at least you are forcing yourself. at some point hopefully you will see progress and feel it getting easier. once that happens, motivation starts to become real easy to get.

situation: i went tandem parachuting with my brother and he kept me very safe. i was really scared but i knew that he would protect me.
dialogue: skydiving is an exillirating and scary experience!
i have never been skydiving myself. i hear that it is a great experience, but i am not sure if i have the bravery for it.
i did not for many years, but my brother convinced me to tandem with him to celebrate our mothers remission.
label: trusting
response: oh wow. is it something that you would do again?

situation: i bought a new tv. the colors are so vibrant and it is so sharp!
dialogue: i bought a new tv. the colors are so vibrant and it is so sharp!
sounds like fund, you must be excited!
i am, i have been watching all my favorite movies.
label: impressed
response: i think i will need to do that, my tv is an oldy.  i am sure you will have a great time.

situation: i went to the bathroom in the middle of the night and i felt a thing fly right into my face. i screamed so loud it woke my husband up
dialogue: i woke up needing to use the bathroom at midnight. as soon as i sit down a giant bug flew into my face!
that sounds horrible. i would not have been able to sleep after that.
i screamed so loud that i woke up my husband and he though we were being burgled!
label: terrified
response: how terrifying. i hope you were able to find and kill it.

situation: i gotta go to this serious interview tomorrow
dialogue: i have this very serious interview tomorrow and i am so nervous. i know what to say but i am scared i will forget everything

well, it is okay to be a bit nervous. interviewers will understand that. you only have to halfway reign in it in and you will hit that happy medium that is good for a workplace interview. where are you applying to?
a government position. cannot really say much. but i really hope i will get this job, they pay really good money
label: anxious
response: i bet you have a good shot at it! good luck

situation: i had a dream about my friends from high school the other night. it brought back all kinds of good memories from my teen years. it also made me miss my best friend from high school.
dialogue: i had a dream the other night about my friends from high school. it brought back all kinds of memories from my teen years and thinking back made me smile.
did you tell anyone about the dream?
i told my husband. the dream made me miss my best friend from high school.
label: nostalgic
response: you should call your best friend on the telephone!

situation: i came home from work today and my wife had a new puppy waiting for me.
dialogue: i came home from work today and my wife had a new puppy waiting for me.
oh that sounds like fun
yeah, he is such a cutie. i have been playing with my new pup the rest of the day.
label: surprised
response: sounds like a wonderful day!

situation: i saved up money to buy a certain dress, but once i had the money the dress was sold out and the only place that had it available was ebay for double to original price. it was a big let-down.
dialogue: i saved up the money to buy a certain dress that i had been wanting for a while. when i finally got the money saved, it was sold out everywhere, except ebay. the problem was, the price was doubled.
oh my! what are you going to do? i would buy it anyway.
i may buy it still, but i have to save up more money now.
label: disappointed
response: well that is unfortunate. hopefully you will be able to buy it soon.

situation: i went to aldi the other day and bought a bunch of german chocolate bars. i then sat and stuffed myself and now i feel really bad about it. no self-control!
dialogue: i bought a load of german chocolate bars in aldi. i then ate too many of them. i should not have done that no self-control!
it happens to the best of us. it would be great if they did not make us gain weight.
it was sheer greed, i am afraid. i know everyone has their moments, but i really should not have done that.
label: guilty
response: well you have to live a little every now and then. i am sure it was worth it, haha.

situation: my son is sick
dialogue: my son is sick, he got this hand foot and mouth desease, nothing serious but he has a fever
oh no, poor baby
i know, i got some motrin, funny movies and lots of cuddles.i hope he will feel better tomorrow
label: caring
response: yes cuddles will help

situation: i used to be a member of a cool dance crew
dialogue: i used to be a member of a cool dance crew. we had so much fun together. we used to battle other teams and win local competitions
that sounds really fun. can you still remember some of the routines?
honestly, no, it is been 8 years haha loooong time ago! i wish i could hang out with all those people again
label: nostalgic
response: yea that is a long time. you should reach out to some and see if they are on social media.

situation: the ryder cup golf tournament is coming up in september and i cannot wait. i have been watching this tournament since i was a kid and love the format.
dialogue: i am getting really psyched about the upcoming ryder cup golf tournament. i have been watching it since i was a kid.
i am fascinated by how people can watch golf, i always found it really boring, but if you enjoy it then great!
i have been around the game all my life and just love both playing and watching. i would imagine that, if you do not play, it would be pretty boring!
label: excited
response: oh that totally changes things i guess, makes sense.

situation: last christmas eve, after a family event, i walked into my ten year old daughter's room and found her crying. when i asked her what was wrong, she said that while at the family event, she overheard someone calling her daddy fat, and making fun of him and it had hurt her feelings. the mama bear side of me came out. i was not very happy at all.
dialogue: last christmas eve, after a family event, i found my ten year old daughter crying in her room. at the event she had overheard someone calling her daddy fat and making fun of him, and it had hurt her feelings.
aw that is terrible, at least you were able to comfort her?
yes, i was able to make her feel better, and her daddy made her laugh. but my mama bear side came out, and i was ready to confront some people.
label: furious
response: i am sure you were! those people deserved some confrontation for sure.

situation: i was cleaning up my garden and found a bunch of old bones in it!
dialogue: i was cleaning up my garden bed when i found a bunch of bones in it!
oh my god! what did you do? did you tell anyone?
i called the cops! turns out that it is bird bones! my cat has been killing bird after bird and leaving it in my garden!
label: disgusted
response: lololol the cops probably had a good laugh about that.

situation: i read the other day about a man who was prosecuted for abusing animals. what a horrible individual!
dialogue: i get really mad when i hear about people abusing animals. what revolting individuals!
me too! ii never could understand what drives people to be so mean to such innocent creatures.
they are filthy, ignorant bullies. i would sentence them to life in prison, without parole!
label: disgusted
response: really! i would go even further and give them the electric chair. i have no tolerance for those types of people.

situation: last night i heard a weird noise outside. it really scored my wife and i.
dialogue: last night i heard a weird noise outside. it really scared my wife and i.
oh, i hate it when that happens. did you find out what it was?
it ended up just being a raccoon rummaging through our trash. but at the time we thought it was someone trying to break in.
label: afraid
response: i am glad it was not something dangerous. that would be a terrifying experience.

situation: i lent a friend quite a lot of money a while back and he has promised to repay me. i really believe he will.
dialogue: my friend borrowed quite a lot of money from me. i really do believe he will repay me.
you do? that is good, friends can be terrible people to lend too.
they can, but he was in a real bind and i was able to do so. i know he is grateful for the loan, so i reckon i will be ok there.
label: trusting
response: i bet he pays you in full.

situation: my husband wanted me to put on a blindfold and follow him the other night. he led me somewhere outside and then took it off and showed me a beautiful sunset lit dinner table. i will never question him again!
dialogue: my husband asked me to put on a blindfold the other night and he led me outside! i was so scared at first
i bet that was scary. did he surprise you with something?
he did! he had set up a dinner table in a clearing in our yard right when the sun was setting. dinner was ready and waiting and warm too!
label: trusting
response: ahhh. how nice. you are lucky to have such a thoughtful husband.

situation: honestly, it is probably because i spend too much time on the creepy subreddit; i should know better. a few nights ago, after reading through a few particularly disturbing threads, i was out smoking a cigarette in the street at 3am. after a few minutes, i saw what looked like a drone flying straight toward me, and i swear my blood went ice cold.
dialogue: ever seen a drone fly at night? it is far creepier than you might imagine at first, especially if it is in the early morning, like 3am or something.
does it look like a space ship?

well at night it is kind of hard to tell that it looks like anything. all you can see is just the blinking locator lights on it, and all you can hear is the buzzing of the props. but who knows what could be attached to the drone? cameras? some kind of gas?
label: terrified
response: i have never seen a drone flying around here. even in the day time

situation: my friend is so nosy
dialogue: i love my friend, she is pretty funny and cool but goodness gracious she is so nosy it is annoying sometimes
what does she do?
like we were hanging out yesterday and my hysband called and i walked to a different room to talk to him and when i came back she started asking me questions about what he said and stuff likethat
label: annoyed
response: wow, i would just tell her its private. sounds annoying

situation: my border collie had to be put down due to a neurological disorder that could not be treated.
dialogue: it is so difficult to have a pet pass away, i really miss him.
aw i understand that, i have gone through that myself and it is very hard. when did this happen?
over the summer, he started acting strange so we took him in for testing.
label: sad
response: oh no i am very sorry. what kind of pet?

situation: my daughter called and said they were taking my newborn grandson to the doctor to have a chest xray because he was having some breathing trouble. i worried all day long until i got the phone call telling me everything was ok. they live far away so i tend to worry even more since i cannot be there.
dialogue: my daughter called and said my grandson had to have a chest xray because he was having trouble breathing. i was so worried i did not know what to do with myself.
oh no, have you been able to calm yourself down?
she called several hours later to let me know everything was ok. i worry even more because they live so far away.
label: anxious
response: i can understand that, i think i would be a mess too.

situation: i would be angry if a truck full of rotten salmon smashed through the wall of my room right now, if i am being honest. not only would it destroy most of what i own, but it would also make the place smell awful for months. and i mean, the smell is a bit more important, let's be real.
dialogue: i am actually furious. i am writing this from a hotel. a truck full of rotten salmon smashed through the wall of my bedroom yesterday. place smells awful.
that does not sound plpeasant at all, maybe they should relocate those who are staying there.
i relocated myself to a hotel to stay there until it gets repaired. luckily my insurance is paying for my stay, but i will be suing the hell out of the trucking company.
label: angry
response: hopefully no one was injured at all from the accident?

situation: i had just packed a roadside emergency kit in my car when a snowstorm hit and stranded me on a back road.
dialogue: i am so glad that i decided to pack a kit for my car in case of bad winter weather.
i bet you are, that is some pretty good foresight right there! did you have to use it this past winter?
i did, two days after packing it we had a blizzard and my tire went flat out in the middle of it. i would have been very unhappy had i not packed it.
label: prepared
response: how satisfying must it be to have something like that ready to go in case of emergency, and then to actually get to use it? i am pretty jealous, and proud in a vicarious kind of way.

situation: i am very worked up about completing my doctoral thesis and defending it this year.
dialogue: i have a ton of work to complete to earn my degree this year.
well good luck with that!
thank you, i have been compiling  data for 5 years, my brain is totally absorbed by it.
label: excited
response: what are you studying?

situation: i was at disney world, and i was going to go on the tycoon rollar coaster but as soon as i got to the top of the line all i could do was worry about the height.
dialogue: i just froze when it was my turn to get on the tycoon rollar coaster at disney world.
do roller coasters scare you
i think it was just the thought of being so high up.
label: apprehensive
response: i used to be afriad of heights too

situation: i had to stay home and work while all my friend got to go to colorado to skii. not only was i missing out on the fun but i was lonely with nothing to do.
dialogue: i had to stay home and work, while all my friends go to denver and snowboard.
that is a bummer. maybe next time you can join them.
hopefully, but the worst part is there is nothing to do on the weekend with everyone gone.
label: lonely
response: sound like a netflix weekend then. hope you got a lot of work done.

situation: i could not believe it when my dog died a few weeks ago. i honestly thought i was going to stay lonely forever. when my girlfriend asked me if i wanted to go look at dogs to cheer me up, i said no.
dialogue: in some ways, losing a pet dog is even worse than losing a relative. they are so innocent, they are so helpless. they do not deserve to have to die or suffer ever.
goodness, you are right about that. plus a pet is the only thing to show unconditional and neverending love for you.
exactly, and they never demand anything from you. when my golden retriever louie died a few weeks ago, i honestly thought i would die too.
label: sad
response: i am so very sorry for your loss, i can only imagine that pain. i had to put my girl down 3 years ago and i promise that it does get easier.

situation: i absolutely could not wait to go on my cruise this summer! i had so many fun activities planned that i just wanted to jump out into the ocean and swim to my destinations, just to get started!
dialogue: a week before my cruise this summer, i was counting down the days with bated breath. i thought i would actually die before i got to go on it.
it is the worst waiting for vacations! you want the time before to go fast but then it to go slow during. never works out that way, unfortunately.
yes! completely the opposite of what you want. the universe can be funny like that. but i had an absolute blast!
label: excited
response: that is great! i am glad you had a good time. i have never been on a cruise before but it sounds like i need to try one out!

situation: when my daughter was born they thought she would never be able to attend school and basically be mentally retarded. now she is a normal a-b student and just started the 8th grades.
dialogue: when my daughter was born doctors said she would not ever go to school and basically be mentally handicapped.
and how is she doing now
she is a normal a-b student and just started 8th grade
label: proud
response: that is awesome.  sometimes a second opinion is all you need

situation: it was raining all day on my day off. the sky was gray and cloudy and it felt really cold. what a terrible day off
dialogue: i finally had a day of, but the weather was terrible and rainy and cold.
aww that is too bad.  i hope you got some solid netflix in at least!
i was hoping to get a chance to play outside and get some sun.
label: sad
response: bummer.  well i hope you get a chance to do that soon!

situation: i just went to a late night showing of insidious. i almost wet myself from the shock at certain parts.
dialogue: i just got back from a latenight showing of the horror movie insidious
oh that sounds fun!
not really i  almost had an accident at some of the startling points.
label: afraid
response: that is not good at all, glad you did not have an accident.

situation: i was looking for quotes for car insurance. i was astonished how high the rates were.
dialogue: i have been looking around at different car insurance quotes
did you find any good companies.
a couple but it amazes me how expensive insurance is
label: surprised
response: did you have alot of accidents that can jack your rates up.

situation: i ate a whole cake by myself, i am suppose to be on a diet. it is so hard!
dialogue: i just ate a whole cake by myself, i feel sick!
it is okay! try to rest on the couch and that might help!
thank you, being on a diet is hard with sweets in the house.
label: guilty
response: i know that feeling all too well. but do not get down on it, just try better tomorrow.

situation: i had a panic attack the other night and it was terrible. the worst part is that i have no reason to be so stressed
dialogue: the other night i had a panic attack out the blue
that must have been scary.  is that the first time it has happened to you?
sadly no, i get them maybe once a year. the worst part was that i had nothing to be stressed about.
label: anxious
response: are you able to do anything to prevent them?

situation: i left the front door unlocked this morning and our dog got out. i cannot believe i would be so careless.
dialogue: i left the front door unlocked this morning and our dog got out. i cannot believe i would be so careless.
i am sure that he will turn up soon. i really hope that you find him.
we have been driving around all evening looking for him. he really is my best friend.
label: disappointed
response: maybe check your local animal shelters? sometimes they are taken there by people who find them.

situation: when my last ex ghosted me after things were going really well, i felt lost. i had no idea what i would done wrong, so i was forced to assume that it was something to do with my personality. that did not help matters.
dialogue: i felt completely discarded after my last ex ghosted me. we'd been seeing each other for a few months, and everything was fine. then.nothing.
aww, i am sorry to hear that.  was it a bad break up or did you part on good terms?
that is just it. we did not really "break up" in the traditional sense. she just sort of stopped talking to me and i eventually texted her and said okay, thanks for the memories. but it was rough.
label: lonely
response: that is really odd.  i wonder why they did not have the courtesy to let you know that they'd lost interest or whatever the case may be.  to just cut off contact seems a little rude.

situation: today i was getting coffee and the person in front of me paid for my drink. i could not believe people would be so nice, i was so thankful because money has been tight.
dialogue: today i was getting coffee and the person in front of me paid for my drink. i could not believe people would be so nice, i was so thankful because money has been tight.
how thoughtful.  now you have to pay it forward, as the saying goes.
i will, you never know when someone else is in need!
label: grateful
response: kindness is infectious.

situation: my husband started college this week, i am so proud of him.
dialogue: my husband started college this week!
how exciting, is he a non-traditional student?
yes, he is still active duty army but getting out in november. i am so proud of him furthering his education!
label: impressed
response: that is really good, speaking from experience, all military men and women should get a degree.

situation: i ordered a hamburger and when i got it there was a hair in it.
dialogue: i am a really picky eater, and now my favorite restaraunt is ruined for me.
why? what happened? i hope you did not get food posioning.
no poisoning, but my burger had a long hair in it, so i could not eat it.
label: disgusted
response: oh gosh, that is gross! maybe tell the manager so he can make it right, and make sure his staff is doing things to health codes!

situation: i was walking back to my desk after getting a cup of coffee and tripped over my own two feet and spilled coffee all over myself
dialogue: i got a cup of coffee the other day and on my way back to my desk i tripped on thin air
oh no! i hope you did not burn yourself.
i thankfully did not burn myself bad but i spilled it all over myself! i was so shy afterwards
label: embarrassed
response: hopefully you were wearing dark clothing, coffee on light colors stinks!

situation: i went down to get a drink of water in the middle of the night and my back door was just standing open.
dialogue: watching scary movies lately has me paranoid, i was really frightened the other night.
oh no! what happened?
i went for a drink downstairs, and the back door was wide open. i did not sleep a wink and kept my phone and a big knife with me the rest of the night,lol.
label: terrified
response: oh man! i would have been so scared!

situation: my neighbors dogs keep barking, and my daughter is asleep. i am afraid they are going to wake her up!
dialogue: my neighbors dog are barking so loud and my daughter is asleep!
ugh that is so annoying. what are they even barking at?
people walking on the bike trail behind our house. it is a daily thing, it gets so annoying!
label: angry
response: yeah, that would drive me crazy. sounds like the neighbor needs to control their dogs.

situation: i had just got done making an entire pizza and eating it whole. it was so filling and left my mouth watering.i was fat and content.
dialogue: i just got done eating an entire pizza by myself.
i do that all the time, no big deal.
i feel so full and fat and happy. i cannot wait to do it again.
label: content
response: what kind of pizza did you eat?

situation: it really put me at ease when i got my first paycheck from my new job that included a bonus. i knew that i would be able to cover my monthly expenses as well as get to buy some nice things for myself.
dialogue: when i got my first paycheck with a bonus, i knew i did not need to worry anymore about my expenses. it was quite the feeling!
that is such a relief, it is so nice to have money saved up in the bank.
yes exactly! i was able to finally start saving for retirement. i would been procrastinating somewhat, so it really was a relief, like you said.
label: content
response: oh yeah, retirement will come before you know it, it is good to be prepared!

situation: tomorrow i start my new job teaching kids. i really hope it goes well!
dialogue: tomorrow i start my new job teaching kids. i really hope it goes well!
oh wow, now that really is exciting, congratulations! did you get the grade level and subject you wanted?
i am teaching at a small private school, so i will be teaching all the subjects for 3rd grade. i am pretty excited, just nervous.
label: anxious
response: teaching little humans will be such a joy. i really hope you enjoy it!

situation: i lost my dog in the divorce, everything else i lost were just things and money. but my dog was one of a kind.
dialogue: i just lost my dog. my ex got him in the divorce
that sucks, will she not let you see the dog at all?
no we are not on speaking terms, it is pretty unfair, thankfully we did not have a kid together.
label: sad
response: yes, that is probably a positive.

situation: i lost my credit card and now my bills are not going through. trying to explain to the phone and internet companies is such a pain.
dialogue: getting a new debit card takes so long and really is a hassle.
yeah it really does. it is even worse to try and close those accounts!
they do not want to. i lost mine or it was stolen. but all my autopay bills are at a standstill and the companies are not happy about it.
label: annoyed
response: man that sounds really stressful.

situation: my sister got a promotion at work last week! she really deserved it and has been waiting for it a long time!
dialogue: my sister got a promotion at work last week!
oh that is awesome. what does she do?
she is an accountant for a college in alaska. she is been working their for years so i am glad they saw her dedication
label: proud
response: that is great. my sister is an account too. she is also the office manager.

situation: it was really cool to be at the award ceremony for my friend whose paper received a scholarship. i knew she had a good piece of writing on her hands that i would helped edit, but i did not expect it to win an award!
dialogue: my friend wrote a creative writing piece that i helped edit, and it won her a scholarship. i was so proud, like a dad, even though we are roughly the same age.
congrats to your friend! that is an amazing accomplishment.
yeah it was! i joke with her that i should get a portion of the money since i told her she had a really good piece and that she should submit it. she was not originally going to.
label: impressed
response: i would be proud of her too! hopefully her success continues. you sound like a good friend!

situation: anxious awaiting son to start college
dialogue: my eldest son is off and is starting his first year in college.   i am so nervous for him!
do not be. i am sure you raised him right. he will be starting his new adventure
i think it is more stressful for me than it is for him!  i just want the best for him, just not used to not being there with him.
label: anticipating
response: i am sure he is cool as a cucumber while you are a nervous wreck. it will be fine.

situation: i was jumping up and down with happiness when i got an n64 for christmas when i turned 11. even when we had to go get an rf switch so it would work with my tv, i was ecstatic.
