dialogue: i have trouble remembering a time i was more incredibly overwhelmed with excitement than when i got the nintendo 64 for christmas all those years ago.
i remember that console, that is old school.
it sure is now, but back then it was the cream of the crop. you can bet that i stayed up a few hours past my bedtime to play it that evening.
label: joyful
response: those were the good old days!

situation: i studied really hard for a physics exam and still did not get a b, which i need for my major.
dialogue: i need a b average to stay in my major and i am struggling in a course.
are you able to get some tutoring or find a study buddy?
i found a study group, i did not flunk the class. but i made an 84 on my physics test and need an 86.
label: disappointed
response: thats good. well you are on your way up!

situation: i came home from work and my husband had dinner already made. it felt nice to be able to just relax.
dialogue: i came home from work today and my husband had dinner already made!
that is awesome, can we trade?
haha my husband plays video games as well, but we limited it to after my daughter goes to bed only.
label: surprised
response: that is a really good idea. he must be thoughtful to have cooked dinner for you and had it ready, unlike mine

situation: it drove me up the wall this morning when i realized i ran out of coffee filters without getting more at the grocery store the other day. i cannot believe i forgot to check!
dialogue: let me tell you something. always check before you go grocery shopping to see if you need to pick up coffee filters. few things worse than having to go without your morning coffee because you forgot!
that is very true
not only did i have a rough morning because of it, but i had to deal with the caffeine withdrawal headache all day at work. what a disaster.
label: annoyed
response: hopefully its better tomorrow!

situation: i studied really hard for a physics exam and still did not get a b, which i need for my major.
dialogue: hmm, that is interesting tell me more about what that number means to you.
four years old is the age a child needs to be for a bearded dragon, they carry something in their nails/claws.
label: disappointed
response: really, my friend had a tarantula as a pet when she was five, scared the poop out of me

situation: having more work than i can handle
dialogue: i got canned from my job and i am feeling pretty good these days because i have more work than i can handle without needing to go to an office everyday
are you really able to work from home? finding a gig is so difficult, i am glad that it is working for you.
yeah it is still a work in progress but i am young and basically living on peanuts, good thing i am not allergic
label: joyful

situation: i was laying in bed getting ready to fall asleep when i realized just how happy i was. i felt so peacful
dialogue: i was laying in bed last night when i realized just how happy i am
that is fantastic. any good new lately?
nope! i just realized how happy and content i am with my life!
label: content
response: that is an amazing feeling.

situation: i was super grossed out last week when i had a sore throat and was coughing up a lot of phlegm. i know it is just a symptom of the cold, but it was still pretty nasty.
dialogue: i had such a bad cold last week, i was coughing up a lot of nasty stuff into cups just so that it would not hurt when i swallowed.
did you go to the doctor
no, thankfully my symptoms were not anything that could not be managed with a stiff mimosa or seven. but still, i had to throw those cups out. yuck.
label: disgusted
response: yuk for sure

situation: when i got falsely accused of eating my roommate's ice cream last night, i was completely outraged! i do not even eat ice cream because i am lactose intolerant, and she knows that!
dialogue: no matter how many times i told her that i did not do it, my roommate insisted that i ate her ice cream last night! unbelievable!
well, did you eat her ice cream?
i certainly would have liked to, but i am lactose intolerant! if i had eaten it, i would have been so miserable that there is no way she would've mistaken it.
label: furious
response: i wonder who actually ate it then.

situation: i am really not sure what to do; my wife is having our baby next week and i do not think we are ready for her! i have read parenting books and talked to my own therapist about it, but i am just a nervous wreck.
dialogue: i am so not ready for this baby. the wife is due next week, and i am really uncertain that i am gonna be a good dad or that we'll have enough to provide for her.
you will be fine. its going to be hard but do not beat yourself up over it.
i hope you are right. i have read lots of parenting books, and i have been seeing my therapist regularly. there is just so much that i am still worried about.
label: apprehensive
response: then it sounds like you are already ahead of most new fathers.

situation: seeing a cat on the side of the road.
dialogue: i was walking and say a cat in front of me wagging its tail on the sidewalk and thought it was awesome
that would be pretty cool to see, but you should know that typically most cats swish their tail when they are annoyed or angry! it did not attack you, did it?
i attacked it with some pets, it was an outside cat which do not get angry too much i am guessing
label: joyful
response: ahh, okay. yeah i do not know. it might have also been scared or feeling like it had to protect it is turf. but still, that is neat to see and not an everyday thing!

situation: i really really would like to make a good grade on my midterm exam this week. it is my first graduate level course, so i need to be on point.
dialogue: i am taking my midterm exam this week, and i really want to do well on it. i have studied a lot, and taken the practice test 5 times. i am still pretty anxious though!
nice, i guess the only times i was nervous to take a test was when i was not prepared, but there is only so much preparation you can do until you just have to trust your brain or whatever
that is true. i probably have it down pat at this point. it is just it is my first graduate course, and i want to ace my entire graduate degree with a 4.0 gpa. this is my first major major grade.
label: hopeful
response: wow! you must have like every technique in your toolbox to go for that goal

situation: when i went through one of my unpacked boxes, i found some of my ex-girlfriend's old clothes that she never picked up. i really missed her, and i started thinking about all the good times we enjoyed together.
dialogue: i was unpacking the other day and realized that my ex-girlfriend did not get all of her stuff out of my place after we split up and before i moved. really made me miss her, seeing all that stuff.
i bet it does bud, i know the feeling. so how do you deal with it
well, i spent some time remembering the good times. then i reminded myself that we broke up for a reason, and we'd moved on. had to process all the way through it, you know?
label: nostalgic
response: yes i know, good memories do help. every relation is a new chapter in the book called our life.

situation: a squad car cut in to my lane head on the other day and i had nowhere to go, i was on a small crossbridge and he would not slow down at all. i could see that he was looking at the seat next to him and not straight ahead so i threw my car in reverse and hauled it.
dialogue: polie officers should still be required to drive safely even when responding to a call.
sometimes they cannot avoid it
i threw the car in reverse and hauled my butt backwards!
label: afraid
response: ok

situation: a squad car cut in to my lane head on the other day and i had nowhere to go, i was on a small crossbridge and he would not slow down at all. i could see that he was looking at the seat next to him and not straight ahead so i threw my car in reverse and hauled it.
dialogue: i understand, but coming at me head on, on a two lane highway, while i am on a bridge with nowhere to go is not cool.
i cannot imagine how scared you must have been.
uh oh, did he destroy something? sounds as though he misbehaved a bit.
label: afraid
response: not sure. you must be very confused. did you crash?

situation: i saw a scorpion in my house. it was huge and it ran under my couch before i could kill it.
dialogue: i saw a scorpion in my house yesterday and still have not found it!
oh god. was it big?
yes, i am scared to sleep! it ran under couch last time i saw it.
label: terrified
response: well, maybe look at its lifespan? maybe it will die if you end up not finding it.

situation: when i saw my sister's artwork for the first time, i knew that she was going to go far if she really applied herself. she is so talented at such a young age.
dialogue: i am constantly amazed by my sister's art skills. i am not sure where she got them.my brother and i cannot draw to save our lives.
what does she draw
mostly anime characters and various portraits. she is still quite young, so she has a way to go, but if you asked me to draw anything similar to what she can when i was her age? forget about it.
label: proud
response: thats awesome

situation: i knew that when my best friend told me she would always be there for me, that i could have great confidence in her. she is always been a good listener in the past, and has never been anything but supportive when i have gone through rough times.
dialogue: i used to worry that i would never have a long term friend who would be there to listen to me if i had problems, but my best friend kayla has proved otherwise.
kayla sounds wonderful! how long have you guys been friends?
i will have known her for 7 years next year. she really is wonderful. i have gone through a lot of tough stuff in my life, and she is always been supportive.
label: trusting
response: finding someone like that is rare. take good care of that one!

situation: i recently found out that i have lung cancer. i think it is beatable, but i really was not expecting to have such a difficult journey ahead of me.
dialogue: i have some bad news, unfortunately. well, bad for me. i was diagnosed with lung cancer.
i am sorry to hear that. how far along is it?

it is stage two. i think i will be able to beat it because i am otherwise in great health, and it hasn't metastasized or anything. i just was not expecting to have to deal with this incredibly difficult time ahead of me.
label: surprised
response: keep a positive attitude. i will be thinking of you!

situation: i almost lost my mind the other day when i heard gunshots right outside my house. i thought someone was going to come in and shoot me!
dialogue: i heard gunshots outside my house the other day in the middle of the night. i think it was 2 or 3 in the morning.
did you find out what happened?

not a chance! i was too scared to go out, and i did not want to peek my head out to talk to the police or anything when they showed up. i honestly thought someone might have barged into my house and started trying to shoot me.
label: terrified
response: man. that must've been really nerve wrecking. did you get any sleep?

situation: i sat in the waiting room last weekend and waited and waited to find out how my dad's neck surgery turned out. this was one of those last ditch effort to keep his cervical vertebrae from having to be fused.
dialogue: i really did not know what to expect while my dad was having neck surgery last weekend.
did it turn out ok ?
seems to have, yeah. he has a lot less neck pain now than he has this past year, but that is happened during his previous neck surgeries as well.
label: anticipating
response: hopes he continues to get better

situation: i recently found out that i have been diagnosed hiv positive, and i am at a complete loss for words. i do not even know how to go on anymore.
dialogue: i got some pretty horrible news recently. i have been diagnosed hiv positive. i am just.lost.

i am so sorry!  do not lose hope though. i know some science based nutrition that helps you overcome and kill it going high nutrition plant based vegan.  look up dr. joel furhman.  it will save you from all the meds that hurt your body.
i might look into that, thank you for being supportive. i know it is nowhere near a death sentence anymore, it is just there are so many questions. can i have kids, is a big one.
label: devastated
response: i know it must be overwhelming you but coming from someone that is fighting chronic epstein barr virus and lupus, it will change your life.  check out hiv and going vegan on youtube and thebody,com and so many other resources.  you might be able to reverse it and it would not even be a concern for having kids.  you take care and have hope!

situation: playing old video games
dialogue: playing old video games reminds of the summers where my friends and i would hang out endlessly
sounds like you are feeling nostalgic.  what games were you plaing?
super smash bros is a classic, never gets old, but yeah you are right
label: nostalgic
response: i have never played it but its supposed to havea bunch of old game characters in it

situation: once i had an interview for a job. i did not feel prepared for it at all
dialogue: i had a job interview recently
oh, how did it go?
not well. i did not really feel prepared for it.
label: anxious
response: i am sorry, i am sure you will be ready next time.

situation: my co-worker discovered the cure for type two diabetes before me, and i just cannot believe it. it was supposed to be my nobel prize, not his. now my dad will never respect me and my accomplishments.
dialogue: speaking of co-workers, one of my colleagues just found the cure for type 2 diabetes, and i honestly could not be more annoyed about it.
wait, why would you be annoyed by that? that is amazing!
yeah, yeah, yeah. amazing and all, but it was supposed to be my discovery. i wanted that nobel prize and the trip to stockholm. now i do not think my dad will ever think i have accomplished anything.
label: jealous
response: i think you need to look at the bigger picture, though. someone cured a disease that has caused so much suffering for so many people. though i suppose to can be both excited for the discovery and jealous at the same time. the two are not mutually exclusive.

situation: there was a movie out i wanted to see but no one else was interested. i went to see it by myself
dialogue: i went to a movie alone recently because none of my friends wanted to go with me
what movie did you see
jurassic world. it was okay.
label: lonely
response: yeah i have heard bad things to be honest

situation: i bought iced coffee and my brother drank it. i was looking forward to drinking it in the morning.
dialogue: i just bought iced coffee yesterday and my brother drank the rest of it without asking me.
wow. does he usually do stuff like that?
yeah, he will eat or drink whatever he finds in the fridge.
label: annoyed
response: damn well, he is gonna have to learn some boundaries with that.

situation: i felt sad when i saw alex jones channel taken down
dialogue: i thought it was unfair how youtube banned alex jones
it is indeed unfair, they should not have done that
i think people are just getting riled up for the midterms
label: sad
response: you are right. but hey people just do what they want to!

situation: playing hide and seek and i ended up in the bathroom
dialogue: i was playing hide n seek when i was a kid and i had to use the restroom, but then i realized after a couple minutes that there was someone behind the shower curtain
i bet that was awkward
yeah, nobody said anything
label: embarrassed
response: i guess that happens sometimes, did you finish the game

situation: i recently found out that my girlfriend has been cheating on me with another woman. she promised me that she was not that type of girl. needless to say, i am quite upset about it.
dialogue: my girlfriend has been cheating on me with another woman!
that is terrible and a little odd!
yeah, tell me about it! i trusted her to only cheat on me with other men, but i just do not know how i can deal with this betrayal!
label: angry
response: wait, you were ok with her cheating?

situation: when my uncle bill told me about how he was planning to desert his military duty and flee to canada, i knew he'd need my support. it was a tough decision for him with a lot of risk, but i was there for him.
dialogue: i knew that i needed to support my uncle bill when he told me he wanted to flee to canada to escape military duty. family always comes first.
yes indeed! what did you do?
i helped him pack the essentials in his wood-paneled station wagon and filled his gas tank for him. it was the least i could do.
label: caring
response: you did great! family comes first. and you gave him your support!

situation: i found out that my son got a b in one of his classes at the end of last year. i thought i had a truly exemplary, world-changing student on my hands. now i know he is just..above average.
dialogue: speaking of kids in school, i just found out my son got a b in his world history class at the end of the previous school year. i cannot believe it.
that is great!  history is so important i think and so few kids really grasp it well.  congrats to him for a job well done!
no no, see, it was the first grade below an a that he is ever made. i honestly thought i had the next einstein on my hands. now i guess i will have to settle for.above average, i guess.
label: disappointed
response: oh, i see what you are saying!  did he get upset about it?  and you never know, he could turn it around next year and blow you away!

situation: i was so elated to find out that my dog could speak to me! even better, he has an adorable cockney accent. we have been chatting about philosophy for three days now.
dialogue: so i have some amazing news. i recently discovered that my dog can speak to me! is not that incredible?
wow, is that true? that is pretty amazing! i would say science should know about your dog.

i would say you are certainly right about that! he is got the best cockney accent though, and will not shut up about philosophy. it is all he wants to talk about! like okay, we get it, you are suuuuper into immanuel kant, cool.
label: joyful
response: wow, that surely is incredible! even the accent too? and intelligent! the full package!

situation: when i saw my competition at the world championship for major league eating, i knew that i had nothing to worry about. these kids had only ever eaten 30-40 hot dogs at once, and here i am, 60, easy.
dialogue: i mean, let's be honest. i am the major league eating world champion. when i saw that my next closest competition had only ever maxed 40 hot dogs, i knew i had that thing in the bag.
dang, that is a lot of dogs. cleaned out the pound, you did. but that does not hold a candle to the 100 i ate yesterday.

ah, i see you are a man of culture as well. i would relish the opportunity to eat alongside you one day at the troughs of battle. be warned, however: only those with the strongest of stomachs have ever dared to challenge me!
label: confident
response: how dare you question my intestinal fortitude?!? i would watch out, friend. i may just slip some cyanide in your relish if i ever have the chance to challenge you!

situation: one time i was sick with the flu. my boyfriend stopped by to check up on me
dialogue: i was sick in bed with the flu. my boyfriend took care of me though
that is so nice of him. are you feeling better?
yes, i feel much better now.
label: grateful
response: that is good to hear. i hope i meet someone that will do that for me.

situation: when i was going through my old photo albums this morning, i came across a picture of my mother and me. it reminded me of a much simpler time, before she abandoned the family and joined a nudist colony. ah, she was the best. i miss her.
dialogue: i was leafing through my old photo albums this morning and ran across a picture of me and my mother. i really remember her fondly.
that would bring the tears. i love looking at pictures especially old ones.
yes, it definitely did. it reminded me of a simpler time, before she abandoned our family to join the local nudist colony. oh, i do miss her though. she was just the best!
label: sentimental
response: sounds like you are conflicted. she ran off but she is the best? are you being sarcastic?

situation: my dog pooped on the floor. i had let her out several times and she still decided to use the house as her bathroom.
dialogue: my dog pooped on the floor after i let her in the house.
that is a tragedy! what ever did you do?!?!
i told her she was a bad dog and had to clean it up.
label: annoyed
response: serves her right! these animals cannot go around thinking they can poop on our things!

situation: i was blown away when my six year old nephew solved the navier-stokes existence and smoothness problem. he will be getting the million dollar prize for it, which i hope he does not blow on cocaine and beef jerky.
dialogue: honestly? i have a pretty special nephew. he just solved the navier-stokes existence and smoothness millenium prize problem.
holy moses, he must be as smart as me. i solved that thing in five minutes last week. child's play.

child's play is right, the kid is only 6 years old. and you could not have, because the clay institute says the million dollar prize is still at large, which i am sure he will be blowing immediately on tropical sprite and cocaine.
label: impressed
response: yeah, that is what they tell everyone because, in reality, they blew all the prize money on the very same thing themselves. i was pretty peeved that i could not even get a dime bag and the sleeziest of hookers.

situation: i have been trying really hard to get a promotion at my company but they just hired someone to fill that spot from outside of the company.
dialogue: i have been trying really hard to get a promotion at my company but they just hired someone to fill that spot from outside of the company.
ahh, that is too bad, did you mention it to your boss?
my boss is pretty temperamental and does not like people questioning his decisions, probably a bad idea.
label: jealous
response: oh i am sorry to hear that. maybe next time!

situation: my roommate's cat passed away last week. there is a heavy air over the household.
dialogue: my roommate's cat passed away last week. there is a heavy air over the household.
i bet. that is so sad. i am so sorry.
yeah hes really lost without her. it was unexpected.
label: sad
response: i bet! i hope they can find peace soon.

situation: i broke up with my boyfriend last week, and nothing is the same without him
dialogue: i broke up with my boyfriend last week, and nothing is the same without him.
time will make it better. you just have to move on.
yeah, i know but we were planning to start our lives together. we were moving in and now i have to rethink everything.
label: lonely
response: better to find out now then move in and invest your time. trust me it is worse.

situation: i just made a delicious pie, i let it cool to room temperature and ate it with ice cream it was perfect.
dialogue: i just made the most delicious pie
really? what kind was it?
it was apple pit,  i let it cool to room temp and ate it with ice cream it was so good.
label: content
response: oh i love apple pie with ice cream, it is such a good combination

situation: i had just got a 100 dollar haircut and some new clothes and yeezy shoes. i felt on top of the world
dialogue: i just got a new pair of yeezy shoes and a clean hair cut.
nice, i wish i could get a pair of those shoes.
i feel on top of the world. i do not know whoever said things cannot bring you happiness. they must never owned a pair of yeezy's
label: confident
response: how much did you pay for them?

situation: i just built a warm fire and huddled up next to it until i started to fall asleep. i felt safe and secure
dialogue: i just went camping and build the warmest fire.
i love a warm fire outside while camping! sounds like a great time.
yeah, i ended up falling asleep to the dying fire. i felt very safe and secure.
label: content
response: yes that sounds like a wonderful way to sleep.

situation: i was all alone in the house. i had all the lights off and was alone in my bed. it was storming outside and i could not fall asleep
dialogue: i just had to spend the night all alone in the house. the power was out and it was storming outside.
that sounds like it could be quite a scary experience.
i started a small fire in the trash can to get some light. it almost started a fire.
label: afraid
response: oh yeah that is a bit dangerous. candles are good to have on hang.

situation: apprehensive: travelling to dubai
dialogue: i am a little worried about travelling to dubai
why are you worried?
these muslim countries can be a bit fanatic
label: apprehensive
response: that is true but dubai is a bit better

situation: i left my cell phone on the table at the starbucks. i was going to the bathroom and did not worry about leaving it.
dialogue: i left my cell phone on the table at starbucks.
oh no! was it still there when you went back?
of course, i am not worried no one would steal from me.
label: trusting
response: you never know these days. luckily there are cameras everywhere.

situation: anxious: i cannot help feel stressed about money
dialogue: i cannot help feel stressed about money
why? are you having financial problems?
yes i just had a major car repair and it took a massive chunk of my savings. $700
label: anxious
response: oh god , that sounds horrible but at least nothing bas happened to you!

situation: i felt alone for those 3 weeks she went to visit family
dialogue: i felt alone for those 3 weeks she went to visit family
oh no, what did you do to stay cheerful ?
lol i played xbox games
label: lonely
response: sounds good, when she got back i hope you schooled her on halo ?

situation: usually i do not feel very well because of health problems. not sure why and do not really care why but this morning i just feel good.
dialogue: i usually do not feel the greatest because of health problems.
what kind of health problems ?
blood pressure and crohns disease, as well as, a few minor ones. not sure why but today i feel really good! slept well, woke up happy and energized
label: content
response: i am glad you feel good today!

situation: i know i will be safe in the event of a total nuclear holocaust as long as i duck and cover underneath the nearest school desk. there is just not a single thing wrong with my plan.
dialogue: you wanna know why i am not worried about nuclear armageddon? because i bought a school desk at one of the district auctions, and all i have to do is duck and cover and nuclear fire will not touch me.
lol! i remember those drills when i was a kid!

ahh, then you know exactly what i mean. i do not see a single thing wrong with my plan. i am not sure why everyone is so worried about north korea or iran or russia or something when it is just like.get a school desk. it is not hard, people.
label: prepared
response: and your largest hardback book will protect you from a tornado as long as you put it over your head and sit in the hall!

situation: i have a job interview next week. i am hoping for the best but not getting my hopes up too much. i really need a new job
dialogue: i have a job interview next week. i am really nervous.
that is normal. try to just be your self. i am sure it will work out fine.
i am hoping for the best, but not getting my hopes up too high. i need a new job!
label: anticipating
response: amen, me too.   i hate my current job.

situation: my new upholstery/carpet cleaner arrived today. i am so very happy it is here as my living room rug needs a good clean!
dialogue: this is going to sound really pathetic, but i am so happy my new upholstery/carpet cleaner arrived today. now i can clean!
it is not crazy! i am all about cleaning up. i love the smell of clean house
me too. i live in a first floor apartment and it gets so dusty. now i will be able to clean the carpet and the couch! funny how some strange things lift your spirits.
label: joyful
response: i find it very satisfactory to clean and vacuum i bet it will smell so good

situation: i cannot help but sit back and think what a great mother my daughter has become. she recently had a baby that was premature and is juggling so many things at once but is doing a great job.
dialogue: my daughter is doing such a great job juggling so many things after having a baby that was premature.
that is good. i know that would be difficult.
she really has become such a good mom. i must have done something right ha ha
label: proud
response: that is great. i am sure you are proud and you should be!

situation: i am moving into a new apartment soon and am really excited about it. but at the same time, i am hoping and praying my neighbors will be nice and quiet. the current upstairs ones are not!
dialogue: i am moving into a new apartment soon. i do hope that the neighbors are nice and quiet.

that is always both an exciting time and a nerve-wracking time. i am in college and i had to move the past two years in a row. this year, i decided i kinda had enough and would just stay put, even though the apartment was just so-so. do you like it well enough even if the neighbors may give you trouble?
not really, but my current upstairs neighbors are awful and i feel it'd be worth moving just to get away from them!
label: apprehensive
response: oh yeah, i know the type. where they sound like they are having a parade at 3am. sorry you had to go through that. luckily (or unluckily, if you want to see it that way) i have a loud window ac unit in my apartment, so even if they did make noise, i could not hear them over it!

situation: when we first decided to sell off everything and hit the road full-time in our rv, i was a bit worried and scared. i was afraid we would not make it. so far so good, 2 years ina nd still going.
dialogue: two years ago we decided to sell off almost everything we owned and move into our rv so we could travel full-time. i was really scared and worried about literally everything.
oh wow that is a huge commitment! how did it go?
it has been amazing! we have enjoyed every minute of the last 2 years. my kids are seeing and experiencing things that they may have never been able to see or do.
label: apprehensive
response: that is really awesome!  i am glad it all worked out for you!

situation: i was looking back through pictures online of me and my friends years ago.  it made me kind of wish i could be back then for a little while.
dialogue: sometimes i look at old pictures of times in my life and kind of wish i could go back for a while.  do you ever feel like that?
yes i feel like that every time i look at old pictures!
it is good to know others feel the same.  i mean, i love my life right now, but sometimes it would be nice to go to something simpler for a bit.
label: nostalgic
response: i agree and time jut goes by too fast!

situation: i was looking at old pictures of my friends and i.  i sometimes wish i could go back to those days, at least for a while.
dialogue: i was looking at old pictures the other day and kind of wishing i could go back to those times in my life.
do you reach out to your friends from your childhood?
as much as i can, but some have gotten far enough away that i am not sure how to track them down anymore.
label: nostalgic
response: exhaust all options, social media is a big way to stay connected

situation: i had a package delivered to the property management office recently. it was quite a large package and i could not carry it. without saying a word, one of the maintenance men took it to my apartment for me. is that service or is that service?!
dialogue: sometimes i am just surprised and amazed at the kindness of others. recently, one of the maintenance men in our complex delivered a package to me, without my saying anything!
wow!  what was in the package?
it was a carpet/upholstery cleaner and is quite heavy. i am disabled, so would not have been able to carry it. they do not normally do deliveries, so i thought that was really nice of him to do that.
label: impressed
response: that was really nice!  what a wonderful surprise!  this act of kindness helps to restore my faith in humanity.

situation: me and my friend used to play nintendo all day long
dialogue: my friend and i used to play nintendo all day long. it was fun! we used to play ninja turtles and other fun games. gosh, i miss her so much
nice do you still keep in touch with her
yes but she lives in a different country, different time zone so we barely have time to talk. i wish she lived closer
label: nostalgic
response: well if you stay in touch then i am sure she will come back..but in the meantime try to take your mind off her or get involved in something fun so you have cool stories to tell her

situation: i am usually at my calmest and happiest when i am sitting on my porch with a good book and a glass of wine. it is a lovely feeling to end the day with.
dialogue: for me, one of life's greatest pleasures is to be sitting on my porch with a good book and a glass of wine.
what book do you enjoy reading?
lots of things. i like historical novels and legal dramas best. what about you? does reading give you a sense of relaxation?
label: content
response: no, actually i am under a lot of stress right now and i am in pretty dire straights financially. the only book i am really reading at this time is the bible.

situation: my cousin recently sent me a video she'd taken with her phone, it was a tour of my home village. what i saw horrified me and made me sick they've built all manner of hideous buildings in really prominent places!
dialogue: my cousin recently sent me a video from her phone of my home village. what i saw made me mad and sad!
where is your home village?
in the north of scotland. it used to be a quiet little place, and now there are hideous buildings in really prominent places!
label: disgusted
response: that is a shame. i"m sorry to hear that.

situation: i really love my dog, i always make sure he has everything he needs food, water, vet etc
dialogue: i love taking care of my little dog i give him everything he need
i love dogs! what breed is he?
he is a french puddle and i love him very much
label: caring
response: that is so sweet! we have blue healers, they just make the world better.

situation: one time for my birthday my college friends "kidnapped" me and put me in the trunk of a car and dunked me in a fountain
dialogue: one time as a surprise for my birthday, my college friends "kidnapped me"
oh my goodness, that must have been terrifying until you figured out what was going on.
nah i knew that they were just having fun with me!  i was blindfolded and put in the trunk of a big car (i am tiny).
label: surprised
response: well at least you had a good time.  did they do something nice for you after?

situation: i hate when i see people homeless in the street i do not know if i should get mad or sad
dialogue: i cannot stand seeing homeless people in the street, i get really angry and sad at the same time
do you ever offer to help thm?
yes i go to my local charity every weekend
label: angry
response: good for you, i feel bad for never helping out.

situation: i never buy scratch off tickets but decided to stop by the store and grab a couple the other day. i waited til i got home to scratch it and ended up winning $500 on one of them. i spent $20 on them and one i won $5 but the other $500.
dialogue: i won $500 on a scratch off the other day.
awesome.  what are you going to do with the money.
i am really not sure. i was shocked to win that much.
label: surprised
response: do not spend it all in one place

situation: i once put googly eyes on a potato and had a nice dinner date with it.  i was really lonely at the time and was doing anything i could to keep occupied.
dialogue: i was really lonely and depressed at one point, and i had a dinner date with a potato i put googly eyes on.
haha, that is a nice way to enjoy a sad moment, how are you feeling recently?
much better, thanks  yeah, i was really just doing anything to feel a connection.
label: ashamed
response: i am happy to hear you are doing better. if you feel that way again please reach out.

situation: i woke up and i found out that my cat had destroyed my shoes! i was so mad
dialogue: i woke up and the first thing i saw that my cat had decided to play with my shoes and ruin them!
oh my, you must have been annoyed with your cat. i guess he just wanted your attention.
i was so mad! i felt so bad being mad at him
label: furious
response: aw he is just a kitty after all. i am sure he did not mean to make you mad.

situation: i was confident that i was going to win that prize
dialogue: i was confident that i was going to win that prize
what prize was it, or what was the competition, rather? i am interested to know, but do not want to pry, if you do not feel like saying.
it was a $25 visa gift card. the competition was a talent show. i did not win unfortunately but it is ok
label: confident
response: ah, gotcha. it is good to see that you tried and that you care that much. most people are too lazy or scared to compete in things, myself included. i hope you continue to do the things that make you competitive and interested.

situation: we were buying a new kind of sausage for the first time and i was really nervous if it was good or not cause it was super cheap!
dialogue: we decided to try and buy a new kind of sausage from the store. it is super cheap
was it any good?
it was! i was super nervous about it though cause of how cheap it was
label: apprehensive
response: sometimes the cheap things are the best

situation: it is really depressing going to visit my grandmother to the hospital and see all the sick patients
dialogue: it is really hard going to the hospital to visit my grandmother
i bet it is! when my grandma was alive it was so heartbreaking to see her in pain. she broke her hip right before her death and she just could not recover
yeah it is the worst having someone in the hospital
label: sad
response: i hope she will recover soon. stay strong and think positive

situation: i am going to my home country next tuesday
dialogue: i am going to my home country next tuesday and i am so excited i cannot sleep! it is been 4 years since i have seen my parents
where is that ?
kazakhstan. i miss it and i miss my parents and friends so much
label: anticipating
response: isnt that where bruno is from ?

situation: i am super proud of my parents for graduating college
dialogue: i am super proud of my parents for graduating college
that is great that they accomplished that and even better that you recognize their achievements.
yeah, they are truly an inspiration that anyone can go to college no matter the age
label: proud
response: ok i did not realize that they may have gone after you were born as opposed to before.

situation: i came home one day to find that my dog had eaten a sandwich i had taken home from lunch.  the odd thing is that it had been in a bookbag, and he had unzipped the bag to get to it.
dialogue: i came home one day and found that my dog had unzipped my bookbag, gotten a sandwich i had forgotten i brought home from lunch, and opened the bag it was in without damaging it to eat it.
that sounds peculiar. i have never known a dog with such finesse, yours may have talent.
he is an evil genius.  he tried to get toys out of a christmas stocking one time by climbing on the coffee table.
label: surprised
response: that is really cool, it makes me want to consider getting a dog.

situation: i am impressed in my sisters camping skills. they are very good
dialogue: i am impressed in my sisters camping skills. they are very good
what did she do ?
we went camping and she prepared everything rather quickly including the tents
label: impressed
response: wow that was nice of her

situation: i am confident that i will win the gaming tournament in chicago
dialogue: i am confident that i will win the gaming tournament in chicago
what kind of gaming is it?
shooting game
label: confident
response: that is sounds interesting!

situation: i go up with my skydiving students daily and i feel confident in their skills
dialogue: when i go up with my skydiving students i feel proud when they do well
i would imagine so.  how long have you been a sky diving instructor for?
i have been instructing for 12 years but skydiving for 25
label: confident
response: aweseme.  i want to go skydiving sometime.

situation: for two years now i have been walking with help of a walker, following a botched hip operation. recently, at a physical therapy session, i was able to walk with a cane the length of the treatment room. i felt quite good about myself!
dialogue: well, recently at physical therapy i walked the length of the treatment room with the help of a cane. i am feeling quite good about that!
wow that is a good job
considering i have been using a walker for the past two years, yes it is. thanks!
label: proud
response: keep it up!

situation: a public road in front of my house closed because of a limestone mine.
dialogue: i am so upset that a public road in front of my house closed because of a limestone mine.
that sounds frustrating. how did it affect you?
it is hard because cars come up the road all the time and turn around in my drive.
label: furious
response: ooh, that would be aggravating. i guess there is not much you can do.

situation: i am hopeful that i will win my ebay bid
dialogue: i am hopeful that i will win my ebay bid
best of luck! what are you bidding for
i am bidding on a rare comic book
label: hopeful
response: archie? marvel? dc?

situation: i was walking home one day and was passing a house that had been empty for a while.  as i was passing a very large dog came charging out barking very loudly at me.
dialogue: i was walking home one time and a really big dog came charging out from a house at me barking really loudly.
sometimes dogs just bark a lot. did anything happen?
thankfully not really, it stopped near me and barked a lot until someone got it, but it was really frightening until it was retrieved.
label: terrified
response: thank goodness. i would be scared, too. you cannot really know whether a dog is harmless or not sometimes.

situation: i was really amazed to see the devolpment of new technology these days compared to past years
dialogue: it is incredible to see how technology has advanced these past days
it has, what did you see that impressed you?
well the phones are basically a 1990's computer
label: impressed
response: they are more powerful than that. more like an early 2000's computer.

situation: i ate like a whole cake last night! it was so good i could not stop eating it
dialogue: i ate an entire cake last night
what did i tell you about doing that. it was a chocolate cake right?
it was! i just could not stop! it was so good that i just had to keep eating
label: guilty
response: ok, at least it was the right kind of cake you liked. but still not a good thing.

situation: i am prepared to help my family financially whenever they need it
dialogue: i am prepared to help my family financially whenever they need it
that is really great.  you do not find too many people willing to help others financially.  do you have a really good job?
ehh, its not the best but it is not bad either\
label: prepared
response: it is good just to have enough these days.

situation: i was afraid when i saw that horror film in the theater
dialogue: i was afraid when i saw that horror film in the theater
which film was it?
it was the first purge
label: afraid
response: i have not heard of it, sounds interesting though.

situation: i just moved to this area quite recently and am quite pleased with the quality of stores, restaurants and variety of accommodations available. it most certainly was not expected.
dialogue: wandering around my little area of the world i am quite pleased with the variety of stores and restaurants here. i did not expect it.
that is good. i live in a small town but we have a big shopping center across the street and there are all the stores i love
nice! you just do not expect it in a rural area. well, i did not anyway. we have large grocery stores and a little (but very good) organic grocery store. quite incredible.
label: surprised
response: wow even organic store? that is pretty cool

situation: i hate when i wash dishes and touch food
dialogue: i hate when i do dishes and touch food that was on the plate1! so gross. makes me wanna throw up
really? it does not bother me at all. i wonder why you feel that way?
because the food is all soggy and mushy. i do not know, such a yucky feeling
label: disgusted
response: well, most people have intense likes and dislikes. personally, i cannot stand cigar smoke, but some people love it! i guess in your case, you need to scrape the food off the plate first.

situation: i hate when my kids leave their clothes all over the floor, i punish their video games but they still manage to leave their clothes on the floor
dialogue: i really hate when my kids leave their dirty clothes on the floor
i can imagine they are a right pain to pick up after!
yeah they even have a bin specially for that
label: angry
response: what an annoyance!

situation: i hate when people try to cut lane in traffic without putting their signal it really makes me angry
dialogue: i hate people that cut lane in traffic without signaling it
oh me too. i am not a driver but that is so annoying.
yeah it really makes me mad to see that people do not care about these types of things
label: annoyed
response: it can be really dangerous too

situation: i found a rabbit that had been shot by someone in my yard.
dialogue: i found a rabbit that had been shot by someone in my yard
that is terrible.  was it dead or just injured?
thank goodness it was dead, poor thing is not suffering, but some people can be so cruel.
label: disgusted
response: that is true.  i would hate for people to be shooting things that close to my house, too.  do you know who it was?

situation: we have been talking about trying a new restaurant that just opened a few months ago. i had been holding off because it is a little pricey and i am worried i will not like the food even though it has gotten good reviews.
dialogue: we had been holding off trying a new restaurant in town.
what is been holding you back?
it is a little pricey and i am worried i will not like the food and waste all that money. it has good reviews though
label: apprehensive
response: that is a tough decision to make. it is good to try new things sometimes and i am sure the waiters can recommend you a nice meal you will enjoy based off your preferences.

situation: i just discovered that our local organic store stocks indian food made by a local indian lady. i was the happiest person alive at that point i love indian food!
dialogue: our local organic store now stocks indian food made by a local indian lady heaven, heaven, heaven!
that is very cool!  i love when food is authentic.  do you shop there often?
about once a week. her husband works in the store, so he brings her food in regularly. it is such a pleasure to find such a thing i missed my indian food!
label: joyful
response: i have never tried making indian food myself, but i do really enjoy indian restaurants.  i am jealous.

situation: i have been practicing my jump shot for months. i am read for a game of horse against my friends.
dialogue: i have been working on  my jump shot all month.
that is awesome!  have you gotten any better yet?
i hope so i have a big horse tournament against my buddies i want to win the 100 bucks prize.
label: confident
response: that would be cool.  hopefully the hard work will pay off

situation: one of my neighbors (next building and two floors up) insists on playing talk radio every morning with his door open. it is blaring out and driving me nuts!
dialogue: one of my neighbors (next building and two floors up) plays talk radio every morning very loudly.
urgh that sounds like the worst! how early?
not until about 8am, but it is so loud i can hear it in my first floor apartment with the doors and windows closed. idiot man!
label: annoyed
response: so inconsiderate! it reminds me of my neighbours doing building work one morning at 6am!

situation: i just bought a ticket to britney spears live show in vegas, it is in 3 months, i cannot wait!
dialogue: nothing in life is certain, the only control you have is to decide what to do with the time that has been given to you.
i tend to believe that those who have biblical faith do have a certainty, that god will bless them despite circumstances.
i have just bought a ticket to a britney spears live show in vegas.
label: anticipating
response: oh really, when are you going to go see her?

situation: i just got an email from property management confirming that i have got the new apartment i wanted. i cannot wait to move in!
dialogue: our property management team just emailed me to say i have got the apartment i wanted!
congratulations! that must have been such a great feeling.
it really was i cannot wait to move in! it is a smaller apartment, but quieter (i hope!).
label: anticipating
response: i cannot wait for the day i move out into my own place!

situation: i was on the patio and a giant roach crawled out under neath the deck. it was as big as a golf ball.
dialogue: i was on the patio and a giant roach crawled out from underneath.
those are my nightmares. they are so big where i live in the south.
it was almost as bug as a golf ball i felt like throwing up.
label: disgusted
response: i would immediately start spraying bug spray all over. those things terrify me.

situation: i have to go to see my orthopedic surgeon next month. it is a bit of a drive about 1 1/2 hours, but i have done it before and know i will manage ok.
dialogue: i have quite a long drive ahead of me next month. it is about 1/12 hours, but i have don it before so i will be fine.
i do not know how you do it. i cannot stand long drives.
i put music on and open the window. otherwise i will disappear into my own little world, and that is not a good thing to do when you are driving!
label: confident
response: definitely not! music is a great idea though; i listen to music on all bus rides and car rides.

situation: i was so amped up to go get my new computer from the store
dialogue: i was so amped yesterday. i got to pick up my now computer for the store!
that is awesome.  what kind of computer are you getting?
it was just a new model hp that i bought but i am so excited!
label: excited
response: very nice.  id be super excited too.  have some fun playing with it

situation: there is a woman in town who has started delivering groceries to peoples' homes. as i am disabled, i am so thankful for her service. things would be a lot more difficult without it.
dialogue: i get my groceries delivered to my home and am so grateful for the service.
yeah it is really nice to have other people do your shopping
it helps me a lot as i am disabled and it can be quite difficult. anyway, i hate grocery shopping!
label: grateful
response: shopping is no fun, waiting in lines is not fun.

situation: i had just watched the notebook. the main character ended up forgetting everything about his life. he died at the end
dialogue: i just watched the notebook, pretty depressing movie.
i have not heard of that movie. what is depressing about it?
it is a romantic love story. does not end so well for the main character.
label: sad
response: oh dear. i think i will give it a miss i cry at the drop of a hat! you should watch a comedy next, just to cheer yourself up!

situation: i was in shock when my little boy showeed me he could count to 10 by the age of 1
dialogue: my little boy learned how to  count to ten eeven know he is super young
ohhh cute! i am so happy for you, smart boy!
yeah i was so proud of him as well i thought i would have to wait months till he got to that point
label: impressed
response: a rare one, i hope he goes a long way and maybe even be the next einstein we need

situation: i was walking to the park, i was wearing flip flops, i tripped over a log and smashed my toe.
dialogue: i just went to the park today.
what did you do there?
i was going to hang out, but i ended up tripping and smashing my toe up into a rock.
label: angry
response: sounds painful, did you have to go to the doctor?

situation: my little brother dumped a glass of water on me while i was sleeping just because we are in a prank war
dialogue: my little brother dumped a glass of water on me this morning to wake me up
oh god, that must have been the worst way to wake up in the morning
yeah i was furious we are in some sort of a prank war
label: furious
response: oh, do you have any revenge planned?

situation: there was a strange sound coming from outside my window last night and i was so scared!
dialogue: last night there was a really strange animal screaming outside my window in the middle of the night
that is really scary!  what was it?
turned out to be a skunk! it sounded so strange!
label: afraid
response: yuck!  stay away from that guy!

situation: i remember being in college and traveling around europe
dialogue: when i was in college i travelled all over europe one semester.
sounds like quite an adventure for one semester! what was your favorite place?
i love all over italy, but i also loved germany and france and spain.
label: nostalgic
response: nice! must have made you really happy to see so many different places.

situation: i could not believe my eyes when we came home from vacation and the house was clean from top to bottom. the kids had to stay home and decided to help out before we got back. wonders never cease to amaze me.
dialogue: we went on vacation and the kids stayed home. i could not believe it when i walked in the door and the house was totally clean.
lol! i thought you were going to say messy! good kids!
wonders never cease to amaze me. first time for everything i guess,
label: surprised
response: so true! maybe they want something or they did something bad and are hiding it

situation: i was excited to go on a zip line day trip recently
dialogue: i went ziplining the other day
oh awesome, i love ziplining, last time i went was 3 years ago tho, how did you find it?
i found it using the internet.  it was a lot of hiking but they had a lot of long lines.
label: excited
response: did you enjoy yourself

situation: i smashed my finger in the door the other day and i was so upset and mad!
dialogue: i smashed my finger in the door last night
ouch sucks to be you! jk did you ice it down
i iced it up but i was so mad because it was my fault for slamming the door
label: angry
response: yes hope you feel better

situation: our dog is getting older and she is just at that point. she is blind and cannot walk well. we might have to put her down soon.
dialogue: we might have to put our dog down soon.
oh no. i have been there before. it was really sad.
yes, she is getting older and she is just getting to that point she cannot move around good.
label: sad
response: it is sometimes for the best but that does not always make it easy.

situation: i was really lucky when my cancer got cured not many people can say that and i feel very lucky
dialogue: i am really lucky that my cancer got cured many years ago
how did you do that? naturally or with chemo?
i did it with chemo and it took a lot of time and effort
label: grateful
response: i bet! look in too chlorella and similar to get rid of any toxins from the chemo

situation: we are moving soon. i am really looking forward to the change and my kids to have a new school to go to.
dialogue: i am so ready to move.
oh yeah? where you planning to move to?
california. i am ready for my kids to try out some new schools and be happier
label: hopeful
response: oh that is a very good reason to go, i am happy for you

situation: i really hate seeing people throw trash on the street like if it was a natural thing to do
dialogue: i cannot stand seeing people throw trash on the streets
this is what you need to do, get out of your car and go give them a beat down that they need
i know right i feel like doing that every time but i do not want to get arrested hahaha let karma get them,
label: angry
response: yea but it will feel better if you take action

situation: i am by myself most of the time in a isolated area. i only have animals as my friends.
dialogue: "i am by myself most of the time in a isolated area. i only have animals as my friends.
oh does that sadden you?
sometimes it makes me sad, but than i think how happy my animal friends makes me feel.
label: lonely
response: animals are far better than humans, most humans have long lot their way and follow only their desires, i am also like you and i embrace it and smile

situation: i just bought a hundred packs of magic cards and i did not get a single good cards. my friend only bought a few packs he got an amazing card
dialogue: i bought 100 packs of magic cards and did not get a single good card.
what are magic cards?
collectible cards. my friend bought only a few packs and got incredible cards.
label: jealous
response: oh interesting! kind of like pokemon cards?

situation: we are going on vacation next week and we cannot bring our dog. i feel so bad that we have to board her in at a kennel. she is going to be so sad
dialogue: i feel really bad that we have to board our dog when we go on vacation next week.
oh that is sad, i am sorry for this, where are you going and what  will you do about your dog?
we are going to a place at the beach that does not allow pets with some friends. our vet also has a kennel there to board dogs so i guess that is what we'll do. she will be so sad though.
label: guilty
response: hmmm i got an idea, how about when you come back you give her an amazing time?

situation: when i applied for several higher paying jobs, i really wanted to land an interview for one.
dialogue: i actually recently applied for a few jobs myself, crossing my fingers for something better than my current one.
well i hope that you find something. any particular reason that you are job hunting?
current job does not pay enough, i am waiting for the stars to align and something better to come along.
label: hopeful
response: keep it up and i am sure something will turn up!

situation: i had bought some tickets at the fair and hoped to win the new mustang. i knew it was unlucky but i still imagined i would win
dialogue: i just bought some tickets to win the price at the state fair.
how lucky you feeling?
i know its not likely but i really want to win the new mustang
label: hopeful
response: well if it is worth anything i give you my luck! i hope you win that mustang!

situation: i am so scared to live in my neighborhood. there is people that come around shooting their guns.
dialogue: i am so scared to live in my neighborhood. there is people that come around shooting their guns.
that sounds dangerous! you should try to move
i have been thinking about moving but i have lived here for over 30 years. the area has changed so much.
label: terrified
response: you really should! with things like that happening you could get seriously injured

situation: i went out to the country to go star gazing. i was overwhelmed by the enormity of the universe.
dialogue: i went out to the country to gaze at some stars.
cool! that sounds like a great time!
i was overwhelmed by the enormity of the universe.
label: sentimental
response: wow that is pretty deep!

situation: my whole family from out of town showed up to my kids birthday, they did not tell me they were coming.
dialogue: my kids birthday was last weekend, my whole family showed up! they did not even tell me they were coming
wow, that had to be quite a surprise.  i hope you like them
yea, i do. hah. they live a few states away, which is why it was so unexpected. do not see them often.
label: surprised
response: well that is good.  hopefully it was a good party!

situation: i bought two pairs of shoes. but i did not try them both on the second set was two right shoes.
dialogue: bought two pairs of shoes recently.
what brand are they?
yeezy's, the worst part is the second pair of shoes were both right footed.
label: annoyed
response: that is crazy did you go return them maybe?

situation: i read the instructions how to set up my fit bit 100 times. i need to record my exercise to prepare for my marathon race
dialogue: i read the instructions to set up my fit bit 100 times.
and what happened?
i need it to work perfectly i need to get ready for a marathon and i need it to track my progress.
label: prepared
response: how long is a marathon?

situation: i have to go to a big gathering and make a speech. i do not really know the people and not sure how i will be received.
dialogue: i have a big speech to give.
are you nervous?
well i do not really know many of the people i will be in front of, so hopefully i do not stutter or something.
label: apprehensive
response: good luck!

situation: i left my purse in my seat in starbucks. i was in a safe neighborhood so i was not to worried.
dialogue: i left my purse at in the seat in starbucks.
oh no! i hope no one took it!
i was in a safe neighborhood so i was not worried.
label: trusting
response: did you go back for it and get it?

situation: i was able to spell the entire alphabet backwards. it was on a dare. i nailed it perfectly.
dialogue: i was able to say the entire alphabet backwards.
wow ! that is quite an accomplishment. how long did you have to practice to perfect that ?
no time, i have a great memory, it was on a dare i nailed it perfectly.
label: proud
response: fantastic ! when you get older, your memory tends to play tricks on you

situation: i had been looking a pictures of car crashes. now i am afraid to drive anywhere. seriously i can hardly go anywhere a car might be.
dialogue: i have been looking at pictures of crazy car crashes.
oh really? any interesting ones?
seriously now i cannot drive anywhere. i cannot even leave the house for fear of car crashes.
label: afraid
response: that is awful! sounds like it might have caused you some trauma unfortunately.

situation: i went shopping at the mall the other day. i was really tired and sat down for a few minutes. i placed the bags beside me and looked away for a second and the next thing i knew the bags were gone. i am still so mad
dialogue: i was at the mall yesterday. i sat down for a few minutes and when i looked away someone stole my shopping bags.
did you catch the person after?
no. i did not notice right away. how could someone do that.  i am so so mad!
label: furious
response: that is unreal, what did you have in the bags?

situation: i had to go to the hospital. there was a man there who came with severe burns. it was repulsive.
dialogue: i was in a hospital and a guy game in with some really bad burns.
oh my gosh. what happened to him?
no idea, but i had never seen something like that in person. it looked painful.
label: disgusted
response: i bet is was. are you ok?

situation: i saw a guy deadlift 700lbs at the gym the other day. i was in awe.
dialogue: i saw a guy deadlift 700lbs at the gym the other day. i was in awe.
oh my god, that is a lot of weight!
yeah it is, it seemed like he had every plate in the gym on the bar. i have never seen someone lift that much in person before.
label: impressed
response: that is really cool, i honestly cannot even imagine someone lifting that much!

situation: i got to go to a cat cafe and i was the only one there so i got to pet all the cats!
dialogue: i got to go to a cat cafe when no one else was around!
i have been to one before with my girlfriend, what an amazing experience eh?
it was! i was the only one around so all the cats came to spend time with me
label: joyful
response: are not you the luckiest?

situation: i walked out to my car and got in and felt something hit my face. it was a giant spider!
dialogue: i walked out to my car theo ther day and felt something hit my face.
really? what was it?
a giant spider! it was terrible and i was so startled!
label: surprised
response: oh gross! i would be startled too!

situation: when i can home, my cat was laying on the pile of laundry that i had pulled out of the dryer before work. now it is covered in hair.
dialogue: when i can home, my cat was laying on the pile of laundry that i had pulled out of the dryer before work. now it is covered in hair.
you must be mad at the cat for that.
well it is pretty inconvenient, that is for sure. nothing i can really do about it now. just got to keep the door closed i guess.
label: annoyed
response: you got too, my cats do not do that thankfully.

situation: today when i went into my roommate's office to fix the internet, i noticed the collar of his old cat that passed away. i miss her.
dialogue: today when i went into my roommate's office to fix the internet, i noticed the collar of his old cat that passed away. i miss her.
i am so sorry to hear that. we need memories of our fur babies to help us in our grief.
yeah, she was not my favorite cat, but i still miss her. cancer sucks.
label: sentimental
response: people do not realize that animals can get cancer too.  its more common than we may think.

situation: listening to old music
dialogue: sometimes an old song runs through my head and i remember the times where i used to listen to songs so many times that i memorized the words
that sounds nice. it is always good to remember better times. what kind of music?
like old kind of emo songs, full of angst and whatnot
label: nostalgic
response: ha, i used to listen to that stuff back in high school. the my chemical romance gets me every time.

situation: the other night when i was taking my dog out to go to the bathroom really late. i heard some rustling in the bushes and panicked.
dialogue: the other night when i was taking my dog out to go to the bathroom really late. i heard some rustling in the bushes and panicked.
guess you dog is not one that is going to take the bullet?
oh she was ready to fight whatever it was, but she was on a leash thankfully. no, i am just really easily started, all that anxiety over an armadillo.  i am so ashamed.
label: afraid
response: lol i have never seen an armadillo but that sounds freaky!

situation: i found a injured baby bird in my yard today. i had to call animal control to come get it, i hope it is okay.
dialogue: i found an injured bird in my yard today, it was only a baby to!
did you help it?
yes, i had to call my local wildlife rescue center to come get it. i hope its okay, they said they think it has a broken wing.
label: caring
response: i hope it get's better! that sounded harsh

situation: i have a friend coming over soon and i keep checking out the window to see if theyre here yet.
dialogue: i have a friend coming over soon and i keep checking out the window to see if theyre here yet.
what do you all have planned
i am making dinner for the both of us. i have a roast in the oven. it smells so good i cannot wait until it is ready.
label: anticipating
response: that sounds nice, must be a really good "friend"

situation: my boss finally noticed my hard work and gave me a pay raise! i am so happy, i can finally take my family on a vacation this winter.
dialogue: my boss finally noticed my hard work and gave me a pay raise!
what a fantastic feeling. where you expecting that?
no not at all! i am excited because now i can plan a family vacation for this winter.
label: grateful
response: well then. what a great surprise. it sounds like you deserved it.

situation: i had a very specific deadline.and none of my co-workers would leave me alone to complete my work because it was friday.
dialogue: i have a deadline at work coming up.
for what kind of project?
it is top-secret. but every time i try and get serious work done, my co-workers will not leave me alone.
label: annoyed
response: did you tell them to leave you alone?

situation: my roommate has been gone all week. i do not have anything to do without him here.
dialogue: my roommate has been gone all week. i do not have anything to do without him here.
what about doing something you enjoy?
it is just not the same doing something by myself. i do not have anyone to go do stuff with.
label: lonely
response: i know it can be tough but maybe trying something new or outside your comfort zone might give you an enjoyable experience

situation: we just adopted a dog from the shelter and i think she is sick with parvo. we are taking her to the vet tomorrow to see.
dialogue: we just adopted a dog from the shelter last week and i think she is sick with parvo.
what is parvo?
it is a deadly dog illness, basically a virus that often leads to death. we think she caught it at the shelter.
label: sentimental
response: that is terrible. can you confirm it?

situation: we are planing on going on a cruise this december. it has been so fun planning the whole trip out.
dialogue: we are planning on going on a cruise in december!
how ever so exciting! is this your first cruise?
no, i went on one in highschool but first one with my husband and daughter. it is has been so fun planning it together!
label: excited
response: i hope you have a great trip and cherish the time with your family!

situation: i came home today and my roommate was cooking dinner, all i had to do was fix my plate. it was so nice.
dialogue: i came home today and my roommate was cooking dinner, all i had to do was fix my plate. it was so nice.
well that was mighty nice of them, you wash dishes ?
i sure did, and the food was delicious. i will have to surprise him with dinner next time.
label: grateful
response: thats cool

situation: we are suppose to be having a bad storm this weekend. i have been stocking up on food and supplies. i feel ready for the worst.
dialogue: we are suppose to be having a bad storm this weekend.
this summer's weather has been really intense here and honestly a little scary
yes, makes you wonder if its global warming. i have been stocking up on food and supplies. ready for the worst.
label: prepared
response: i hope it does not get too bad near you

situation: my husband just got called back into work, was not expecting that. we were in the middle of eating dinner to!
dialogue: my husband just got called back into work, was not expecting that!
why did he get called back in?
someone stole some gear, so they called everyone back to investiage. we had just sat down to eat dinner to!
label: surprised
response: wow, did he get paid for it?

situation: i had just prepared an amazing mac and cheese dinner. it is so tasty and covered in pepper.
dialogue: i just prepared an amazing plate of mac and cheese.
my sister loves mac and cheese. she would probably live off of that if given the chance
it is so good if you add the right amount of pepper.
label: joyful
response: i like paprika in my mac and cheese

situation: i just bought the flyest shirt. i have a brand new necklace. i am going out this weekend and i feel stylish.
dialogue: i just bought a brand new necklace and shirt.
what kind of necklace did you purchase? it is good to treat yourself some times.
not sure i just though it looked cool. hopefully it gets me noticed.
label: confident
response: you will just make sure you have your nice new shirt on with that cool necklace and you will be all eyes.

situation: my dog keeps having accidents in the house ever since we got another dog. i keep taking her outside to!
dialogue: my dog keeps having accidents in the house! i am getting fustrated.
it could be a medical problem. make sure its checked out.
thank you, i will. i think she is doing it to mark her territory, it started when we brought a new dog home.
label: angry
response: ohh i see. that is super annoying. hopefully she gets over this phase and they get along.

situation: a time i really felt i had made an achievement was when i was promoted to a team leader at work.
dialogue: when i was promoted to team leader at work, i really felt like all my hard work had paid off, to some extent, and i gave myself a little pat on the back.
you must have really proud of yourself. its good to acknowledge your own achievements from time to time.
yes, and it can be difficult at times to move up at places, especially when there are many other long timers there!
label: proud
response: i agree, which is why getting into that position can be so gratifying. hopefully you maintain that level of hard work that got you there.

situation: we have a fun weekend planned. i am happy the kids get to go to the water park this weekend. it is their favorite.
dialogue: i cannot wait to go to the water park this weekend.
oh that sounds nice
yes, my kids love it so they are going to be so happy when we get there.
label: excited
response: sounds like a great time, hopefully its not too hot out there

situation: i am just laying in bed with a scented candle burning in my room and my cat on my lap, things could not be any better.
dialogue: i am just laying in bed with a scented candle burning in my room and my cat on my lap, things could not be any better.
that sounds like heaven to me as well
yeah my kitty is just purring away, we are having a good time watching youtube.
label: content
response: i have a cat too close to me, they are the best

situation: my mom sent my daughter a toy i played with when i was a child. it is neat to see and remember when i was her age.
dialogue: my mom sent my daughter a toy i played with when i was a child!
oh thoughtful ! did she enjoy playing with it ?
yes, it was neat to see her play with it. it will make some great photos, since i have one of me playing with it at her age.
label: nostalgic
response: its quite wonderful to share your childhood memories with your children is not it ?

situation: we are getting married next month. the man of my dreams proposed to be at a concert 6 months ago and i cannot wait to be his wife.
dialogue: six months ago my boyfriend proposed to me and we are getting married next month. i cannot wait
congratulations. are you going on a hollywood
on a honeymoon,? not right away. he is totally the man of my dreams. i am so lucky
label: excited
response: well i am happy for you

situation: my husband might loose his job. i am not sure what we will do if he does. his company is downsizing.
dialogue: my husband might loose his job, i am not sure what we will do if he does.
that is terrible. why do you think that he will lose his job?
the company is downsizing and cutting a lot of departments. his hasn't been cut yet but there are rumors!
label: terrified
response: i understand. that is very stressful. did he started looking for another jod? it could be solution.

situation: i found out that my childhood cat passed away yesterday
dialogue: i found out my childhood cat passed away
that is sad. i love cats
i do too, it was so sad.
label: sad
response: how old was the cat?

situation: i felt very secure when my daughter was nominated to be 'most artistic' at school. she is so very talented!
dialogue: my daughter is such a talented and creative young artist. when she was nominated to be 'most artistic' at school, i felt very secure she would win, because she really is amazing!
that is awesome. did she?
she did! i know i am the parent so can be biased, but it is really so impressive how well she draws, paints, shades.
label: confident
response: i bet you are so proud. i would definitely be

situation: i was ready for the first time i got into a car crash. i had everything i needed perfectly read
dialogue: i was very ready for my first car crash
why?
i had all the paperwork set and ready, i had a blanket cause it was in the winter.
label: prepared
response: what happened after your car crashed?

situation: last night there was a fly in the bedroom while i was trying to sleep. it kept landing on my face
dialogue: last night a fly got into the bedroom and would not stop trying to land on my face
flies are so annoying
it was terrible! right as i was about to fall asleep the dang thing would land on my nose!
label: annoyed
response: i had that problem with a mosquito once. i woke up with a bite on the tip of my nose

situation: i left my dog alone in the house when i went to get the mail. while i was gone she got in the cat box and ate the cat poop, super gross.
dialogue: i left my dog alone in the house when i went to get the mail. while i was gone she got in the cat box and ate the cat poop, super gross.
i would have hated to clean that up. i wonder why they do that?
there was nothing to clean. she definitely swallowed it. i stuck her outside cause i cannot even think about dealing with her licking anything right now. gives me the hebbie jibbes thinking about it.
label: disgusted
response: yea that is so gross but also kind of funny. i cannot help but laugh.

situation: i have been rehearsing my speech for days now. i have the perfect delivery and all the talking points down. i will be impressive.
dialogue: i have been practicing my speech for days now.
do you have to give a big speech soon?
i have the perfect delivery and all the talking points drilled down. i will be impressive
label: confident
response: that is the way to go! practice and practice until you are confident and then the real thing will be a breeze.

situation: my cat puked up a hairball this morning and i had to clean it up.
dialogue: my cat puked up a hairball this morning and i had to clean it up.
that is horrible. does he puke up hairball often?
she pukes up hairballs every now and then i have some salmon flavored jelly i can feed her, but it happens so infrequently i forget to.
label: disgusted
response: i understand.

situation: when i left the bathroom in high school once i had toilet paper stuck to my shoe.
dialogue: when i left the bathroom in high school once i had toilet paper stuck to my shoe.
i bet it was very embarrassing?
yeah it sure was, you know how mean teenagers can be. it is like they have no empathy or think about what if it was them.
label: embarrassed
response: it is alright we have all been there many times.

situation: i wanted to try this new pizza and it was terrible!
dialogue: i got a new type of pizza i wanted to try
what kind of pizza is it?
a normal pepperoni but it was terrible!
label: disappointed
response: that is never good, i love pizza

situation: when i was in costa rica i was having a lot of trouble with the address of my airbnb, i was so lost.
dialogue: when i was in costa rica i was having a lot of trouble with the address of my airbnb, i was so lost.
oh no! that must be so frustrating being in a foreign country
it was because my spanish was a bit lacking, it also did not help that people kept giving me bad directions. i eventually stumbled on it but for a while i was worried i would never make it there.
label: afraid
response: i am glad you eventually found it and did not have to sleep somewhere else.

situation: was not ready for race to start
dialogue: i was caught off guard when the gun fired for a race i was in
ahh, it happens. i used to swim competitively so i would sometimes get stunned too when i hear the gun go off
yeah, i forgot to take my sweat pants off, that is when i realized running is not for me
label: surprised
response: ahaha, i hate running too

situation: i felt bad when i cheated on my partner
dialogue: i slept with a new girl last week
huh, ok.  do you like her a lot?
not really
label: guilty
response: sounds like you do not have much respect for women.

situation: i was eating dinner last night and and i just felt so happy for a moment it was great
