no, it turns out the power had went out for a minute and it was the sound of the printer calibrating.
label: terrified
response: i am glad everything turned out okay!

situation: it has been raining a lot lately, i am really trusting the seal on our doors to keep the water out.
dialogue: it has been raining a lot lately, i am really trusting the seal on our doors to keep the water out.
yeah flooding is a real problems these days. the weather is crazy! hopefully you and your house will stay nice and dry.
i know, it really starts too pool up by our house. it is getting kind of scary!
label: hopeful
response: i would be scared too. i hope everything will be ok for you. fingers crossed.

situation: i bought a cake from the store and it ended up tasting terrible.
dialogue: i bought a cake from the store and it ended up tasting terrible.
you sort of gamble on store bought cakes, did you take it back?
no, i ended up just suffering through it and eating it.
label: disappointed
response: you are a lot bravery than i, i do't think i could it eat

situation: i recently applied for a new job, beforehand i bought a new outfit and got a haircut to make me feel better about myself and my chances.
dialogue: i was nervous about an upcoming job interview recently, i bought a new outfit and got a haircut to make myself feel better.
do you feel any less nervous?  job interviews are always nerve-wracking
yea, it made me feel better about myself and my chances, or maybe i just like spending money
label: confident
response: either way, as long as you feel a little bit better it was worth it.  i am sure you will do great!

situation: i love chocolate cookies because my grams would always make them for me.
dialogue: i love chocolate cookies because my grams would always make them for me.
oh yeah! i love chocolate anything! but grandmas cooking is always the best of all!
nothing beats cookies made by grandma. except for the oatmeal ones. too healthy haha.
label: nostalgic
response: not me! haha i love them all!

situation: i found an old picture of when my oldest daughter started kindergarten 11 years ago.
dialogue: i found an old picture of when my oldest daughter started kindergarten 11 years ago.
that must be a cute picture
it is!  in it, she is just standing with a huge smile on her face and a hello kitty backpack.
label: nostalgic
response: so young and ready to conquer the world

situation: watching my daughter grow and become more intelligent makes me happy. i have been teaching her to play certain video games and she catches on so quickly.
dialogue: i have been teaching my young daughter to play video games with me, she is such a quick learner.
what video games are the two of you playing?
minecraft and asphalt racing are two of them, it is amazing to watch a child learn and grow their intelligence.
label: joyful
response: it is always amazing how quickly kids pick up on new skills.

situation: it broke my heart today when i went to the grocery store and found out that they were out of dean's french onion dip.
dialogue: it broke my heart today when i went to the grocery store and found out that they were out of dean's french onion dip.
you must really love that dip to have that much of a reaction to the loss of it.
i do!  i have loved that particular brand for years to me it is the best out there.  but i guess there is quite a few people out there besides me that have a real love for it!
label: disappointed
response: i would assume so, since there has to be someone out there who robbed you of your oniony gold!

situation: i am glad i stuck my job out as long as i did i finally got offered a promotion today.
dialogue: i am glad i stuck my job out as long as i did i finally got offered a promotion today.
congrats! is it a good promotion?
it is!  i will actually be the manager of the entire office, and not just the one section i was in!
label: faithful
response: wow that is super exciting. not many people get that opportunity. you must have worked hard

situation: i put in to get a promotion at work, and i should know something either way by tomorrow.
dialogue: i put in to get a promotion at work, and i should know something either way by tomorrow.
wow, that is really exciting! good for you, you must be nervous.
on the one hand, i am but on the other hand i have to relax knowing i did everything i could do and worked as hard as i could.  it is kinda out of my hands now.
label: anxious
response: that is great, what kind of work are you in?

situation: last week, they arrested 9 people for animal cruelty at a nearby farm and the place was littered with dead and sick and dying animals that they were not taking care of.
dialogue: last week, they arrested 9 people for animal cruelty at a nearby farm and the place was littered with dead and sick and dying animals that they were not taking care of.
that is horrible news!  i do not understand how people can be so cruel sometimes.
i have a hard enough time understanding man's inhumanity towards their fellow man, but towards animals who cannot do much to defend themselves?  i hope they put those people *under* the jail!
label: disgusted
response: i know in some places, the penalty for hurting an animal can be tougher than that for hurting your kids.  nothing makes sense sometimes.

situation: when the england national team made the semi-finals of the world cup.
dialogue: when the england national team made the semi-finals of the world cup
was that a good day for you?
so good, genuinely had my faith restored in the national team and everyone was having a good time larking about in good weather!
label: faithful
response: that is amazing! sounds like a beauty day! are you english?

situation: the kids went back to school today!
dialogue: but yeah school started for the kids today and it was weird how quiet it was once the bus pulled away.
oh, but i bet you appreciated it! summer can get long.

it can.  but we had fun!  visited lots of relatives, cooked lots of stuff, goofed off and watched more anime than is probably humanly possible.a part of me is enjoying the quiet but on the other hand, i miss having my kids around to do stuff with.
label: joyful
response: oh, that does sound like a fun summer. i read recently that we only get 18 summers with our kids- make them count.

situation: i had to clean beneath a desk which had not been cleaned in about three years, after there had been some flooding from a manufacturing unit. it was so gross!
dialogue: i had to clean beneath a desk which had not been cleaned in about three years, after there had been some flooding from a manufacturing unit. it was so gross!
oh no, i can imagine so! was it gunky?
yes indeed, there was even a frog under there! so bizarre!
label: apprehensive
response: oh goodness, glad you got through is safe

situation: they arrested 9 people at a nearby farm for animal cruelty and they are already out on bond!
dialogue: they arrested 9 people at a nearby farm for animal cruelty and they are already out of jail on bond!
oh, that is not right. i have a rescue dog, she had a litter of puppies at a puppy mill before she was a year.

wow!  it makes me sad how people can be so cruel to animals that do not have the ability to fight back.  the rescue shelters here have been working overtime to get things straightened out at that farm.
label: furious
response: i could chat with you all day! we have a lot in common- i feel the same way. keep chatting? poor rescue animals.

situation: my son's soccer coach said nice things about his play last year and told me he would do what he could to get him on his team this year as well.
dialogue: my son's soccer coach said nice things about his play last year and told me he would do what he could to get him on his team this year as well.
that sounds awesome, i am glad he did well.
i am, too!  i am glad he is doing something he loves.  at this point, i am just waiting on the text to see which team he made it onto.
label: impressed
response: i hope he gets the team he wants.

situation: i am so glad the kids went back to school today!
dialogue: i am so glad the kids went back to school today!
you must be relieved! you excited for free time?
yes!  i can go back to having ice cream for breakfast!  i can watch law and order all i want to without the, "mom, you always watch this!" comment!
label: grateful
response: that sounds seriously like a dream. i cannot wait until mine are old enough to start school.

situation: my two best friends are going on vacation next week and i will not have anyone else at work to goof off with.
dialogue: my two best friends are going on vacation next week and i will not have anyone else at work to goof off with.
awww that will be a boring week. sorry to hear that. maybe you will be productive!
on the one hand, i hope so but on the other hand, i will get bored because there is nothing to break up the day.  just straight.ugh!  xd
label: lonely
response: i hope it flies by!

situation: one of the neighbors has a white husky dog. i was walking one day and it approached me and started growling, i thought it was going to bite me.
dialogue: i went for a walk the other day and one of the neighbors dogs was loose, a bit white husky, he was aggressive.
was the owner not around? did the dog cause any harm?
he was growling at me and looked like he wanted to bite me, the neighbor finally came out and called him home. was intense.
label: afraid
response: sounds scary! dogs are very loyal creatures but can cause a lot of harm

situation: the little kitten i rescued last friday passed away.
dialogue: the little kitten i rescued last friday passed away.
that is very heartbreaking. how did you find the kitten?

she was under my house, crying.  her mother had apparently abandoned her.  i called my friend who said she was dehydrated and we did what we could, but her motor functions quit and she passed away in her sleep.
label: sad
response: very sad to hear. you have a good heart and are very caring, that is something to atleast be proud of!

situation: my 6 year old daughter could not understand how to use a gaming controller. after a few days she had figured it out on her own.
dialogue: my 6 year old tried to play a video game but could not understand how the controller worked. a few days later she was playing no problem!
kids pick those things up quickly.  and it will help with her hand-eye coordination, reading all sorts of things!
yea, i was pretty proud of her, especially since things are more complicated now than when i was a kid.
label: impressed
response: yeah.  back when the only buttons on a controller were start, select, a and b!

situation: i thought i had paid all my daughter's band fees only to find out that i am 10 dollars short.
dialogue: i thought i had paid all my daughter's band fees only to find out that i am 10 dollars short.
oh no! hopefully you are able to get it sorted out. it is hard to keep up with all the fees for kids schooling.
i keep all my receipts i learned that lesson her 9th grade year.  i just hate having to make the trip over to the high school because it is in the opposite direction of where i do everything else!
label: annoyed
response: sounds like a headache, i know the feeling. i got a letter saying i had a few days to purchase a purple shirt from my daughters school. good luck!

situation: when i was going through a divorce, money was tight, my mom stepped in and helped with attorney fees, was so helpful.
dialogue: i went through a divorce last year, which caught me off guard financially, luckily my mom was able to help with some of the costs.
that would be rough.  hopefully youre in a better spot now!  that is awesome you had family to help you out too!
yea i am much better now, thanks to my mom. attorneys make a killing on these types of things.
label: grateful
response: i bet they do! i mean they do go to school for a while and study hard, plus the schools are not cheap but they still do not have to charge as much as they do!

situation: when my wife left me a year ago i went a little stir crazy. it was so silent in the house, i had to get out and make new friends.
dialogue: when my wife left me it was so quiet in the house! it almost drove me crazy
i would love some quiet time to myself, consider yourself lucky!
hah, i hear ya. i just got so used to all the commotion i suppose.
label: lonely
response: i have a husband and three kids, its always loud in my house

situation: when i was a kid, my sister and i stole one of my moms checks from her checkbook and ordered a pizza. when she found out she was so mad! i felt terrible about it.
dialogue: when we were kids, my sister and i once stole a blank check from our mom to order a pizza, we got caught.
oh no! how did you guys get caught?
my mom noticed the charge and found a the missing check from her checkbook, i will never forget the look of dissapointment on her face!
label: guilty
response: i bet, did you both get in a lot of trouble?

situation: one time there was a movie i wanted to see that had really good reviews. i went to see it and it was not very good at all
dialogue: i just saw a movie i had been looking forward to and it was terrible
what movie was it?  is it currently in theaters?
it was the new jurassic world
label: disappointed
response: that is too bad! i was hoping that one was going to be good!

situation: my coworker forgot to turn in the paperwork to switch our on call weeks. he ended up costing me $250! i am so mad!!
dialogue: my coworker forgot to turn in the paperwork to switch our on call weeks. he ended up costing me $250! i am so mad!
oh my gosh! i would be furious as well.
he is such a worm. i cannot stand it.
label: furious
response: i am sorry that happened. do not do him any favors.

situation: i work from home, sometimes my daughter will bug me intentionally to get a rise out of me, it can be bothersome.
dialogue: working from home can be difficult when people will not leave me alone to get work done.
yeah, you need peace and quiet to be able to work.
i love my kid but she is non stop with trying to show me the latest my little pony video, gonna pull my hair out.
label: annoyed
response: my son keeps trying to show me youtube videos so i completely understand

situation: i have a big date coming up and i cannot get these butterfly feelings to go away.
dialogue: i have a big date coming up and i cannot get these butterfly feelings to go away.
that is normal that just means that the other person is special
yeah, i really think she might be the one. i hope i do not screw it up.
label: anxious
response: well i will keep my finger crossed for you!

situation: i bit into an apple and found a worm. it was so gross.
dialogue: i bit into an apple and found a worm. it was so gross.
yeah i can imagine but a little worm will not hurt ya
yeah, but not what i want to bite into when i am trying to enjoy my apple.
label: disgusted
response: i understand but atleast it was not poisonous

situation: i was hiking in the mountains and walked up on a female bear with her two cubs.
dialogue: i was hiking in the mountains and walked up on a female bear with her two cubs.
i live in bear country.
they really startled me, the female did not seem happy to see me.
label: terrified
response: i bet i would have been scared

situation: i got a new dog recently, he is the best. i am so thankful for him!
dialogue: i got a new dog recently, he is the best. i am so thankful for him!
awwww. that is so sweet! details. boy, girl, breed.
he is a male australian shepherd. his name is charlie, he is super cute!
label: joyful
response: awwwww. he sounds super cute! have lots of fun with him.

situation: there was one piece of pie left in the fridge. instead of sharing it, i ate it. i kind of feel bad.
dialogue: there was one piece of pie left in the fridge. instead of sharing it, i ate it. i kind of feel bad.
oopsy. i hope it was worth it.
it might not be when my wife returns and sees it gone. i look super guilty right now.
label: guilty
response: lol! can  you run out and get another pie before she gets home?

situation: i was at the park today and almost stepped on a rattle snake. i almost jumped out of my skin.
dialogue: i was at the park today and almost stepped on a rattle snake. i almost jumped out of my skin.
that sounds terrifying, so glad you did not step on it
me too, that would of wrecked my day. it was so close! it haunts my thoughts even now.
label: afraid
response: i can imagine i would have nightmares about that

situation: i just got a bonus from my job. that money came at the perfect time!
dialogue: i just got a bonus from my job. that money came at the perfect time!
congratulations. that is always a plus.
it was a really nice bonus too, they were impressed with the quality of work i have done this year.
label: grateful
response: good for you!

situation: i was going to go to the movies with a bunch of friends. but they all bailed on me and now i have to go alone.
dialogue: i was going to go to the movies with a bunch of friends. but they all bailed on me and now i have to go alone.
if the movie is worth it you will never miss them.
i hope so, but i am really missing them right now. i did not want to go alone.
label: lonely
response: i understand. its tough these days.

situation: i was out photographing butterflies and took the most incredible photo. i am really happy with how it turned out!
dialogue: i was out photographing butterflies and took the most incredible photo. i am really happy with how it turned out!
i love butterflies because of the colors. what color was the butterfly?
the butterfly was yellow. it was a tiger swallowtail. one of my favorites!
label: impressed
response: yellow butterflies are beautiful. photography can capture some great images a lot of times.

situation: one time i saw my dog try to eat my nephew's dirty diaper. it was really gross.
dialogue: i saw my dog try to eat a dirty diaper one time
oh, my dog did that, too! i do not know how they think it is a tasty morsel.so gross!
yeah, it is nasty. i would not let her lick my face for a while after that.
label: disgusted
response: i was just going to say the same thing! i am like "stay away!"

situation: i was trying to take a nap, but my cat kept on trying to play with my head.
dialogue: i was trying to take a nap, but my cat kept on trying to play with my head.
i love cats.
i usually love mine, but not when it is keeping me from sleeping
label: annoyed
response: i agree absolutely

situation: one time i had been to a job interview. i was told that i would hear back in a week. i could not wait to find out if i got the job
dialogue: i just had a job interview and i am waiting to hear if i got the job.
congratulations. i hope you get it?
me too. i am feeling pretty nervous about it
label: anxious
response: just relax. if its meant to be it will be.

situation: one time i was on a plane and we got very strong turbulence.  the plane became very bumpy and i was afraid we would crash
dialogue: i was on a plane ride and we went through some pretty severe turbulence
that must have been scary.
yes it was. i was so afraid we'd crash
label: terrified
response: i bet

situation: one time i tricked my butler into thinking he had won millions of dollars in the lottery. he quit his job and insulted my family before discovering that my cousin and i had tricked him. now he is homeless
dialogue: my cousin and i tricked my butler into thinking he won millions in the lottery. i feel so bad.
how long did he think he had won?
only a few minutes.
label: guilty
response: that was funny i bet.

situation: one time someone came to my door with a gun. he robbed my house
dialogue: someone came to my door with a gun, asking for money
oh wow, did you give him the money?
i did not have any. he came into the house and stole some stuff
label: afraid
response: that would be so scary, i am glad you are safe!

situation: our cat had to many health problems, so we had to put him down.
dialogue: our cat had to many health problems, so we had to put him down.
i am so sorry to hear that. how long had your cat been with you?
i had him for 17 years, he lived a full and happy life, but i was not ready for him to go.
label: sad
response: it is always hard to go through that. that is why i am wary of having any pets

situation: i went to a karaoke bar with a guy i was dating and he sang really well. i did not know he had such talent
dialogue: i went to do karaoke with a guy i am dating and i discovered he is a really talented singer
does he like to sing?
he is kind of shy about it. he had to get really drunk to perform karaoke
label: impressed
response: i bet he sings in the shower everyday.

situation: one time i had to give a presentation in order to get my master's degree. it was very stressful but i passed and was able to graduate
dialogue: i had to do a research project and present it to my professors to graduate. thankfully i passed!
you must have worked hard for that! i am sure it is great and you will pass with a flying color!
i worked many long hours. it was stressful but i am happy to have done well
label: joyful
response: yeah, such a relief to get a huge project done. you must feel proud!

situation: one time my sister kept playing a song i hated over and over again. i could not get it out of my head for a week
dialogue: my sister has been playing a song i dislike over and over and over
that must be really irritating. is she doing it deliberately?
she does it more because she likes it than to bug me. it is going to be stuck in my head for weeks
label: annoyed
response: haha maybe you will learn to love it! there must be something good about it, if your sister has any taste.

situation: one time i got to spend two weeks in france. it was my first time visiting another country.
dialogue: okay.
i have never been abroad before, but i am going to spend two weeks in france next month!
that is great! what will you be doing there?
label: excited
response: i am going to visit a few cities and tourist attractions.

situation: one time i was playing basketball and i accidentally slapped a girl in the face. i felt so bad about it.
dialogue: i accidentally slapped someone in the face while i was playing basketball.
oh no, did they get angry?
no, i think she was just a little shocked by it. i felt so bad.
label: ashamed
response: okay, i am glad that they were not angry. and i am sure they knew it was unintentional so do not feel too guilty about it.

situation: one time an international student i was friends with wanted to practice driving with my car. i let him borrow  my car because i believed he would not get in any accidents
dialogue: i let my friend borrow my car. he is an international student and only has a permit.
wow you are very trusting, i do not think i would allow a friend to borrow my car. is it legal for him to drive with just a permit?
i was in the car with him. he just wanted to practice driving and he did not have his own car.
label: trusting
response: oh okay i see, i thought you actually lent him your car and let him drive around town with it by himself!

situation: i walk out on belief that i will be lead down the right path. i read the bible and i know the answer will come.
dialogue: i am at a cross road. i am trying to decide my major in college.
that is a big decision! what are your choices?
i was thinking about graphic design. or, i was going to do something practical like nursing.
label: trusting
response: if you want my advice choose something you are going to enjoy. i personally could not be a nurse too messy!

situation: i have been trying to save money so that i can help my husband pay for christmas gifts for our daughters. at first, i was not very successful because i was not making very much, but things have picked up recently and i feel like i will really be able to help when its time to shop for christmas gifts.
dialogue: i have been trying to save money so that i can help my husband with the christmas shopping this year.
i hoep you reach your goal. it must be tiring.
well at first i was a little discouraged because i was not making that much. things have picked up recently though, and i feel i will be able to help him a good bit so i am feeling better about it.
label: hopeful
response: do not give up. things may not be great one day but they always pick up eventually.

situation: i had planned to take my daughters shopping a couple of weeks ago. we were all very excited about it, but the plans fell through. i was able to take them shopping later so that made me feel a little better.
dialogue: i had planned to take my daughter shopping a few weeks ago. we were all really excited, but the plans fell through.
that stinks were you guys going school clothes shopping?
yes. we were able to go about a week later, but the closer it got to school starting back i started to stress. everything is good now though.
label: disappointed
response: that is good, school shopping is always stressful for me

situation: i believe in a marriage that you are equal. in order to be equal you have to be honest and respectful to each other.
dialogue: i check in with my partner to see if we are okay. i ask him if there is anything that we can work on to make the relationship better.
okey no problem
i do not want to have problems. this is why i check in with him.
label: faithful
response: for mine too. that was also i said.

situation: i am ashamed when i do not have enough money. when i go out with friend i have to order the cheapest thing on the menu because i am counting pennies.
dialogue: when i go out with friends i really have to be tight with my money. times are really hard for me financially?
i understand completely. one has to live within one's budget. it can be hard though.
i like go out but i have to really make sure that i do not spend too much. i sometimes like to leave a tip if possible.
label: ashamed
response: it is only normal to want to live within one's means. too bad you cannot leave a tip every time.

situation: i find it appalling how my husband's family is acting now that his grandfather has passed away. there are all being so childish and selfish. my husband and i really do not understand why they are acting this way.
dialogue: i find it appalling how my husband's family is acting now that his grandfather has passed away.
wow ! that is quite unfortunate!
yes, it is. they are all being really selfish and childish. my husband is staying out of it, but i can tell that he is getting fed up with it.
label: disgusted
response: well handle it wisely

situation: i feeling kind of anxious today because i have to run several errands for my father-in-law and he wants them done before my mother-in-law gets back into town which will be sometime today. we do not know what time, so that just complicates things.
dialogue: i have to run several errands for my father-in-law today and he wants them done before my mother-in-law get into town, which is at some unspecified time today.
it sounds like a stressful day. you have to just live in the present so, you will not be too stress out.
yeah, i am ready to get everything done so i can relax. i cannot start on the errands until i drop the kids at school though.
label: anxious
response: when that is over then you can do you. we have to make time for ourselves.

situation: i think about my mother and i getting really sad. she has been dead for 15 years now.
dialogue: i really do miss my mother. she has been dead for about 15 years now.
i am very sorry for your loss. thinking about and remember all of your good memories with her may help.
it is a blessing and curse. when i am having problems i think about what she would say to me.
label: sentimental
response: that is a good way to remember her and keep her close to your heart.

situation: i feel protective of my children. i love them more than anything in this world.
dialogue: my children are getting old. they are starting to spread the wings. so, i would have to let go and let them fly.
that cannot be easy. how old are your children? sometimes i wish we could keep our kids small forever!
i have 23, 20, 17 and 14. they are doing stuff that i question but i do not want them to not tell me stuff.
label: caring
response: yeah you want them to learn, but it is definitely hard to see them doing things that you might not agree with.

situation: when i went into labor with my youngest child, while i was at the hospital, the baby's heartbeat dropped and they told me that had to take me for an emergency c-section. it was one of the scariest days of my life. she is a happy and healthy three year old now.
dialogue: when i was in labor with my third child, they were monitoring me regularly in the hospital. the nurse came in and made a face and then called the doctor. in the 2 minutes it took for him to get to my room, my heart dropped and i started to panic. he told me that the baby's heart rate had dropped and they had to preform an emergency c-section right then.
wow that is really scary! labor is a really terrifying thing, especially when something like that happens. did everything turn out okay?
yes, everything turned out fine. she is a healthy and happy three year old. it was the scariest day of my life though.
label: terrified
response: i can imagine. when i was in the hospital with my 3 year old they lost all his vitals as well. kids like to keep us on our toes from the start!

situation: i beat level 150 on my favorite game grim dawn this morning. i have been grinding levels all week!
dialogue: i finally beat level 150 on the crucible today in my favorite game grim dawn.
what platform do you play it on? pc or ps4?
pc all the way. i have been grinding devotion points all week.
label: proud
response: pc is the way to go for gaming. that sounds like an awesome type of game. is it multiplayer?

situation: i was cleaning my daughters room the other day and found a hello kitty pot filled with water and old flowers that had turned into a green mold soup. we had a talk about keeping things like this in the house.
dialogue: i just found a hello kitty pot in my daughters room filled with water and old flowers.
that is so cute. how old is she?
it is not cute, and she is nine. by old flowers i mean, it is a green, stagnant slush with mold growing on top.
label: disgusted
response: oh mine. that is not cute.

situation: i fainted on the bus. all of the passages looked at me with disdain.
dialogue: when i enter the bus, i fainted. i think that i got overheated.
that is no good. did you go to the doctor?
yes i did. it was so hot outside and i did not have much to drink.
label: embarrassed
response: got to make sure you take care of your self. it is scary when your heat sensitive.

situation: i got drunk and embarrassed myself in front of my friends.
dialogue: i got drunk and embarrassed myself in front of my friends
it will be okay. we sometimes do things that we regret.
i fell down, and apparently said some embarrassing things.
label: ashamed
response: you have to forgive ourselves. we do not need others validation.

situation: i cannot wait until my daughter graduate. she has worked hard. i know that she will be so happy.
dialogue: my daughter is graduating from college. i cannot wait until she finish.
will you be able to spend more time with her?
yes, i will. she has been under a lot of stress.
label: anticipating
response: i can imagine, but it is good that her hard work is about to pay off.

situation: a couple years ago i suddenly went blind in my right eye. two days and several test later, i found out i had ms.
dialogue: two years ago i got diagnosed with ms.
what'd ms?
its a disease that attacks the nervous system. it was really scary to find out i had it. i just went blind in my right eye one day. two days and several test later i found out i had ms.
label: surprised
response: well ,i pray you get through it

situation: my daughter does not share things with me. i found out that she was moving out from my other daughter
dialogue: i found out that my daughter is moving out. my youngest one told me so.
how do you feel about that ?
i feel really sad because i felt she should have told me.
label: jealous
response: hopefully she re considers you should talk to her about it

situation: i let my sister borrow my car. i was confident in her driving ability even though she is an inexperienced driver.
dialogue: i let my sister borrow my car. she is a new driver.
that is risky, what do you plan to do
well, nothing. i am sure that she will be a responsible driver.
label: trusting
response: okey if she is no cause for alarm

situation: i feel that i can make an a in my graphic design class. i have been keeping up.
dialogue: i think that i will do good on my test.
good. you sound confident. when is it?
it is tonight. i studied really hard.
label: confident
response: i am sure you will do great then!

situation: i heard a song that i hadn't heard in awhile. it reminded me of my high school days.
dialogue: i heard a song that i hadn't heard in awhile. it reminded me of my high school days
oh how sweet, high school days is always fun
yes, it had me feeling nostalgic about the times when i was young.
label: sentimental
response: yes it does happen

situation: my father passed away when i was 33 years old.
dialogue: my dad dies when i was 33 years old.
am sorry to hear that, may he rest in peace
thank you. i was crushed, and it left me with questions about my own mortality.
label: devastated
response: i hope you getting better now

situation: my mother fell and injured herself. i wanted help and comfort her in any way possible.
dialogue: my mother fell and injured herself. i wanted help and comfort her in any way possible.
oh no! i am sorry. is she going to be ok?
yes, but bhe bruised her wrist, and had a concussion. i wish that i was there for her when it happened.
label: caring
response: oh man. do not feel guilty accidents happen. hopefully she recovers quickly.

situation: i had a nice meal and my favorite beverage after work.
dialogue: i had a nice meal and my favorite beverage after work
that is great what is your favorite meal?
it was a skirt steak with avocados. i was very satisfied.
label: content
response: that sounds so good i love steaks

situation: i started a new job. i was worried about proving myself all over again.
dialogue: when i started a new job. i was nervous about proving myself all over again.
it can been nerve-wracking to start a new job. but i am sure you did well, right?
i did, but i find it hard to trust people. especially at work.
label: apprehensive
response: it is wise to be careful but suspecting people all the time may not be healthy. you need to build a good relationship with your new co-workers.

situation: i am trying to stop drinking soda and i have prayed and asked god to help me with this. the problem is that i am addicted to soda so i am finding it hard to quit. this causes feelings of guilt.
dialogue: i am trying to quit drinking soda and i have prayed to god and asked him to help me. the problem is i am addicted to soda and its very hard to quit. when i do manage to skip a day, the lack of caffeine causes horrible headaches.
i know exactly how you feel. i have a crazy addiction to soda.  i do not think i can quit!
it just makes me feel bad, that no matter how many times i try, i still give in to the temptation.
label: guilty
response: maybe try to slowly quit? like just drink one less a day

situation: i went on a job interview. i am waiting to hear if i got the job.
dialogue: i went on a job interview. i am anxiously waiting to hear if i got the job.
when will you find out?
i still need wait another week.
label: anticipating
response: oh the wait is terrible.  what type of job?

situation: i just found a bunch of random toys in the catch of the sink of my kids bathroom. there going to have some explaining to do when they get home.
dialogue: i just went to clean my kids sink a few minutes ago. i found a bunch of toys in the catch and i am mad.
oh no! that is not good! hopefully you were able to get them out.
yeah, all the toys are out. but, they got some explaining to do after school.
label: angry
response: lol! i am sure. do not be too rough on them.

situation: the other day i ate a large amount of shepard's pie. it was at night right before i went to bed.
dialogue: i could not sleep last night. i ended up staying up till 2am and eating a large amount of shepard's pie.
why could not you sleep?
combination of stress and new meds i think. maybe i can get back to my old scheduled soon.
label: ashamed
response: i hope so! why are you stressed?

situation: i saw my crush talking to someone else.
dialogue: i saw my crush talking to another guy.
oh, that sounds uncomfortable. how did you play it?
i was a little upset, but it was not my business. i let it go.
label: jealous
response: i respect that, i think it shows character and honor. i am hoping something rewarding comes your way.

situation: the other day i seen a guy tweaked out on drugs at the grocery store. he seemed a little unpredictable, so i used the other door to enter the store.
dialogue: when i went to the store the other day, i seen a guy all tweaked out on drugs.
oh geez, that is not good.  was he bothering anyone?
no, but he seemed a little unpredictable, so i used the other door.
label: apprehensive
response: i do not blame you.  i probably would have done the same thing.

situation: holding each of my children for the first time was amazing. i cannot think of anything else that produces the type of feelings that it produces.
dialogue: holding each of my children for the first time was amazing.
i remember that feeling with my daughter, it is indescribable.
yes! i cannot think of any thing else that produces feelings like that.
label: joyful
response: there is nothing to compare it to. i wish i hadn't been waking from anesthesia in that moment so i could have been more awake.

situation: a couple years ago i forgot my grandmother's birthday. i felt so bad about it.
dialogue: i forgot about my grandmother's birthday a couple years back. i felt so bad about it!
oh no! it happens to the best of us have you talked to her about it when you remembered?
absolutely! i called her the next day and made sure to visit her.
label: ashamed
response: awww i am sure she completely understood and really appreciated you reaching out and going to visit her!

situation: i found my old paintball gun at my dads house a while ago. it brought back such fond memories, that i decided to go play!
dialogue: i was digging around in some of my old stuff at my dads the other day, and i found all my old paintball gear.
oh, how cool! dd you and your dad play together?
no, just me. but, i am going to go play this weekend at a place up the road. it is been years since i have played.
label: sentimental
response: that is great. it will be wonderful to relive those happy moments in the present maybe with your family.

situation: last summer i went skydiving with my partner. i was scared to death!
dialogue: i went skydiving last summer with my partner. it was so scary!
wow, that is scary. were you nervous?
absolutely! i have always been scared of heights, but i am so glad i made myself.
label: apprehensive
response: it sounds like a great experience!

situation: when i was a kid, my granpa bought me a dog. the dog was supposed to be a hunting dog, and he did not want to keep it because i had made it into a pet. he ended up giving it away.
dialogue: when i was a kid, i had a dog at my grandpa's. he gave it away because it would not hunt.
how did you feel when he gave it away?
i was very upset. i was only like nine at the time so i took it really hard.
label: devastated
response: yeah i would have been too. as a nine year old kid that is hard to deal with.

situation: i tripped and fell in front of some people.
dialogue: i tripped and fell in front of some people.
ouch! was it a serious fall?
no, only my pride was injured.
label: embarrassed
response: that is a relatively quick recovery, fortunately.

situation: i found an old necklace my grandmother gave me for a birthday when i was very young recently. it brought back a lot of memories!
dialogue: i recently dug up a necklace my grandmother gave me when i was young for a birthday. i hadn't seen it in years.
oh my. that must have been very sad. i cannot even imagine how you must have felt.
yeah, she passed more than five years ago and i had forgotten all about it. it brought back so many memories though!
label: sentimental
response: i am so sorry.! but i am really glad you've got those pleasant memories and the memento to hold on to so you can remember her fondly.

situation: i just won an award for best yard in the neighborhood!
dialogue: i just won an award for best yard in the neighborhood!
wow that is great, you must have put a lot of work into your yard.
i did, mowed it three times a week and watered it twice a day. all the hard work really paid off.
label: proud
response: cool, i guess the grass is actually greener in your yard now!

situation: i get to go to the park today for a bbq with friends, it should be so much fun!
dialogue: i get to go to the park today for a bbq with friends, it should be so much fun!
ooh nice. that does sound like alot of fun. do you guys play any sport while your there?
we often throw around a frisbee for a little bit, but we never get too intense with any sports.
label: excited
response: cool. well enjoy, i hope the weather hold up.

situation: i snuck some candy out of my daughter's snack stash.
dialogue: i snuck some candy out of my daughter's snack stash. i feel bad because i had been trying to diet.
i understand that feeling. i have had trouble letting go of those kind of cravings too. has your diet been going well otherwise?
otherwise it is been pretty good- i have managed to lose 12 pounds! just wish i could let the sugar cravings go.
label: guilty
response: wow, congratulations! sugar is one of the hardest things to kick, i do not have the knack for it either, but still you are making great progress!

situation: not too long ago, i lost a watch one of my closest friends gave me for my birthday years ago. i was devastated!
dialogue: my childhood friend gave me a watch for by birthday a few years ago, i lost it in a move recently. i am pretty upset by it.
oh no!  it always seems like things get lost when you move does not it?  is there anyway you can go back and see if its at your old place?
i have actually checked and went through all the boxes too. here's hoping it turns up one day though!
label: devastated
response: it will probably be where you least expect it!

situation: i let my daughter ride her skateboard in the road by her self the other day. i was still close by watching, but i think she is pretty good at looking out for cars on her own.
dialogue: i let my daughter ride in the road by herself on her skateboard the other day.
oh wow.  how did she do?
she did great. she is pretty good about looking out for cars.
label: trusting
response: that is awesome!  that is great exercise!

situation: i was upset that my daughter total the car in the accident. she said that she was not responsible for the accident.
dialogue: it is so upsetting that my daughter was in a car accident. i am thankful that she was fine but we lost our car because of someone's bad judgment.
oh, no! that is so terrible!
it was. they wanted to blame my daughter but it was their fault.
label: furious
response: i am so sorry that happened! i am glad she is okay, though.

situation: my sister surprised me with a visit the other week! she knew i was feeling down and drove hours to spend time with me.
dialogue: i was feeling really down for a few weeks and my sister knew. she drove hours to come see me and make me feel better!
that is a great sister. i am sorry you were feeling down
yeah it was really sweet of her and made me feel so much better!
label: caring
response: i am glad you are feeling better now

situation: went on a long international flight and we experienced the worst turbulence i had ever been through.
dialogue: i was recently on a long international flight and we hit some really bad turbulence.
that must've been scary! did you freak out?
i did not, but i was really nervous for a little while. my wife did not handle it quite as well.
label: terrified
response: oh no. i am sorry to hear that. at least you both survived the flight.

situation: i screwed up plans for a date night with my wife. we ended up having to cancel and she was really mad about it.
dialogue: i screwed up plans for a date night with my wife. we ended up having to cancel and she was really mad about it.
oh i bet you were pretty upset. did you guys reschedule?
we did and i made sure to not screw that one up!
label: guilty
response: haha good! i am glad that one went well.

situation: i was able to go back home for a few weeks recently. it was wonderful i have not felt that relaxed in a long time.
dialogue: i was able to go back home to my parents for a few weeks recently. it was wonderful to relax in my childhood home.
it is always nice to visit home. did your parents enjoy your visit?
they loved having me around again! our ten year old dog would not leave my side.
label: content
response: ha ha! i bet. dogs are the best. i bet he missed you just as much as they did.

situation: i was thinking about buying new wheels for my skateboard the other day. i think i will just keep the ones i have for now though.
dialogue: i have been thinking about buying some new, softer skateboard wheels.
what makes you want to get softer wheels? are those harder to skateboard on?
no, they make rough pavement feel smoother. i think i will just keep the ones i have for now though. just have to deal with having a rough ride.
label: content
response: i did not know that about softer wheels! maybe in the future you can change to those.

situation: i took my dog to meet my husband's sisters. it did not go well!
dialogue: i took my dog i have had for years over to meet one of my husband's sisters the other night.
oh neat!  how did the little one handle it?
it did not go well at all! she pooped all over the carpet and she never has accidents at home.
label: embarrassed
response: oh no!  poor baby must have been really stressed out.

situation: i had to take my daughter to the doctor the other day. she was very sick. turns out she had the flu.
dialogue: i had to take my daughter to the doctor the other day. she was very sick.
oh no!  hopefully its just the flu.  what did they say?
it was just the flu. i got her some medicine, brought her home, and made tomato soup and grilled cheese sandwiches.
label: caring
response: that is good!  i hope she gets to feeling better soon.  the flu is no fun.

situation: so my sister is getting married in a few months. my whole family is so excited!
dialogue: so my sister is getting married in a few weeks.
congratulations! i bet she is excited and hopefully you are excited for her.
absolutely! the whole family is flying out, we can barely contain ourselves.
label: anticipating
response: oooo!! that is so awesome! will you be in her wedding party?

situation: my friend adopted a new kitten.
dialogue: so my friend adopted a new kitten very recently.
i love kitten, but i cannot have one where i live. i bet it is so cute
oh, she is absolutely adorable! i am so envious, i have not been able to adopt one yet.
label: jealous
response: do you plan on getting one

situation: we recently had some really bad storms. i really thought it was going to hail on my brand new car,
dialogue: bought a new car a few months back. couple nights ago we had a big storm roll through. i thought for sure it was going to hail all over my new car.

oh man. i hate that. we have had some pretty nasty storms come through austin in the last few months and luckily i have managed to be in some random parking garage out shopping or eating when they've rolled through.
nice! we have a garage, but my wife takes up what little room is not filled with junk with her car. mine would not fit anyway unless i cleared it out.
label: afraid
response: lol. well that is no good. cleaning garages bites.

situation: i work with a programming wizard. i recently asked for his help with a hard problem and i just sat back and watched him work. i did not even understand what he was talking about.
dialogue: i do programming work and i recently had a question i had to run by a co-worker. he is a programming wizard. he easily handled my issue and was using terms and methods i had never even heard of.
i guess in your field of work you would run across terms and methods which are unfamiliar
that is true. i usually can keep up, but this guy is on another level.
label: impressed
response: you will find some like that, not much you can do

situation: i had a meeting with my bosses a few days ago to talk about a promotion.
dialogue: i had a meeting with my bosses the other day to discuss finally getting a promotion.
how long did it take you to get your promotion?
i have been working there for a couple years now. i am feeling pretty good about my chances! have not heard back yet.
label: confident
response: i bet that your bosses will give you the long over promotion. i will keep my fingers crossed for you. good luck!

situation: i feel so good about knowing i am going to win the race on sunday. the race is for my favorite charity. when i win the race i get to give my winnings to my charity of choice.
dialogue: i feel so good about knowing i am going to win the race on sunday. the race is for my favorite charity. when i win the race i get to give my winnings to my charity of choice.
that is wonderful! do you have a charity in mind yet?
yes, it is my local animal shelter. they will be there to cheer me on!
label: confident
response: i bet it will feel amazing to have them cheering you on! i have a feeling you will do great in your race.

situation: i got to take my wife on a trip she has been wanting to take for over a decade on her 30th birthday. she was really happy and it made me really happy in turn.
dialogue: my wife has had a trip in mind ever since i have known her. she recently had a big birthday so i surprised her with the trip. we went and she loved it. it made me happy to see her so happy.
that is wonderful! where are you guys going to go?
it was just a trip to the west coast. there was a handful of things she is always wanted to see/do. so we did all of them.
label: joyful
response: i am glad you guys had a good time. are you planning another trip?

situation: i really get emotional when i go visit my hometown. i go maybe once a year and i feel so thrill.
dialogue: i live in florida. when i go home once a year it is a grand occasion.
where is it that you go to go home?
i grew up in alabama. it is not far from florida but still i get so thrill when i can go back to see family and friends.
label: nostalgic
response: that is awesome. i love going back to my hometown to visit as well. it is nice to see family you do not see every day.

situation: it was my sons first day of school the other day. i was really nervous till he got off the bus.
dialogue: my sons first day of school was the other day.
wow. like, very first? or just the start of the year?
very first. i was so nervous till he got off the bus.
label: anticipating
response: how did he like it? how did you do?

situation: i have a test coming up that i have been studying for non stop.
dialogue: i have a test coming up that i have been studying for weeks for.
oh boy!   what is the test over?
it is a japanese language test for college. i feel pretty good about it though, been going over and over it every night.
label: prepared
response: japanese language seems like it would be heard to learn.  good luck on your test,  i am sure you will do fine.

situation: i had phone interview for a job. it went very well.
dialogue: i had phone interview for a job. it went very well
great, i hope you get the job.
thank you. i wrote down a list of questions and key points beforehand.
label: prepared
response: so you were really prepared.

situation: i saw an old movie. it reminded me of the days of my youth.
dialogue: i saw an old movie. it reminded me of my younger days.
that is cool, good movies have a way of tapping into those feelings.
yes. it is almost like a time machine. fond memories.
label: nostalgic
response: sometimes it almost makes me want to go back somehow. but it is also important to move forward.

situation: i lost my job because my company did not pay rent at our location.
dialogue: i lost my job because my company did not pay rent at our location.
oh that is so wrong. how are you handling it?
not very well. it makes me so angry. so i go work out to relieve the stress.
label: furious
response: that is good you do that, i would be very frustrated too. that is really unfair. can you pursue legal charges?

situation: my wife went out of town for a girls weekend and i sat at home with the dog for 3 days by myself.
dialogue: recently my wife left me home alone with the dog all weekend while she was gone on a girls trip.
oh i bet that was fun. what kind of dog do you have?
i missed her while she was gone. we have a mixed breed rescue pup.
label: lonely
response: my husband was gone all weekend buying us a new puppy, so i understand feeling lonely!

situation: there are problems with our system at work and no one will take responsibility or fix it.
dialogue: our computer system at work is goofing up a lot, but the development team just keeps saying there is nothing wrong.
ugh, i bet that is really frustrating. is it making it difficult to do your job?
sometimes. it does not stop me from doing things, just slows me down and takes longer than it should to do the things i need to do.
label: annoyed
response: that makes for long days at work. i hope they can fix it for you soon.

situation: every time my kids go to grandma's they get to eat candy and get a new toy. some times i wish i was a kid again.
dialogue: every time my kids go to grandma's they get to eat all kinds of candies, and get new toys.
omg, i bet they come home so spoiled.
yeah they do! some times i wish i got to go visit grandma's like they do.
label: jealous
response: yeah, what the heck i do not remember my mom being so nice when i was a kid!

situation: shortly after my nephew was born, i received a call from my sister informing me that he had a genetic disease.
dialogue: i was really happy when my nephew was born, sadly i was informed he had cystic fibrosis, a genetic disease.
that is sad to hear. what is his prognosis?
he is doing about as well as he can be. very healthy, but without some new discoveries he will likely have a shortened lifespan.
label: sad
response: hopefully medical technology will catch up to where it needs to be for him.

situation: i bought some cheap stocks hoping that they would go up in price. they did not.
dialogue: i bought some cheap stocks hoping that they would go up in price. they did not.
oh no! i used to be a financial advisor so i am sure that was frustrating. i hope you did not lose too much money!
not too much. i only put in what i could afford to lose.
label: disappointed
response: as much as i hate they did not go up in price for you, i am so happy that you did not overdo it.

situation: i came home yesterday and my dog had pooped all over the floor. he hasn't done that in ages.
dialogue: i came home yesterday and my dog had pooped all over the floor. he hasn't done that in ages.
oh yuck! i am sorry that that happened. what kind of dog is he? is he sick?
thanks. i do not think so. he has seemed fine otherwise. i have watched him on our security cam today and he seems fine. he is a mutt from a local shelter.
label: angry
response: hopefully it was just a bad day for him and he will not do it again! i have a couple rescue mutts as well.

situation: i have been trying to learn a new programming language and was able to, somewhat easily, knock out the first task i received at work.
dialogue: i work for a software company. i have been trying to learn a new language for some stuff. i knocked out my first task like a champ.
that is great! do you get a chance to learn new languages often?
well i have the opportunity, but rarely have the time to really devote to it.
label: proud
response: my ex programs for insurance companies and they all use the same, ancient language for their statistics. she hasn't had to learn anything new for decades.

situation: the other day i landed my first ollie on a skateboard in 14 years. it felt great.
dialogue: i landed an ollie on my skateboard for the first time in 14 years yesterday.
holy moly that is great i cannot ever walk normal
yeah it took a lot of practice.
label: confident
response: oh i bet

situation: i am heading to the beach next week for a much needed vacation.
dialogue: next week i am off work and going to the beach.
that is wonderful! so you will be on a vacation? will you be going alone?
no i am going with my wife and her family. but we all get along great so it should be fun.
label: excited
response: you will be having fun in the sun. nothing like a day at beach.

situation: an airline once lost my whole suitcase, it made me so upset!
dialogue: not too long ago, i took a trip on a plane. the airline lost my whole suitcase!
oh man! how long did it take to get your stuff back?
the whole vacation! i was so upset! i did not have anything to wear for the duration.
label: furious
response: oh wow, that can sure put a damper on things.

situation: my wife got me an apple watch for my birthday.
dialogue: we usually do not do anything big for birthdays but my wife got me an apple watch this year.
oh wow that is fancy
yeah i really did not see it coming at all.
label: surprised
response: i bet a shocker indeed i like apples

situation: i recently sat down and had a personal conversation with my boss about some stuff.
dialogue: my boss and i went to lunch and had a personal conversation about some life issues.
nice! what did you guys get to eat?
we just went to a local taco place. it was a good conversation.
label: trusting
response: that is good that it was a profitable  conversation! do you guys talk often?

situation: i recently got an unsolicited raise at work.
dialogue: i came back from a trip recently, got called in the boss's office and was given a decent sized raise.
ooh, very nice suprize!
absolutely. i certainly will not say no to that.
label: grateful
response: keep up the good work, whatever your doing.

situation: my wife's car is getting really old and i am afraid it is going to die soon.
dialogue: budget is kind of tight lately and i am really afraid my wife's aging car is about to bite the dust.
oh dear. i am so sorry to hear. it is possible for you to get a second job?
i may have to if that happens. we are making it now, but if the car goes it will be pretty tough.
label: apprehensive
response: i can just imagine. i wish there was something that i could do to help.

situation: i went through some boxes and found some of my childhood dolls.
dialogue: so i recently went through some old boxes and found some of my childhood dolls. it brought back a lot of memories!
that is always a fun thing to do! i hope the memories were all good!
absolutely! i remember having so much fun with them dressing them up. my sister and i would play for hours.
label: nostalgic
response: that is awesome! did you show them to your sister after you found them?

situation: my daughter was running through the house like usual the other day. she tripped on my laptop cord and pulled it off the table and the screen cracked. i was upset.
dialogue: so, i may be in the market for a new laptop or a repair at least, thanks to a little mishap.
oh no! what happened to your laptop? if you get a new one which one are you looking at?
my daughter tripped on the cord and it smashed on the ground, not sure if it can be saved. i was pretty angry.
label: angry
response: ouch, what a pain that is! i can imagine, i would be the exact same in that situation.

situation: i woke up the other morning, got ready and drove all the way to work. just to find out it was a holiday and we had the day off.
dialogue: i woke up the other morning, got ready and drove all the way to work. just to find out it was a holiday and we had the day off.
oh man that sucks. i am so sorry because you could have slept in
i know, but the extra day of work was nice. especially since i was not expecting it.
label: surprised
response: see there is always a bright side. you got a surprise day off from work!

situation: i am starting a new job tomorrow. i am feeling really nervous, but optimistic.
dialogue: my new job is starting tomorrow. i am feeling nervous, but really optimistic about it.
hey that is cool it is a new opportunity, what are you gonna do?
it is a job they opened up for graphic design! i am super excited to get started and learn more from them.
label: hopeful
response: hey that is really good i am proud of you!!

situation: going to my son's first pee-wee football game tomorrow!
dialogue: going to my son's first pee-wee football game tomorrow!
that sounds like fun! my son does basketball. i bet he looks tough in his helmet and football gear.
he thinks he does.  all i can think of is a bunch of tiny titans in helmets running around like chicks in a barnyard.  *chuckle*
label: excited
response: ha! they'

situation: i put in a job application for a new job. i am fairly certain that my credentials are enough to get me the job.
dialogue: i put in a job application for a new job. i am fairly certain that my credentials are enough to get me the job.
that is awesome!  have you been scheduled for an interview yet?
i was, i go in next tuesday. i am pretty excited for them to give me the job.
label: faithful
response: i would be too!  i hope everything goes well with it!

situation: i got a call about job with a good company that is in my line of work.
dialogue: i got a call about job with a good company that is in my line of work.
that is excellent! is it a done deal yet?
no, but i have the necessary experience, and i am optimistic that it will work out.
label: hopeful
response: cool! good luck and think positive.

situation: i went to the petstore with my dog and he had an accident in front of everyone. he had the saddest look on his face.
dialogue: i went to the petstore with my dog and he had an accident in front of everyone. he had the saddest look on his face.
oh no. poor baby must've been embarrassed. did he cheer up?
he did, the clerk walked over, told him it was ok and gave him a treat.
label: ashamed
response: that was really sweet of them. glad he got a treat to cheer him up.

situation: i had a video job interview.
dialogue: i had a video job interview. that was a new experience.
i have done one of those before. they are pretty cool. do you think you will get the job?
i am not sure. it was a little awkward and stressful.
label: anxious
response: i am sorry to hear that. i will pray for you if that is okay and  then maybe you will get it, but if not, maybe something even better will come along.

situation: i have been diagnosed with psoriatic arthritis and the pain is horrible. the problem is, the medicine that my doctor wants me to take has side effects that are worse than the pain, so i do not want to take them. that means i have to suffer through the pain.
dialogue: i have been diagnosed with psoriatic arthritis and the pain is horrible. the problem is that the medicine that my doctor wants me to take has side effects worse that the pain.
sorry to hear that. there are no alternatives?
maybe, i have not been back because i cannot afford to go right now. i have just been dealing with the pain.
label: afraid
response: i can relate. i do not have healthcare at the moment.

situation: my son got picked to be on the soccer team that he was on last year!
dialogue: my son got picked to be on the soccer team that he was on last year!
yay! that is great news! he must be so happy he made it!
he is!  especially since last year's team won the opening day tournament and then won the regular season title!
label: surprised
response: wow! what a great team to be on!

situation: the other day, my three year old did not think that i was listening to her while she was playing. i overheard her trying to teach our dog how to count to ten. i thought that was pretty cool for a three year old.
dialogue: the other day, my three year old did not know i was paying attention to her while she was playing with the dog. i overheard her trying to teach the dog how to count to ten.
that is amazing. she is a very smart girl.
yes, i thought that was pretty good for a three year old. when i asked her about it she said they were playing school. haha.
label: impressed
response: you must be proud of her. that is a lucky dog, a bark for each count. haha.

situation: i remember when i was younger i saved up all summer and took odd jobs so i could buy a dreamcast. probably the most i have ever anticipated anything.
dialogue: i babysat and worked odd jobs all summer when i was younger to save up and buy a sega dreamcast.
oh god i miss my dreamcast, i bet you were so happy when you got it.
yep, i have never looked forward to something so much in my life. i still have the dreamcast as well.
label: excited
response: that is great i have pretty much all of the ones i had in my childhood, even the atari.

situation: it has been a very, very long time since i have wet the bed, probably over a decade. i do not even know how it happened. i did not have very much to drink last night, i did not have a scary dream, nothing like that. how unfortunate.
dialogue: i am gonna need your support here, because i am going through something a little bit rough, okay?
anything you need! i am here for you!
i am 29 years old and i woke up to find that i would wet the bed last night. i am.not even sure how. i did not drink a whole lot before bed or anything.
label: ashamed
response: do not sweat it, it happened to me in my mid 20's also. could not even tell ya how or why, just that it did.

situation: when my uncle jebodiah told me that he had a strong brew that could cure my herpes, i did not think twice about gulping the whole thing. i know my uncle jeb would not do me wrong like that.
dialogue: my uncle jebodiah is always looking out for me. he recently told me that he had a special concoction that if i drank it, it would cure my herpes.
lol! i do not think i would trust that concoction if i were you.
listen, my uncle jeb would not do me dirty like that. you may call it """snake oil""" but i call it the miracle cure this world needs. after all, it worked.
label: trusting
response: well then. kudos to uncle jeb!

situation: my cat had to stay overnight at the vet recently. they had to keep her for x-rays, i was so worried.
dialogue: my cat was kept overnight at the vets recently. i was so worried!
i am so sorry to hear. i have a cat that i love very much. how is the cat doing now?
she is fine now! they found out it was something minor after x-rays. i was so relieved.
label: anxious
response: i am glad that she is much better.

situation: my car broke down on the busy highway the other day. there were so many cars, it was scary!
dialogue: my car broke down on a busy highway the other day. there were so many cars zooming past me, it was scary!
that is very scary, how did you get home
my brother had to pick me up. he had to pull up behind me on the curb. it felt dangerous!
label: terrified
response: that is dangerous, glad that both of your are okay

situation: when i found out that i was not going to be one of the ones who gets to walk on the moon during the upcoming lunar missions, i took it pretty hard. i have been training my whole life for this, and now i just have to do lame nasa grunt work because i have a "communicable disease that makes me a flight risk." it is just ebola, what is the big deal?
dialogue: look, can we just be honest with each other for a second? having ebola should not mean that i have to be grounded and miss out on my chance to walk on the moon during the upcoming lunar missions.
okay, well if you have it then you would have to see a doctor.

i saw one, and he said if i gave him $25,000 he would clear me for flight, but i do not have that kind of money just lying around. it is a real bummer. now i just have to do super boring nasa desk work like tracking comets. lame.
label: devastated
response: now that is interesting, i wish you the best of luck.

situation: i am always prepared because i hate to not be.
dialogue: i am obsessive about being ready for anything
oh really? are you afraid of missing out on something?
i do not know.  i just see stuff in the grocery store and think i like that food and buy it because it is on sale.  even if i already have it!
label: prepared
response: well it is good to have extra food on hand these days. you never know what major event can happen.

situation: when my girlfriend got her leg bitten off my a bull shark last summer, i spent a month in the hospital with her, then another three months in physical rehab. if she ever got sick of me being around, she never said anything.
dialogue: my girlfriend's leg was bitten off by a bull shark last summer.
oh my! is she ok, and was it while surfing?

she is fine now. i spent a month in the hospital with her, then was with her every day for three months while she was in rehab. she was out spreading sacrificial lamb's blood in the water on a fishing trip. gotta love her.
label: caring
response: did you recover the leg? and i once almost got my finger bit off by a snapping turtle, it was not a pleasant experience so i could not imagine hers. you are great for staying there.

situation: i forgot that i had made plans with my mother over the weekend. we had been planning it for a few days i feel awful.
dialogue: i forgot about plans that i had made with my mother over the weekend.
how could you? oh dear now you would have to apologise
i called her right up and we rescheduled! i felt so bad though.
label: guilty
response: i am glad that you were able to reschedule

situation: i was talking to a friend of mine who is from england about our president
dialogue: i was talking to a british friend of mine and trying to explain why our president feels compelled to tweet
i am sure that was an interesting conversation.  what did your friend think?
they think someone needs to take his phone away
label: embarrassed
response: lol   i think that even the people who like him would agree with that

situation: i was looking through the attic and found a box of childhood toys. they brought back so many memories!
dialogue: i was looking through the attic and found a box of childhood toys. they brought back so many memories!
that must have really been a wonderful surprise!
it was nice to find them all and think back to those simpler times
label: sentimental
response: yeah childhood ends way too fast it is great when we have a chance to reflect on them.

situation: i fainted on a plane!
dialogue: the last trip i took to chicago was by plane.
nice, the windy city! had you been before?
i had! i love chicago.  the flight is nice and short too, though i was not feeling well.
label: embarrassed
response: i have never been but would love to go one day! ah no what was wrong?

situation: wake forest is starting classes now and i remember the excitement of studying abroad through them
dialogue: my university is posting live stream of students moving in and i was reminiscing about when i studied abroad in college
aww, that is nice. where did you study abroad?
i studied in venice italy and travelled all over europe
label: nostalgic
response: wow, how exciting! i also traveled europe and italy many years ago. i loved it! wish i could just move there.

situation: i found my grandmother's glass eye in a trunk full of her belongings in a storage shed auction that i won last monday. it really reminded me of all the times she used to mess with me when i was a kid by popping it out and showing me her empty eye socket. those were such good times.
dialogue: i won a storage shed auction last monday and found my grandmother's old glass eye in a steamer trunk inside of the shed. really reminded me of her and how much i miss her.
wow that is incredible. what was her anme?
rita may. she used to mess with me by popping it out and showing me her empty eye socket just to get a laugh while she got drunk off of bourbon. those were such good times.
label: sentimental
response: haha that is really funny. i bet she was a special person.

situation: it is almost time for halloween horror nights at universal studios.  i am super excited to go, and cannot wait to snag tickets!
dialogue: i am pretty excited for the upcoming halloween season.
i am too! what are your plans?
well in september, universal studios starts their halloween horror nights events, after dark!  it is so much fun i cannot wait to grab tickets.
label: anticipating
response: i have been to universal and everything else around there, but sadly never during halloween, i have always wanted to.

situation: i was loyal to the same company for 10 years.
dialogue: i was loyal to the same company for 10 years.
that is rare these days, i was with mine for 7
nice. i was not rewarded though. they laid me off.
label: faithful
response: i hope you at least got a severance package!

situation: i told a lie to my mother.
dialogue: i told a lie to my mother.
was it a bad one? and did she find out?
i was about school. and i eventually confessed.
label: guilty
response: sometimes the lies get so heavy you just crack. good for you though.

situation: i got a job after a long period of unemployment.
dialogue: i got a job after a long period of unemployment.
i know how hard that can be. is it working out?
yes. i was very happy to be gainfully employed.
label: joyful
response: it does take a lot of stress off of you.

situation: i was in a car accident.
dialogue: i was in a car accident. both cars were totaled.
i hope you are ok, what happened?
they were running from the police. it was nerve rattling.
label: afraid
response: i can believe so , hope you get justice, and a paycheck!

situation: my family surprised me with a birthday party this year. i was so elated and happy.
dialogue: so my family surprised me this year with a party for my birthday.
that is always fun! did you get anything cool?
they got me the new shoes i have been wanting. i was so elated and had such a good time!
label: joyful
response: yay! i think shoes are a great gift.

situation: i had a job interview. the guy really knew his stuff.
dialogue: i had a job interview. the guy really knew his stuff.
nice, how did it go? was the guy nice?
yes, really smart and easy to talk to.
label: impressed
response: that is great! did you get the job?

situation: our electric went out for the whole night. it was so dark and scary.
dialogue: our power went off the other night. we were without it until morning!
that sucks. do you know what caused the outage?
someone crashed into the power line i think. it was so quiet and felt pretty spooky.
label: afraid
response: you do not realize how dependent we are on electricity until the lights go out.

situation: i bought a ticket where i have a 1/500 chance of winning a car
dialogue: i bought a raffle ticket for a charity where i have a 1/500 chance of winning a car
oh nice! that seems more likely than winning the state lottery. that would be so cool if you won!
yes.  they were $100 but they only sell 500 tickets.  and the money raised goes to breast cancer research
label: hopeful
response: that sounds like a really nice program. where can i buy some tickets?!

situation: someone helped me move.
dialogue: someone helped me move.
were they a close friend? and did you pay them with pizza?
yes, and i paid them with beer. i was thankful because i had a toe injury.
label: grateful
response: i had a shoulder injury when i last moved, except i had to pay movers and pretend they were my friends for a day.

situation: i bought a powerball ticket
dialogue: i bought a powerball ticket last week but did not win
sorry to hear that. what would you do if you won it?
i would have bought a new car and a house perhaps.  but i lost
label: disappointed
response: it is good to dream. dreams can come true.

situation: i spent saturday night playing lord of the rings online.
dialogue: i spent saturday night playing lord of the rings online.
oh , was it good? i have considered it.
it is good, but i sometimes wonder if i am trading real life for a fantasy world.
label: lonely
response: only if you are choosing that, over real tangible moments with friends or outside people.

situation: i am furious at our politicians who will not stand up to russian hacking
dialogue: i am so mad that our politicians will not do something to stop russian hacking
that would take a miracle , or have some major money backing it.
yes.  the republicans just do not seem to care about our country any more and i am so mad that putin owns trump
label: furious
response: take some small steps and vote in other things for people with the right values, not just pandering to the ignorant.

situation: my goldfish died.
dialogue: my goldfish died.
i am sorry to hear that, how long did you have him?
for 4 years. i am bummed.
label: sad
response: yeah that is a long time for a fish, do you have plans to get another one

situation: i had an unprofessional job interview.
dialogue: i had an unprofessional job interview.
what happened?
the receptionist ignored me, and my interviewer was not prepared.
label: annoyed
response: i hate when that happens, they expect us to be on point every time, yet they cannot bother. i usually decline anything after.

situation: my computer crashed while i was working on a project.
dialogue: my computer crashed while i was working on a project.
oh no! did you lose a lot of work?
i did. i hadn't saved, and i forgot to set up autosave. it was very frustrating.
label: angry
response: i can relate. i have lost whole essays for the same reason. i had to call in sick for school because of it.

situation: my favorite team blew a big lead in the playoffs.
dialogue: my favorite team blew a big lead in the playoffs. it was like drinking sour milk.
im a browns fan i feel that pain
i hate when teams choke. it makes me sick.
label: disgusted
response: yea me too it sucks

situation: my eye is itchy and my eyelid is droopy
dialogue: i woke up this morning and my eye is itchy and my right eyelid is drooping
you should probably go to the doctor about that
yeah i am going to see what it seems like tomorrow not sure if something got in it that scratched it or what
label: anxious
response: you could have a tear on your eye. you really should get it checked out

situation: i saw a magician pull out a rabbit from his hat. it was unbelievable!
dialogue: me and my family went to see a magic show for the first time today.
i bet that was fun, who did you go see?
i did not catch his name, but he pulled a rabbit out of his hat. classic trick, but i will never forget it!
label: impressed
response: magic is such a cool thing. that suspension of belief.

situation: i have a job interview tomorrow.
dialogue: i have a job interview tomorrow. i am looking forward to it.
oh that is wonderful! is it a job that you would enjoy?
yes. it seems like a great opportunity.
label: excited
response: that is great! i hope you do well and get the job. good luck!

situation: i scored well on an aptitude test.
dialogue: i scored well on an aptitude test.
that is good, what are you going to do to celebrate
i had a few drinks. i felt good.
label: proud
response: that is always good, have one for me!
