situation: my mother knew i had been really stressed and busy. she brought over a whole week of meals to help.
dialogue: so today my mother brought over a whole week of meals to help me out.
aww, that was sweet of her. does she do that often for you?
yes, she is always helping me out! i am so thankful for her she is an amazing mother.
label: grateful
response: that is wonderful. it is nice to have someone in life who cares for your well being.

situation: i moved away from my parents not too long ago. it is been really different and a little too quiet.
dialogue: so i moved away from my parents not too long ago. it is been a big change.
oh wow. how far away did you move??
out of state. i am by myself now, so it is pretty quiet! i miss them a lot.
label: lonely
response: awww! i know they miss you, too. i hope you are finding some fun with living on your own too!

situation: my oldest child needed braces and her health insurance would not cover is. the cost was close to 4000 dollars. my aunt paid half of it for us and did not ask for any of the money back, just because she knew we needed the help.
dialogue: my oldest child needed braces but her health insurance would not cover the expense. it was close to 4000 dollars and we did not have that kind of money at the time.
i feel you. last week, i spend 1000 dollars to fix my daughter's teeth. dentists ask a lot of money now a days.
yes they do. my aunt paid half of the cost for us and did not has for any of it back because she knew we needed the help.
label: grateful
response: ohh well that is good for you. these kind people always help in difficult times.

situation: i was sitting on the couch after a long day. my family was all happy, watching tv together. everything just felt right.
dialogue: i was sitting on the couch after a long day taking care of work and all the mommy stuff the other day.
sounds good so far
it was! my family was happy and together. chatting and watching tv. everything just felt right.
label: content
response: thats a great feeling

situation: my husband used to work out of town in a different state sunday through thursday. even though my kids were with me and we kept to our usual routine, i still missed him very badly when he was gone. every sunday after he left, i would cry.
dialogue: my husband used to work out of town in a different state sunday through thursday.
ohh he is so hardworking. you are very lucky.

yeah, he does work hard. even thought my children were with me and we kept our usual routines, i was miserable when he was gone. i would cry after he left every sunday. luckily now, he has a job where he is home everyday by supper time.
label: lonely
response: ohh good for you. you two are made for each other!

situation: i did not have a car to use, so my parents lent me theirs for the full month. it was amazingly giving of them and meant a lot they would lend it to me that long.
dialogue: i did not have a car to get to and from work, so my parents actually let me just keep theirs for a bit!
oh that is great
yeah it was so giving of them to leave it to me for so long and helped me a ton!
label: trusting
response: thats always super

situation: i passed by my grandma's old house today, she passed last year. it really brought me down.
dialogue: while driving today i went past my grandma's old house. she passed last year.
i bet that gave you some good feeelings
oh for sure. good feelings, but i also miss her so much.
label: sad
response: yeah i bet. but atleast you have the memorys

situation: someone ran over my mailbox this morning. they left it totally demolished.
dialogue: i went outside to get my paper this morning. someone had ran over my mailbox!
o no! can you fix it?
no, it is completely demolished! i am feeling pretty annoyed.
label: angry
response: well it is not hard to build a mailbox i am sure you can do it

situation: my sister got a big story she is been working on published in the paper. it is a really big deal and i am so happy for her.
dialogue: my sister is a journalist and she got her first big story published in the paper today!
now that is some super news
it is! it is a really big deal and i could not be happier for her.
label: proud
response: thats great

situation: my partner surprised me with a trip to hawaii this year! i could not be more elated.
dialogue: so my partner gave me the biggest surprise this week.
what did they do?
he got us a trip to hawaii! i could not believe it, i am so elated!
label: excited
response: that is awesome! i bet your happy about that

situation: i adopted a cat last month and got way more than expected. she ended up being pregnant and i woke up to a whole litter of kittens.
dialogue: i finally went and adopted a cat last month and go way more than i expected!
oh my gosh! how many did you adopt?!
well it was only supposed to be her, but we found out she was pregnant! she popped out a whole litter of adorable.
label: surprised
response: oh, i see! what a lovely surprise though. what did you do with her litter?

situation: i had to leave town and needed someone to take care of my pets. they are so important to me. my sister took care of them and did such a good job.
dialogue: i had to leave town last week and that meant leaving my pets who are my babies. i needed someone who could take care of them properly.
yeah it is hard to leave our animals behind
it is very hard! the only one who i would let do it was my sister and she did an amazing job.
label: trusting
response: that is nice of her!

situation: i took my dog for the first time to visit the dog park. he refused to leave my side the entire time and was a sweetheart.
dialogue: so i finally decided to take my dog for his first dog park visit.
aww that is so cute! did he enjoy it?
it is hard to tell! he refused to leave my side the entire time and just watched the other dogs play.
label: faithful
response: poor guy was just nervous, i am sure the more you take him the more he will venture away from you and have some fun!

situation: i forgot i had planned to pick up my brother from work the other day. he had to wait for me to get there, i felt like such a jerk.
dialogue: i am embarrassed to admit i forgot to pick up my brother from worth the other day after agreeing to
well hopefully he is understanding, if he is anything like my brother nothing a cold 6 pack will not fix.
ha ha, he was a little miffed. he got over it though when i stopped and got him ice cream on the way back though! i felt like such a jerk.
label: ashamed
response: all is well that ends well, especially with family they gotta give ya do overs.

situation: i decided to go back to school this year. i am was pretty hesitant at first, but now i am excited about learning more!
dialogue: i finally took the plunge and decided to go back to school this year.
that is a great idea! how is it so far?
i start next week! i was super hesitant at first, but i am so glad i am making myself do it.
label: apprehensive
response: yeah you will improve yourself and feel good about it

situation: i found a box of jewelry my grandparents had given me as gift over the years. it really made me think about them.
dialogue: i was going through some stuff and found a box of jewelry my grandparents had gifted me through the years.
thats great
yeah, it really made me think of them and old times.
label: sentimental
response: i bet it did

situation: i recently got my tires fixed on my car. the shop did it so quickly!
dialogue: i recently had a shop fix my car. they worked so fast!
that is good, did you have to wait there or were you able to go home?
i was able to go home, but i realize now that i did not even have to
label: impressed
response: haha that;s rare when it comes to mechanics.

situation: my husband is going through the process of quitting smoking and he also has drama going on with his parents that is not his fault. there is nothing that i can do to make the situation better for him, so it makes me sad.
dialogue: my husband is going through the process of quitting smoking on top of dealing with drama from his parents. he is having a hard time.
im sorry, that is awful. its a shame his parents are not being more supportive
they are not being supportive at all, but that is not surprising, that do not support him very well in anything. i just wish i could make it better for him, but i cannot
label: sad
response: im sure he appreciates having you around though

situation: i have amazing friends. one of them drove me to the airport
dialogue: i have some great friends. one of them drove me to the airport tomorrow
that was really nice of them. i bet you are appreciative.
yes i am, they are great
label: grateful
response: i am sure you will do a favor for them in the future.

situation: i work for a company and we just found out the the person who works in our accounting department has been stealing money from us for years. it is revolting.
dialogue: we just found out the person working in our accounting department has been stealing money from our company for years.
yikes! that is terrible! what a awful thing to do! i am glad he finally got busted! wow, for years, huh?
yes, it just makes me sick to my stomach. you think you know someone but the whole time they are stealing you blind. i do not get some people
label: disgusted
response: yeah, me either. hopefully they regret what they did and are able to learn something from this.

situation: i miss being in high school. i still remember my old girlfriend fondly
dialogue: i miss high school. my girlfriend was the best
i enjoyed highschool, too.
that is great. college was also fun
label: nostalgic
response: college was pretty laid back for me, i did a lot of online classes.

situation: i recently said goodbye to a good friend for a while. i love her!
dialogue: i recently bid farewell to a good friend. i miss her
i am sorry for your loss. i hope you can find comfort during this difficult time.
thank you, that means a lot. i will see her again
label: sad
response: you will, and that is what gives us the strength to face tomorrow!

situation: i lost my car keys. i am furious with myself.
dialogue: i lost my car keys. i am such a fool!

happens to everybody. my girlfriend, who is the smartest person i know, has had to make 5 duplicates of her car keys because she is locked herself out so much. she is so forgetful because she is so efficient and on top of everything else important, that sometimes she misses the small things. maybe that is true in your case, too!
that is pretty funny, and makes me feel better. this is the first time i have lost my keys so i hope to keep it that way!
label: angry
response: i have heard some people place theirs in a bowl near the front door as soon as they come home, or they stick it in the fridge with their lunch. silly things to make sure they can keep it together.

situation: i came home the other day and my roommate had a friend over. i have only seen him with a friend over once in my 3.5 years of living here.
dialogue: i came home the other day and my roommate had a friend over. i have only seen him with a friend over once in my 3.5 years of living here.
wow. that must be a very special friend. i net you were surprised.
yeah i sure was, he seems to like this one much better than the last one he had over. he could not wait for that first guy to leave.
label: surprised
response: oh dear. maybe he is a loner and does not like friends.

situation: one of my co-worker came and asked me a lot of really weird questions about my supervisor. it seemed suspicious so i pretty much told her i did not know any of the answers to her questions. i do not think she like my supervisor.
dialogue: one of my co-worker came and asked me a lot of really weird questions about my supervisor. it seemed suspicious so i pretty much told her i did not know any of the answers to her questions. i do not think she likes my supervisor.
oh that is just a recipe for disaster 100% of the time.
yeah i figured it was, so i just played dumb and let my supervisor know. my supervisor has always been good to me.
label: faithful
response: mine has too. i think you did the right thing by not getting involved.

situation: i was down to my last $400, and we had a bicycle trip planned. my buddy asked me to give him all of it to print some bootleg concert posters. we netted $2000 a piece.
dialogue: man there are not many people i would give my last couple hundred dollars to, with one notable exception.
hm, who might that be?
my buddy stefan. he used it to print hundreds of bootleg concert posters. we sold them and netted $2000 a piece!
label: trusting
response: that is neat. you must trust him a lot given his track record of making money!

situation: i just finished first in a foot race! i feel awesome
dialogue: i finished first in a race. i feel like gold
oh my goodness!  that is amazing!  congratulations! was it your first gold medal race?
yes! it was my first victory. all my hard work is paying off
label: proud
response: that is awesome! it is for running?

situation: some of my friends told me that they had a big surprise for me. they know i hate surprises, but i complied and let the blindfold me and drive me out to the location.
dialogue: some of my friends told me that they had a big surprise for me. they know i hate surprises, but i complied and let the blindfold me and drive me out to the location.
that sounds exciting and scary.  what was the surprise?
they had decided to pool their money together and get me one big present together. it was a flying lesson at the local airport.
label: trusting
response: that is so awesome.  did you have fun? and more important, are you a pilot now?

situation: one time i found a photo album that had pictures of my family when we were young. it brought back a lot of memories.
dialogue: i found an old photo album at my grandma's house that had pictures of me when i was a kid
that is cool, did it bring back some good memories?
yeah, it did. i really miss the 90s. everything seemed a lot simpler in those days
label: sentimental
response: i love the 90's also, best decade in my opinion!

situation: when i was in middle school, i had a friend come over to ride horses with me. after riding my mother pressured me to get on a horse bareback i was not comfortable riding. she made such a big scene that i got on to make her stop.
dialogue: when i was in middle school, i had a friend come over to ride horses with me. after riding my mother pressured me to get on a horse bareback i was not comfortable riding. she made such a big scene that i got on to make her stop.
oh no, did you get hurt?

yes, the horse took off running and i got thrown into a metal fence. my mother then proceeded to yell and me and make fun of me for trusting her. she told me that i should never trust anyone not even my own parents, it was really embarrassing to get yelled at in from my friend. afterwards my ribs hurt for 2 months.
label: ashamed
response: yikes, i am sorry to hear that.  that sounds horrifying!

situation: my friend really wanted me to go rollerblading with him, but i have not been rollerblading since i was a little kid. i did not want to roll into a car.
dialogue: my friend really wanted me to go rollerblading with him, but i have not been rollerblading since i was a little kid. i did not want to roll into a car.
so what did you do?
we went, but it was still pretty terrible because i felt completely uncomfortable and was bent over the whole time ready to catch myself.
label: apprehensive
response: well, i bet your friend had a good time with you being there. sometimes we have to make sacrefices for those we care about.

situation: my husband is on the road a lot, it often gets lonley. i have to remember he does it for our family and try to enjoy the alone time.
dialogue: my husband is on the road a lot, i hardley ever see him.
i am sorry. my wife could sympathize with you since i am gone a lot on business as well.
yes, its hard but i try to remember he does it for our family! i have been trying to adapt to enjoying alone time.
label: faithful
response: i am sorry you feel lonely.  my wife says she ofens feels the same way.  i know your husband misses you awfully while he is away.  i love having chats with my wife every day when i am gone.

situation: one time i had a interview for a job i did not feel qualified for. i felt pretty nervous going into it
dialogue: i have an interview for a job that i do not feel qualified for
just be confident and you will do great!
i will try. i am a pretty anxious person in general so it is hard
label: apprehensive
response: you got this!

situation: i am moving in a few months and nervous about the new start. my husband is getting out of military.
dialogue: i am moving in a few months to a new state, i am starting to feel nervous.
ah, yeah moving can be hectic! are you moving somewhere you want to be?
to my husband hometown so it will be new for me but he is excited to be back near family.
label: apprehensive
response: that is a positive at least, good luck on the move!

situation: i saw a dog get hit by a car today, it was a very emotional day.
dialogue: i saw a dog get hit by car today on the highway.
oh no! did you see what happened to the dog?!
it was pretty tramatic, i still see the dog getting hit in my head and the sound. no, i was on my way to work, i could not stop
label: sentimental
response: that is so sad! what on earth is a dog doing around a highway?! that just breaks my heart.

situation: the first time i got a tattoo i was worried about pain and blood. i faint pretty easily at the sight of my own blood, and at the time had a low pain threshold. it worked out alright in the end!
dialogue: i cannot even begin to tell you how nervous i was about my first tattoo.
i can understand the anxiety. its a whole new different experience for first timers!
definitely! i get lightheaded when i see my own blood, and my pain threshold was low at the time. it turned out great though, and now i have several!
label: apprehensive
response: same thing happens to me. i sometimes faint at the sight of a needle! its good that your experience went well! now you will not be nervous anymore.

situation: i love my husband. he has been so sweet this week. he knew i had a long day today so he bought me my favourite wine and taco bell!
dialogue: i love my husband! he has been so sweet this week!
aww! that is so cute! has he done something special this week that made him extra sweet?
he knew i had a rough day today so he brought home my favourite wine and taco bell! it is the little things
label: caring
response: that is so sweet of him. its definitely the little things.

situation: it is been a great week! i got a promotion at work and my husband has been so caring!
dialogue: it is been a great week!
good! what is been going on?
i got a promotion at work that i was not expecting!
label: content
response: woo! congrats on that! that is always a nice surprise. what do you do?

situation: i have a bunch of records that belong to my father before he passed away. sometimes i put them on and imagine what it would have been like to party with him in the 70s.
dialogue: music is a powerful thing. sometimes it feels like it can transport you to another time and place. you know what i mean?
yeah exactly!  music is awesome.
who can deny it? my dad passed away 2 years ago. sometimes i put on his old records and imagine what it would have been like to hang out with him in the 70s.
label: sentimental
response: yeah he sounds amazing.  sorry for your loss friend

situation: i was feeling kind of down so i ended up snuggling with a stuffed rabbit i have. it brought back a lot of good old memories.
dialogue: i was feeling kind of down so i ended up snuggling with a stuffed rabbit i have. it brought back a lot of good old memories.

never too old or too manly to snuggle a stuffed animal. my mom said i used to carry this blanket with me when i was a toddler, everywhere i went. i wish i still had it. if i did, i would consider using it again, or at the very least passing it down to my own kid. what is the harm, you know? if something gives you comfort and does not bother anyone else, there should be no shame.
awe yeah thanks. he is pretty soft even though he some derpy eye that point in opposite directions. brings me a lot of comfort and reminds me that someone cares.
label: sentimental
response: well, if i were you, i would keep it up, whether or not my spouse laughed at me, or a new girlfriend/boyfriend, whatever. it is not childish to me. life is stressful enough. let us snuggle what we want.

situation: one time my dog got hit by a car. he did not survive.
dialogue: my dog got hit by a car.
aw! that is horrible, i am sorry to hear that.
he did not live. i have never felt so sad before.
label: devastated
response: that is so sad, i do not even know what to say!

situation: some random guy was in my backyard, i did not realize before i looked outside that i was missing pants. turns out he was the cable guy fixing a wire.
dialogue: some random guy was in my backyard, i did not realize before i looked outside that i was missing pants.
oh no! that is really creepy, why is he in your backyard?
turns out he was the cable guy fixing a wire. still mad he did not ask permisson first.
label: embarrassed
response: yeah, that is illegal i think, they need to at least knock or ring the door bell!

situation: my father had a large tumor removed from his kidney. they thought the surgery successful and he was recovering. on the third day he passed away suddenly, with no known cause of death.
dialogue: my family is still hasn't recovered from the untimely passing of my father two years ago.
i am so sorry to hear that. it cannot be easy for you and your family.
my siblings and i are managing, and have found some peace. my mother is a different story. it was just so sudden and unexpected.
label: devastated
response: no doubt it will take time to process. i wish your family the best. stay strong my friend.

situation: one time i got a week's vacation from work. i got to spend a lot of time watching my favorite shows
dialogue: i have got a week off from work. time to sleep in and binge watch my favorite shows.
what shows are your favorite? that must be nice.
i like it is always sunny in philadelphia. i am rewatching it for the third time
label: content
response: must be nice, got any nice snacks?

situation: i was really stressed out and grad school and had no choice but to drop out to keep my sanity.
dialogue: i was really stressed out and grad school and had no choice but to drop out to keep my sanity.
good choice. you are health is more important than some grad degree.
that is what i was thinking at the time, but i have been having a really tough time finding a job where i can advance into a higher position. i always seem to get positions with no mobility.
label: devastated
response: i think nowadays employers just want experience. so it should be easier once you have that.

situation: one time i was walking on the sidewalk to my next class and i tripped on some steps. i fell flat on my face in front of a bunch of people.
dialogue: i tripped on some steps in front of a whole bunch of people on my way to class.
ah, i hate when that happens! how embarrassed were you?
it was pretty humiliating. i fell flat on my face.
label: embarrassed
response: sorry to hear that. hopefully you are not seriously hurt!

situation: one time my boyfriend was sick. i made him some soup help him feel better because that is all he could eat
dialogue: my boyfriend is sick. he cannot eat much so i made some soup for him
you are sweet, what kind of soup did you make him?
i made chicken noodle soup.
label: caring
response: i love chicken noodle, he must be so grateful.

situation: i had a meeting last week where i gave a presentation over the wrong documentation and no one said anything until after the meeting.
dialogue: i had a meeting last week where i gave a presentation over the wrong documentation and no one said anything until after the meeting.
i bet that was a little embarrassing.
after i figured out what i did, i sure was. ate at my cube ever since i do not even want to make eye contact with anyone.
label: embarrassed
response: i am sure it was not as bad as you think.

situation: i have a really big meeting next week. i have rehearsed what i am to go over all this past week and plan to practice a little more this weekend.
dialogue: i have a really big meeting next week. i have rehearsed what i am to go over all this past week and plan to practice a little more this weekend.
wow! what kind of meeting is it?
it is a meeting presenting a new product to the board. big stuff and big money for the company.
label: prepared
response: dang! i hope you have successful meeting then!

situation: one time i found out my boyfriend had been texting his ex. i was afraid he wanted to still be with her
dialogue: i caught my boyfriend texting his ex
oh no, was it romantic texts?
it was definitely a bit flirty. i think he misses being with her
label: jealous
response: that is sad. i hope you are ok.

situation: i know i broke up with my ex, but i cannot help but feel irritated when he talks about going on dates.
dialogue: i know i broke up with my ex, but i cannot help but feel irritated when he talks about going on dates.
that must be weird to talk to your ex still.
we actually get along really well and are much better friends than a couple. i guess i still just get a littler territorial, i think he does too.
label: jealous
response: you must have feelings for him that are lingering.

situation: one time i had done really well in a class. i fully expected to get an a in it
dialogue: i cannot wait to see my final grades. i think i got all a's this semester.
nice! it feels good to be confident. when do they come out?
on monday. i am going to treat myself if i did well
label: anticipating
response: as you should. you must have good teachers too!

situation: i found my kitten outside very ill, it had to be put down because it ate a poisonous plant.
dialogue: i was very upset when i found my kitten today.
why? what happened to it? is it okay?
no, i had to put it down. it ate a poisonous plant. he should not have been outside.
label: devastated
response: that sounds terrible, i hope you did not cry alot.

situation: i like to take treats to the retirement home, especially the people with no family.
dialogue: i enjoy visiting the nursing home on occasion.
oh yeah?  do you know someone that lives there?
not really, i take my daughter to see them, so many of them have no visitors at all.
label: caring
response: yeah.  that is awesome that you do that though.  makes for some special moments with your daughter and teaches her stuff.

situation: my mother is always there for me and i know i can go to her with my darkest secrets. i feel like she is the one i know will never betray me.
dialogue: i had a secret and went to my mother to confide in her, as well as get off my chest. i know she would never betray my secret and can always count on her.
i am so happy for you that you have someone you can trust so completely.
yes, i sure do! there are not many people you can feel that way with and i am so grateful!
label: trusting
response: hopefully she knows how much this means to you.

situation: a time that i felt uneasy and anxious was waiting for my son to find out if he was accepted to a prestigious college.
dialogue: my son applied to a prestigious college and the wait killed us. i was anxious and nervous waiting to see if he was accepted!
did he get accepted? i hope so
he did! he is in his 3rd year, going to be an aerospace engineer, so we are very proud of him.
label: apprehensive
response: omg that is amazing, good on him! you must be so proud

situation: my sister passed away in 2010. she had taken her own life and my mother and i found her after she did. it was very traumatic and painful for us, and all our family.
dialogue: my sister passed away several years ago. she took her life, and my mother and i found her right after she did it. this was very painful, traumatic and hard for us all.
oh wow, how did your mother handle this, how did you handle it . i can only imagine the pain.
it did not really seem to sink in for my mother for awhile, she was in denial. but, it was so hard when it did. i went into a depression for awhile, as she was my only sibling and we were very close.
label: devastated
response: that is really painful, i hope everything becomes better soon.

situation: i felt so much love and affection when my son was moving to college. it was hard, as i was not ready, but was so proud of him!
dialogue: when my son first started college, i felt so much love and affection, but it was definitely hard to see him go! i was very proud though.
where did he go study at? i can imagine how hard that could be. but it is good to see him following his dreams\
he went to the university of alabama in huntsville. it is focused on science, engineering, etc. he is going to be an aerospace engineer. it is great to see him go for his dreams!
label: caring
response: aerospace engineer that sounds very interesting. hopefully he will stay focused and reach his goals.

situation: when we went to the beach for vacation a few weeks ago, i felt so relaxed and happy! it was so great to spend that time with my family.
dialogue: we went on vacation a few weeks ago and went to the beach, it was so relaxing and great. i really enjoyed the time with my family.
aww that is amazing, i am going on vacation next week and i cannot wait
that is great! i am sure you earned it, just like we do. it is so good to get some time away from the hustle and bustle of life!
label: content
response: i know! i am sure you were able to recharge your batteries

situation: my husband has been out of town for a few weeks on business but is coming back next week. i am anxious and looking forward to when he gets home!
dialogue: i am looking forward to next week! my husband has been out of town on business for several weeks and comes home next weekend!
do you have any special welcome-back events planned?
i am going to cook a special meal and see if he wants to go out, just us two. i know he will like that.
label: anticipating
response: that sounds great. does he travel often?

situation: i have a surprise planned for a night out for my husband when he gets back from traveling for work. i feel pretty optimistic and sure he will really enjoy it.
dialogue: my husband has been out of town a few weeks for work but is coming back next weekend. i have a surprise night planned for just us. i am optimistic and sure he will really enjoy it.
how exciting! i hope everything goes as planned!
thanks! we have been married almost 23 years but i try to keep things fun and spend time together.
label: confident
response: sounds like you have a good relationship. i hope when i get married it turns out just as good.

situation: i was feeling a bit nostalgic the other day when my son went back to college. it made me think of him when he first started kindergarten.
dialogue: my son went back to college recently and it had me feeling a bit nostalgic. i could just picture him starting kindergarten and it seemed not so long ago!
aww. i am sure you must feel proud of him
yes, very. but, time sure has flown by with him growing up. i can just see his little blonde head when he was 5 and just starting school!
label: sentimental
response: that sounds so cute

situation: when i was promoted to team leader, i had years of experience and felt very comfortable in my ability to perform the job. i was very ready for the leadership role!
dialogue: i was promoted to a team leader and i felt very secure i could do well at the job. i had years of experience and was ready for a leadership role.
that is good news. its always good when what you learn helps you get ahead
yes, thank you! i had worked very hard through the years, and i felt that i earned it, and would do well at it.
label: prepared
response: i hope you do well and excell

situation: one day a back neighbor insulted my 10 year old son and made fun of him for his weight. she actually called him a name and cursed. needless to say, i was so mad, beyond angry!
dialogue: there was an incident where one of my back neighbors called my young son a name and made fun of him. i was so mad, beyond angry!
an adult did this?

yes, and she had two children of her own, similar in age. her son also weighed more than mine! she did it because my son rode his bike through the corner of her yard as rode around the circle, that made her mad! can you believe that??
label: furious
response: i do not get people sometimes. who does that that sort of thing.

situation: last week was the first day of school for my granddaughter. she did not go to preschool so i was really worried how she would like it and if she would be sad or not. turns out she loves it and i was worried for nothing
dialogue: last week my granddaughter started school for the first time. i worried about her the entire day.
aww, they grow up so fast!  how did she do?
it turns out she loves and and i was a mess for 8 hours for nothing.
label: anxious
response: haha, i am sorry you were so upset for nothing!  but it is so great that she loves school.  i hope she loves learning her whole life.

situation: i plan for weeks every time we go on vacation and make sure we have everything we need. i did not do very well when we went on our honeymoon though. i guess i was so excited about the wedding that i forget just about everything.
dialogue: i always try and plan everything in advance to bring everything we need when we go on vacation. we recently went on our honeymoon and i did not do very well this time. ugh!
what went wrong?
i forgot everything. i guess i was so excited about the wedding, i totally failed at packing this time. oh well, it was still fun.
label: prepared
response: that is all that matters, its about the love.

situation: my friend's boyfriend had the nerve to kiss me when i was visiting her one day. it was an out of the blue, sneaky move and repulsed me!
dialogue: one day i was visiting a friend and her boyfriend came up and kissed me, while i was waiting for my friend to return from another room! it was sneaky and repulsed me!
i understand. did you told your friend?

i did not.only because of her situation. she had custody of her very ill and handicapped infant grandson, she was not working so depended on him financially and she was very much in love with him. she already suspected he was with other women, and stayed.
label: disgusted
response: wow, it is terrible.

situation: the other night i was home alone and it was late. all of a sudden, i heard someone knocking at the door really loud and they would not stop. i ignored it but i was so scared and about to call the police but they finally stopped and went away.
dialogue: the other night i was home alone and all of a sudden i heard someone knocking at the door really loud and they would not stop. i was so scared.
did you go see who it was?
no, i ignored them and they finally went away. i was just about to call the police before they left though. i hope that does not happen again.
label: terrified
response: no that is scary stuff.

situation: my 50th birthday just passed. i was trying to ignore it but my family ended up having a surprise party for me. it was such a happy night. made me realize i should embrace my age and not ignore it.
dialogue: i was trying to ignore the fact that my 50th birthday was coming up but my family decided to throw me a surprise party.
that is great. what is it fun?
it was so much fun and such a happy night. i am trying to embrace my age now and not ignore it any more
label: joyful
response: that is always difficult.

situation: my husband and i had an argument a few weeks ago. i got pretty mad and said some things i wished i hadn't. i felt bad and disappointed in my actions aferwards.
dialogue: a few weeks ago, my husband and i had a big argument. i said some pretty hurtful things, and wished i hadn't. i felt very bad and disappointed in myself afterwards.
i am single and never been married. i assume arguments are part of marriage.
yes, that is true. i tend to be a bit more verbal on my end and say things i regret later.
label: ashamed
response: i am bad at giving advice especially to people i do not know.  i am the opposite.  i am too mellow. and that sometimes gets me in trouble.

situation: one night my children and i came home and came in through the back door. as i opened it, i saw a tall shadow in the hallway! it scared me so much, as i feared an intruder was in my home.
dialogue: one night when my kids and i came home, i saw a shadow in my hallway as i came in the back door. i was so scared and was afraid someone had broken in my home.
in some ways that is a bit funny but it certainly can be a scary time to come home alone to an empty dark house.
yes, and i live out in the country so i would not get a quick response time from emergency vehicles. but, luckily, it turned out to be my shadow!
label: terrified
response: i hope you are not still scared of your shadow?

situation: one day i was a bit short on cash so i did not give a homeless man any money. i felt really bad, as i always try to give something to those that are in need.
dialogue: there was a day that i was a bit short on cash on hand and i did not give money to a homeless man. i usually always do, as i feel it is my part to help those in need, as i am blessed. i felt very bad that i did not that day.
i do not think you should feel too bad about missing one day!  it sounds like you are generous regularly.  i get it though.
well, homeless people are not common in my area, so that is why i felt a bit bad about it.
label: guilty
response: it is hard to see people and not be able to help.  you seem really giving!

situation: when my children were born, it was such a wonderful and amazing occasion for me. it is a happiness beyond words.
dialogue: when my children were born, it was a rejoicing time for me. i cannot think of a time i felt more happiness.
children are a beautiful thing for us parents. what a great memory you have of that.
yes, i have two children and i feel so blessed to have them. i lucked out and got a boy and girl, both healthy, smart and wonderful.
label: joyful
response: that is perfect, a boy and a girl that is what most people want. congrats.

situation: i have been true to my beliefs for a very long time, even if it means disagreeing with others. i used to work in a place where everyone had different beliefs to me. i just had to walk away from conversations on occasion.
dialogue: i used to work in a place where all my colleagues had different believes to myself. i wanted to stay true to what i believed in, so had to walk away from conversations on many occasions.
in what do you believe?
just that all people should be given an equal chance in life and that no one type of person is better than another, just because of their religion or skin color, or where they come from.
label: faithful
response: that is great. in what do your colleagues believe?

situation: i did not have a car for a few years and just recently bought a new one. i was scared to drive at first, especially on the highways around here. people drive like crazy people and did not want to get in another accident. i am getting used to it now though.
dialogue: i recently bought a new car after not driving for several years and i was really scared to drive it, especially on the highway.
what car did you buy?
just a honda civic. people drive crazy around here. i do not want to have another car accident like the last one.
label: afraid
response: jeez. where do you live? i do not remember any state i have been to with bad drivers.

situation: i decided to join to group to lose weight. i had so much respect and admired what all of these people were going through with there struggle. it really helped having their support too.
dialogue: i recently joined a group to help me lose weight. i have so much respect and admire everyone in that group so much.
good luck! my sister-in-law has been with weight watchers for a while now. she loves the camaraderie and how everyone encourages each other.
it has really helped to have their support. i am so grateful for them
label: impressed
response: you will reach your goal. you just have to make small adjustments which'll sustain you throughout your life. how many meetings do you attend?

situation: i am from scotland originally and had to apply to become a us citizen. to do that, you have to pass a civics test. i was so nervous!
dialogue: a few years ago i applied for us citizenship. to succeed you have to pass a civics test. i was so terribly nervous!
that test seems so hard. i probably could not even pass it. how did you do?
i passed! turns out you only had to answer three questions correctly. but they have 50 to choose from so you have to study the lot!
label: apprehensive
response: i did not know that. congratulations. that is so awesome.

situation: i was sorting through some stuff recently and came across some old christmas cards. it was lovely to read them and remember the friends and family who sent them!
dialogue: i found some old christmas cards the other day and had a lovely time reading them and reminiscing about the people who sent them.
that must have been nice. i keep cards too.
it was so nice. i am terrible about throwing cards out. i feel, if someone's taken the time to write, i should preserve it. does that sound silly?
label: sentimental
response: of course not. there is so much paper in this house. i keep cards, photos, school projects. everything. we are not here forever

situation: i was running to get in the store because it wasraining. i slipped and fell on the wet floor as i entered the store.
dialogue: when i was entering the store it was really slippery.
why was it slippery
it had been raining , so i ran across the parking lot in to the store. i slid about 3 feet.
label: embarrassed
response: oh no, were you okay

situation: i found out that my best friend was lying to her husband but i kept her secret.
dialogue: i am feeling a bit guilty about keeping a secret for my friend.
oh no. why are you keeping the secret?
i do not want to out her to her husband, usually the only thing that happens is they drop the friend.
label: faithful
response: oh it sounds like you are in a difficult situation. i hope you can get out of the middle of it!

situation: i really wanted to get the part in the school rendition of a play. but my friend got it.
dialogue: i feel kind of blue today, they announced the parts for the annual play.
oh i am sorry. did you get any part?
i did, and it is a good one, just not the one that i wanted. i did not want the lead or anything.
label: jealous
response: i am glad you got a good part. i am sure it is a let down to not get what you were hoping for though.

situation: i am teaching my daughter how to drive, and so far, so good!
dialogue: i am teaching my daughter how to drive, and so far, so good!
that is wonderful, i imagine she is very excited.
she is!  at first, though, she was very nervous.  i told her we could start off slow her dad lives 1 mile from me down a quiet road, so we started driving back and forth between the two houses.
label: trusting
response: okay i see well, take your time she will be getting her liscense soon

situation: my house is a mess and i have got people coming over later this evening.
dialogue: my house is a mess and i have got people coming over later on this evening.
that can be overwhelming. are you going to be cleaning all day then?
i am going to try to.  if worst comes to worse, i will just toss everything in my back bedroom, shiny up the floors and hope for the best!  *chuckle*
label: ashamed
response: i am sure you will get it done!

situation: i am so lucky i have a brother i can trust absolutely to do the right thing at all times. when we had to sell a property he dealt with everything and it was all carried out perfectly.
dialogue: my brother and i recently had to sell a house and he dealt with everything. i am so lucky to have a brother i can rely on and who i know will not try and con me.
that is neat. do you guys make a lot of money?
we did and he was so precise with who got what and made sure he sent me my share quickly. he is such a neat brother in so many regards. i always know he will be there for anyone who needs help.
label: trusting
response: i wish my siblings were like that. we should be more supportive and close like that

situation: my son was in advanced placement and honors class in high school. once he graduated, he was accepted at a very good college and is going to be an aerospace engineer. i really astonished at how well he does, and admire his intelligence and hard work.
dialogue: my son was in advance placement and honors during high school. he went to a prestigious college after, going for as an aerospace engineer. he never ceases to astonish me with his intelligence and admire me with how hard he works to pursue his dreams.
wow!  it sounds like your kid is quite smart and gifted!  you must be really proud of him!
i am quite proud, thank you! i also have a teenage daughter that is very smart and an amazing artist, (which i do not know where she gets that talent). they really impress me with amazing they are!
label: impressed
response: man, that is amazing that both your kids are so talented.  i hope my little ones are like that.  congrats on your great parenting!

situation: going out today to learn a new route for my job and hoping i do not get lost.
dialogue: going out today to learn a new route for my job and i am hoping that i do not get lost.
are you able to learn the route first before you have to take it for your job or are they kind of just throwing you into it?

i got the assignment yesterday, and i told myself that i would go drive around it today and tomorrow.  my boss is supposed to ride along with me the first week, and then after that i will be on my own.
label: apprehensive
response: well hopefully you are able to familiarize yourself quickly. good luck!

situation: i was so upset when i heard my grandma had passed. i was overseas and did not know about it as nobody could contact me.
dialogue: i was over here in the us when my grandma passed in scotland. i was so upset nobody could get hold of me to tell me and her funeral was over before i knew about it.
that is sad. have you been to scotand since?
only for funerals, unfortunately. both my parents have since died. unpleasant fact of life, i am afraid.
label: devastated
response: i am sorry to hear that. were you born there?

situation: i recently purchased an xbox! i have never owned a gaming console
dialogue: i just bought an xbox! i have never owned a gaming console before
excellent! are you enjoying it?
i am! i bought halo and am ready to ride.
label: excited
response: sick. i hope it is as fun as it looks!

situation: my mother lives in the same neighborhood as i do and i am so happy she lives close. my father passed away about 2 years ago and i am so thankful she is still here with us.
dialogue: my father passed away 2 years ago, but my mother lives in my neighborhood now. i am so thankful she lives close by and still here with us. she is such a wonderful mother.
i am glad that she is living close to you. that must make you feel special. my mom is dead so i understand how you feel.
i am sorry to hear that, i know it is so hard to lose a parent. i think we take them for granted when we are younger, but i am blessed she is still here.
label: grateful
response: i am happy that your mom is still around. cherish the days that you spend together.

situation: my upstairs neighbors are away for the weekend and i am as happy as a clam. no thumping, screeching, playing loud video games. heaven!
dialogue: i am as happy as a clam right now. my neighbors are away for the weekend!
are they typically bad or something?
the live upstairs and constantly thump around, screeching into their cellphones. and then there is the video games.
label: content
response: oh that makes sense, well enjoy the peace and quiet!

situation: my good friend came over last night! it was shocking since he lives hours away
dialogue: my friend from across the continent came over yesterday! i was so happy about it
that is awesome. what did you guys do?
we ended up hanging out and recording some audio. he is a voice actor
label: surprised
response: that sounds fun!

situation: while out walking in a boston suburb, we heard some animal cries. it turned out to be a baby kitten (very young) in a window well, with not identifying information. we took it home and adopted it.
dialogue: i was out for a walk one night in a suburb of boston when we heard the cries of a young animal. it was a baby kitten, with no collar, in a window well.
poor thing! what did you do?   did you take it home with you?
we actually did, and ended up adopting him. he was still so young he needed formula, but now he is thriving!
label: caring
response: eww,  that is great you took such great care of him.

situation: when a baby bird was alone
dialogue: i felt a need to help when the baby bird was by itself
that 's nice of you.  did you keep it as a pet
i did not, i was little but i think i put it back into a tree
label: caring
response: cool.  some birds should not be in captivity.  what kind of bird was it

situation: waiting for my results
dialogue: waiting to see if i would graduate was pretty unnerving
that is a nerve-racking experience. but i am betting you did graduate and did just fine!
yep, had to take a class online over the summer but it worked out
label: anxious
response: congratulations! waiting for results can be very stressful everything's out of your hands and all you can do is wait.

situation: i forgot my mother-in-laws birthday this year and cannot look her in the eye! my husband was working away from home and forgot to remind me.
dialogue: i forgot my mother-in-law's birthday this year and cannot look her in the eye!
i am sure she understands, just tell the truth!
i just feel so embarrassed she never forgets my birthday. and my husband was away and did not remind me
label: embarrassed
response: yeah, i would be pretty scared too, but it is better to be upfront about it to get it off your chest

situation: wearing pajamas to a party
dialogue: i was the only one wearing pajamas at this party, not my greatest moment
oh boy. did you not get the memo that you were supposed to be wearing a dress?
i thought that it was a pajama party haha, never worn a dress before, maybe that is the secret
label: embarrassed
response: everyone looks good in a dress. just make sure to shave first.

situation: having nightmares when i was little was scary
dialogue: i had some trippy nightmares as a kid, now i do not really have dreams
oh man, i did too.  i still do every once in a while but only when i am having trouble sleeping.  does one stand out from the rest that you remember vividly?
yeah, it was like i was tied to a chair and a huge thing was staring at me, pretty weird
label: terrified
response: creepy! i once had a dream of a lion laying at the end of my bad. it was scary but also comforting.  i feel like i could've touched it. glad you are free of those dreams now.

situation: when i stole from a store i felt bad
dialogue: i did not realize that stealing was bad until i realized how it made me feel afterwards
so you probably felt pretty guilty huh. did you return what you stole?
no, i was scared to get charged, but i stopped after that
label: guilty
response: glad to hear you stopped with your wayward habits before the po po caught up with you!

situation: at a meditation retreat i felt better than ever
dialogue: i was at a meditation retreat last year for 10 days and i can say that i experienced a better feeling there than i could ever remembe
i have always liked the idea of meditation, but i feel like it'd be hard. my mind is always racing!
yeah, thankfully there is an app for that headspace (no i am not sponsored)
label: joyful
response: awesome, i will check that out! i hear all sorts of great things about meditation.

situation: i was really looking forward to our family vacation to california this year. i love spending the holidays in new places.
dialogue: i am really looking forward to going away for the holidays.
me too, do you have any special plans?
i want to go see the harry potter land at universal, the kids will love it.
label: anticipating
response: how fun! yes i am sure they will have  a great time!

situation: i am pretty certain that i am going to be matched with my first choice school of law. i did really well on the lsat.
dialogue: i am really hoping my acceptance letter shows up in the mail soon.
is it for college?
law school, i am pretty sure i got in to my first choice, but you never know.
label: confident
response: well good luck, i hope you get in!

situation: i just ordered a new cookery book and i cannot wait for it to arrive. i love to cook and will really enjoy trying out the recipes.
dialogue: i just ordered a new cookery book and am eagerly awaiting its arrival. i want to delve in and try lots of new recipes!
i love cooking! what types of things do you like to cook?
i am vegetarian and cook all sorts of different cuisines indian, italian, american. the only cuisine i am not good at is chinese. how about you?
label: anticipating
response: i am also a vegetarian and i love cooking italian food.

situation: someone did the bottle flip onto a little ledge at my school
dialogue: i witnessed the most epic bottle flip in the history of bottle flips at my school
those are so much fun. was everyone hype?
yee yee, it landed on this little ledge that was super high up.
label: impressed
response: tight. probably will not be able to do that again!

situation: my little grandson just came home from the hospital. he was born several week premature and weighed under 2 pounds but now he is doing well and we are so thankful everything is ok.
dialogue: my little grandson just came home from the hospital. he was born premature and weighted under 2 pounds.
oh my gosh, so tiny. i am hoping since he was released from the hospital he is doing well now?
he is doing well, thank you. and we are so thankful everything is ok. it was touch and go for awhile
label: grateful
response: i can imagine. i am glad to hear he is better! life is such a gift.

situation: i am in love with my girlfriend. i would never cheat on her
dialogue: i love my girlfriend. she would never cheat on me
that is really nice that you guys have that trust.
i hope to make her my wife some day!
label: faithful
response: that is an awesome goal! good luck!

situation: my sister spilled milk on me. i hated it
dialogue: my sister spilled some milk on me. it set me off!
i hope it did not mess up your clothes. i am sure it was a mistake.
it was indeed a mistake. my clothes are fine now.
label: annoyed
response: i am glad it did not mess anything up and that your relationship with your sister is still in tact.

situation: i was not able to pay rent recently. i had a messed up home.
dialogue: i recently did not pay my rent. my land lord has been terrible at providing services
oh no. i rent also so i know your pain. my last landlord was awful.  how did your landlord react?
he decided to start caring and doing his part.
label: apprehensive
response: oh good, glad he did that instead of just coming down on your for not paying.  glad it worked out for you.

situation: i feel thankful for my vehicle
dialogue: i am thankful that i was able to repair my tire before it went flat on my car
lucky you did that in time!
right, i caught it just as it happened and brought it to the shop, did not cost as much as i thought it would either.
label: grateful
response: sounds like it worked out great for you!

situation: my friend is a beautiful person. she drove me to class
dialogue: i love my friend. she just drove me to class
wow! you should do something back for her!
i think i am getting her a gift soon!
label: trusting
response: nice, i am jealous of your friendship!

situation: i stole from my friends when i was young. i feel terrible
dialogue: i stole from my friends when i was a child. i feel terrible about it now
was it something important that you took ?
it was some pokemon cards!
label: ashamed
response: i see, did they ever find out it was you ?

situation: my father almost died last year. the whole experience was very, very tough
dialogue: my father almost passed away last year. it was very tough on everyone
that is awful, i am sorry to hear that.  is he doing better now?
yes, he has made a full recovery! it is been a journey
label: devastated
response: i am so glad he is better.  is the whole family doing alright?  i know that can be really hard on people.

situation: i remember when i was young. i used to love life
dialogue: i remember when i was a young one. i loved life.
life was easier back then, hopefully you still love life?
i do, but maybe not with he same flare as before
label: sentimental
response: nostalgia can stir emotions. you will find something to love about life again.

situation: i helped my friend find her lost cats. we found both of them
dialogue: i helped find my friend's cats. she is glad they are back now
oh, no!  what happened?  did she just get loose?
yes they both just wandered off when the door was open!
label: caring
response: thankfully, they are both okay.  dogs or cars, or anything for that matter could get them!

situation: i just got an a on my paper. it feels slick
dialogue: what?
i recently got an a on my paper. i feel great.
label: content
response: congrats! i bet that feels great!

situation: i went swimming. i then lost my trunks coming out!
dialogue: i went swimming recently. i lost my trunks walking out of the pool.
that is embarrassing. i would hate to have that happen.
yeah, we all have a good laugh about it now
label: embarrassed
response: that is the best way to handle those situations.

situation: drinking a gallon of milk made me sick
dialogue: drinking a gallon of milk in a day was not a good idea
ouch! i can relate. what made you decide to drink a whole gallon in a day?
i wanted to see how hard it would be, turns out my stomach was just big enough
label: disgusted
response: haha! i hope you experience no seriously ill effects!

situation: my friend got with a girl i liked. it sucks
dialogue: my friend slept with a girl i like. i feel horrible now
sheesh that is brutal, did you smack him?
no, but i do not think he is my friend any more
label: jealous
response: i do not blame you, that is low.

situation: when people try to control me
dialogue: i do not like working with managers that try to micro-manage me
me neither, i hate it when they just will not leave you alone
right, it kind of feels like they are insecure with their abilities while trying to make me feel bad at the same time
label: sad
response: yes! i feel the same

situation: having a toothache is irritating
dialogue: teeth are weird, but also take a lot of upkeep which is sometimes irritating
always try to brush your teeth at least twice a day, it helps
yeah that is what my dentist says, i will try
label: annoyed
response: if you do not take care of your teeth then you will have a bad time later in life

situation: sometimes i feel scared for no reason
dialogue: i wake up with chills sometimes for no reason
that is bizarre, have you had this seen about?
i think it is from dreams that i am not able to recall
label: afraid
response: that is odd, are you afraid when you wake up?

situation: not being able to reach my goals
dialogue: i was not able to reach my goals in the gym a couple days ago, and it helped me realize where i am slacking off in other areas
you sound a lot like my husband. he is really into going to the gym. life is not right if he does not get gym time.
yeah, it is fun to see how much you can conquer yourself, and it is nice to be able to see how you are changing
label: angry
response: i agree. its pretty cool to see the changes. i never really got into going to the gym though.

situation: i jumped out of an airplane to sky dive yesterday. i still felt in control
dialogue: i recently went skydiving. it was a thrilling rush
i have been skydiving, too! it was a fun experience.
it was excellent. i feel so alive!
label: confident
response: i lost my hearing for a few hours after though, but other than that it was a wonderful experience.

situation: i think i will be successful. i love life
dialogue: i think i will have success in my life. i love life these days!
that is great, did something recently happen?
i recently finished a new album i have been working on!
label: confident
response: awesome! what type of music?

situation: i am feeling happy to know that there is so many things i can be grateful for
dialogue: i am excited to think of all the possibilities that are available to me at the moment
what possibilities do you speak of?
being able to learn basically anything with the internet for one
label: excited
response: that sounds pretty exciting.

situation: finding myself changing perspectives on a day to day basis is amazing
dialogue: i like meditating because it puts things into perspective in a way that i do not usually expect
i have never been much for meditating. i am glad you enjoy it.
for sure, my mind is pretty energetic
label: surprised
response: what got you into meditation?

situation: sometimes i feel like i am alone for no reason
dialogue: i have been processing what being lonely feels like, because i want to be able to have fun by myself sometimes
i think that is a good idea so you are not always dependent on others to have fun and just enjoy time to yourself.
true, and i have felt that way before, but sometimes like a wave of those kinds of feelings hits like i am not worthy enough and stuff like that, but it is all good
label: lonely
response: meditation on goals and positive ideas during some of that alone time can be so uplifting and refocuses you.

situation: i felt a weight off my shoulders when i just let things happen
dialogue: i am trying to get over my need to control things, and i find if i just let things happen it feels like a weights been pulled off my shoulders
i used to struggle with the same problem, it can be overwhelming
right, but things always seem to turn out for the best anyway
label: trusting
response: i agree!

situation: i feel good about the progress i have made with lifting
dialogue: i grew up pretty skinny and now that i have grown some muscle i feel a lot more comfortable in my skin
grats.  how long have you been working out for?
around 9 months, been pretty slow to make progress but overall it is been solid
label: proud
response: keep your diet clean and you will keep improving.

situation: i am going camping tomorrow. the car is already packed!
dialogue: i am going to go camping tomorrow! the back's already packed
that sounds nice. hopefully it is not too hot for you.
i hope not. i am in florida so it might get bad
label: prepared
response: are you going to be sleeping in a tent?

situation: remembering my old house makes me think about the good old days
dialogue: my old house burned down, and i went to check it out, was surreal taking a look around the place
that is just so sad. house fires are terrifying to me.
yeah, it was built a long time ago, some kind of electrical fire
label: sentimental
response: the wiring was probably old and not up to code anymore.

situation: i felt like the world was over when my tire got punctured
dialogue: i was truly surprised when i notice my tire got hit by a rock, thought i would not make it to the tire place in time
did it go flat?
it did not, got it replaced when i dropped it off, pretty lucky
label: devastated
response: that is very fortunate!

situation: when the cat had string stuck on it i felt the need to help
dialogue: there was a cat who had string stuck around it so i had to help
that is really nice of you!  is the cat ok now?
yeah, everything turned out fine in the end
label: caring
response: that is good.  if not for you, who knows what could have happened.  you must be a very caring individual.

situation: i feel a strong connection to the almighty
dialogue: i feel like deepening my connection to god is the most important thing in my life
i think that is a lovely thing
it is like if i do not get that sorted out i will not be able to live a fulfilling life
label: faithful
response: if its important, you will figure it out

situation: i feel anxious when i cannot take a moment for myself
dialogue: when i cannot take a breather in the day i feel suffocated
yea, its a good idea to take time for yourself when you can
right, it is like i cannot focus or relax
label: anticipating
response: i think relaxing is very important

situation: when i was a kid i wanted to be popular, so i was envious of the popular kids
dialogue: when i was in elementary school i was envious of the kids who were popular!
yeah as a child it is hard to see other kids with a bunch of friends when you do not have that many.
yeah, i just had trouble socializing is all
label: jealous
response: well, i hope you got over that issue and ended up making lots of friends yourself.

situation: i feel very self assured after challenging my comfort zone
dialogue: when i do things that are challenging i feel more self-reliant. i recently tried taking an ice bath
oh man! that is impressive, those baths are rough.
yeah, my bath was not deep enough, so i did not get covered all the way!
label: confident
response: that is good. but still! you must be pretty tough!

situation: i am always doing things to take care of the future
dialogue: i am eating a lot of food to make sure i can lift more weight in the gym next time!
are you taking protein?
i am taking everything, honey, raw garlic, yogurt, everything!
label: prepared
response: that is good, hopefully it helps!

situation: i feel mad when marketers try to con me
dialogue: i do not like scammy sales people, nothing good comes from it
i agree, were you recently screwed by one?
yeah, it is like they live to manipulate people for money
label: furious
response: yep its disgusting

situation: i went out to lunch with my kids the other day. my daughter needed help opening her dipping sauce. nothing like it squirting all over me from the waste up!
dialogue: i went to lunch the other day with my kids. my daughter needed help opening her dipping sauce and of course i did.
that is sweet of you, kids are cute
they are but when i finally got it open it sprayed me from my waste all the way to my hair!
label: embarrassed
response: oh that is not good, i hope you were able to clean it up easily..

situation: i love listening to old music, brings back memories
dialogue: listening to old artists like they might be giants is my jam
wow i have not thought of them in years.  sometimes it is good to have bands you can always go back to
haha, i did not grow up with them but it is like discovering a gold mine that no one else seems to listen to
label: nostalgic
response: true.  i have favorite bands to that i consider to be musical comfort food

situation: i felt like the future was looking bright when i got my lisence
dialogue: getting my driver's license was a freeing experience
nice! are you getting a car soon too?
yeah, that was a while ago, cars are great in a lot of situationsz!
label: hopeful
response: definitely, especially when you get really hungry at night. i love a good drive thru

situation: someone stole my credit card information. they have been charging up my card like crazy. i am scared about my identity.
dialogue: i have had the worst week, someone stole my credit card information.
that is awful. i have had it happen to me once before.
yes it is been hell, they charged over 15 thousand dollars on it. i hope my identity is fine besides the card.
label: devastated
response: i sure hope so, too! it is a lot of work to get it sorted out.

situation: when i found out my job was not cracked up to what i thought it was
dialogue: i was pretty disillusioned when i found out door to door sales was not a fun time

yeah. that seems like a hard gig, especially in today's day and age, where everyone is so wary, and especially since there is not often people at home during the day. you have to have good people skills to do that job, though. so, you at least probably have that going for you.
i realized that it was unethical in the end!
label: disappointed
response: ah. yeah, i am sorry you had to run into that kind of problem. it is hard doing a job you do not agree with the ethics of. there is really no way to fake it sometimes. but at least you were able to realize that and stand by your morals.

situation: ugh, i am so annoyed. my husband went out with his friends again, the third time this week. i am exhausted watching my daughter alone all the time.
dialogue: ugh, i am so annoyed! my husband went out again with his friends, third time this week.
is he going out drinking?
yes, i am exhausted. my daughter is teething so she hasn't been sleeping well.
label: jealous
response: that is such a tough time, my son is teething as well

situation: i felt very nasty knowing that people are taken advantage of by fake religious groups
dialogue: seeing people taken advantage of by fake religious services is something i find the most vile. it makes them believe that they are doing the right thing, but the person taking advantage of them knows what is really up. what do you know about that?

well i am not a religious person but i will have to say it urks me when i am surronded my religious people that is trying to push their belief on me. then seeing them feel people heads with stuff that they can not prove is there irritates me also
exactly, i feel that getting people to believe irrational things is the same as giving them a brain virus, it will slowly erode their ability to think rationally.
label: disgusted
response: lol. exactly how i feel

situation: i have a presentation for work on monday, about our hiring policys and how to retain more people. i know i have this! i have been preparing all weekend.
dialogue: i have a presentation for work on monday, i am a little nervous.
oh, that is not unusual. you must try to relax. is it an important presentation?
kind of, but i have prepared a lot so i am sure it will go good! i work in the human resource department for a big company and we are trying to find new ways to retain good employes.
label: confident
response: i see, i hope it goes well for you. remember to breathe!

situation: when i left my key in my car for the mechanic i was left wondering
dialogue: i had to leave my key in my car for the mechanic and i was left wondering if someone might find it
that is a scary situation. people do not care anymore.
right, there is too many people to say that it would not happen
label: anxious
response: you are so right!

situation: this week is the last week for this semester of my college courses. i cannot stand having to wait to see the final grades!
dialogue: this week was the last one for this semester of my college courses
that is awesome, what degree are you working towards?
healthcare administration, only 6 months left! i get so antsy waiting to see the final grades, it drives me crazy
label: anticipating
response: i can imagine, waiting sucks!

situation: getting woken up in the middle of the night was scary as heck
dialogue: i got woken up by my roommate and i swear his voice is the last thing you want to hear in the middle of the night, sent the fear of god through my veins
that is kind of odd. i probably would have tried to take a swing just out of pure instinct. what was the reason they wanted to wake you up?
i do not know, i did not answer, pretended i was asleep
label: terrified
response: hahaha. that is kind of goofy in a way. yeah, sometimes nothing good can come of people trying to get your attention randomly in the middle of the night. that is probably the wisest choice. i probably would not be able to act that good enough to pull it off.

situation: when i almost got caught stealing i felt bad
dialogue: i almost got caught stealing, i felt pretty bad
ouch!  what did you take?
a computer keyboard from my school
label: ashamed
response: was it an awesome keyboard worth getting in trouble for?

situation: i am 38 weeks pregnant, could have my baby any day now. i am nervous but know i am ready and have everything we need.
dialogue: i am 38 weeks pregnant, could have my baby any day now!
congrats! that is so exciting do you fel ok?
yes, a bit nervous because my first birth was hard, but i know i am ready and have everything we need for the baby!
label: prepared
response: yay! good job! he/she is going to be beautiful

situation: i felt overcome with emotions when christmas came around as a kid
dialogue: christmas was the best time of year back in the day!
i still think it is, i always get so excited
yeah, it is like there is nothing to worry about
label: joyful
response: yep that is one of the things that make it so nice

situation: i was scared when this random guy walked into my room
dialogue: some random dude walked into my room while i was laying down, could not have been more weird
oh wow that is weird. did you say anything to him?
i was like what the hell, and then he said sorry and walked out
label: afraid
response: yeesh, how awkward is that.

situation: someone hit my car at walmart and drove off! i am so annoyed they did not have the decency to leave a note or something.
dialogue: someone hit my car at walmart today and drove off!
were you able to take the plate id?
no, i did not see it someone reported it to customer service and they paged me. i wish they would have left a note! people have so decency sometimes!
label: furious
response: i understand. sorry to hear about that.

situation: i saw my favourite candy at the store today, reminded me of my childhood eating them after school.
dialogue: i saw my favourite candy at the store today! was so excited, hadn't seen it in a while.
oh nice. what kind of candy was it?
this sour s'ghetti candy by haribro. i use to eat this all the time as a child.
label: nostalgic
response: oh yeah i think i have tried that one! i love anything by haribro!

situation: my daughter has been sick, but it looks like she is finally getting better. she had a bad bacterial infection from daycare.
dialogue: my daughter has been sick for months but she is finally starting to get better!
glad to hear it. i hate hearing about children having tragic childhoods and not being able to just simply be a kid. but at least she will have a good perspective and appreciate life more.
thank you, defenitly! she is still young and most likely will not remember this either!
label: hopeful
response: even if she does, it will help make her a well-rounded, relatable person. usually these things help ground kids and give them character. but maybe you are right, if she moves on from it quickly, that is great too!

situation: i was totally surprised when i saw my friend's minecraft world
dialogue: my friend showed me his minecraft world and it was amazing! looked like he spent days on it
what had he made in the world?
he had created one giant hole and filled it up with water, super cool
label: impressed
response: that is super cool, i played a few years back but eventually quit.

situation: had to cancel our family vacation coming up next month. my husband's work said he could not go after they already approved the time off.
dialogue: i had to cancel our family vacation coming up next month.
i am really sorry to hear that.  i hope everything is alright.
yes, his work told him he could not go after they already approved the time off. guess next month is going to be busy at his work
label: disappointed
response: well, that is just terrible.  i hate it when companies jerk you around like that.  i hope you will be able to reschedule it, although i know that would not make up for the frustration.

situation: i am glad that life is being good to me
dialogue: life is good, it is the gift that keeps on giving
that is a great way to look at it
glad you think so as well!
label: grateful
response: yeah more people should look at life like you do

situation: i saw a huge cockroach outside my house today. we live in texas so they are common but still gross!
dialogue: i saw a huge cockroach outside my house today!
did you call the exterminator?
not yet since it is the weekend. we live in texas so they are common but still gross! i am glad i have not see any in my house.
label: disgusted
response: i live in texas to so i know those feels
